A fost fondat √Æn 1836, odatƒÉ cu Catedrala MitropolitanƒÉ. √én prezent, este unul dintre cele mai populare locuri din Chi»ôinƒÉu pentru plimbƒÉri »ôi relaxare, √Æn plus, √Æn parc se organizeazƒÉ adesea diverse t√¢rguri »ôi evenimente.Construc»õia parcului aproape a coincis cu construc»õia Catedralei, pe care arhitectul Avraam Melnikov a √Ænceput sƒÉ o construiascƒÉ √Æn 1830. Construc»õia a fost finalizatƒÉ √Æn 1836 »ôi, din acel moment, au √Ænceput lucrƒÉrile √Æn jurul catedralei, fiind construite cƒÉrƒÉri care duceau la CatedralƒÉ, au fost planta»õi copaci »ôi tufe.', 'The Monument to Ferdinand I (Romanian: Monumentul lui Ferdinand I) was a prominent monument in Chi≈üinƒÉu, Moldova.The building of the monument was decided at a meeting held in Chi≈üinƒÉu on 16 January 1937 and led by Gherman P√¢ntea and Elefterie Sinicliu.It was located on an axis aligned with the Triumphal arch and Chi»ôinƒÉu Cathedral, whereby the statue of the king faced the cathedral.Vigoarea Basarabiei interbelice (1937 - 1939)', 'The National Museum of Fine Arts (Romanian: Muzeul Na»õional de ArtƒÉ) is a museum in Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova, founded in November 1939 by Alexandru PlƒÉmƒÉdealƒÉ and Auguste Baillayre.', 'Teatrul Republican de PƒÉpu»ôi ‚ÄûLicurici‚Äù din Chi»ôinƒÉu a fost fondat pe 15 octombrie 1945. √én 1966, "Licurici" devine membru al UNIMA √Æn cadrul UNESCO. Titus Jucov a stat la c√¢rma teatrului √Æntre 1979 - 17 noiembrie 2013.', 'The Stephen the Great Monument (Romanian: Monumentul lui »òtefan cel Mare) is a prominent monument in Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.The monument to Stephen the Great was designed by architect Alexandru PlƒÉmƒÉdealƒÉ in 1923. It was erected near the main entrance of the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu. The monument was completed in 1927 and opened on 29 April 1928 (to replace the monument to Alexander II of Russia, destroyed by the Romanian authorities in 1918). The total cost of the monument was 4.000.000 lei.', 'The Capitoline Wolf (Romanian: Lupoaica CapitolinƒÉ) is a monument in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova. It is located in front of the National History Museum of Moldova.During the first decades of the 20th century, Italy donated to Romania five copies of the Capitoline Wolf, which were installed in Chi≈üinƒÉu (1921), Bucharest (1906), Cluj-Napoca (1921), T√¢rgu Mure≈ü (1924) and Timi»ôoara (1926). In Chi≈üinƒÉu, the monument was completed in 1923 and placed in front of Sfatul »öƒÉrii Palace. In 1940, at the beginning of the Soviet occupation of Bessarabia and Northern Bukovina, the copy from Chi≈üinƒÉu was destroyed.', 'The National Museum of History of Moldova (Romanian: Muzeul Na»õional de Istorie a Moldovei) is a museum in Central Chi≈üinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'Nicolai Costenco (December 21, 1913, Chi≈üinƒÉu - July 29, 1993, Chi≈üinƒÉu) was a writer from Moldova. He was managing editor of Via≈£a Basarabiei (1934‚Äì1940) and was deported to Siberia √Æn 1941.Nicolai Costenco was born in Chi≈üinƒÉu on December 21, 1913, but his maternal grandparents, Gheorghe and Libeada, brought him up in Cihoreni. He worked for Via≈£a Basarabiei (1934‚Äì1940). In 1941 he was deported to Siberia because he claimed that there is no difference between the Moldovan language and the Romanian language. In his poem, "PicteazƒÉ-mi o miri≈üte", Grigore Vieru wrote: "Nicolai Costenco, poetul/ Care ≈üi-a scris poemele/ Pe caietul de ghea≈£ƒÉ Siberian"...', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', '»òtefan cel Mare Central Park (Romanian: GrƒÉdina PublicƒÉ ‚Äû»òtefan cel Mare‚Äù / Parcul ‚Äû»òtefan cel Mare‚Äù) is the main park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova. It is the oldest park in Moldova and spans about 7 hectares (17 acres). It has gained the nickname "The Park of the Lovers" in Chi»ôinƒÉu due to its popularity as a meeting spot for couples. The park contains 50 species of trees, some of which are quite old, the mulberries and acacias being between 130 and 180 years. The Alley of Classics is located in the park.', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'The Alley of Classics (Romanian: Aleea Clasicilor) is a sculptural complex located in the Stephen the Great Park in Central Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova.', 'The Maria Bie»ôu National Opera and Ballet Theatre (Romanian: Teatrul Na≈£ional de OperƒÉ ≈üi Balet ‚ÄûMaria Bie»ôu" din Republica Moldova) in Chi≈üinƒÉu, Moldova, is one of the leading opera and ballet theatres in Eastern Europe. It is housed in a building on the Boulevard Stefan the Great, one of the main roads in Chi≈üinƒÉu. In 2012, it was given the name of the renowned opera singer Maria Bie»ôu.The Chi≈üinƒÉu National Opera, the national opera company of Moldova, was founded in the mid-1940s and became a professional company in 1956. Following the collapse of the USSR, the company is one of the few ex-Soviet opera companies to retain its own orchestra, chorus, soloists and ballet company.', 'The Maria Bie»ôu National Opera and Ballet Theatre (Romanian: Teatrul Na≈£ional de OperƒÉ ≈üi Balet ‚ÄûMaria Bie»ôu" din Republica Moldova) in Chi≈üinƒÉu, Moldova, is one of the leading opera and ballet theatres in Eastern Europe. It is housed in a building on the Boulevard Stefan the Great, one of the main roads in Chi≈üinƒÉu. In 2012, it was given the name of the renowned opera singer Maria Bie»ôu.The Chi≈üinƒÉu National Opera, the national opera company of Moldova, was founded in the mid-1940s and became a professional company in 1956. Following the collapse of the USSR, the company is one of the few ex-Soviet opera companies to retain its own orchestra, chorus, soloists and ballet company.', "Nicolae Iorga (Romanian pronunciation: [nikoÀàla.e Ààjor…°a]; sometimes Neculai Iorga, Nicolas Jorga, Nicolai Jorga or Nicola Jorga, born Nicu N. Iorga; 5 June 1871 ‚Äì 27 November 1940) was a Romanian historian, politician, literary critic, memoirist, poet and playwright. Co-founder (in 1910) of the Democratic Nationalist Party (PND), he served as a member of Parliament, President of the Deputies' Assembly and Senate, cabinet minister and briefly (1931‚Äì32) as Prime Minister. A child prodigy, polymath and polyglot, Iorga produced an unusually large body of scholarly works, establishing his international reputation as a medievalist, Byzantinist, Latinist, Slavist, art historian and philosopher of history. Holding teaching positions at the University of Bucharest, the University of Paris and several other academic institutions, Iorga was founder of the International Congress of Byzantine Studies and the Institute of South-East European Studies (ISSEE). His activity also included the transformation of VƒÉlenii de Munte town into a cultural and academic center.", 'Palace of the Republic (Romanian: Palatul Republicii) is an official multi-purpose building as well as a concert and theatre hall in Moldova. It is located at the Buiucani sector in the commune of Condri»õa in Chi»ôinƒÉu.', '–ü–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ –∂–µ—Ä—Ç–≤–∞–º –µ–≤—Ä–µ–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –≥–µ—Ç—Ç–æ ‚Äî –º–µ–º–æ—Ä–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ —Å–æ–æ—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–µ –ö–∏—à–∏–Ω—ë–≤ –≤ –ø–∞–º—è—Ç—å –æ –µ–≤—Ä–µ—è—Ö, —É–±–∏—Ç—ã—Ö –Ω–µ–º–µ—Ü–∫–æ-—Ä—É–º—ã–Ω—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –æ–∫–∫—É–ø–∞–Ω—Ç–∞–º–∏ –≤ –≥–æ–¥—ã –í–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–π –û—Ç–µ—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –≤–æ–π–Ω—ã –≤ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∞—Ö –ø–æ–ª–∏—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–µ—Å–ª–µ–¥–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –∏ —É–Ω–∏—á—Ç–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—è –µ–≤—Ä–µ–µ–≤.–£—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω –≤ 1992 –≥–æ–¥—É, –Ω–∞ –º–µ—Å—Ç–µ, –≥–¥–µ —Ä–∞—Å–ø–æ–ª–∞–≥–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∞ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –≥–µ—Ç—Ç–æ (–ò–µ—Ä—É—Å–∞–ª–∏–º—Å–∫–∞—è —É–ª–∏—Ü–∞, –º–µ–∂–¥—É —É–ª. –ê. –ü—É—à–∫–∏–Ω–∞ –∏ –±—É–ª. –ì—Ä–∏–≥–æ—Ä–µ –í–∏–µ—Ä—É). –£–ª–∏—Ü–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–∏–º–µ–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∞ –≤ –ò–µ—Ä—É—Å–∞–ª–∏–º—Å–∫—É—é –≤ —á–µ—Å—Ç—å 3000-–ª–µ—Ç–∏—è –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–∞, —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ 6 –ª–µ—Ç –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–∏ –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞.–ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Å–æ–±–æ–π —Å–∫–æ—Ä–±–Ω—É—é —Ñ–∏–≥—É—Ä—É —Ä–∞–≤–≤–∏–Ω–∞ —Å–æ —Å—Ç–µ–ª–æ–π –ø–æ–∑–∞–¥–∏. –ù–∞–¥–ø–∏—Å–∏ –Ω–∞ —Ä—É–º—ã–Ω—Å–∫–æ–º, —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–º –∏ –∏–¥–∏—à–µ: ¬´–ú—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –∏ –∂–µ—Ä—Ç–≤—ã –∫–∏—à–∏–Ω–µ–≤—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –≥–µ—Ç—Ç–æ! –ú—ã, –∂–∏–≤—ã–µ, –ø–æ–º–Ω–∏–º –æ –≤–∞—Å¬ª. –í —Å—Ç–µ–ª–µ –∑–∏—è–µ—Ç –¥—ã—Ä–∞ –≤ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–µ –∑–≤–µ–∑–¥—ã –î–∞–≤–∏–¥–∞.', 'The Army Museum of Chi»ôinƒÉu (Romanian: Muzeul armatei din Chi»ôinƒÉu), is a center of military history of the Armed Forces of Moldova located in northern Chi»ôinƒÉu, the capital of Moldova.', 'Casa-muzeu ‚ÄûAleksandr Pu»ôkin‚Äù este un muzeu »ôi monument de arhitecturƒÉ de valoare na»õionalƒÉ, inclus √Æn Registrul de monumente de istorie »ôi culturƒÉ a municipiului Chi»ôinƒÉu.Edificiul este cel √Æn care faimosul poet rus Aleksandr Pu»ôkin a locuit timp de douƒÉ luni, dupƒÉ ce sosise √Æn capitala Basarabiei »õariste pe 21 septembrie 1820. Casa, care la moment apar»õinea generalului Inzov (anterior apar»õinuse negustorului Naumov, care la r√¢ndul sƒÉu a cumpƒÉrat-o de la bunicul astronomului Nicolae Donici), a ob»õinut statut de muzeu la 10 februarie 1948. √én total, Pu»ôkin a petrecut trei ani (perioada 1820‚Äì23) pe teritoriul guberniei, dupƒÉ ce anterior fusese exilat aici de cƒÉtre administra»õia »õaristƒÉ.', 'Muzeul zemstvei, inclus √Æn Registrul monumentelor de arhitecturƒÉ sub denumirea ‚ÄûClƒÉdirea fostului orfelinat, mai t√¢rziu c√¢rmuirea zemstvei Guberniale a Basarabiei‚Äù, este o clƒÉdire istoricƒÉ amplasatƒÉ √Æn Chi»ôinƒÉu, pe strada Alexei »òciusev 103. ReprezintƒÉ un monument de arhitecturƒÉ »ôi istorie de √ÆnsemnƒÉtate na»õionalƒÉ, introdus √Æn Registrul monumentelor de istorie »ôi culturƒÉ a municipiului Chi»ôinƒÉu la ini»õiativa Academiei de »òtiin»õe.', "The Chi»ôinƒÉu Water Tower is an architectural monument of Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova, located at 2 Mitropolit BƒÉnulescu-Bodoni Street and built at the end of 19th century after a project by Alexander Bernadazzi. It was a main part of Chi»ôinƒÉu's water system. The upper level was built of wood and was destroyed by an earthquake. It was rebuilt between 1980 and 1983. It currently hosts Chi»ôinƒÉu City museum, which contains items dating from 15th to 20th centuries. The upper level is a space for exhibitions of both legacy and modern paintings and photographies, as well as various cultural events.", 'Muzeul Na»õional de Etnografie »ôi Istorie NaturalƒÉ este un muzeu din municipiul Chi»ôinƒÉu, situat pe str. Mihail KogƒÉlniceanu, 82. A fost creat √Æn octombrie 1889 √Æn baza colec»õiei exponatelor primei expozi»õiei agrare din Basarabia, organizatƒÉ sub ini»õiativa baronului A. Stuart.Edificiul muzeului (oficial ‚Äì ‚ÄûClƒÉdirea Muzeului Na»õional de Etnografie »ôi Istorie NaturalƒÉ, fost Muzeu zoo-agricol »ôi a me»ôte»ôugurilor populare‚Äù) este un monument de arhitecturƒÉ de √ÆnsemnƒÉtate na»õionalƒÉ, introdus √Æn Registrul monumentelor de istorie »ôi culturƒÉ a municipiului.Pe parcursul anilor, muzeul a avut mai multe denumiri:', 'GrƒÉdina Muzeului Na»õional de Etnografie »ôi Istorie NaturalƒÉ din Chi»ôinƒÉu este o arie protejatƒÉ din Republica Moldova, reprezent√¢nd un monument de arhitecturƒÉ peisagisticƒÉ. Este amplasatƒÉ √Æn ora»ôul Chi»ôinƒÉu, √Æn perimetrul strƒÉzilor Mihail KogƒÉlniceanu, Maria Cebotari, Alexei »òciusev »ôi Sfatul »öƒÉrii, √Æn spatele clƒÉdirii muzeului. Are o suprafa»õƒÉ de 0,075 ha. √én 1998, se afla √Æn administrarea Ministerului Culturii.GrƒÉdina a fost √Ænfiin»õatƒÉ √Æn 1906, √Æn baza grƒÉdinii-parc create la mijlocul secolului al XIX-lea, cu scopul de a prezenta la scarƒÉ redusƒÉ flora spontanƒÉ din toate zonele Basarabiei.', 'Muzeul Na»õional de Etnografie »ôi Istorie NaturalƒÉ este un muzeu din municipiul Chi»ôinƒÉu, situat pe str. Mihail KogƒÉlniceanu, 82. A fost creat √Æn octombrie 1889 √Æn baza colec»õiei exponatelor primei expozi»õiei agrare din Basarabia, organizatƒÉ sub ini»õiativa baronului A. Stuart.Edificiul muzeului (oficial ‚Äì ‚ÄûClƒÉdirea Muzeului Na»õional de Etnografie »ôi Istorie NaturalƒÉ, fost Muzeu zoo-agricol »ôi a me»ôte»ôugurilor populare‚Äù) este un monument de arhitecturƒÉ de √ÆnsemnƒÉtate na»õionalƒÉ, introdus √Æn Registrul monumentelor de istorie »ôi culturƒÉ a municipiului.Pe parcursul anilor, muzeul a avut mai multe denumiri:', 'Stadionul Dinamo is a multi-use stadium in Chi≈üinƒÉu, Moldova. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the home ground of FC Politehnica Chi≈üinƒÉu. The stadium holds 2,888 people.', 'Eternity Memorial Complex (Romanian: Complexul Memorial Eternitate) is a memorial located in Chi»ôinƒÉu, the capital of Moldova. The memorial is located along P. Halippa Street (formerly Marshal Malinovsky Street). It is dedicated to Soviet soldiers who died in the battles against the German-Romanian troops of the Second World War.In Soviet times the complex was known as the Victory Memorial. The monument was made on May 9, 1975 in honour of the Soviet soldiers who died in the Great Patriotic War. The monument was restored on August 24, 2006, marking the 62nd anniversary of the Second Jassy‚ÄìKishinev Offensive.', 'Statuia lui Grigore Kotovski din Chi»ôinƒÉu este un monument ecvestru √Ænchinat eroului comunist al rƒÉzboiului civil din Rusia Grigori Kotovski, amplasat √Æn municipiul Chi»ôinƒÉu, capitala Republicii Moldova.Statuia ecvestrƒÉ a comunistului Grigore Kotovski, participant la rƒÉzboiul civil din Rusia, a fost √ÆnƒÉl»õatƒÉ √Æn anul 1953, la Chi»ôinƒÉu »ôi a fost realizatƒÉ de cƒÉtre un grup de sculptori »ôi pictori format din LazƒÉr Dubinovschi, Konstantin Kitaika, I. Per»ôudcev »ôi A. Poseado, »ôi dupƒÉ planurile arhitectului Fiodor Naumov.', 'Circul de Stat din Chi»ôinƒÉu (bd. Rena»ôterii, 38) este un edificiu construit √Æn 1981 »ôi prevƒÉzut pentru reprezenta»õii de circ. Autorii proiectului »ôi unii realizatori ai lui (arhitec»õii Semion »òoihet »ôi A. Kirilenko, inginerii T. Goriunova »ôi M. »òein, brigadierul A. Parsin, electrosudorul-montor M. Postolache, muncitorul-marmurist N. Star»õev) au fost distin»ôi cu Premiul de Stat al RSSM.Sala de spectacole, cu 1.900 locuri dispuse √Æn amfiteatru, are o arenƒÉ cu diametrul de 13 m.', 'Parcul Valea Morilor este un parc din sectorul Buiucani, Chi»ôinƒÉu, Republica Moldova. Acesta a fost √Ænfiin»õat la ini»õiativa lui Leonid Brejnev, √Æn anul 1950, »ôi ini»õial a fost numit ‚ÄûParcul Central de CulturƒÉ »ôi OdihnƒÉ al Comsomolului Leninist‚Äù. Parcul se aflƒÉ pe malul Lacului Valea Morilor »ôi este situat pe un teren de o suprafa»õƒÉ cu un relief variat, av√¢nd 4 intrƒÉri. Proiectul parcului a fost elaborat sub conducerea arhitectului Robert Kurz.Zona de parc a constituit ini»õial circa 114 hectare, lacul av√Ænd o suprafa»õƒÉ de 34 hectare. √én jurul lacului a fost amenajatƒÉ o alee inelarƒÉ de o lungime de 2,5 kilometri.', 'The Train of Pain ‚Äì Memorial to Victims of Stalinist Repression (Romanian: Trenul durerii ‚Äì Monument √Æn memoria victimelor represiunilor staliniste) is a monument in Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova. A temporary stone was unveiled in 1990 in Central Station Square commemorating the 1940‚Äì1951 mass deportations in Soviet Moldavia. A permanent memorial was completed at the site in 2013. The sculptural element was assembled in Belarus.Monument to the Victims of the Soviet Occupation Soviet Occupation Day, Moldova', 'Rose Valley Chi≈üinƒÉu (Romanian: Valea Trandafirilor) is an urban park including the remains of an ancient Slavonic sanctuary. It is located in the city of Chi≈üinƒÉu, Moldova.In the 1950s, rose plantations were planted in the Rose Valley.At the end of the 1960s, the park saw some improvement. New lanes were laid, concrete dams were built, and lakes were cleared of silt.', 'The Victims of Chi»ôinƒÉu Pogrom Monument (Romanian: Monumentul Victimelor Pogromului de la Chi»ôinƒÉu) is a memorial stone to the victims of Chi»ôinƒÉu pogrom, unveiled 1993 in Alunelul park Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova. It consists of two marble blocks, one in 1993 and one in 2003.The Chi»ôinƒÉu pogroms (more commonly known as the Kishinev pogroms) took place in 1903 and 1905. The victims were buried in the Jewish cemetery, but in 1959, this part of the cemetery was destroyed to make way for a park facing Calea Ie»ôilor Street.', 'The Zimbru Stadium is a football-specific stadium in Chi»ôinƒÉu, Moldova, completed in May 2006 with a capacity of 10,400 people, corresponds to all norms required by UEFA and FIFA for national and international matches. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the home stadium of Zimbru Chi»ôinƒÉu and the Moldova national football team.The construction of the stadium took 27 months to complete at a cost of almost US$11 million.The VIP box is reserved for 250 people. Sports journalists have 44 places at their disposal. The arena meets all the requirements for holding official international matches.', 'GrƒÉdina ZoologicƒÉ din Chi»ôinƒÉu a fost √Ænfiin»õatƒÉ la 9 mai 1978 √Æn sudul Chi»ôinƒÉului, nu departe de GrƒÉdina BotanicƒÉ. √én plan »ôtiin»õifico-metodic activitatea GrƒÉdinii este coordonatƒÉ cu Academia de »òtiin»õe a Moldovei »ôi Ministerul Mediului.', 'The Chi»ôinƒÉu Botanical Garden of the Academy of Sciences of Moldova was founded in 1950 by the Russian Academy of Science. The garden is located in Chi»ôinƒÉu, Botanica, Moldova and covers an area of 76 hectares. In 1973, a new botanical garden was established in the Botanica sector of Chi»ôinƒÉu. Two years later, the garden was given the status of a Research Institute of the Academy of Sciences of Moldovan SSR. There are around ten thousand species of plants in the garden.', 'Ghidighici Stadium is a football stadium located in Ghidighici, Moldova. It has a capacity of 1,500 seats.']

column5: ['Ela Beach', 'Sir Hubert Murray Stadium', 'Battle of Port Moresby', 'National Capital Botanical Gardens', 'Lyod Robson Oval', 'PNG National Museum and Art Gallery']
column6: ["Ela Beach, formerly known as Era Kone, meaning 'Turtle Beach' in the Motuan dialect of the Papuan region of Papua New Guinea, is Port Moresby's primary public beach.With white sand stretching approximately 1 km long.Located along the Ela Beach front are various recreational facilities such as basketball courts, beach volleyball courts, a boardwalk, a three-star hotel, two kiosks and an amphitheater.Ela Beach is also the host venue for the annual Hiri-Moale Festival.Local Motu-Koita people held an annual Hiri Moale Cultural Festival to celebrate the ancient Hiri trade voyages that used to be launched from Era Kone.A native hospital close to Ela Beach was closed in 1957 or 1958.", 'The Hubert Murray Stadium is a sports venue located in Port Moresby, the capital city of Papua New Guinea. It was developed for the 1969 South Pacific Games on reclaimed land at Konedobu that had previously been shoreline mangroves. The athletics events and the opening and closing ceremonies were held at the new stadium, which was named after Sir Hubert Murray, a former lieutenant governor.', 'The Battle of Port Moresby was an aerial battle fought between the Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) and United States Army Air Force (USAAF) on one side and the Imperial Japanese Army and Imperial Japanese Navy on the other between 3 February 1942 and 17 August 1943 over Port Moresby, Papua. At the start, the defenders consisted only of Australian Army anti-aircraft batteries and machine-guns, but by late March had been strengthened by the arrival of Kittyhawk fighters from No. 75 Squadron RAAF. However, in just nine days they lost 11 aircraft and only the arrival of replacements enabled the unit to maintain ten serviceable machines.According to the Australian government:', "National Capital Botanical Gardens is de naam van de botanische tuin in Port Moresby (Papoea-Nieuw-Guinea). De botanische tuin is gelieerd aan de University of Papua New Guinea. De tuin is in 1971 opgericht door Andr√© Millar.De botanische tuin heeft een grote collectie planten uit Nieuw-Guinea en de rest van de wereld. Hieronder bevinden zich palmen, bamboe, Heliconia, Cordyline, Pandanus en bomen, struiken en orchidee√´n die van oorsprong voorkomen in Nieuw-Guinea. Er is een miniregenwoud. Ook zijn er dieren te zien als de kroonduif, boomkangoeroes, paradijsvogels, kaketoes, lori's, papegaaien en vele andere vogels. Ook is er een 5,8 m lange netpython te zien.", 'The Sir John Guise Stadium is a multi-sport and athletics venue located in Port Moresby, the capital city of Papua New Guinea, and is part of the larger Sir John Guise Sports Precinct which also includes an indoor arena, beach volleyball/hockey court, and aquatics center. The stadium is named after Sir John Guise, the first Governor-General of Papua New Guinea.The stadium was opened in 1991 to host the South Pacific Games that year. The stadium had an original capacity of approximately 5,000 spectators.', 'The Papua New Guinea National Museum and Art Gallery (NMAG) is a museum and art gallery in Waigani, Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea. It is the national museum of Papua New Guinea.In 1889 the British governor of Papua New Guinea, William Macgregor began a collecting programme in order to create a collection of natural history specimens and objects reflecting the uniqueness of the animals and cultures in the territory. The initial aim of the program had also been to establish a museum, however the idea did not gain traction and the collection was ultimately dispersed to a number of museums in Australia, until such a time as the country had its own museum.']

Construction started in 2011 and was completed in January 2012.The arch is 21 meters in height, and cost EUR 4.4 million. Its author is Valentina Stefanovska, sculptor who made several other grandiose monuments from Skopje 2014 project, including the statue dedicated to Alexander the Great officially named "Warrior on a Horse." During the opening ceremony, the Prime Minister Nikola Gruevski admitted that he personally is the instigator of the Skopje 2014 plan.', '–ñ–µ–Ω–∞ —Å–æ –≥–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–∞ –ø—Ä–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–∞–≤—É–≤–∞ –º–µ—Ä–º–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ —Å–∫—É–ª–ø—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –Ω–∞ –∂–µ–Ω–∞ —Å–æ –≥–∏—Ç–∞—Ä–∞. –°–ø–æ–º–µ–Ω–∏–∫–æ—Ç —Å–µ –Ω–∞–æ—ì–∞ –Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ –ö–µ—ò–æ—Ç ‚Äû13 –Ω–æ–µ–º–≤—Ä–∏‚Äú –≤–æ —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–æ—Ç –Ω–∞ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ. –ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä –Ω–∞ –æ–≤–∞–∞ —Å–∫—É–ª–ø—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –µ –°–∏–Ω–∏—à–∞ –ù–æ–≤–µ—Å–∫–∏. –°–∫—É–ª–ø—Ç—É—Ä–∞—Ç–∞ –±–∏–ª–∞ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–µ–Ω–∞ –≤–æ –∞–ø—Ä–∏–ª 2009 –≥–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞.–û–≤–∞–∞ —Å–∫—É–ª–ø—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –µ –¥–µ–ª –æ–¥ –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ç –Ω–∞ –ú–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ç–æ –∑–∞ –∫—É–ª—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –∑–∞ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤—É–≤–∞—ö–µ 36 —Å–∫—É–ª–ø—Ç—É—Ä–∏ –≤–æ —Ü–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä–æ—Ç –Ω–∞ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ.', '–ê—Ä—Ö–µ–æ–ª–æ—à–∫–∏ –º—É–∑–µ—ò –Ω–∞ –ú–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω–∏—ò–∞ (—Å–ª—É–∂–±–µ–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç –∫–∞–∫–æ –ê—Ä—Ö–µ–æ–ª–æ—à–∫–∏ –º—É–∑–µ—ò –Ω–∞ –°–µ–≤–µ—Ä–Ω–∞ –ú–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω–∏—ò–∞) —Å–µ –Ω–∞–æ—ì–∞ –≤–æ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ, –ú–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω–∏—ò–∞, –Ω–∞ –ª–µ–≤–∏–æ—Ç –±—Ä–µ–≥ –æ–¥ —Ä–µ–∫–∞—Ç–∞ –í–∞—Ä–¥–∞—Ä.–ü—Ä–≤–∞—Ç–∞ –∞—Ä—Ö–µ–æ–ª–æ—à–∫–∞ –∑–±–∏—Ä–∫–∞ –µ —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ –≤–æ 1920 –≥–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞ –≤–æ —Ä–∞–º–∫–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –§–∏–ª–æ–∑–æ—Ñ—Å–∫–∏–æ—Ç —Ñ–∞–∫—É–ª—Ç–µ—Ç –≤–æ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ. –í–æ 1924 –≥–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞ –µ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∏—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ –º—É–∑–µ—ò—Å–∫–∞ –∏–Ω—Å—Ç–∏—Ç—É—Ü–∏—ò–∞, –ø–æ—Ç–æ—á–Ω–æ, –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Å–∫–æ ‚Äì –∞—Ä—Ö–µ–æ–ª–æ—à–∫–∏ –º—É–∑–µ—ò —Å–æ –ª–∞–ø–∏–¥–∞—Ä–∏—É–º –∫–æ—ò –±–∏–ª —Å–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ–Ω –≤–æ –ö—É—Ä—à—É–º–ª–∏ –∞–Ω.', 'The Museum of the Macedonian Struggle (Macedonian: –ú—É–∑–µ—ò –Ω–∞ –º–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∞ –±–æ—Ä–±–∞) is a national museum of North Macedonia located in the capital city of Skopje. Construction of the museum began on 11 June 2008 and it was opened to the public on the 20th anniversary of the declaration of independence on 8 September 2011. The building is located between the Museum of Archaeology, the Holocaust Museum of Macedonia, the Stone Bridge and the Vardar River.', 'The Mother Teresa Memorial House (Macedonian: –°–ø–æ–º–µ–Ω-–∫—É—ú–∞ –Ω–∞ –ú–∞—ò–∫–∞ –¢–µ—Ä–µ–∑–∞, Albanian: Sht√´pia p√´rkujtimore e N√´n√´ Terez√´s) is dedicated to the Catholic saint and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Mother Teresa. It is located in her hometown Skopje, in North Macedonia, where she lived from 1910 to 1928. The memorial house was built on the popular Macedonia Street in the Centar municipality, on the very location of the once Sacred Heart of Jesus Roman Catholic Church, where Mother Teresa was baptized. It lies just east of the Risti·∏± Palace and the Macedonia Square. In the first three weeks, the memorial house was visited by 12,000 people.', '–°–ø–æ–º–µ–Ω–∏–∫ –Ω–∞ –∂–µ–Ω–∞—Ç–∞ –±–æ—Ä–µ—Ü ‚Äî —Å–ø–æ–º–µ–Ω–∏–∫ –∫–æ—ò —Å–µ –Ω–∞–æ—ì–∞ –≤–æ –ø–∞—Ä–∫–æ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ–¥ –ö–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç –û—Ö—Ä–∏–¥—Å–∫–∏, lit.\u2009'Sveti Kliment Ohridski'; Greek: ·ºçŒ≥ŒπŒøœÇ ŒöŒªŒÆŒºŒ∑œÇ œÑ·øÜœÇ ·ºàœáœÅŒØŒ¥Œ±œÇ; Slovak: sv√§t√Ω Kliment Ochridsk√Ω; c.\u2009830-840 ‚Äì 916) was one of the first Medieval Bulgarian saints, scholar, writer and enlightener of the Slavs. He was one of the most prominent disciples of Saints Cyril and Methodius and is often associated with the creation of the Glagolitic and Cyrillic scripts, especially their popularisation among Christianised Slavs. He was the founder of the Ohrid Literary School and is regarded as a patron of education and language by some Slavic people. He is considered to be the first bishop of the Bulgarian Orthodox Church, one of the Seven Apostles of Bulgarian Orthodox Church and one of the premier saints of modern Bulgaria. The mission of Saint Clement was the crucial factor which transformed the Slavs in Macedonia into Bulgarians. Saint Clement is also the patron saint of North Macedonia, the city of Ohrid and the Macedonian Orthodox Church.", 'Gjergj Kastrioti Sk√´nderbeu (1405 ‚Äì 17 January 1468), known as Skanderbeg (Albanian: Sk√´nderbej from Ottoman Turkish: ÿßÿ≥⁄©ŸÜÿØÿ± ÿ®⁄Ø\u200e, romanized: ƒ∞skender Bey), was an Albanian feudal lord and military commander who led a rebellion against the Ottoman Empire in what is today Albania, North Macedonia, Greece, Kosovo, Montenegro and Serbia.', 'Museum of the City of Skopje (Macedonian: –ú—É–∑–µ—ò –Ω–∞ –ì—Ä–∞–¥ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ) (Albanian: Muzeu i Shkupit) is a cultural institution located in Skopje, North Macedonia. Founded in 1949, it is located in a former railway station that was partly destroyed in the 1963 earthquake. institution in North Macedonia and one of the oldest museums in the country. It is located in the Old Bazaar in Skopje, near the Skopje Fortress. The Museum of the Republic of North Macedonia was created by joining three museum in one. The three museum that were unified were the archaeological, historical and ethnological museum, of which the archaeological museum was the oldest one; it was opened in 1924 and that date is considered as an establishing date of the national museum. It is in the area of Museum of Macedonia. It has served as an inn and as a prison.Kursumli An was built in the 15th or 16th century. There were stables for 100 horses.The walls form a square but roof consists of pyramid-shaped domes. The domes were originally covered in lead, and this is why the serai is called "Lead Bazaar." –ø—Ç–∏—Ü–∏ –∏ —Ü–∏—Ü–∞—á–∏. –í–æ –ú—É–∑–µ—ò–æ—Ç —Å–µ –æ—Ä–≥–∞–Ω–∏–∑–∏—Ä–∞–∞—Ç –∏ —Ç–µ–º–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏ –∏–∑–ª–æ–∂–±–∏.–ó–≥—Ä–∞–¥–∞—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞ –ü—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–¥–æ–Ω–∞—É—á–Ω–∏–æ—Ç –º—É–∑–µ—ò –Ω–∞ –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–æ—Ç–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ –µ –æ–¥ 9.00 –¥–æ 16.00 —á–∞—Å–æ—Ç, —Å–µ–∫–æ—ò –¥–µ–Ω, –æ—Å–≤–µ–Ω –ø–æ–Ω–µ–¥–µ–ª–Ω–∏–∫.', 'The Skopje Zoo (Macedonian: –ó–æ–æ–ª–æ—à–∫–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–¥–∏–Ω–∞ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ; Albanian: Kopshti zoologjik Shkup) is a 12-hectare (30-acre) zoo near City Park in Skopje, North Macedonia. It is home to 500 animals representing 85 species.The zoo was founded in 1926 by a three-member commission led by Stanko Karaman. When it opened, the zoo covered only 4 hectares (10 acres), and exhibited only a few animals which it had received as gifts. With a decision by the Skopje city council in 1965, and the new town zoning in 1966, the zoo was expanded to its current size.', "Kral Kƒ±zƒ± Monument or Kral Kƒ±zƒ± Mausoleum (Macedonian: –¢—É—Ä–±–µ –Ω–∞ –∫—Ä–∞–ª—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∞ —ú–µ—Ä–∫–∞, Turkish: Kral Kƒ±zƒ± T√ºrbesi, Serbo-Croatian: Kral K'zi) is a mausoleum dedicated to the Bosnian princess Catherine located in the city of Skopje, North Macedonia, near the Faculty of Natural Sciences and Mathematics of Ss. Cyril and Methodius University. The tomb was reconstructed in 2014 by the Ministry of Culture of Macedonia with financial contribution from the Ministry of Culture and Sports of Bosnia and Herzegovina, after having been destroyed in the 1963 earthquake.", 'ƒåair Stadium (Macedonian Cyrillic: –°—Ç–∞–¥–∏–æ–Ω –ß–∞–∏—Ä, Stadion ƒåair) is a multi-use stadium in the Municipality of ƒåair in Skopje, North Macedonia. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the formerly home of FK Sloga Jugomagnat and currently home of FK Shkupi. The stadium has a capacity of 6000 with 2,800 seats."S.R.C. CAIR" (in English) Macedonian Football (in English) Football Federation of Macedonia (in Macedonian and English)', '–¢—É—Ä–±–µ—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ –ì–∞–∑–∏ –ë–∞–±–∞ —Å–µ –Ω–∞–æ—ì–∞ –Ω–∞ –∏—Å—Ç–æ–∏–º–µ–Ω–∏–æ—Ç —Ä–∏–¥ –≤–æ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ. –í–æ –Ω–µ–≥–æ –±–∏–ª –ø–æ–≥—Ä–µ–±–∞–Ω –ê—à–∏–∫ –ß–µ–ª–µ–±–∏, –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç —Ç—É—Ä—Å–∫–∏ –ø–æ–µ—Ç –∫–æ—ò –≤–æ —Å–≤–æ—ò—Å—Ç–≤–æ –Ω–∞ –∫–∞–¥–∏—ò–∞ –≥–æ –ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–ª –æ—Å—Ç–∞—Ç–æ–∫–æ—Ç –æ–¥ —Å–≤–æ—ò–æ—Ç –∂–∏–≤–æ—Ç –≤–æ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ, –∫–∞–¥–µ —à—Ç–æ –∏ —É–º—Ä–µ–ª –≤–æ 1571 –≥–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞.–¢—É—Ä–±–µ—Ç–æ –ì–∞–∑–∏ –ë–∞–±–∞ –µ –∑–∞—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–∞ –æ—Å–º–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∞ –∫—É–ø–æ–ª–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–¥–±–∞. –ò–∑–≥—Ä–∞–¥–µ–Ω–æ –µ –æ–¥ —Ç—É–ª–∞, –∞ –Ω–µ–≥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–¥–≤–æ—Ä–µ—à–Ω–æ—Å—Ç –µ –º–∞–ª—Ç–µ—Ä–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∞.–ó–∞ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ –Ω–∞ –∑–µ–º—ò–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Å–æ—Ç –æ–¥ 1963 –≥–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞ –æ–±—ò–µ–∫—Ç–æ—Ç –±–∏–ª –ø—Ä–∏–ª–∏—á–Ω–æ –æ—à—Ç–µ—Ç–µ–Ω. –î–µ–Ω–µ—Å —Ç—É—Ä–±–µ—Ç–æ –µ —Ä–µ–∫–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä—É–∏—Ä–∞–Ω–æ.', "Scupi is an archaeological site located between Zajƒçev Rid (–ó–∞—ò—á–µ–≤ –†–∏–¥ 'Rabbit Hill') and the Vardar River, several kilometers from the center of Skopje in North Macedonia. A Roman military camp was founded here in the second century BC on the site of an older Dardanian settlement. It became later Colonia Flavia Aelia Scupi and many veteran legionnaires were settled there. A Roman town was founded in the time of Domitian (AD 81‚Äì96) and Scupi became the chief center for romanizing Dardania. It was abandoned in AD 518 after an earthquake completely destroyed the city.", '–ö—Ä—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä (–ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞—Ç –∏ –∫–∞–∫–æ –ö—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–∞—Ä) ‚Äî –Ω–∞—ò–≤–∏—Å–æ–∫ –≤—Ä–≤ –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏–Ω–∞—Ç–∞ –í–æ–¥–Ω–æ, —ò—É–∂–Ω–æ –Ω–∞–¥ –≥—Ä–∞–¥–æ—Ç –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ. –ù–µ–≥–æ–≤–∞—Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–¥–º–æ—Ä—Å–∫–∞ –≤–∏—Å–æ—á–∏–Ω–∞ –∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å—É–≤–∞ 1.066 –º–µ—Ç—Ä–∏, –∞ —Ç–µ—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—ò–∞–ª–Ω–æ –ø—Ä–∏–ø–∞—ì–∞ –Ω–∞ —Å–∫–æ–ø—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∞ –û–ø—à—Ç–∏–Ω–∞ –ö–∞—Ä–ø–æ—à. –í—Ä–≤–æ—Ç –Ω–µ –µ –ø–æ—à—É–º–µ–Ω –∏ –ø—Ä–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–∞–≤—É–≤–∞ —Ç—Ä–µ–≤–Ω–∞—Ç–æ-–∫–∞–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç —Ç–µ—Ä–µ–Ω. –ù–∞ –≤—Ä–≤–æ—Ç –ö—Ä—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ä —Å–µ –Ω–∞–æ—ì–∞–∞—Ç –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏–Ω–∞—Ä—Å–∫–∏–æ—Ç –¥–æ–º ‚Äû–î–∞—Ä–µ –è–∞–º–±–∞–∑‚Äú –∏ –ú–∏–ª–µ–Ω–∏—É–º—Å–∫–∏–æ—Ç –∫—Ä—Å—Ç, –µ–¥–µ–Ω –æ–¥ –±–µ–ª–µ–∑–∏—Ç–µ –Ω–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–¥–æ—Ç –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–µ–Ω –≤–æ 2002 –≥. –í–æ –Ω–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ä–µ–¥–Ω–∞ –Ω–∞ —Å–∞–º–∏–æ—Ç –≤—Ä–≤ —Å–µ –ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–µ–Ω–∏ –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–∞–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –∑–∞ —Ç–µ–ª–µ–≤–∏–∑–∏—ò–∞ –∏ –º–æ–±–∏–ª–Ω–∞ —Ç–µ–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω–∏—ò–∞, –∞ —Å–µ –Ω–∞–æ—ì–∞–∞—Ç –∏ –≤–æ–µ–Ω–æ-–ø–æ–ª–∏—Ü–∏—Å–∫–∏ –æ–±—ò–µ–∫—Ç–∏, –∫–∞–∫–æ –∏ –∏–∑–≤–æ—Ä –Ω–∞ –≤–æ–¥–∞. –ù—É–¥–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä—Å–µ–Ω –ø–∞–Ω–æ—Ä–∞–º—Å–∫–∏ –ø–æ–≥–ª–µ–¥ –Ω–∞ —Ü–µ–ª–∏–æ—Ç –≥—Ä–∞–¥ –°–∫–æ–ø—ò–µ, –∞ –∫–æ–Ω —ò—É–≥ –Ω–∞ —Å–µ–ª–∞—Ç–∞ –ì–æ—Ä–Ω–æ –°–æ—ö–µ –∏ –î–æ–ª–Ω–æ –°–æ—ö–µ, –∫–∞–∫–æ –∏ –Ω–∞ –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏–Ω–∏—Ç–µ –ö–∞—Ä–∞—ü–∏—Ü–∞ –∏ –î–∞—É—Ç–∏—Ü–∞.', 'Vodno (Macedonian: –í–æ–¥–Ω–æ) is a mountain in North Macedonia. It is located in the northern part of the country, to the southwest of the capital city Skopje. The highest point of the mountain is at Krstovar peak, on 1066 meters and the submontane is on 337 meters (Middle Vodno is on 557 m). In 2002, on Krstovar peak the Millennium Cross was built, one of the biggest Christian Crosses in the world.', '–ù–µ–æ–ª–∏—Ç–Ω–æ—Ç–æ —Å–µ–ª–æ (–Ω–∞ –º–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω—Å–∫–∞ –ª–∏—Ç–µ—Ä–∞—Ç—É—Ä–Ω–∞ –Ω–æ—Ä–º–∞: –ù–µ–æ–ª–∏—Ç—Å–∫–æ –°–µ–ª–æ) –µ –∞—Ä—Ö–µ–æ–ª–æ–≥–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏ –º—É–∑–µ–π –≤ –∫–≤–∞—Ä—Ç–∞–ª –ú–∞–¥–∂–∞—Ä–∏ –Ω–∞ –≥—Ä–∞–¥ –°–∫–æ–ø–∏–µ, –†–µ–ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞ –ú–∞–∫–µ–¥–æ–Ω–∏—è, –≤—ä–∑—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–∞ –Ω–∞ –Ω–µ–æ–ª–∏—Ç–Ω–æ—Ç–æ —Å–µ–ª–∏—â–µ –¢—É–º–±–∞. –°–µ–ª–∏—â–µ—Ç–æ –¢—É–º–±–∞, —Å—ä—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É–≤–∞–ª–æ –æ—Ç 6000 –¥–æ 4300 –≥–æ–¥–∏–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä.–Ω.–µ., –µ –Ω–∞–π-–≤–∞–∂–Ω–æ—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–æ–ª–∏—Ç–Ω–æ —Å–µ–ª–∏—â–µ –≤ –°–∫–æ–ø—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω–∞.']

column5: ['Djibouti', 'El-Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium']
column6: ["Djibouti (also called Djibouti City and in many early English texts and on many early maps, Jibuti; Arabic: ŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿ¨Ÿäÿ®Ÿàÿ™Ÿä\u200e, French: Ville de Djibouti, Somali: Magaalada Jabuuti, Afar: Magaala Gabuuti) is the eponymous capital and largest city of Djibouti. It is located in the coastal Djibouti Region on the Gulf of Tadjoura.Djibouti has a population of around 600,000 inhabitants, which counts for 54% of the country's population. The settlement was founded in 1888 by the French, on land leased from the ruling Somali and Afar Sultans. During the ensuing period, it served as the capital of French Somaliland and its successor the French Territory of the Afars and Issas.", "The El Hadj Hassan Gouled Aptidon Stadium is a multi-use stadium in Djibouti City, Djibouti. It is currently reserved mostly for football matches. The stadium has a capacity of hosting up to 20,000 fans. As of April 2007, the Stade has an artificial turf pitch courtesy of FIFA's Win in Africa development programme. It is currently the home ground of the Djibouti national football team. The stadium is home to many sports federations in Djibouti, including the Djiboutian Football Federation."]

column5: ['Qaser Al-Basha Museum', 'Qaser Al-Basha Museum', 'Battle of Gaza', 'Gaza War Cemetery', 'First Battle of Gaza', 'Second Battle of Gaza', "Battle of Shuja'iyya", 'ANZAC Memorial', '◊ë◊ê◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ë◊†◊í◊ë', "Battle of Be'erot Yitzhak", 'a Fortress facing Gaza', 'Black Arrow', 'Beeri IDF Temporary Military Cemetery Monument']
column6: ["Qasr al-Basha (Arabic: ŸÇÿµÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿßÿ¥ÿß\u200e), also known as Radwan Castle and Napoleon's Fort, was formerly a large palace, and now a two-floored girls' school and museum, situated in the Old City of Gaza. It served as a seat of power in the Mamluk and Ottoman periods and as a police station under the British Mandate.", "Qasr al-Basha (Arabic: ŸÇÿµÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿßÿ¥ÿß\u200e), also known as Radwan Castle and Napoleon's Fort, was formerly a large palace, and now a two-floored girls' school and museum, situated in the Old City of Gaza. It served as a seat of power in the Mamluk and Ottoman periods and as a police station under the British Mandate.", "The Battle of Gaza was a battle of the Third war of the Diadochi between Ptolemy (and Seleucus) against Demetrius (son of Antigonus I Monophthalmus).In late 312 BC, Ptolemy launched an invasion from Egypt, he marched with 18,000 infantry and 4,000 cavalry along the northern edge of the Sinai. Receiving timely intelligence, Demetrius recalled his troops from their winter quarters and concentrated them at Gaza. Demetrius's advisors told him not to fight the more experienced Ptolemy and Seleucus, but he ignored their advice.", 'The Commonwealth Gaza War Cemetery, often referred to as the British War Cemetery, is a cemetery administered by the Commonwealth War Graves Commission on the Salah al-Din Road in Gaza City\'s Tuffah district. The cemetery is 1.5 km (1 mi) in size. The majority of burials at the cemetery are of Allied soldiers who lost their lives in World War I, principally in the First, Second and Third Battles of Gaza. Some 3,217 British and Commonwealth servicemen are buried in the cemetery; nearly 800 of the graves lack identification, and are inscribed "Soldier of the Great War, known unto God". 234 graves of non-Commonwealth soldiers are also present in the cemetery. A further 210 Commonwealth soldiers were interred in the cemetery following their death in World War II; the post-war period saw 30 more burials.', 'The First Battle of Gaza was fought on 26 March 1917, during the first attempt by the Egyptian Expeditionary Force (EEF) to invade the south of Palestine in the Ottoman Empire during the Sinai and Palestine Campaign of the First World War. Fighting took place in and around the town of Gaza on the Mediterranean coast when infantry and mounted infantry from the Desert Column, a component of the Eastern Force, attacked the town. Late in the afternoon, on the verge of capturing Gaza, the Desert Column was withdrawn due to concerns about the approaching darkness and large Ottoman reinforcements. This British defeat was followed a few weeks later by the even more emphatic defeat of the Eastern Force at the Second Battle of Gaza in April 1917.', "The Second Battle of Gaza was fought between 17 and 19 April 1917, following the defeat of the Egyptian Expeditionary Force (EEF) at the First Battle of Gaza in March, during the Sinai and Palestine Campaign of the First World War. Gaza was defended by the strongly entrenched Ottoman Army garrison, which had been reinforced after the first battle by substantial forces. They manned the town's defences and a line of strong redoubts which extended eastwards along the road from Gaza to Beersheba. The defenders were attacked by the Eastern Force's three infantry divisions, supported by two mounted divisions, but the strength of the defenders, their entrenchments, and supporting artillery decimated the attackers.", 'The Battle of Shuja\'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel‚ÄìGaza conflict in the Shuja\'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.:\u200a71\u200a Shuja\'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. The UN Protection Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed as a result of the IDF\'s actions. At the time, estimates varied from 66 to about 120 Palestinians killed, with a third of them women and children, and at least 288 wounded. The UN figures of Palestinian casualties are preliminary and subject to revision. 13 Israeli soldiers were killed.', '◊ô◊ì ◊ê◊†◊ñ◊ê"◊ß (The Anzac Memorial) ◊î◊ô◊ê ◊ê◊†◊ì◊®◊ò◊î ◊ú◊ó◊ô◊ô◊ú◊ô ◊¶◊ë◊ê◊ï◊™ ◊ê◊ï◊°◊ò◊®◊ú◊ô◊î ◊ï◊†◊ô◊ï ◊ñ◊ô◊ú◊†◊ì (◊©◊†◊ß◊®◊ê◊ï ◊ô◊ó◊ì ◊ê◊†◊ñ◊ê"◊ß) ◊©◊†◊î◊®◊í◊ï ◊ë◊ê◊®◊• ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú ◊ë◊ß◊®◊ë◊ï◊™ ◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ú◊ù ◊î◊®◊ê◊©◊ï◊†◊î.◊î◊ê◊†◊ì◊®◊ò◊î ◊©◊†◊ó◊†◊õ◊î ◊ë◊©◊†◊™ 1967 ◊ë◊ô◊¢◊® ◊ë◊ê◊®◊ô, ◊™◊ï◊õ◊†◊†◊î ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊î◊ê◊®◊õ◊ô◊ò◊ß◊ò ◊ô◊ì◊ô◊ì◊ô◊î ◊ê◊ô◊ñ◊†◊©◊ò◊ò ◊ï◊†◊™◊®◊û◊î ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊ô◊î◊ì◊ï◊™ ◊ê◊ï◊°◊ò◊®◊ú◊ô◊î ◊ï◊†◊ô◊ï ◊ñ◊ô◊ú◊†◊ì ◊ú◊ñ◊õ◊® ◊î◊õ◊ï◊ó◊ï◊™ ◊û◊©◊™◊ô ◊î◊ê◊®◊¶◊ï◊™, ◊©◊§◊¢◊ú◊ï ◊ë◊û◊ß◊ï◊ù ◊ñ◊î. ◊ê◊ñ◊ï◊® ◊î◊ê◊†◊ì◊®◊ò◊î ◊î◊ô◊î ◊ó◊ú◊ß ◊û◊ñ◊ô◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ß◊®◊ë ◊¢◊ñ◊î ◊î◊®◊ê◊©◊ï◊ü ◊ï◊ß◊®◊ë ◊¢◊ñ◊î ◊î◊©◊†◊ô. ◊î◊ê◊†◊ì◊®◊ò◊î ◊ë◊†◊ï◊ô◊î ◊ë◊¶◊ï◊®◊™ ◊î◊ê◊ï◊™ A ◊©◊î◊ô◊ê ◊î◊ê◊ï◊™ ◊î◊®◊ê◊©◊ï◊†◊î ◊ë◊û◊ô◊ú◊î Anzac, ◊ï◊ë◊®◊ê◊©◊î ◊û◊®◊§◊°◊™ ◊™◊¶◊§◊ô◊™ ◊¢◊ú ◊õ◊ú ◊î◊ê◊ñ◊ï◊®.730 ◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊û◊î◊ê◊†◊ñ◊ê"◊ß: 544 ◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊û◊ê◊ï◊°◊ò◊®◊ú◊ô◊î ◊ï-186 ◊û◊†◊ô◊ï ◊ñ◊ô◊ú◊†◊ì ◊ò◊û◊ï◊†◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊ë◊™◊ô ◊î◊ß◊ë◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ú◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô ◊î◊ê◊ô◊û◊§◊®◊ô◊î ◊î◊ë◊®◊ô◊ò◊ô◊™ ◊ë◊ê◊®◊• ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú ◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊î◊¢◊ï◊ú◊ù ◊î◊®◊ê◊©◊ï◊†◊î. ◊©◊ô◊¢◊ï◊® ◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô ◊î◊ê◊†◊ñ◊ê"◊ß ◊û◊™◊ï◊ö ◊õ◊ú◊ú ◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô ◊î◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊î, ◊©◊î◊ô◊ï 12,197 ◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô◊ù, ◊î◊ï◊ê 6%.', '◊ë◊ê◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ë◊†◊í◊ë ◊î◊ï◊ê ◊û◊®◊õ◊ñ ◊û◊ï◊®◊©◊™ ◊©◊î◊ï◊ß◊ù ◊ë◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊¢◊ú◊ï◊û◊ô◊ù. ◊î◊û◊®◊õ◊ñ ◊¢◊ï◊ß◊ë ◊ê◊ó◊®◊ô ◊™◊ï◊ú◊ì◊ï◊™◊ô◊ï ◊©◊ú ◊î◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊î◊ì◊™◊ô, ◊ë◊ê◊®◊ï◊™ ◊ô◊¶◊ó◊ß ◊©◊î◊ï◊ß◊ù ◊ë◊û◊ß◊ï◊ù ◊ë-1943, ◊ï◊†◊î◊®◊° ◊ë◊¢◊ß◊ë◊ï◊™ ◊î◊ß◊®◊ë ◊¢◊ù ◊î◊û◊¶◊®◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊î◊¢◊¶◊û◊ê◊ï◊™. ◊û◊®◊õ◊ñ ◊î◊û◊ï◊®◊©◊™ ◊û◊õ◊ô◊ú ◊ê◊™ ◊û◊®◊õ◊ñ ◊î◊û◊ë◊ß◊®◊ô◊ù ◊ë◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊¢◊ú◊ï◊û◊ô◊ù, ◊ï◊ê◊™ ◊û◊í◊ì◊ú ◊î◊û◊ô◊ù ◊î◊ô◊©◊ü ◊©◊ú ◊î◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊•.', "The Battle of Be'erot Yitzhak was a military engagement between the Israel Defense Forces and Egyptian army in the 1948 Arab‚ÄìIsraeli War. It was fought on July 15, 1948, in the ten-day period between the first and second truces of the war.The Egyptian army, after unsuccessful attacks on Negba on July 12 and Gal On on July 14, assaulted the lightly defended outlying Negev village Be'erot Yitzhak. They managed to penetrate the village perimeter, but the Israelis concentrated in an inner position in the village, and fought off the Egyptian advance until reinforcements arrived and drove out the attackers.", '◊û◊¢◊ï◊ñ ◊û◊ï◊ú ◊¢◊ñ◊î ◊©◊ë◊ß◊®◊ë◊™ ◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊°◊¢◊ì ◊î◊ï◊ê ◊ê◊™◊® ◊û◊ï◊®◊©◊™ ◊ï◊û◊ï◊ñ◊ô◊ê◊ï◊ü ◊ú◊®◊ê◊©◊ô◊™ ◊î◊î◊™◊ô◊ô◊©◊ë◊ï◊™ ◊î◊ì◊™◊ô◊™ ◊ë◊†◊í◊ë ◊¢◊®◊ë ◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊î◊¢◊¶◊û◊ê◊ï◊™.◊î◊û◊ï◊ñ◊ô◊ê◊ï◊ü ◊î◊ï◊ß◊ù ◊ë◊ë◊ô◊™ ◊î◊ë◊ô◊ò◊ó◊ï◊ü ◊©◊ú ◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊°◊¢◊ì - ◊í◊ë◊¢◊î ◊†◊û◊ï◊õ◊î ◊©◊†◊ß◊®◊ê◊î ◊¢◊ú ◊©◊ù ◊©◊ï◊ú◊î ◊ê◊†◊í◊ú◊°◊ë◊®◊í, ◊ó◊ë◊®◊™ ◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊ë◊ê◊®◊ô ◊©◊†◊®◊¶◊ó◊î ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊û◊ó◊ë◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊©◊ó◊ì◊®◊ï ◊ú◊ß◊ô◊ë◊ï◊• ◊ë-25 ◊ë◊ì◊¶◊û◊ë◊® 1949.◊î◊ê◊™◊® ◊î◊ï◊§◊¢◊ú ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊ó◊ô◊ô◊ú◊ô ◊î◊®◊ë◊†◊ï◊™ ◊î◊¶◊ë◊ê◊ô◊™ ◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊°◊ô◊†◊ô, ◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊©◊©◊™ ◊î◊ô◊û◊ô◊ù ◊ï◊ë◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊™ ◊ô◊ï◊ù ◊î◊õ◊ô◊§◊ï◊®◊ô◊ù ◊ú◊©◊ù ◊ß◊ë◊ï◊®◊î ◊ê◊®◊¢◊ô◊™ ◊©◊ú ◊ó◊ô◊ô◊ú◊ô ◊¶◊î"◊ú ◊©◊†◊§◊ú◊ï ◊ë◊ó◊ñ◊ô◊™ ◊î◊ì◊®◊ï◊ù. ◊î◊ì◊ë◊® ◊†◊¢◊©◊î ◊ë◊ê◊ô◊ü ◊ô◊õ◊ï◊ú◊™ ◊ú◊î◊ï◊¶◊ô◊ê ◊ú◊§◊ï◊¢◊ú ◊ê◊™ ◊ß◊ë◊ï◊®◊™◊ù ◊î◊ß◊ë◊ï◊¢◊î ◊™◊ï◊ö ◊õ◊ì◊ô ◊î◊û◊ú◊ó◊û◊î. ◊ë◊õ◊ú ◊î◊û◊ß◊®◊ô◊ù ◊î◊ï◊¢◊ë◊®◊ï ◊ê◊®◊ï◊†◊ï◊™ ◊î◊ó◊ú◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊û◊î◊û◊ß◊ï◊ù ◊ë◊û◊î◊ú◊ö ◊î◊©◊†◊î ◊©◊ú◊ê◊ó◊® ◊†◊§◊ô◊ú◊™◊ù ◊ú◊ß◊ë◊ï◊®◊î ◊ß◊ë◊ï◊¢◊î ◊ë◊ê◊™◊®◊ô◊ù ◊©◊†◊ë◊ó◊®◊ï ◊¢◊ú ◊ô◊ì◊ô ◊ë◊†◊ô ◊û◊©◊§◊ó◊ï◊™◊ô◊î◊ù.']

column5: ['National Gallery of Jamaica', 'Blue and John Crow Mountains National Park', 'Independence Park', 'Bob Marley museum', 'Port Royal']
column6: ['The National Gallery of Jamaica, in Kingston, Jamaica, is Jamaica\'s public art museum. It was established in 1974 and is located in the Kingston Mall, a commercial and cultural center on Kingston harbour. The National Gallery of Jamaica also has a branch in Montego Bay, National Gallery West.The gallery houses several important works, mostly by artists from Jamaica, including John Dunkley, Mallica "Kapo" Reynolds, Edna Manley, Barrington Watson, Albert Artwell, Everald Brown, Cecil Baugh, Albert Huie, Carl Abrahams, Osmond Watson, Judy Ann MacMillan, Omari Ra, Laura Facey, Jasmine Thomas-Girvan, Petrona Morrison, Hope Brooks, Ebony G. Patterson, Philip Thomas and Leasho Johnson .', 'Blue and John Crow Mountains National Park is a national park in Jamaica. The park covers 495.2 km2 and accounts for 4.5% of Jamaica\'s land surface. It gets its name from the Blue Mountains, the mountain range that runs through it, as well as a common bird found in the park, the "John crow" or turkey vulture (Cathartes aura). The park is globally known for its biodiversity. This park is the last of two known habitats of the giant swallowtail butterfly (Papilio homerus), the largest butterfly in the Western Hemisphere and also the habitat for the endangered Jamaican blackbird (Nesopsar nigerrimus), a refuge for the Jamaican boa (Chilabothrus subflavus) and the Jamaican hutia (Geocapromys brownii).', "Independence Park is a sports and cultural complex in Kingston, Jamaica built for the 1966 British Empire and Commonwealth Games. It houses a variety of sports facilities. A statue of Bob Marley marks the entrance to the site. The main sports venue at the complex is the National Stadium.The National Stadium is primarily used for football (being the home field of the Jamaica Football Federation) but is also considered the apex of Athletic competition in the West Indies being home to Jamaica's national athletic team for the Olympic Games and Commonwealth Games.", "The Bob Marley Museum is a museum in Kingston, Jamaica, dedicated to the reggae musician Bob Marley. The museum is located at 56 Hope Road, Kingston, and is Bob Marley's former place of residence. It was home to the Tuff Gong reggae record label which was founded by The Wailers in 1970. In 1976, it was the site of a failed assassination attempt on Bob Marley.List of music museumsAerial view. The museum at the Bob Marley Foundation's website.", 'Port Royal is a village located at the end of the Palisadoes, at the mouth of Kingston Harbour, in southeastern Jamaica. Founded in 1494 by the Spanish, it was once the largest city in the Caribbean, functioning as the centre of shipping and commerce in the Caribbean Sea by the latter half of the 17th century. It was destroyed by an earthquake on 7 June 1692, which had an accompanying tsunami. Severe hurricanes have regularly damaged it. Another severe earthquake occurred in 1907.']

column6: ['The Bank Al-Maghrib is the central bank of the Kingdom of Morocco. It was founded in 1959 as the successor to the "Banque d‚Äô√âtat du Maroc" (est. 1906). In 2008 Bank Al-Maghrib held reserves of foreign currency with an estimated worth of US$36 billion. In addition to currency management, the Bank Al-Maghrib also supervises a number of private banks supplying commercial banking services. The bank has a branch in Casablanca, and agencies in 18 other cities in Morocco. The current governor is Abdellatif Jovahri.The bank is a member of the Alliance for Financial Inclusion and active in promoting financial inclusion policy.', 'ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ÿßŸÑŸàÿ∑ŸÜŸä ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßŸÖÿ≥ ÿ£Ÿà ŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßŸÖÿ≥ ŸáŸà ÿ£ŸÉÿ®ÿ± ŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ® Ÿàÿ£ŸàŸÑ ŸÖÿ®ŸÜŸâ ŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠Ÿä ÿ£ŸÜÿ¥ÿ¶ ŸÖŸÜÿ∞ ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇŸÑÿßŸÑŸá. ÿ™ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ≥ ÿπÿßŸÖ 1962 ŸàŸäŸÇÿπ Ÿàÿ≥ÿ∑ ŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ®ÿßÿ∑ÿå ÿπÿßÿµŸÖÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®ÿå ŸÇÿ±ÿ® ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸäŸÖÿ© Ÿàÿ¥ÿßÿ±ÿπ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßŸÖÿ≥.ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿ£ŸÜÿ¥ÿ£Ÿá ŸÖÿ¥ÿ±Ÿàÿπ ŸÖŸÜ Ÿàÿ≤ÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≠ÿ®ÿßÿ≥ ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸÖŸàŸÑÿ™ ÿ®ŸÜÿßÿ¶Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ŸÖŸÖ ÿπÿßŸÖ 1961ÿå ŸàÿØÿ¥ŸÜŸá ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÑŸÉ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ≥ŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ´ÿßŸÜŸä ŸÅŸä 14 ŸÖÿßÿ±ÿ≥ 1962 ÿ™ÿ≠ÿ™ ÿßÿ≥ŸÖ "ŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßŸÖÿ≥" ÿ™ŸÉÿ±ŸäŸÖÿß ŸÑŸàÿßŸÑÿØŸá ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿßÿ≠ŸÑ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßŸÖÿ≥. ÿµÿßÿ± ŸàŸÅŸÇÿß ŸÑÿ∏ŸáŸäÿ± ÿµÿØÿ± 22 ŸÅÿ®ÿ±ÿßŸäÿ± 1973 "ŸÖÿ§ÿ≥ÿ≥ÿ© ÿπŸÖŸàŸÖŸäÿ© ÿ∞ÿßÿ™ ÿ∑ÿßÿ®ÿπÿ© ŸÇÿßŸÜŸàŸÜŸäÿ© Ÿàÿßÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇŸÑÿßŸÑŸäÿ© ŸÖÿßŸÑŸäÿ© ÿ™ÿÆÿ∂ÿπ ŸÑŸÑÿ•ÿØÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÉŸÑŸÅÿ© ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿ§ŸàŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÇÿßŸÅŸäÿ©" ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸÉÿßŸÜÿ™ ÿ¢ŸÜÿ∞ÿßŸÉ Ÿàÿ≤ÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≠ÿ®ÿßÿ≥ ŸÑŸÑÿ¥ÿ§ŸàŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ≥ŸÑÿßŸÖŸäÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÇÿßŸÅÿ©ÿå ŸàÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÜ Ÿàÿ≤ÿßÿ±ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÇÿßŸÅÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿßÿ™ÿµÿßŸÑ‚Äîÿ™ÿ≠ÿ™ ÿßÿ≥ŸÖ ŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿÆÿßŸÖÿ≥ ÿßŸÑŸàÿ∑ŸÜŸä.ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàŸÇÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖŸäÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ® ÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿ≥ŸÑÿß ÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ®ÿßÿ∑', "The National Photography Museum (Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿßŸÑŸàÿ∑ŸÜŸä ŸÑŸÑŸÅŸàÿ™Ÿàÿ∫ÿ±ÿßŸÅŸäÿß\u200e) is a Moroccan art museum dedicated to photography located in Rabat, Morocco, within the repurposed 19th century Burj Kebir Fortress. This museum was initiated by the National Museums Foundation in Morocco and inaugurated January 14, 2020.The National Photography Museum is located within the remains of the Burj Kebir Fortress, also known as Fort Rottembourg. The fort was constructed from 1886 to 1900 under the reign of Sultan Hassan I. Rottembourg refers to Walter Rottembourg, the German engineer who oversaw the fort's construction.", 'The Mohammed VI Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art , abbreviated MMVI, (Arabic: ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿßÿØÿ≥ ŸÑŸÑŸÅŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿØŸäÿ´ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿπÿßÿµÿ±\u200e) is a contemporary and modern art museum in Rabat, Morocco which opened in 2014. It is one of fourteen museums of the National Foundation of Museums of Morocco. The museum curates modern and contemporary Moroccan and international art. The MMVI is the first large scale museum built in Morocco since independence from France in 1956. It was the first Moroccan public museum to meet International Museography Standards. The museum houses the works of 200 Moroccan artists, including Hassan Hajjaj and Ahmed Yacoubi.', "The Museum of History and Civilizations (Arabic: ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿßÿ±ŸäÿÆ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ∂ÿßÿ±ÿßÿ™\u200e, French: Mus√©e de l'histoire et des civilisations) is an archaeological museum in Rabat, Morocco. The stadium holds 15,000 spectators.Stadium information StadiumDB.com images', "Le jardin d'essais botaniques de Rabat est un jardin botanique de dix-sept hectares situ√© dans le quartier de l'Agdal √† Rabat, centr√© sur l'Avenue de la Victoire, avec une partie en amont donnant sur la rue Oqba et la Biblioth√®que nationale, et une autre partie en aval limit√©e par l'Avenue Hassan II et qui abrite certains laboratoires de l'Institut national de la recherche agronomique du Maroc.Cr√©√© en 1914, C'est l'un des plus anciens jardins d'essai et d'acclimatation. It contains the tombs of the Moroccan king Mohammed V and his two sons, late King Hassan II and Prince Abdallah.The mausoleum complex was designed by Vietnamese architect Cong Vo Toan using traditional forms with modern materials. The rich materials, as well as the deliberate use of historical crafts and motifs, is meant to not only pay tribute to Mohammed V but also to evoke his own efforts to encourage traditional craftsmanship as a means of promote a sense of Moroccan identity.', "The Grand Theatre of Rabat (French: Grand Th√©√¢tre de Rabat; Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ±ÿ≠ ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ± ŸÑŸÑÿ±ÿ®ÿßÿ∑\u200e, lit.\u2009'The Great Theatre of Rabat') is a large performing arts center under construction in Rabat, the capital city of Morocco. The building is designed by Zaha Hadid and her architectural firm Zaha Hadid Architects. Planning began for the project in 2010 and construction officially started on October 7, 2014. Completion of the project was scheduled for late 2019. The building is among the last projects designed by Zaha Hadid before her passing in 2016.", "The Medina of Sal√©, or Sal√© old town (in Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπÿ™ŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÑÿ≥ŸÑÿß) is the medina quarter and the oldest walled part in the city of Sal√© in Morocco. It is classified as a national cultural heritage since October 1914, and is considered as one of the oldest medinas of Morocco.Sal√©, in the time of the Ifrenids, was very difficult to besiege, which made it very difficult for the Almohads to conquer the city. Under the order of the Almohad Caliph Abd al-Mu'min, they decided to destroy the ramparts. Adopting the same motto as his grandfather, Abu Yusuf Yaqub al-Mansur had the Sal√© enclosure rebuilt on the north and south-east side in 1196.", 'Stade Boubker Ammar is a football stadium in Sal√©, Morocco. It is the home stadium of Association Sal√© of the Botola. The stadium holds 10,000 spectators.Stadium information', 'ÿ∂ÿ±Ÿäÿ≠ ÿ≥ŸäÿØŸä ŸÖŸàÿ≥Ÿâ ÿßŸÑÿØŸÉÿßŸÑŸäÿå ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπÿ±ŸàŸÅ ÿ£Ÿäÿ∂ÿß ÿ®ÿ≥ŸäÿØŸä ŸÖŸàÿ≥Ÿâÿå ŸáŸà ÿ∂ÿ±Ÿäÿ≠ ŸÑŸÑŸàŸÑŸä ÿßŸÑÿµÿßŸÑÿ≠ ÿ≥ŸäÿØŸä ŸÖŸàÿ≥Ÿâ ÿßŸÑÿØŸÉÿßŸÑŸäÿå Ÿäÿ∑ŸÑ ÿπŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≠Ÿäÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ∑ŸÑÿ≥Ÿäÿå ÿ®ŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿ≥ŸÑÿß ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®. Ÿäÿπÿ™ÿ®ÿ± Ÿáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ∂ÿ±Ÿäÿ≠ ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®ÿßŸÜŸä ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿßÿ±ŸäÿÆŸäÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿßŸÇÿπ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿßÿ∑ŸÇ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿ™ÿ®ÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿπÿØÿßÿØ ÿßŸÑÿ¢ÿ´ÿßÿ± ÿ®ÿπŸÖÿßŸÑÿ© ÿ≥ŸÑÿßÿå ŸàŸáŸà ŸÖÿ≥ÿ¨ŸÑ ÿ∂ŸÖŸÜ ŸÖÿ®ÿßŸÜŸä ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ±ÿßÿ´ ÿßŸÑŸàÿ∑ŸÜŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿå ÿ≠ÿ≥ÿ® ŸÇÿ±ÿßÿ± Ÿàÿ≤ÿßÿ±Ÿä ÿ®ÿ™ÿßÿ±ŸäÿÆ 16 ÿ£ŸÉÿ™Ÿàÿ®ÿ± 1948ÿå ÿµÿØÿ± ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¨ÿ±ŸäÿØÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© ÿ±ŸÇŸÖ 1882 ŸäŸàŸÖ 19 ŸÜŸàŸÅŸÖÿ®ÿ± 1948.ÿßÿ±ÿ™ÿ®ÿ∑ ÿßŸÑÿ∂ÿ±Ÿäÿ≠ ŸÖÿ§ÿÆÿ±ÿß ÿ®ÿ£ÿπŸÖÿßŸÑ ÿ≥ÿ≠ÿ± Ÿàÿ¥ÿπŸàÿØÿ© ÿ™ÿ¨ÿ±Ÿä ÿØÿßÿÆŸÑŸáÿå ÿ¨ŸÑÿ®ÿ™ ÿßŸÜÿ™ŸÇÿßÿØÿßÿ™ ÿπÿØÿ© ŸÅÿπÿßŸÑŸäÿßÿ™ ŸÖÿ≠ŸÑŸäÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿ∑ŸÇÿ©.ÿ®ŸÜŸä ÿßŸÑÿ∂ÿ±Ÿäÿ≠ ŸÜÿ≥ÿ®ÿ© ŸÑŸÑŸàŸÑŸä ÿßŸÑÿµÿßŸÑÿ≠ ÿ≥ŸäÿØŸä ŸÖŸàÿ≥Ÿâ ÿßŸÑÿØŸÉÿßŸÑŸäÿå ÿßŸÑÿ∞Ÿä ÿ™ŸàŸÅŸä ÿ≥ŸÜÿ© 580 ŸÑŸÑŸáÿ¨ÿ±ÿ©.', 'Kasbah Gnawa (Arabic: ŸÇÿµÿ®ÿ© ⁄≠ŸÜÿßŸàÿ©), also referred to as: Kasbah of Gnaouas or Ismailian Kasbah is a kasbah located in the city of Sal√© in Morocco, and is the only one on the right bank of the Bou Regreg river.Nowadays, the kasbah is hosting a circus school called "Shemsy\'s", which is the national Moroccan circus school, and the only circus school in Morocco and the whole of Africa.', 'Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium (Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¨ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂Ÿä ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖŸäÿ± ŸÖŸàŸÑÿßŸä ÿπÿ®ÿØ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Rabat, Morocco. It is named after Prince Moulay Abdellah of Morocco.It was built in 1983 and is the home ground of Association sportive des FAR. It is currently used mostly for football matches and it can also stage athletics. The stadium has an occupancy of 53,000 people.', 'Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium (Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¨ŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂Ÿä ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖŸäÿ± ŸÖŸàŸÑÿßŸä ÿπÿ®ÿØ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸá\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Rabat, Morocco. It is named after Prince Moulay Abdellah of Morocco.It was built in 1983 and is the home ground of Association sportive des FAR. It is currently used mostly for football matches and it can also stage athletics. The stadium has an occupancy of 53,000 people.', 'The Bou Regreg (Arabic: ÿ£ÿ®Ÿà ÿ±ŸÇÿ±ÿßŸÇ\u200e) is a river located in western Morocco which discharges to the Atlantic Ocean between the cities of Rabat and Sal√©. The estuary of this river is termed Wadi Sala.The river is 240 kilometres long, with a tidal estuary of approximately 24 kilometres extending upriver. Its average discharge is 23 m3/s and can reach 1500 m3/s during periods of flooding. The source of the river originates from the Middle Atlas mountains at an altitude of 1627 meters on the level of Jbel Mtourzgane (Province of Khemisset) and of Grou (Province of Kh√©nifra) and descends to its mouth at the Atlantic Ocean separating the cities of Rabat to the south and Sal√© to the north.', 'Rabat Zoo (Arabic: ÿ≠ŸéÿØŸêŸäŸíŸÇŸéÿ© Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿ≠ŸéŸäŸíŸàŸéÿßŸÜŸéÿßÿ™ ÿ®ŸêŸ±ŸÑÿ±ŸêŸëÿ®Ÿéÿßÿ∑\u200e, romanized: ·∏§adƒ´qat al-·∏§aywƒÅnƒÅt bir-RibƒÅ·π≠ ("Zoological Garden in Rabat"), Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿ≠ŸéÿØŸêŸäŸíŸÇŸéÿ© Ÿ±ŸÑŸíŸàŸéÿ∑ŸéŸÜŸêŸäŸéŸëÿ© ŸÑŸêŸÑŸíÿ≠ŸéŸäŸíŸàŸéÿßŸÜŸéÿßÿ™ ÿ®ŸêŸ±ŸÑÿ±ŸêŸëÿ®Ÿéÿßÿ∑ ("The National Park for Animals in Rabat"); French: Jardin Zoologique de Rabat), also known as "Temara Zoo", is a zoological park near Rabat in Morocco that was established in 1973. The first enclosures were built to house lions that were previously kept in the royal palace. These lions were thought to be descendants from Barbary lions.']

column6: ['Teatro Nacional de El Salvador, or National Theatre of El Salvador, is the oldest theatre in Central America. It began construction on November 3, 1911, by the French architect Daniel Beylard; and inaugurated March 1, 1917. It is of French Renaissance style with modern touches. It was decorated by the Italian architect Lucio Cappellaro, and its Great Hall is one of the most beautiful and elegant in Central America.El Salvador‚Äôs National Theater was opened in 1903. That is the oldest theater in Central America.', "The current National Palace of El Salvador, located in San Salvador, the capital city of the country of El Salvador, replaced the old National Palace built in 1866‚Äì1870, which was destroyed by fire on December 19, 1889. The construction, done between 1905 and 1911, was the work of engineer Jos√© Emilio Alcaine, under the direction of the foreman Pascasio Gonz√°lez Erazo. To finish the project, legislation was passed that collected one colon for every quintal of coffee exported. The materials used were imported from several European countries including Germany, Italy and Belgium. The Palace's facilities were occupied by government offices until 1974.", 'The Plaza Gerardo Barrios is a plaza in the historic center of the city of San Salvador, El Salvador.The monumental statue in the center of the plaza, dedicated to president Gerardo Barrios, was made by Francisco Durini and inaugurated in 1909. The project for the monument was conceived by brothers Antonio and Carlos Ezeta, with participation of educator Rafael Reyes. The statue, cast in bronze, shows an equestrian statue of the military leader. The statue is placed on a pedestal of granite that shows battle scenes cast in bronze and the coat of arms of El Salvador.', 'El Museo Universitario de Antropolog√≠a ubicado en las instalaciones de la Universidad Tecnol√≥gica de El Salvador. El edificio que contiene la instituci√≥n es denominado ¬´Anastasio Aquino¬ª, conocido en alg√∫n tiempo como ¬´Casa √Åvila¬ª en referencia a una familia que lo habit√≥ a inicios del siglo XX.', 'El Parque Cuscatl√°n est√° localizado en la ciudad de San Salvador, El Salvador. El √°rea comprende sitios de inter√©s como el Museo Tin Mar√≠n, la Sala Nacional de Exposiciones y el Monumento a la Memoria y la Verdad. Adem√°s de ser sitio de esparcimiento familiar, en el lugar se desarrollan diferentes exposiciones y conciertos musicales, especialmente durante las fiestas patronales de la capital, asimismo es sede del Grupo Scout 51 "Huellas de Cuscatl√°n. Fue inaugurado en el 1¬∞ de marzo de 1939.[1]', 'El Monumento a la Memoria y la Verdad est√° localizado en la ciudad de San Salvador, El Salvador. Fue inaugurado el 6 de diciembre de 2003 y se encuentra en el interior del parque Cuscatl√°n. Consiste en un muro de 85 metros de largo, hecho de granito negro, que contiene los nombres grabados de al menos 25.000 v√≠ctimas de la Guerra Civil Salvadore√±a.[1]', 'Monumento al Mar, m√°s conocido como Fuente Luminosa, es un monumento ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador Capital de El Salvador y fue creado por el escultor espa√±ol Benjam√≠n Sa√∫l para rendir tributo a la belleza femenina. El nombre de Fuente Luminosa se debe a que por las noches la fuente se ilumina con sus reflectores y luces de ne√≥n.La pasi√≥n por la figura femenina y por los seres marinos motiv√≥ al espa√±ol Benjam√≠n Sa√∫l a trabajar en sus esculturas. Algunas de ellas, como El monumento al mar est√°n ubicadas en zonas p√∫blicas de El Salvador.', 'El museo Tin Marin est√° ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador, El Salvador. Es un espacio cultural dedicado a los ni√±os que pretende transmitir conocimientos mediante un ambiente de diversi√≥n.[1]Asimismo, intenta reforzar el contenido de los programas educativos de los centros escolares. Las instalaciones ‚Äîubicadas dentro del √°rea del parque Cuscatl√°n‚Äî son administradas por la Asociaci√≥n Museo de los Ni√±os y comprenden 27 salas permanentes de exhibici√≥n. Fue inaugurado el a√±o de 1999.‚ÄúTin Mar√≠n‚Äù Museo de los Ni√±os', 'El Museo Militar de la Fuerza Armada de El Salvador est√° ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador. Ocupa las instalaciones del antiguo Cuartel El Zapote, edificio que data de los a√±os 1920. La colecci√≥n del museo abarca catorce salas de exhibiciones ‚Äîalgunas identificadas con nombres de militares destacados‚Äî y dos √°reas interactivas. Adem√°s, en este sitio se encuentra el Monumento de los Pr√≥ceres Nacionales y Plaza Memorial.', 'Estadio Nacional Jorge "M√°gico" Gonz√°lez is a football stadium in San Salvador. It is named after Salvadorean star player Jorge Alberto Gonz√°lez. The stadium has a capacity of 35,000 and was previously known as "Estadio Nacional Flor Blanca", referring to the name of the San Salvador neighborhood where it is located.The stadium was restored in 2001 to host notable sporting events in Latin America, the Central American and Caribbean Games in August 2002.', 'El Monumento a la Paz se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de San Marcos, en El Salvador. Est√° ubicado exactamente en el kil√≥metro 8 de La Carretera a Comalapa.Fue dise√±ado por el escultor Rub√©n Mart√≠nez en honor a los Acuerdos de Paz de Chapultepec. La figura del ¬´Cristo de la Paz¬ª que predomina en la estructura, fue elaborada con casquillos de balas, lat√≥n y bronce fundido; y tiene los brazos extendidos como s√≠mbolo de reconciliaci√≥n entre las ideolog√≠as de derecha e izquierda y a manera de ¬´bendici√≥n al pueblo salvadore√±o¬ª. Tambi√©n resalta una paloma en su mano izquierda en posici√≥n de vuelo.[1]', 'Monumento Cristo de La Paz, es un monumento ubicado entre los l√≠mites de la ciudad de San Salvador Capital de El Salvador y el municipio de San Marcos, siempre del departamento de San Salvador, espec√≠ficamente en el kil√≥metro 9 de La Autopista al Aeropuerto Internacional de El Salvador. El monumento fue elaborado para recibir a los pa√≠ses que participar√≠an en los (V) Juegos Deportivos Centroamericanos y en s√≠ simbolizan la reciente conciliaci√≥n de la derecha y de la izquierda pol√≠tica del pa√≠s. Adem√°s, reza el siguiente mensaje ‚ÄúLa Paz sea con vosotros‚Äù como mensaje dirigido a todo el pueblo salvadore√±o.', "Monumento al Divino Salvador del Mundo (English: Monument to the Divine Savior of the World) is a monument located on Plaza El Salvador del Mundo (The Savior of the World Plaza) in San Salvador City, El Salvador. It consists of a statue of Jesus Christ standing on top of a global sphere of planet Earth, placed on top of the tall four-sided concrete base pedestal. It is a landmark located in the country's capital San Salvador. It is a symbol that identifies and represents both El Salvador and Salvadorans throughout the world.", "Monumento al Divino Salvador del Mundo (English: Monument to the Divine Savior of the World) is a monument located on Plaza El Salvador del Mundo (The Savior of the World Plaza) in San Salvador City, El Salvador. It consists of a statue of Jesus Christ standing on top of a global sphere of planet Earth, placed on top of the tall four-sided concrete base pedestal. It is a landmark located in the country's capital San Salvador. It is a symbol that identifies and represents both El Salvador and Salvadorans throughout the world.", "Monumento al Divino Salvador del Mundo (English: Monument to the Divine Savior of the World) is a monument located on Plaza El Salvador del Mundo (The Savior of the World Plaza) in San Salvador City, El Salvador. It consists of a statue of Jesus Christ standing on top of a global sphere of planet Earth, placed on top of the tall four-sided concrete base pedestal. It is a landmark located in the country's capital San Salvador. It is a symbol that identifies and represents both El Salvador and Salvadorans throughout the world.", 'The Estadio Cuscatl√°n is a football stadium located in San Salvador, El Salvador. It is the largest stadium in Central America with a capacity of 53,400. The stadium is the home ground of the El Salvador national football team and Alianza F.C.Cuscatl√°n stadium was first developed as a replacement to what at the time was El Salvador\'s largest stadium, Estadio Nacional de la Flor Blanca (now known as Estadio Jorge "M√°gico" Gonz√°lez). Its creation was made possible by EDESSA (Estadios Deportivos de El Salvador) who in 1969 first proposed the idea of a new national stadium.', 'The Estadio Cuscatl√°n is a football stadium located in San Salvador, El Salvador. It is the largest stadium in Central America with a capacity of 53,400. The stadium is the home ground of the El Salvador national football team and Alianza F.C.Cuscatl√°n stadium was first developed as a replacement to what at the time was El Salvador\'s largest stadium, Estadio Nacional de la Flor Blanca (now known as Estadio Jorge "M√°gico" Gonz√°lez). Its creation was made possible by EDESSA (Estadios Deportivos de El Salvador) who in 1969 first proposed the idea of a new national stadium.', 'Monumento a La Constituci√≥n de El Salvador, es un monumento ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador Capital de El Salvador, Fue elaborada para simbolizar el valor de la Constituci√≥n Salvadore√±a que esta vigente desde 1983 y para el nacimiento de una √©poca de paz en El Salvador, fue esculpida por un destacado escultor salvadore√±o.El Monumento a la Constituci√≥n, mejor conocido como ‚ÄúLa Chulona‚Äù (porque no tiene ropa) es un monumento muy famoso entre los salvadore√±os, especialmente los capitalinos.', 'El cerro San Jacinto est√° ubicado en las demarcaciones de los municipios de San Marcos, San Salvador, Santo Tom√°s y Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador, El Salvador. Sobre su cima funcion√≥ el Telef√©rico San Jacinto hasta el a√±o de su cierre en 2001. Tiene una elevaci√≥n de 1.153 msnm.Instituto Geogr√°fico Nacional (1986). Diccionario Geogr√°fico de El Salvador, Tomo II, L - Z. San Salvador: Talleres Litogr√°ficos del Instituto Geogr√°fico Nacional. Informaci√≥n de Cerro San Jacinto Denuncian saqueo en el Telef√©rico. La Prensa Gr√°fica.', 'El Teatro Presidente se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad de San Salvador, El Salvador.Fue inaugurado el 1 de diciembre de 1971 durante el gobierno del presidente Fidel S√°nchez Hern√°ndez. Inicialmente se proyect√≥ para que sirviera de escenario de eventos gubernamentales, tales como el traspaso del gobierno, reuniones de la Asamblea Legislativa o capacitaciones para los empleados p√∫blicos. Sin embargo, a finales de la d√©cada de los a√±os 1970 y durante los a√±os 1980 se utiliz√≥ como sala cinematogr√°fica y de teatro.[1]', 'El Monumento a la Revoluci√≥n est√° localizado en la ciudad de San Salvador, El Salvador, en las instalaciones del Museo de Arte de El Salvador. Su edificaci√≥n inici√≥ durante el gobierno del coronel √ìscar Osorio para conmemorar el alzamiento que depuso al general Salvador Castaneda Castro del poder, en 1948. Fue terminado en la administraci√≥n del coronel Jos√© Mar√≠a Lemus.', 'El Museo de Arte de El Salvador (MARTE), localizado en la ciudad de San Salvador, es una instituci√≥n privada sin fines de lucro encargada de la conservaci√≥n y difusi√≥n del arte de ese pa√≠s.', 'El Jard√≠n Bot√°nico La Laguna es un parque nacional de El Salvador y jard√≠n bot√°nico de 46 manzanas de extensi√≥n, de las cuales 4.5 manzanas est√°n destinadas para uso p√∫blico, ubicado en el fondo de un cr√°ter volc√°nico, en el municipio de Antiguo Cuscatl√°n, departamento de La Libertad.Jard√≠n Bot√°nico del Plan de la Laguna en el kil√≥metro N¬∫ 8 de la carretera panamericana, zona industrial plan de La Laguna, al sur de la ciudad de Antiguo Cuscatl√°n, Departamento de La Libertad (zona central de El Salvador).Planos y vistas satelitales.13¬∞40‚Ä≤20‚Ä≥N 89¬∞15‚Ä≤00‚Ä≥OA 805 msnm. Disfruta de una temperatura promedio de 23 ¬∞C y una humedad relativa de 75%.']
