column6: ['Quatro de Setembro Theater (Teatro 4 de Setembro, or 4 September theatre)) is located in the Brazilian city of Teresina, capital of Piau√≠ state.It was inaugurated on April 21, 1894. It has a capacity of 560.', 'O Museu do Piau√≠ √© um museu brasileiro criado e mantido pelo governo do estado do Piau√≠. Fundado em 1995 pelo ex-vice-governador do Piau√≠ OsmarJunior.1 hist√≥ria2 listas de ex-diretores3 divis√µes4 associa√ß√µes de amigos do museuFoi criado em 1934, a princ√≠pio era uma se√ß√£o do Arquivo P√∫blico do Estado do Piau√≠ e em 1980 foi instalado no sobrado do antigo pal√°cio do governo do Piau√≠. Em 1999 recebeu a denomina√ß√£o Museu do Piau√≠ "Odilon Nunes" em homenagem a esse historiador piauiense.', 'O Mercado Central S√£o Jos√© que tamb√©m recebe as denomina√ß√µes de Mercado Central de Teresina ou Mercado Velho √© um tradicional centro comercial de modalidade de mercado p√∫blico localizado na Pra√ßa da Bandeira, no centro hist√≥rico de Teresina, capital do estado brasileiro do Piau√≠.', 'O Parque Nova Potycabana ou Poticabana √© um parque de lazer, em Teresina, √†s margens do Rio Poti, nas proximidades da Ponte Juscelino Kubitschek e do Teresina Shopping, com uma √°rea de 43 mil metros quadrados.', '√â um s√≠tio paleontol√≥gico localizado nas margens do Rio Poti, na √°rea urbana de Teresina, Piau√≠, com troncos f√≥sseis do per√≠odo Permiano (aprox. 280-270 milh√µes de anos atr√°s). Destaca-se por possuir v√°rios troncos petrificados em posi√ß√£o de crescimento, e por ser o √∫nico s√≠tio paleontol√≥gico dentro de uma capital brasileira.Foi descoberta no ano de 1909 pelo ge√≥logo Miguel Arrojado Lisboa. Estudos posteriores foram realizados, revelando a presen√ßa de v√°rios troncos em posi√ß√£o de vida e de uma esp√©cie nova para a ci√™ncia. O s√≠tio paleontol√≥gico foi transformado em Parque Municipal no dia 8 de janeiro de 1993 e tombado pelo Minist√©rio de Cultura no 25 de outubro de 2010.', 'A Multicine Cinemas, conhecida tamb√©m como apenas Multicine, √© uma empresa privada brasileira, que atua no ramo da exibi√ß√£o cinematogr√°fica, com sede em Goi√¢nia. Est√° presente em treze cidades localizadas em sete Unidades da Federa√ß√£o das regi√µes Centro-Oeste e Nordeste. Seu parque exibidor √© composto atualmente por treze complexos de cinema, perfazendo 54 salas, m√©dia de 4,15 salas por complexo, sendo que suas 8 171 poltronas perfazem uma m√©dia de 151,31 assentos por sala.', 'Est√°dio Governador Alberto Tavares Silva, also known as Albert√£o is a multi-purpose stadium in Teresina, Brazil. It is currently used mostly for football matches and it is the home stadium of River Atl√©tico Clube and Esporte Clube Flamengo. The stadium holds 44,200. column5: ['Teatro Cervantes', 'Tangier American Legation Institute', '9th April 1947 Grand Square', 'Grand Stade de Tanger']
column6: ['Gran Teatro Cervantes is a theatre, dedicated to Miguel de Cervantes, in Tangier, Morocco. The theatre was built in 1913 by the Spanish.The construction was led by Esperanza Orellana, her husband Manuel Pe√±a and the owner Antonio Gallego. The first stone was laid on April 2, 1911, in a solemn ceremony, and was completed in 1913, the year of its inauguration. Its capacity is 1400 seats.', 'The Tangier American Legation (Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÅŸàÿ∂Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖŸäÿ±ŸÉŸäÿ© ŸÅŸä ÿ∑ŸÜÿ¨ÿ©\u200e; French: L√©gation am√©ricaine de Tanger) is a building in the medina of Tangier, Morocco. The first American public property outside the United States, it commemorates the historic cultural and diplomatic relations between the United States and the Kingdom of Morocco. It is now officially called the Tangier American Legation Institute for Moroccan Studies, and is a cultural center, museum, and a research library, concentrating on Arabic language studies.', "The Grand Socco Alto Mall is a large Shopping Mall in Tangier, Morocco. The term, socco is a Spanish corruption of the Arabic souq (or souk). The Grand Socco Alto Mall and Carrefour Socco occupy Tangier's medina (old quarter) and continues to operate as a bazaar or market-place.The square underwent further development in 2005.", 'Stade Ibn Batouta (Berber: ‚¥∞‚µè‚µè‚¥∞‚µî ‚µè ‚µâ‚¥±‚µè ‚¥±‚¥∞‚µú‚µì‚µú‚¥∞, Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿßÿ®ŸÜ ÿ®ÿ∑Ÿàÿ∑ÿ©\u200e) is a multi-use stadium in Tangier, Morocco. It is used mostly for football matches and big events as ceremonies or concerts. The stadium has a capacity of 45,000 people. It serves as the new home of IR Tanger, replacing the former Stade de Marchan. The stadium is named after Ibn Battuta.It was inaugurated on April 26, 2011. On July 27, the stadium hosted the 2011 Troph√©e des champions, in which Marseille beat Lille 5‚Äì4.It was one of the confirmed host stadiums for the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations, which was to be hosted by Morocco until it was stripped of its hosting rights.']

column5: ['Tekkiye Moaven-ol-Molk', 'Biglarbeigi Tekiyeh', 'Zagros Paleolithic Museum']
column6: ['Tekyeh Moaven al-molk (Persian:ÿ™⁄©€åŸá ŸÖÿπÿßŸàŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÑ⁄©) is a Tekyeh and historical place located in Kermanshah city of Iran. It was built during Qajar era as a Shia mourning site. On 1 December 1975 Tekyeh Moaven al-molk was recognized as National monument of Iran. It is well known for its exclusive tiling, picturing Islamic era Ghazi (warrior), Battle of Karbala and Iranian kings such as Achaemenid kings and Persepolis. It has three main parts: Hussainiya, Zaeynabiya and Abbasiya. Museum of Anthropology of Kermanshah, and Clothes and Jewelry Museum of Kermanshah are located in Abbasiya.', 'Tekyeh Biglarbeygi is a Tekyeh located in Kermanshah. this construction is well known for unique mirror decoration. Tekyeh Biglarbeygi was made during Qajar dynasty by efforts of Abdullah khan Biglarbeygi. here has inscriptions of Mozaffar ad-Din Shah Qajar.Of course, this place is not used for mourning today, but it has been turned into a museum of calligraphy as well as old documents of the Biglarbeygi family. This place has been registered in the list of national monuments on December 10, 1996, number 1797. In 2001, it purchased its cultural heritage and was restored in 2002 and 2003, and in 2004, it was opened as a museum of calligraphy. In 2008, the Zagros Paleolithic Museum was inaugurated by the cultural heritage on the south side.', 'Zagros Paleolithic Museum (Persian: ŸÖŸàÿ≤Ÿá Ÿæÿßÿ±€åŸÜŸáÿ≥ŸÜ⁄Ø€å ÿ≤ÿß⁄Øÿ±ÿ≥\u200e) is a museum in Kermanshah, Iran, established in 2008. The museum contains a large collection of stone tools and animal fossil bones from various Paleolithic sites in Iran. In Iran, it is the only museum of its kind.The museum was established by Fereidoun Biglari and A. Moradi Bisetouni at Tekieh Biglar Baigi, Kermanshah in 2007. Marjan Mashkour, a zooarchaeologist, was in charge of animal fossil identification for the museum.']

column6: ['Ernesto "Che" Guevara (Spanish: [Ààt Ée …£eÀàŒ≤a…æa]; 14 June 1928 ‚Äì 9 October 1967) was an Argentine Marxist revolutionary, physician, author, guerrilla leader, diplomat, and military theorist. A major figure of the Cuban Revolution, his stylized visage has become a ubiquitous countercultural symbol of rebellion and global insignia in popular culture.', 'Juana Azurduy de Padilla (July 12, 1780 ‚Äì May 25, 1862) was a guerrilla military leader from Chuquisaca, Viceroyalty of the R√≠o de la Plata (now Sucre, Bolivia). She fought for Bolivian independence alongside her husband, Manuel Ascencio Padilla, earning the rank of Lieutenant Colonel. She was noted for her strong support for and military leadership of the indigenous people of Upper Peru. In 2015, in Buenos Aires, Argentina, a statue of Azurduy replaced the one of Christopher Columbus in front of the Casa Rosada, causing some controversy.', 'Lucio P√©rez Velasco (2 March 1854 ‚Äì 27 November 1904) was a Bolivian politician who served as the 13th Vice President of Bolivia from 1899 to 1903. He served as first vice president alongside second vice president An√≠bal Capriles Cabrera during the administration of Jos√© Manuel Pando. By decree of 23 January 1903. he ws dismissed. A member of the Liberal Party, he was elected deputy for the Beni department in 1884. From 1889 to 1893, he was Senator for Beni.', 'Bautista Saavedra Mallea (30 August 1870 in Sorata ‚Äì 1 May 1939) was a Bolivian lawyer and politician who served as the 29th President of Bolivia from 1921 to 1925. Prior to that, he was part of a governing junta from 1920 to 1921.', "Adolph Kolping (8 December 1813 ‚Äî 4 December 1865) was a German Catholic priest and the founder of the Kolping Association. He led the movement for providing and promoting social support for workers in industrialized cities while also working to promote the dignities of workers in accordance with the social magisterium of the faith. He was called Gesellenvater (the Journeymen's Father).The beatification for the priest commenced on 21 March 1934 and he was later titled as Venerable in 1989. His beatification was celebrated under Pope John Paul II on 27 October 1991 in Saint Peter's Square; his liturgical feast is not affixed to the date of his death as is the norm but rather on 6 December.", 'The Museo de Arte Antonio Paredes Candia is an art museum in El Alto, Bolivia.Inaugurated in 2002, as of 2011 the museum contains 503 works of art and 11,931 books. It includes works by P√©rez Alcal√°, Dar√≠o Antezana, Gil Imana, Alfredo Laplaca, Marina N√∫√±ez del Prado, V√≠ctor Zapana, Gonzalo Condarco, and many more.In 2013, organized by contemporary art collective Public Delivery, Swiss-Bolivian artist Luciano Calderon had a solo show titled Ciudad Esperanza.', 'The Coca Museum (in Spanish, Museo de la Coca) covers the history of the coca plant from the Andean region and related drug cocaine. It is associated with the International Coca Research Institute (ICORI) in La Paz, the government seat in Bolivia. A travelling version of the museum is available.List of museums in BoliviaCoca Museum website', 'El Museo Tambo Quirquincho es un importante espacio cultural en el Centro Hist√≥rico de la ciudad de La Paz, se encuentra ubicado en la Plaza Alonso de Mendoza esq. Calle Evaristo Valle, La Paz, Bolivia.', 'Antonio Jos√© de Sucre y Alcal√° (Spanish pronunciation: [anÀàtonjo xoÀàse √∞e Ààsuk…æe j alkaÀàla] (listen); 3 February 1795 ‚Äì 4 June 1830), known as the "Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho" (English: "Grand Marshal of Ayacucho"), was a Venezuelan independence leader who served as President of Peru and as the 2nd President of Bolivia. Sucre was one of Sim√≥n Bol√≠var\'s closest friends, generals and statesmen.', 'La Casa de la Cultura Franz Tamayo es una importante instituci√≥n municipal de la ciudad de La Paz. Ubicada en el Centro Hist√≥rico y siendo parte del Casco Urbano Central, se constituye en un importante hito urbano. Nominada en honor al pol√≠tico y poeta Franz Tamayola instituci√≥n alberga un teatro denominado Modesta Sangin√©s, salas de exposici√≥n y la Biblioteca Costa de la Torre, importante Centro Documental Municipal.', 'Sim√≥n Jos√© Antonio de la Sant√≠sima Trinidad Bol√≠var y Ponte Palacios y Blanco (24 July 1783 ‚Äì 17 December 1830) (Spanish: [siÀàmom boÀàliŒ≤a…æ] (listen), English: BOL-iv-…ôr, -\u2060ar also US: BOH-liv-ar), also colloquially as El Libertador, or Liberator of America was a Venezuelan military and political leader who led what are currently the countries of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama to independence from the Spanish Empire.', 'El Museo Nacional de Etnograf√≠a y Folklore (Musef) es uno de los principales centros de difusi√≥n de la etnograf√≠a de Bolivia. Los antecedentes previos a su fundaci√≥n se remiten a la creaci√≥n del Museo Nacional fundado en 1925, cuando nace el Departamento Cient√≠fico de Etnograf√≠a como parte de los festejos del Centenario de Bolivia. El MUSEF abre sus puertas el 23 de agosto de 1962 con el nombre de Museo de Artesan√≠a y Arte Popular, ubicado en el palacio de los Marqueses de Villaverde en la esquina de las calles Ingavi y Jenaro Sanjin√©s, en el municipio de La Paz. El palacio fue nombrado monumento nacional en 1930. El 2004, el museo inaugur√≥ una subsede en la ciudad de Sucre en el castillo de Francisco Argando√±a.[3] Para el 2005 se entrega su ampliaci√≥n en la sede de La Paz que llega a tener 7500 m¬≤ de infraestructura.', 'El Museo Nacional de Etnograf√≠a y Folklore (Musef) es uno de los principales centros de difusi√≥n de la etnograf√≠a de Bolivia. Los antecedentes previos a su fundaci√≥n se remiten a la creaci√≥n del Museo Nacional fundado en 1925, cuando nace el Departamento Cient√≠fico de Etnograf√≠a como parte de los festejos del Centenario de Bolivia. El MUSEF abre sus puertas el 23 de agosto de 1962 con el nombre de Museo de Artesan√≠a y Arte Popular, ubicado en el palacio de los Marqueses de Villaverde en la esquina de las calles Ingavi y Jenaro Sanjin√©s, en el municipio de La Paz. El palacio fue nombrado monumento nacional en 1930. El 2004, el museo inaugur√≥ una subsede en la ciudad de Sucre en el castillo de Francisco Argando√±a.[3] Para el 2005 se entrega su ampliaci√≥n en la sede de La Paz que llega a tener 7500 m¬≤ de infraestructura.', 'The National Museum of Art, Palacio Diez de Medina is a museum in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. It has an important permanent collection of colonial paintings, including canvases by Melchor P√©rez de Holgu√≠n, a painter 16th century and those of Gregorio Gamarra, a 17th century painter.The museum is located right in front of the main square of the city of La Paz, Plaza Murillo, specifically at the intersection of the pedestrian promenade Calle Comercio and Calle Socabaya.', 'La Calle Ja√©n es una calle ubicada en La Paz, Bolivia. La calle alberga bares, caf√©s y museos, como la casa de Pedro Domingo Murillo.[1] Durante el siglo XVI fue conocida por ser un mercado de compra y venta de cam√©lidos. Tiene una extensi√≥n de 100 metros. Sus edificaciones con balcones y calles empedradas conservan el estilo colonial.[2][3][4]Museo Costumbrista Museo de Metales Preciosos[5] Museo Litoral Boliviano Casa de Pedro Domingo Murillo Museo de Instrumentos musicalesWikimedia Commons alberga una categor√≠a multimedia sobre Calle Apolinar Ja√©n.', 'The National Museum of Art, Palacio Diez de Medina is a museum in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. It has an important permanent collection of colonial paintings, including canvases by Melchor P√©rez de Holgu√≠n, a painter 16th century and those of Gregorio Gamarra, a 17th century painter.The museum is located right in front of the main square of the city of La Paz, Plaza Murillo, specifically at the intersection of the pedestrian promenade Calle Comercio and Calle Socabaya.', 'El Teatro Municipal ¬´Alberto Saavedra P√©rez¬ª[1] (tambi√©n conocido como Teatro Municipal de La Paz) es el principal teatro de la ciudad de La Paz y escenario para la presentaci√≥n de recitales y conciertos musicales, obras teatrales, ballet y opera, entre otros espect√°culos culturales. Localizado en la calle Jenaro Sanjinez esquina Indaburo de la ciudad de La Paz,[2] sede de gobierno del pa√≠s sudamericano de Bolivia.[3] Fue inaugurado en 1845, siendo el segundo teatro m√°s antiguo de Sudam√©rica.[2]', 'El Museo Litoral Boliviano es un museo dedicado a la guerra de 1879, en la cual Bolivia perdi√≥ sus costas sobre el Oc√©ano Pac√≠fico, y al h√©roe de esa guerra, el Coronel Eduardo Abaroa.Cuenta con cuatro ambientes donde se exhiben fotograf√≠as de los puertos del Pac√≠fico que fueron perdidos ante Chile, de personajes de la guerra, as√≠ como armas, estandartes y objetos rescatados del enfrentamiento.El museo se encuentra en la Ciudad de La Paz, Avenida Sucre en la calle Apolinar Ja√©n N.¬∫ 789.', 'El Museo Costumbrista Juan de Vargas es un museo ubicado en la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. El museo se encuentra ubicado en la Avenida Sucre, Plaza Riosinho en la calle Apolinar Ja√©n .Dentro esta pinacoteca de dos plantas se exhibe no s√≥lo obras con tem√°ticas hist√≥ricas, referentes a las costumbres y tradiciones de la antigua y contempor√°nea cultura pace√±a, sino tambi√©n exposiciones temporales.', 'El Paseo del Prado se encuentra ubicado sobre el principal eje vial del centro de la Ciudad de La Paz Se halla flanqueado por la Avenida 16 de julio en sus sentidos de bajada y subida. A inicios del siglo XX fue conocido con el nombre de "Paseo de la Alameda".', 'El Museo de Arte Contemporaneo Plaza La Paz, ubicado en La Paz (Bolivia), exhibe una colecci√≥n de pinturas, esculturas, cer√°mica, obras de artistas reconocidos nacionales o extranjeros de los √∫ltimos 500 a√±os.[1]El museo queda ubicado en la Av. 16 de julio Nro 1698, La Paz, Bolivia. El paseo del Prado mantuvo hasta mediados del siglo XX su car√°cter exclusivo, albergando lujosas residencias y delegaciones diplom√°ticas. Un ejemplo de dicho periodo es este inmueble en arquitectura ecl√©ctica, destacando en su fachada los balcones en hierro forjado de estilo Art Noveau.', "Pedro Domingo Murillo (September 17, 1757‚Äì January 29, 1810) was a patriot of Upper Peru who played a key role in Bolivia's independence.", 'The Plaza Murillo is the central plaza of the city of La Paz and the open space most connected to the political life of Bolivia. Prominent buildings on the plaza include the Presidential Palace, National Congress of Bolivia, and the Cathedral of La Paz (or more formally, the Cathedral Basilica of Our Lady of Peace, La Paz). It is located in the old town, or Casco Viejo, of the city and is surrounded by Socabaya Street to the west, Ayacucho Street to the east, Comercio Street to the south, and a continuation of Ingavi and Ballivan Streets to the north.', 'Andr√©s de Santa Cruz y Calahumana (Spanish pronunciation: [anÀàd…æes √∞e Ààsanta k…æuŒ∏] (listen); 5 December 1792 ‚Äì 25 September 1865) was a general and politician who served as Interim President of Peru in 1827, the Interim President of Peru from 1836 to 1838 and the 6th President of Bolivia from 1829 to 1839. He also served as Supreme Protector of the short-lived Peru-Bolivian Confederation from 1836 to 1839, a political entity created mainly by his personal endeavors.', 'Antonio Jos√© de Sucre y Alcal√° (Spanish pronunciation: [anÀàtonjo xoÀàse √∞e Ààsuk…æe j alkaÀàla] (listen); 3 February 1795 ‚Äì 4 June 1830), known as the "Gran Mariscal de Ayacucho" (English: "Grand Marshal of Ayacucho"), was a Venezuelan independence leader who served as President of Peru and as the 2nd President of Bolivia. Sucre was one of Sim√≥n Bol√≠var\'s closest friends, generals and statesmen.', 'La Plaza Espa√±a se encuentra en la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, en la zona de Sopocachi, al suroeste de Plaza Abaroa, al noreste del barrio de San Jorge y al sur del barrio de San Pedro. A una altura de 3.607 m.s.n.m..En centro de la plaza, sobre un pedestal de granito, se levanta la estatua de Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra.[1]A unos pasos se encuentra el Mont√≠culo, un parque mirador y lugar de recreo, desde donde se puede observar el majestuoso Illimani; junto a toda la ciudad,.[2]A una cuadra se encuentra la estaci√≥n Supu Kachi de la l√≠nea amarilla del sistema de transporte Mi Telef√©rico, entre la calle Miguel de Cervantes y Saavedra esquina Calle M√©ndez Arcos.', 'Plaza Abaroa (Abaroa Square) is a public space, named in honor of Eduardo Abaroa the Bolivian hero who fought in the War of the Pacific. It is located in the city of La Paz, Bolivia, in the Sopocachi area, among 20 de Octubre, S√°nchez Lima, Pedro Salazar & Belisario Salinas streets.The plaza has a rectangular shape, and has eight radial pedestrian accesses that flow into a central fountain in the center of which is a memorial of Eduardo Abaroa on a pedestal with the shape of an incomplete bridge. The bronze sculpture representing the hero in a challenging position was made by the sculptor Emiliano Lujan Sandoval.', "Colonel Eduardo Abaroa Hidalgo (October 13, 1838, San Pedro de Atacama ‚Äì March 23, 1879) was Bolivia's foremost hero of the War of the Pacific (1879‚Äì1883), which pitted Chile against Bolivia and Peru. He was one of the leaders of the civilian resistance to the Chilean invasion at the Battle of Top√°ter.", 'El Mont√≠culo es un parque mirador ubicado en el barrio de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz, a una altura de 3635 m.s.n.m..[1]Fue dise√±ado en los a√±os 40 por el arquitecto Mario del Carpio.[2]El nombre oficial del Mont√≠culo es N√©stor Portocarrero, en homenaje al compositor del tango Illimani, canci√≥n emblem√°tica de la ciudad de La Paz. El parque ha sido fuente de inspiraci√≥n para varios creadores, como el artista pl√°stico Cecilio Guzm√°n de Rojas o el escritor Julio de la Vega.[3]', "El Mirador de Killi Killi es un parque mirador ubicado al noroeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. El nombre proviene del nombre local del halc√≥n falco sparverius,[1] ave rapaz que habita la zona .Est√° situado en lo m√°s alto del barrio de Villa Pab√≥n, sobre el cerro Santa B√°rbara.[2] A cuatro kil√≥metros de la Plaza Murillo.[3]El cerro Santa B√°rbara , as√≠ como otros numerosos espacios que rodean la ciudad de La Paz, ha sido desde tiempos prehisp√°nicos un espacio ceremonial, es parte del grupo de wakas y apachetas en las que se realizan wajt'as y ofrendas a las deidades de Los Andes.[4]", 'Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz (13 March 1931 ‚Äì 17 July 1980) was a noted writer, dramatist, journalist, social commentator, university professor, and socialist political leader from Bolivia. In 1964 Marcelo won the PEN/Faulkner Award for Fiction for his novel Los Deshabitados.Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz married Mar√≠a Cristina Trigo in 1954. She gave birth to their daughter Mar√≠a Soledad in Santiago in 1957, and to their son Pablo Rodrigo in Salta in 1959.', 'Isabella I (Spanish: Isabel I, 22 April 1451 ‚Äì 26 November 1504) was Queen of Castile from 1474 until she died in 1504, reigning over a dynastically unified Spain jointly with her husband, King Ferdinand II of Aragon. She was Queen of Aragon after Ferdinand ascended in 1479. Together they are known as the Catholic Monarchs.', 'El Parque Urbano Central de La Paz, Parque Urbano Central o PUC, por sus siglas es un √°rea verde y √°rea natural protegida de la ciudad de La Paz. Se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad y est√° compuesto por 23 √°reas que incluyen paseos, la v√≠a balc√≥n, la c√∫pula de adobe,[1] cicloruta, boulevard los √Ålamos, Campo Ferial del Bicentenario,[2][3] Paseo de la memoria;[4] memorial Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz.[5]Es administrado por la entidad descentralizada Ema verde, dependiente del Gobierno Aut√≥nomo Municipal de La Paz desde 2015.[6]', 'Carlos Gardel (born Charles Romuald Gard√®s; 11 December 1890 ‚Äì 24 June 1935) was a French-born Argentine singer, songwriter, composer and actor, and the most prominent figure in the history of tango. He was one of the most influential interpreters of world popular music in the first half of the 20th century. Gardel is the most famous popular tango singer of all time and is recognized throughout the world. He was notable for his baritone voice and the dramatic phrasing of his lyrics. Together with lyricist and long-time collaborator Alfredo Le Pera, Gardel wrote several classic tangos.', 'Ana Mar√≠a Romero de Campero (29 June 1941 ‚Äì 26 October 2010) was a Bolivian journalist, writer, activist and influential public figure in her country. She was the first Human Rights Ombudswoman (Defensor del Pueblo) (1998‚Äì2003) of Bolivia and President of the Senate of Bolivia at the time of her death. Ana Mar√≠a Romero dedicated her life to promoting democracy and human rights with particular regard for those most disadvantaged in Bolivian society.', "Jos√© Francisco de San Mart√≠n y Matorras (25 February 1778 ‚Äì 17 August 1850), known simply as Jos√© de San Mart√≠n (Spanish pronunciation: [xoÀàse √∞e san ma…æÀàtin] (listen)) or the Liberator of Argentina, Chile and Peru, was an Argentine general and the primary leader of the southern and central parts of South America's successful struggle for independence from the Spanish Empire who served as the Protector of Peru. Born in Yapey√∫, Corrientes, in modern-day Argentina, he left the Viceroyalty of the R√≠o de la Plata at the early age of seven to study in M√°laga, Spain.", 'Ignatius of Loyola (c. 23 October 1491‚Äì31 July 1556; b. I√±igo L√≥pez de O√±az y Loyola; Basque: Ignazio Loiolakoa; Spanish: Ignacio de Loyola; Latin: Ignatius de Loyola) ‚Äî venerated as Saint Ignatius of Loyola ‚Äî was a Spanish Catholic priest and theologian, who, with Peter Faber and Francis Xavier, founded the religious order of the Society of Jesus (The Jesuits), and became the first Superior General of the Society of Jesus, at Paris, in 1541. Teaching and missionary work are the purposes of the Society of Jesus, who, as priests, are bound by a fourth (special) vow of obedience to the sovereign pontiff, to be ever-ready to fulfill the special missions of the papacy; thus the Jesuits were instrumental in realizing the Counter-Reformation.', 'Confucius ( k…ôn-FEW-sh…ôs; Chinese: Â≠îÂ§´Â≠ê; pinyin: K«íng F≈´z«ê, "Master K«íng"; or commonly Â≠îÂ≠ê; K«íngz«ê; 551‚Äì479 BCE) was a Chinese philosopher and politician of the Spring and Autumn period who was traditionally considered the paragon of Chinese sages. Confucius\'s teachings and philosophy formed the basis of East Asian culture and society, and continues to remain influential across China and East Asia as of today.', 'El Jard√≠n Bot√°nico es una instituci√≥n cultural de la ciudad de La Paz, administrada por la empresa Empresa Municipal de √Åreas Verdes, Parques y Forestaci√≥n (EMAVERDE)[1] dependiente del Gobierno Aut√≥nomo Municipal de La Paz.Se ubica en la zona de Miraflores, en la esquina formada por las calles Lucas Jaimes y Nicaragua. En su registro cuenta con 96 414 especies de plantas y 16 especies nativas de aves.[2] El lugar, adem√°s de su variedad de plantas, es uno de los lugares m√°s rom√°nticos de la ciudad seg√∫n una publicaci√≥n local.[3]El √°rea fue propiedad de una familia japonesa a inicios del siglo XX.', "Melvin Jones (January 13, 1879 ‚Äì June 1, 1961) was Secretary-treasurer of Lions Clubs International.He was born in Fort Thomas, Arizona (at that time the Arizona Territory). His father was a captain in the United States Army. In 1886 or '87, the family moved east when his father was transferred. Melvin Jones settled in Chicago, where he studied at the Union Business and Chaddock colleges of Quincy, Illinois. At age 33 he was the sole owner of his own insurance agency in Chicago and became a member of the local business circle, and was elected secretary shortly thereafter. Melvin Jones was also a Freemason.", 'Rafael Pab√≥n Cuevas (Irupana, La Paz, Bolivia; 23 de julio de 1903 - Chaco Boreal, Paraguay; 12 de agosto de 1934) fue un militar y piloto boliviano, considerado uno de los m√°s grandes ases militares de la aviaci√≥n boliviana, durante la Guerra del Chaco (1932 - 1935).Rafa√©l Pab√≥n naci√≥ en la localidad de Irupana, La Paz el 23 de julio de 1903. Hijo de Carmen Cuevas y Luciano Pab√≥n.[1] Muy joven se traslad√≥ a la ciudad de La Paz donde curs√≥ la primaria y la secundaria en el Instituto Americano de esa ciudad.[2]', 'El espacio sociocultural Jard√≠n japon√©s es un parque cerrado de la ciudad de La Paz administrado por el Gobierno Aut√≥nomo Municipal de La Paz. Habilitado como espacio sociocultural acoge eventos y celebraciones culturales de diferente √≠ndole.[1]El jard√≠n fue inaugurado el 22 de septiembre de 1975[2] en conmemoraci√≥n a las Bodas de Oro de la Sociedad Japonesa en Bolivia.El Espacio se halla ubicado junto a la rivera del R√≠o Irpavi cercano a un desfiladero que sirve de tel√≥n para el jard√≠n que presenta un trabajo paisaj√≠stico de inspiraci√≥n japonesa, el acceso se realiza a trav√©s de la calle 8 de Calacoto, el espacio cuenta con diferentes √°reas.', 'Jos√© Gervasio Artigas Arnal (June 19, 1764 ‚Äì September 23, 1850) (Spanish pronunciation: [xoÀàse xe…æÀàŒ≤a.sjo a…æÀàti.…£as a…æÀànal]) was a political leader, military general, statesman and national hero of Uruguay and the broader R√≠o de la Plata region.He fought in the Latin American wars of independence against the Spanish Empire, but also against the Portuguese Empire and the centralist government of Buenos Aires in the pursuit of political and civil liberties for the peoples of the Viceroyalty of the R√≠o de la Plata.He is considered a Libertador of Latin America and a national hero in Uruguay, sometimes referred as "the father of Uruguayan nationhood".']

It has 1,192 seats.Kokura Racecourse has grass courses and a dirt course.The turf measures 1615m (1 mile + 19 feet). 1000m, 1200m, 1700m, 1800m, 2000m, and 2600m races run on the oval.The dirt course measures 1445 meters (7/8 mile + 310 feet). 1000m, 1700m, and 2400m races run on the oval.', 'The Kitakyushu Municipal Museum of Art (Âåó‰πùÂ∑ûÂ∏ÇÁ´ãÁæéË°ìÈ§®, Kitaky≈´sh≈´ Shiritsu Bijutsukan) is located in Tobata-ku, Kitakyushu, Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. Designed by Arata Isozaki, it sits on a hill straddling the three wards of Kokura Kita, Tobata, and Yahata Higashi. The museum houses more than 6,000 pieces of art, as well as offering various exhibitions throughout the year. column5: ['Stade Lumumba', 'Boyoma Falls']
column6: ["Stade Lumumba is a stadium located in Kisangani, Democratic Republic of the Congo. It has a capacity of 10,000 spectators for football matches. It serves as the home of AS Nika, TS Malekesa and AS Makiso of the Linafoot.A peine r√©habilit√©, le stade Lumumba de Kisangani se d√©t√©riore √† nouveau Kisangani, L'Avenir 6/06/2008", 'Boyoma Falls, formerly known as Stanley Falls, is a series of seven cataracts, each no more than 5 m (16 ft) high, extending over more than 100 km (62 mi) along a curve of the Lualaba River between the river port towns of Ubundu and Kisangani (also known as Boyoma) in the Orientale Province of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.:\u200aVol.Two,\u200a175\u200a The seven cataracts have a total drop of 61 m (200 ft). They form the largest waterfall by volume of annual flow rate in the world, exceeding both the Niagara Falls and the Iguazu Falls.']

column6: ['El Teatro Morelos es un edificio hist√≥rico ubicado en la Ciudad de Aguascalientes, el cual fue construido entre 1883 y 1885. Es m√°s conocido porque fue elegido como escenario y punto de encuentro de la Soberana Convenci√≥n Revolucionaria de octubre de 1914, donde se reunieron la mayor√≠a de los generales y l√≠deres de la Revoluci√≥n mexicana.[3] Se trata de uno de los edificios m√°s representativos de la ciudad, ubicado adem√°s en la plaza principal, junto a la catedral de la ciudad.', 'El centro hist√≥rico de Aguascalientes es la zona de monumentos hist√≥ricos de la ciudad mexicana de Aguascalientes en el estado hom√≥nimo declarado por el Instituto Nacional de Antropolog√≠a e Historia (INAH) como Patrimonio de la naci√≥n.[2]En esta √°rea se encuentran edificaciones de estilo colonial abarcando una √°rea de 0.47 kil√≥metros cuadrados formada por treinta manzanas que comprenden alrededor de 116 edificios construidos entre los siglos XVI al XIX entre los que destacan las iglesias de San Marcos, La Merced, El Conventito, Ave Mar√≠a y presbiteriana Emmanuel, de culto religioso.[3]', 'The Aguascalientes Museum of Contemporary Art is an art gallery located in the city of Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, Mexico and has 6 galleries.In the "Jes√∫s F. Contreras" gallery there are art works by contemporary Mexican artists. These were rewarded works from the Young Encounter of Arts; in another gallery is the work of Enrique Guzm√°n Villag√≥mez, a recognized artist whose work is expressionist in nature. In the Arts Library gallery, there are works by photographers from a variety of backgrounds and styles.In the first floor Saturnino Herr√°n gallery, temporary exhibitions by recognized Mexican and international artists are exhibited.', 'El Templo de San Marcos o Parroquia de Nuestra Se√±ora del Carmen es una iglesia cat√≥lica ubicada en el Barrio de San Marcos de la Ciudad de Aguascalientes. El templo fue fundado en 1764, dedicado a la Virgen del Carmen y a San Marcos evangelista, por lo cual se conmemoran dos fiestas patronales, un novenario el 16 de julio, dedicado a la Virgen del Carmen, y un triduo para San Marcos el 25 de abril.[1]', 'El Jard√≠n de San Marcos, se encuentra localizado en el coraz√≥n del Barrio de San Marcos. Es un espacio p√∫blico, icono de la Ciudad de Aguascalientes, tambi√©n de la famosa Feria Nacional de San Marcos. Alberga diversos tipos de especies de plantas y √°rboles. Cuenta con caminos por todo el jard√≠n. En su centro est√° un kiosco, donde debajo de √©l se dan espect√°culos con fuentes y luces multicolores. Algo que caracteriza al Jard√≠n de San Marcos es su balaustrada hecha en cantera rosa, la cual rodea completamente el jard√≠n, excepto por las famosas cuatro entradas que se encuentran en el centro de los cuatro lados del mismo.', 'Plaza de toros Monumental de Aguascalientes is a bullring in the city of Aguascalientes, Mexico. It is currently used for bullfighting and concerts. The stadium holds 16,000 people and it was inaugurated on November 23, 1974. Its currently the 4th largest bullring in Mexico.Official homepage www.worldstadiums.com', 'The Aguascalientes City Museum (Spanish: Museo de Aguascalientes) is located in the City of Aguascalientes, in the state of Aguascalientes Mexico, as the premier art museum in the city.It was built in 1903 by Refugio Reyes Rivas in a neoclassical style. Its facade outstands as a Greek Temple made out of groove capitals and columns. It is built in pink quarry. The interior is composed of two yards; the first yard has carved columns; and the second yard has central quarry fountains, work of Jos√© Refugio Reyes Rivas. It has capital columns and arcs.', 'The Aguascalientes City Museum (Spanish: Museo de Aguascalientes) is located in the City of Aguascalientes, in the state of Aguascalientes Mexico, as the premier art museum in the city.It was built in 1903 by Refugio Reyes Rivas in a neoclassical style. Its facade outstands as a Greek Temple made out of groove capitals and columns. It is built in pink quarry. The interior is composed of two yards; the first yard has carved columns; and the second yard has central quarry fountains, work of Jos√© Refugio Reyes Rivas. It has capital columns and arcs.', 'La Estacion Theme Park (The Railway Station), including The Old Train Station and Railway Museum, is a historic and recreational complex located in the city of Aguascalientes, in the state of Aguascalientes, in Mexico.The State of Aguascalientes was at some point a major railway hub for Mexico, due to its central location between important cities. It was home to some of the largest workshops and warehouses in Latin America. When the workshops ceased its work, the calderas, machinery and old workshops remained abandoned. They were salvaged by the city council and converted into a museum area and theme park.', 'La Estacion Theme Park (The Railway Station), including The Old Train Station and Railway Museum, is a historic and recreational complex located in the city of Aguascalientes, in the state of Aguascalientes, in Mexico.The State of Aguascalientes was at some point a major railway hub for Mexico, due to its central location between important cities. It was home to some of the largest workshops and warehouses in Latin America. When the workshops ceased its work, the calderas, machinery and old workshops remained abandoned. They were salvaged by the city council and converted into a museum area and theme park.', 'Estadio Victoria is sports stadium in the Mexican city of Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes. The stadium opened in 2003 and has a capacity of 23,000 seats. Although the stadium is capable of multi-use, its main use is for soccer games. It is the home stadium of football Club Necaxa, which played in Mexico City at the Estadio Azteca before relocating to Aguascalientes and Estadio Victoria. The stadium is named after a leading brand of beer brewed by Grupo Modelo.', 'El Jard√≠n Bot√°nico Rey Nezahualcoyotl, es un jard√≠n bot√°nico dependiente administrativamente de la Universidad Aut√≥noma de Aguascalientes (UAA).Su c√≥digo de identificaci√≥n internacional como instituci√≥n bot√°nica afiliada al BGCI, as√≠ como las siglas de su herbario es HUAA.Universidad Aut√≥noma de Aguascalientes, Av. Universidad 940 Fracc. Los Bosques 20100, Ciudad de Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, M√©xico.Planos y vistas satelitales.21¬∞54‚Ä≤48.17‚Ä≥N 102¬∞18‚Ä≤54.09‚Ä≥OEl Jard√≠n Bot√°nico "Rey Netzahualc√≥yotl" fue creado en 1986, con el objetivo de exhibir y conservar la biodiversidad vegetal nativa de la entidad y de la regi√≥n en general.']

C'est un lieu calme avec une v√©g√©tation locale et m√©diterran√©enne riche et vari√©e, des arbres centenaires et des all√©es ombrag√©es.", "The Majorelle Garden (French: Jardin Majorelle, Arabic: ÿ≠ÿØŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÖÿßÿ¨Ÿàÿ±ŸäŸÑ\u200e hadiqat mmajuril, Berber languages: ‚µì‚µî‚µú‚µâ ‚µé‚¥∞‚µä‚µì‚µî‚µâ‚µç urti majuril) is a two and half acre botanical garden and artist's landscape garden in Marrakech, Morocco. It was created by the French Orientalist artist Jacques Majorelle over almost forty years, starting in 1923, and features a Cubist villa designed by the French architect, Paul Sinoir in the 1930s. The property was the residence of the artist and his wife from 1923 until their divorce in the 1950s. In the 1980s, the property was purchased by the fashion designers, Yves Saint-Laurent and Pierre Berg√© who worked to restore it. Today, the garden and villa complex is open to the public. The villa houses the Berber Museum and has recently opened the Yves Saint Laurent Museum.", "The Majorelle Garden (French: Jardin Majorelle, Arabic: ÿ≠ÿØŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÖÿßÿ¨Ÿàÿ±ŸäŸÑ\u200e hadiqat mmajuril, Berber languages: ‚µì‚µî‚µú‚µâ ‚µé‚¥∞‚µä‚µì‚µî‚µâ‚µç urti majuril) is a two and half acre botanical garden and artist's landscape garden in Marrakech, Morocco. It was created by the French Orientalist artist Jacques Majorelle over almost forty years, starting in 1923, and features a Cubist villa designed by the French architect, Paul Sinoir in the 1930s. The property was the residence of the artist and his wife from 1923 until their divorce in the 1950s. In the 1980s, the property was purchased by the fashion designers, Yves Saint-Laurent and Pierre Berg√© who worked to restore it. Today, the garden and villa complex is open to the public. The villa houses the Berber Museum and has recently opened the Yves Saint Laurent Museum.", 'ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖÿßÿ≤Ÿäÿ∫ ŸÅŸä ÿ≠ÿØŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÖÿßÿ¨Ÿàÿ±ŸäŸÑ ÿ®ŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ŸÖÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ¥ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ŸÖŸÉÿ±ÿ≥ ŸÑÿ£ŸÖÿßÿ≤Ÿäÿ∫ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ® ŸàŸÖÿ¨ÿ™ŸÖÿπÿßÿ™ŸáŸÖ Ÿàÿ´ŸÇÿßŸÅÿßÿ™ŸáŸÖ Ÿàÿ™ŸÇÿßŸÑŸäÿØŸáŸÖÿå ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ±ŸäŸÅ ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¥ŸÖÿßŸÑ ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿ±ÿßÿ° ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑÿ¨ŸÜŸàÿ®. ŸäŸÇÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ŸÅŸä Ÿàÿ≥ÿ∑ ÿ≠ÿØŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÖÿßÿ¨Ÿàÿ∫ÿßŸÑÿå ŸÅŸä ÿ≥ÿ™ŸàÿØŸäŸà ÿ¨ÿßŸÉ ŸÖÿßÿ¨Ÿàÿ∫ÿßŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸäŸÖÿå ŸàŸäÿπÿ±ÿ∂ ŸÇÿ∑ÿπ ÿ£ÿ´ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖÿßÿ≤Ÿäÿ∫ ŸÖÿ´ŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿ¨ÿßÿØ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≤Ÿäÿßÿ° ŸàÿßŸÑÿ≠ŸÑŸä Ÿàÿ•ÿ®ÿ±ŸäŸÇ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿßŸä Ÿàÿ∫Ÿäÿ±Ÿáÿß ŸÅŸäÿ≠ŸàŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ 600 ŸÇÿ∑ÿπÿ© ÿ£ÿ´ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ŸÅÿ±ŸäÿØÿ©.ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ Ÿäÿ∫ÿ∑Ÿä ŸÖÿ≥ÿßÿ≠ÿ© ÿ™ŸÅŸàŸÇ ŸÖÿ¶ÿ™Ÿä ŸÖÿ™ÿ± ŸÖÿ±ÿ®ÿπÿå ŸàŸäÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇÿ®ŸÑ ÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ 140 ÿ£ŸÑŸÅ ÿ≤Ÿàÿßÿ± ÿ≥ŸÜŸàŸäÿß. ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ŸÜÿ™Ÿäÿ¨ÿ© ÿ¨ŸáŸàÿØ ŸÖÿπŸÖÿßÿ±ŸäŸäŸÜ ŸàÿπŸÑŸÖÿßÿ° ÿßŸÑÿ•ŸÜÿ≥ÿßŸÜ ŸàŸÖÿ§ÿ±ÿÆŸäŸÜ Ÿàÿ®ÿßÿ≠ÿ´ŸäŸÜ ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿ¨ÿßŸÑÿßÿ™ ÿ£ÿÆÿ±Ÿâÿå ÿ®ŸÖŸÜ ŸÅŸäŸáŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿ™ÿßÿ∞ ÿ£ÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿ≥ŸÉŸàŸÜÿ™Ÿä.Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÇÿßÿπÿ© ÿ™ŸàŸÅÿ± ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπŸÑŸàŸÖÿßÿ™ ÿπŸÜ ÿ™ÿßÿ±ŸäÿÆ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖÿßÿ≤Ÿäÿ∫ Ÿàÿ™ÿ∞ŸÉÿ± ÿ®ÿπÿ∂ ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ®ÿßÿ¶ŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ© .Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÇÿßÿπÿ© ŸÖŸÖÿ™ŸÑÿ¶ÿ© ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ∑ÿπ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ´ÿ±Ÿäÿ© ÿ®ŸÖÿß ŸÅŸäŸáÿß ÿ≠ŸÇÿßÿ¶ÿ® Ÿàÿ£ÿØŸàÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±ŸÅ ŸàŸÖÿπÿØÿßÿ™ ÿ™ÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÜÿ≠ŸÑ ŸàŸÖŸàÿßÿØ ÿØŸäŸÜŸäÿ© Ÿàÿ∫Ÿäÿ±Ÿáÿß.', 'Dar el Bacha (Arabic: ÿØÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿßÿ¥ÿß\u200e, lit.\u2009\'House of the Pasha\') is a palace located in the old medina of Marrakesh, Morocco.Built in 1910, the Dar el Bacha, which means "house of the pasha", was the residence of Thami El Glaoui, who was given the title of pasha (roughly "governor" or other high official) of Marrakech by the Sultan Moulay Youssef in 1912. For years he was the most powerful political figure of the Moroccan south under French rule. He built his private palace on a lavish scale to impress guests. Some illustrious guests who visited Dar el Bacha include Colette, Maurice Ravel, Charlie Chaplin, Josephine Baker, Winston Churchill among others.', 'Dar el Bacha (Arabic: ÿØÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿßÿ¥ÿß\u200e, lit.\u2009\'House of the Pasha\') is a palace located in the old medina of Marrakesh, Morocco.Built in 1910, the Dar el Bacha, which means "house of the pasha", was the residence of Thami El Glaoui, who was given the title of pasha (roughly "governor" or other high official) of Marrakech by the Sultan Moulay Youssef in 1912. For years he was the most powerful political figure of the Moroccan south under French rule. He built his private palace on a lavish scale to impress guests. Some illustrious guests who visited Dar el Bacha include Colette, Maurice Ravel, Charlie Chaplin, Josephine Baker, Winston Churchill among others.', "The Mouassine Mosque or al-Muwassin Mosque (Arabic: ÿ¨ÿßŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿßÿ≥ŸäŸÜ\u200e, romanized: jama' al-muwƒÅssƒ´n) is a major neighbourhood mosque (a Friday mosque) in Marrakech, Morocco, dating from the 16th century during the Saadian Dynasty. It shares its name with the Mouassine neighbourhood.", "Jemaa el-Fnaa (Arabic: ÿ≥ÿßÿ≠ÿ© ÿ¨ÿßŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÜÿßÿ°\u200e SƒÅ·∏•at JƒÅmi æ al-FanƒÅ æ, also Jemaa el-Fna, Djema el-Fna or Djemaa el-Fnaa) is a square and market place in Marrakesh's medina quarter (old city). It remains the main square of Marrakesh, used by locals and tourists.", 'ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸäŸÖÿ© ŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ¥ ÿ£Ÿà ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπÿ™ŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ¥ÿå ÿ≥ÿ¨ŸÑÿ™ ŸÅŸä ÿ≥ŸÜÿ© 1985ÿå ÿ∂ŸÖŸÜ ŸÇÿßÿ¶ŸÖÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ±ÿßÿ´ ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÑŸÖŸä ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ£ŸÇÿ±ÿ™Ÿáÿß ŸÖŸÜÿ∏ŸÖÿ© ÿßŸÑŸäŸàŸÜŸäÿ≥ŸÉŸà ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ§ÿ™ŸÖÿ± ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÖ ŸÑÿØŸàÿ±ÿ™Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿßÿ®ÿπÿ© ÿπÿ¥ÿ±ÿ© ÿ®ÿ®ÿßÿ±Ÿäÿ≥ÿå ŸÅŸä 16 ŸÖŸÜ ŸÜŸàŸÅŸÖÿ®ÿ± 1972.ÿ®ŸÜŸäÿ™ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπÿ™ŸäŸÇÿ© ŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ¥ ÿ≥ŸÜÿ© 1071-1072ÿå ŸÉÿπÿßÿµŸÖÿ© ŸÑŸÑÿØŸàŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿßÿ®ÿ∑Ÿäÿ© ÿ´ŸÖ ŸÑŸÑÿØŸàŸÑÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿ≠ÿØŸäÿ©. ÿ™ÿ∂ŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπÿ™ŸäŸÇÿ© ÿπÿØÿØÿß Ÿáÿßÿ¶ŸÑÿß ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¢ÿ´ÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿßÿ±ŸäÿÆŸäÿ©: ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥Ÿàÿßÿ± Ÿàÿ£ÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®Ÿáÿßÿå ÿ¨ÿßŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÉÿ™ÿ®Ÿäÿ© ŸàŸÖŸÜÿßÿ±ÿ™Ÿá ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ™ÿ®ŸÑÿ∫ 77 ŸÖÿ™ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿπŸÑŸàÿå ŸàŸÖŸàÿßŸÇÿπ Ÿàÿ¢ÿ´ÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿπÿØŸäŸäŸÜ ŸàŸÉÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿßÿ≤ŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ™ŸÇŸÑŸäÿØŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸäŸÖÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂ÿßÿ™ Ÿàÿ∫Ÿäÿ±Ÿáÿß ÿ®ÿ∑ÿßÿ®ÿπŸáÿß ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®Ÿä ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸäŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ŸÖŸäÿ≤.', 'The Shrob ou shouf fountain (also spelled Chrob ou chouf) is a historic wall fountain in the medina of Marrakech, Morocco. It dates from the late 16th or early 17th century and is located near the Ben Youssef Madrasa.The fountain was erected during the Saadian dynasty period, when Marrakesh was the capital of Morocco, and closely resembles other Saadian fountains in style (e.g. the fountains of the Mouassine Mosque and Bab Doukkala Mosque).:\u200a461\u200a Although the date and founder of the structure is not directly identified, some attribute the fountain to the reign of Sultan Ahmad al-Mansur (1578-1603).', "The Almoravid Qubba (Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ®ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿßÿ®ÿ∑Ÿäÿ©\u200e), or Qubba Ba'adiyyin/Barudiyyin, is a small monument in Marrakech, Morocco. It was erected by the Almoravid dynasty in the early 12th century. It is notable for its extraordinary decoration and for being one of the only remnants of Almoravid architecture in Marrakech.", "The Almoravid Qubba (Arabic: ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ®ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ±ÿßÿ®ÿ∑Ÿäÿ©\u200e), or Qubba Ba'adiyyin/Barudiyyin, is a small monument in Marrakech, Morocco. It was erected by the Almoravid dynasty in the early 12th century. It is notable for its extraordinary decoration and for being one of the only remnants of Almoravid architecture in Marrakech.", "The Menara Gardens (Arabic: ÿ≠ÿØÿßÿ¶ŸÇ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸÜÿßÿ±ÿ©\u200e) are a historic public garden and orchard in Marrakech, Morocco. They were established in the 12th century (circa 1157) by the Almohad Caliphate ruler Abd al-Mu'min. Along with the Agdal Gardens and the historic walled city of Marrakesh, the gardens have been listed as UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1985. The gardens are laid out around a central water basin and reservoir, next to which is a pleasure pavilion dating in its current form from the 19th century. The reservoir and its pavilion, often framed in pictures against the background of the High Atlas Mountains to the south, are considered one of the iconic views and symbols of Marrakesh.:\u200a282\u200a", "The Museum of Marrakech is a historic palace and museum located in the old center of Marrakesh, Morocco. In addition to its notable architecture, the museum's collection showcases various historic art objects and contemporary art from Morocco.", "The Museum of Marrakech is a historic palace and museum located in the old center of Marrakesh, Morocco. In addition to its notable architecture, the museum's collection showcases various historic art objects and contemporary art from Morocco.", "The Saadian Tombs (Arabic: ŸÇÿ®ÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿπÿØŸäŸäŸÜ\u200e, romanized: qubur as-sa'adiyyin, Berber languages: ‚µî‚µá‚¥±‚¥∞‚µî ‚µè ‚µâ‚µô‚¥∞‚µÑ‚¥∞‚¥∑‚µâ‚µ¢‚µè, French: Tombeaux Saadiens) are a historic royal necropolis in Marrakesh, Morocco, located on the south side of the Kasbah Mosque, inside the royal kasbah (citadel) district of the city. They date to the time of the Saadian dynasty and in particular to the reign of Ahmad al-Mansur (1578‚Äì1603), though members of Morocco's monarchy continued to be buried here for a time afterwards. The complex is regarded by many art historians as the high point of Moroccan architecture in the Saadian period due to its luxurious decoration and careful interior design. Today the site is a major tourist attraction in Marrakesh.", "Bab el-Khemis (Arabic: ÿ®ÿßÿ® ÿßŸÑÿÆŸÖŸäÿ≥\u200e, lit.\u2009'gate of Thursday') is the main northern gate of the medina (historic walled city) of Marrakesh, Morocco.", 'Dar Si Said (Arabic: ÿØÿßÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿä ÿ≥ÿπŸäÿØ\u200e) is a historic late 19th-century palace and present-day museum in Marrakesh, Morocco.', 'ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ™ ŸÅŸÑŸäŸÜÿ™ ÿ£Ÿà ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ÿ™Ÿäÿ≥ŸÉŸàŸäŸÜ ŸáŸà ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ŸäŸÇÿπ ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ¥ ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ±ÿ® ŸÖŸÜ ŸÇÿµÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ®ÿßŸáŸäÿ©.ŸÉÿßŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅ ŸÖŸÜÿ≤ŸÑÿß ÿ≥ÿßÿ®ŸÇÿß ŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ™ ŸÅŸÑŸäŸÜÿ™ ŸÅŸä ÿ£Ÿàÿßÿ¶ŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÇÿ±ŸÜ 20 ÿ®ÿπÿØŸáÿß ÿ£ÿµÿ®ÿ≠ ŸÖÿ™ÿ≠ŸÅŸãÿß ŸÖÿÆÿµÿµŸãÿß ŸÑŸÑÿ≠ÿ±ŸÅ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© ŸÖŸÜÿ∞ ÿπÿßŸÖ 1996.ŸÉÿßŸÜ ÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ™ ŸÅŸÑŸäŸÜÿ™ ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ™ÿßÿ∞Ÿãÿß ŸáŸàŸÑŸÜÿØŸäŸãÿß ŸÑŸÑÿ™ÿßÿ±ŸäÿÆ ŸàÿßŸÑŸÅŸÜ ŸàŸÖÿ≥ÿßŸÅÿ±Ÿãÿß ŸÖŸÅÿ™ŸàŸÜŸãÿß ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ® Ÿàÿ´ŸÇÿßŸÅÿ™Ÿá ŸÑÿ£ŸÉÿ´ÿ± ŸÖŸÜ 50 ÿπÿßŸÖŸãÿß.ÿ®ÿßŸÑÿ•ÿ∂ÿßŸÅÿ© ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ŸÖÿ¨ŸÖŸàÿπÿßÿ™Ÿá ÿå ŸÅÿ•ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸáŸÜÿØÿ≥ÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿπŸÖÿßÿ±Ÿäÿ© ŸÑŸáÿ∞ÿß ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÉŸÜ ŸáŸä ŸÖŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÜŸàÿπ ŸÅŸÜ ÿ•ÿ≥ŸÑÿßŸÖŸä-ÿ•ÿ≥ÿ®ÿßŸÜŸä. ÿ¥ÿ∫ŸàŸÅŸãÿß ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÜŸàŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ¥ÿπÿ®Ÿäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ∫ÿ±ÿ®Ÿäÿ© ÿå ŸÇÿßŸÖ ÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ™ ŸÅŸÑŸäŸÜÿ™ ÿ®ÿ™ÿ¨ŸÖŸäÿπ ŸÖÿ¨ŸÖŸàÿπÿ© ÿ™ÿ¥ŸÖŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ¢ŸÑÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàÿ≥ŸäŸÇŸäÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≤Ÿäÿßÿ° ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿ¨ŸàŸáÿ±ÿßÿ™ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ´ÿßÿ´ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿ¨ÿßÿØ ŸàÿßŸÑÿ£ŸàÿßŸÜŸä ÿßŸÑŸÇÿØŸäŸÖÿ© ŸàÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ±ŸÅ ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÜŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖÿßÿ≤Ÿäÿ∫Ÿäÿ©ÿå ÿÆÿßÿµÿ© ŸÖŸÜ ÿ≥ŸáŸÑ ÿ≥Ÿàÿ≥ Ÿà ŸÖŸÜÿ∑ŸÇÿ© ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿ±ÿßÿ°. ŸÖŸÜ ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ŸÖÿ¨ŸÖŸàÿπÿßÿ™Ÿá ÿå ŸÅÿ•ŸÜ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿßŸáŸÖÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÅÿ±ŸäŸÇŸäÿ© Ÿàÿ¨ŸÜŸàÿ® ÿßŸÑÿµÿ≠ÿ±ÿßÿ° ŸáŸä ÿßŸÑÿ™Ÿä ÿ£ÿ®ÿ±ÿ≤Ÿáÿß ÿ®Ÿäÿ±ÿ™ ŸÅŸÑŸäŸÜÿ™.', 'The Slat al-Azama Synagogue or Lazama Synagogue (Arabic: ŸÉŸÜŸäÿ≥ ÿµŸÑÿßÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπÿ≤ÿßŸÖÿ©\u200e, Hebrew: ◊ë◊ô◊™ ◊î◊õ◊†◊°◊™ ◊¶◊ú◊ê◊™ ◊ê◊ú ◊¢◊ñ◊û◊î\u200e) is one of the best-known synagogues in Marrakesh, Morocco. It is located in the historic Mellah (Jewish quarter) of the old city.', "The Agdal Gardens (or Aguedal Gardens) are a large area of historic gardens and orchards in Marrakesh, Morocco. The gardens are located to the south of the city's historic Kasbah and its royal palace. Together with the medina of Marrakech and the Menara Gardens, the Agdal Gardens were listed by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site in 1985. The gardens contain several historic water reservoirs as well as several historic palaces and pavilions, including the Dar el-Hana and the Dar al-Bayda.", 'Marrakesh Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ŸÖÿ±ÿßŸÉÿ¥\u200e, Berber: Annar n Mrraksh) is a multi-use stadium in Marrakesh, Morocco. It was designed by Gregotti Associati International.Completed in January 2012, it is used mostly for football matches with the capability of hosting Olympic Games. It is home to Kawkab Marrakesh football team. The stadium has a capacity of 45,240 people. It replaces Stade Al Harti as the home of Kawkab Marrakech and as the main stadium of the city.It hosted the 2014 IAAF Continental Cup, four games including the final in the 2014 FIFA Club World Cup, and the 2014 African Championships in Athletics.']

—Å–∞–π—Ç", 'Donetsk State Academic Opera and Ballet Theatre named after A. Solovyanenko was established in 1932 in Lugansk on the basis of fit-up theatre of Right-bank Ukraine. Since 15 March 1932 the theatre was transferred to Donetsk theatre group The first season opened on September 1, 1932 with opera Prince Igor composed by Alexander Borodin. On April 12, 1941, the Theatre opened the season in the new theater building by premiere of Mikhail Glinka\'s Ivan Susanin. On August 7, same year, the premiere of the first ballet performance Laurencia by Alexander Crain was held. After the outbreak of the Great Patriotic War part of the company was evacuated to Kirghizia, later, in June 1942, the theater moved to Przhevalsk city, where actors held concerts in hospitals and military units. In January 1944 the theater returned to Stalino and already in September, right after the liberation of the Donets Basin a premiere of Alexander Borodin\'s Prince Igor took place. On October 2, 1977, the Theater was awarded with Academic status for significant contribution to the development of Soviet art. In 1992 the Choreographic School of Vadim Pisarev, the People\'s Artist of Ukraine, was established in the Theater. Starting from 1994 the Theater has been hosting the International Festival "World Ballet Stars", Vadim Pisarev is as well the founder and art director. On December 9, 1999 by the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine, the theater was named after Soviet Ukrainian opera singer Anatoliy Solovyanenko.', "Alexander Vladimirovich Zakharchenko (Russian: –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞ÃÅ–Ω–¥—Ä –í–ª–∞–¥–∏ÃÅ–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∏—á –ó–∞—Ö–∞ÃÅ—Ä—á–µ–Ω–∫–æ, IPA: […êl ≤…™kÀàsandr vl…êÀàd ≤im ≤…™r…ôv ≤…™d ë z…êÀàxart…ï…™nk…ô]; Ukrainian: –û–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞ÃÅ–Ω–¥—Ä –í–æ–ª–æ–¥–∏ÃÅ–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∏—á –ó–∞—Ö–∞ÃÅ—Ä—á–µ–Ω–∫–æ; 26 June 1976 ‚Äì 31 August 2018) was a separatist leader who was the head of state and Prime Minister of the Donetsk People's Republic, a self-proclaimed state and rebel group which declared independence from Ukraine on 11 May 2014. Zakharchenko was appointed Prime Minister in August 2014 after his predecessor, Alexander Borodai, resigned, and went on to win the early November 2014 election for the position.Zakharchenko was killed in 2018 when a bomb was planted in a caf√© that he visited.", "–ü–∞–º'—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ –ê–Ω–∞—Ç–æ–ª—ñ—é –°–æ–ª–æ–≤'—è–Ω–µ–Ω–∫—É –≤—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–π 31 —Ç—Ä–∞–≤–Ω—è 2002 —Ä–æ–∫—É —É Under the arch there is a granite slab with the names and ages of the killed children. The facility is located in the center of the city, in the Lenin Comsomol park. With a capacity of 52,518 spectators, the stadium used to host FC Shakhtar Donetsk matches and also hosted some matches of Euro 2012. The final cost of construction for Donbass Arena was $400M. —Å—Ö—ñ–¥—Ü—è–º–∏.", "To Donbas Liberators (Ukrainian: –¢–≤–æ—ó–º –≤–∏–∑–≤–æ–ª–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º, –î–æ–Ω–±–∞—Å–µ, romanized: Tvoim vyzvolyteliam, Donbase, lit.\u2009'To your liberators, Donbas') is a monument in Lenin Comsomol park, Donetsk, dedicated to the memory of all military units and formations that liberated Donbas during the Great Patriotic War (World War II). It is the largest monument in the south-east of Ukraine, the main military history monument of the city and region.Memorial events dedicated to Victory Day are traditionally held near the monument. Veterans march through downtown to the monument, where they are congratulated and banquet tables are arranged for them in the alleys near the monument."]

column5: ['Statua antropofica', 'Plaza de Armas', 'Casa Iturregui', 'Museo del Juguete', 'Teatro Municipal', 'Piscina Ol√≠mpica', 'Estadio Mansiche', 'Estadio Chan Chan', 'Huaca La Esmeralda', 'Museo de sitio Chan Chan', 'Huacas del Sol', 'Huaca de la Luna', 'Museo Huacas de Moche']
column6: ['The Freedom Monument, located in the center of the Plaza de Armas in Trujillo, Peru, is the work of sculptor Edmund Moeller. It consists of three sections: the first is on a circular platform with pedestals, resting on a granite base, and supporting sculptures representing the art, science, trade and health. The second section consists of three statues: a bent man, symbolizing oppression or slavery; a person with arms reaching backwards, symbolizing the struggle for freedom; and a man with arms raised and hands making fists, symbolizing liberation. The section contains three plaques. The first recalls the proclamation of the independence of Trujillo by Jos√© Bernardo de Torre Tagle, on December 29, 1820. The second plaque commemorates the Battle of Jun√≠n, and the third plaque commemorates the Battle of Ayacucho.', 'Plaza de Armas of Trujillo is the main square where the Spanish foundation of Trujillo was made, in northern Peru. It has been the principal locus of history in this city in the republic era. It is located in the central zone of the Historic Centre of Trujillo. In the streets that form this main square are located the buildings of Municipality Palace, the Cathedral, among others. The Plaza de Armas of Trujillo is formed by the Pizarro, Independencia, Orbegoso and Almagro streets. In this square, the proclamation of the independence of Trujillo took place.', 'El palacio Iturregui es una casa ubicada en Trujillo, Per√∫. Fue edificada en 1842 en estilo neocl√°sico. Actualmente es sede del Club Central de Trujillo. Posee dos plantas. El exterior destaca los grandes ventanales con coronaciones forjado en hierro con forma de peineta y columnas adosadas. El piso es de laja espa√±ola y m√°rmol de Italia. Fue propiedad de Juan Manuel Iturregui Aguilarte - pr√≥cer de la independencia - y, luego, de su hijo Juan Manuel Iturregui Gonz√°lez. Posee inmobiliarios de siglo XIX. [1] [2]', 'Museo del Juguete puede referirse a:Museo del Juguete (Trujillo), en Per√∫ Museo del Juguete Antiguo M√©xico Museo Alem√°n del Juguete', 'El Teatro Municipal de Trujillo es un teatro situado en el centro hist√≥rico de Trujillo, Per√∫. Tiene un aforo de 408. Fue adquirida por la comuna el 10 de enero de 1876. En 1910 se incendia producto de un estallido de una m√°quina de proyecci√≥n de cine. Cuenta con una sede administrativa, sala de piano, sala de ballet.[1][2][3]El 21 de febrero de 1910 ser√° recordado siempre como una fecha fat√≠dica dentro de la historia trujillana. El Teatro Municipal de Trujillo, fue reducido a escombros por un gigantesco incendio que termin√≥ por enlutar a la ciudad entera y al pa√≠s en general.', 'La Piscina Ol√≠mpica Mansiche se encuentra en la ciudad de Trujillo y es uno de los escenarios de los XVII Juegos Bolivarianos Trujillo 2013 para el desarrollo de competencias de nataci√≥n.[2][3]Las instalaciones de la piscina forman parte del Complejo Deportivo Mansiche y es un centro de nataci√≥n en la ciudad de Trujillo. Cuenta con una piscina de precalentamiento construida para los Juegos Bolivarianos de 2013.[4]XVII Juegos Bolivarianos Trujillo 2013, en estos juegos las competencias nataci√≥n se realizaron en la Piscina Mansiche. Anterior a su remodelaci√≥n para los Juegos Bolivarianos 2013[5] la Piscina Mansiche fue escenario de campeonatos nacionales y nor regionales de nataci√≥n.', 'Estadio Mansiche is the biggest stadium of the city of Trujillo and the home of the most important football clubs in the city, Carlos A. Mannucci and Universidad C√©sar Vallejo. The stadium also has a running track for track and field sports. The stadium is part of the greater Mansiche Sports Complex which includes the Coliseo Gran Chimu, a swimming pool, and other facilities.', 'El estadio Chan Chan es un escenario de f√∫tbol y atletismo ubicado en la ciudad de Trujillo, capital de la Regi√≥n La Libertad (Per√∫).[1] Este estadio es parte del Complejo Deportivo Mochica Chim√∫ uno de los escenarios de competencia donde se desarrollaron los XVII Juegos Bolivarianos Trujillo 2013.Juegos Bolivarianos de 2013 Lista de estadios del Per√∫ Complejo Deportivo Mansiche Complejo Deportivo Mochica Chim√∫ Trujillo', 'The Huaca La Esmeralda is an archaeological building belonging to the Chimu culture, is located in the Peruvian city of Trujillo. It is estimated that the adobe construction was done during the first stage of development of the Chimu culture, in close link with the capital Chan Chan. It occupies an area of approximately 2,600 square meters.It is said the Huaca La Esmeralda could have been the palace of a great Chim√∫ lord of the Mansiche area. Its architecture has three terraces adorned with zoomorphic and geometric figures (diamonds) all in relief, has a fairly steep ramp that connects its two levels.', 'El Museo de Sitio Chan Chan es un museo peruano, que est√° situado en el departamento de La Libertad.[1][2]El museo tiene salas de exposici√≥n permanentes y de exposici√≥n temporal. Tambi√©n recrea a trav√©s de maquetas la edificaci√≥n de Chan Chan.[3] La zona arqueol√≥gica Chan Chan fue declarada como Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en 1986 e incluida en la Lista del Patrimonio de la Humanidad en peligro en el mismo a√±o. [4]Alberga alrededor de 15 mil piezas arqueol√≥gicas de cer√°mica, piezas l√≠ticas y de metales, textiles y restos √≥seos.[5][6][7][8]', 'The Huaca del Sol is an adobe brick temple built by the Moche civilization (100 CE to 800 CE) on the northern coast of what is now Peru. The temple is one of several ruins found near the volcanic peak of Cerro Blanco, in the coastal desert near Trujillo at the Moche Valley. The other major ruin at the site is the nearby Huaca de la Luna, a better-preserved but smaller temple.', 'Huaca de la Luna ("Temple or Shrine of the Moon") is a large adobe brick structure built mainly by the Moche people of northern Peru. Along with the Huaca del Sol, the Huaca de la Luna is part of Huacas de Moche, which is the remains of an ancient Moche capital city called Cerro Blanco, by the volcanic peak of the same name.', 'El Museo Santiago Uceda Castillo es un museo que est√° situado en el departamento de La Libertad.']

column5: ['Anna Stadium', 'Anna Science Centre']
column6: ['The Anna Stadium is a stadium at the Anna Sports Complex located in the Indian city of Tiruchirappalli. The main football and athletics stadium, Anna Stadium, has a capacity of 10,000. Constructed in 1970, it is spread over an area of 31.25 acres (12.65 ha). The complex also houses a multi-purpose indoor stadium and has separate courts for sports such as tennis, badminton, basketball, football, kabaddi, hockey, and volleyball. The complex is located in Khajamalai, a suburb of Tiruchirappalli.', 'Anna Science Centre is established for the cause of educating young generation and general public on the objectives of Tamil Nadu Science and Technology Centre. The Centre hosts Science and Technology Halls with various exhibitions and also a planetarium.It is located in the Indian city of Tiruchirappalli, on the National Highway 210 between Trichy and Pudukottai adjacent to the Tiruchirapalli Airport. The Nearest Railway Station is Tiruchirappalli Junction located in 5 km. The Planetarium is well connected through City buses.']

column5: ["People's Park", 'Afaq Khoja Mausoleum. Bus 20']
column6: ["People's Park (simplified Chinese: ‰∫∫Ê∞ëÂÖ¨Âõ≠; traditional Chinese: ‰∫∫Ê∞ëÂÖ¨Âúí; pinyin: R√©nm√≠n G≈çngyu√°n) is an urban public park in the city of Kashgar in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region, western China. The 24-hectare (59-acre) park is one of the largest in Kashgar.Located in the center of Kashgar, south of the People's Square, People's Park is one of the main recreational places in the city. It has more than 26,000 trees of more than 50 species, and 4,000 metres (13,000 ft) of trails. The park's facilities include an artificial lake, pavilions, a Uyghur-style cultural palace, children's playgrounds, orchards, a zoo, and a rollerskating rink. Admission is free.", 'The AfƒÅq Khoja Mausoleum or Aba Khoja Mausoleum (ÿ¢ŸÅÿßŸÇ ÿÆŸàÿßÿ¨Ÿá ŸÖÿ≤ÿßÿ±) (Uyghur: Apaq Xoja Maziri), is a mausoleum in Xinjiang, China. The holiest local Muslim site, it is located some 5 km north-east from the centre of Kashgar, in Haohan Village (Êµ©ÁΩïÊùë H√†o H«én C≈´n; Ayziret in Uyghur), which has is also known as Yaghdu. The shrine is heavily patronized by sightseers and has been designated as a tourist attraction by Chinese officials.']
