column6: ['Los Remedios National Park is a national park in Mexico, located in the far west of the municipality of Naucalpan in Mexico State, just northwest of Mexico City. The park was established by federal decree in 1938 with an area of 400 hectares (990 acres). Within its borders is the Sanctuary of the Virgin of Los Remedios, a colonial-era aqueduct and a pre-Hispanic archaeological zone with a Chichimeca temple. All of these are located in and around the mountain called Cerro Moctezuma. The site was an Aztec observatory and is also believed to be where Hern√°n Cort√©s and his men rested after fleeing Tenochtitlan.', 'Parque Naucalli is a park in Mexico City in the municipality of Naucalpan de Ju√°rez. Planning for the park began in 1975. Reforesting the area began in 1977 and the park opened to the public in 1982.', 'El Acueducto de los Remedios (conocido coloquialmente como "Los Arcos") est√° ubicado dentro del municipio de Naucalpan en el Estado de M√©xico, en lo que correspondiera anteriormente al poblado de Los Remedios (y que hoy forma parte de la mancha urbana), es un monumento de la √©poca colonial y que se pensaba sirviera para llevar agua del ejido de San Francisco Chimalpa al pueblo de los Remedios, alrededor del santuario del mismo nombre.', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', "Parque Tezoz√≥moc is a large park in Mexico City. It is located in the Azcapotzalco borough, in the northwestern section of Mexico City (M√©xico, D. F.), Mexico. It is 28 hectares (69 acres) in size.The park was designed by Mario Schjetnan, and opened in 1982. It is near the El Rosario residential neighborhood, and was built on the land of the former Hacienda del Rosario. It an important public open space, sports and recreational area, and a point of reference landmark for northwestern Mexico City.In the park's center there is a large pond with a 'nature reserve' island. The Museum of Regional Art, and the Museum of Three Dimensional Art, are both located on the northern perimeter.", 'The Bust of Victor Hugo is an 1883 patinated plaster sculpture by the French artist Auguste Rodin of the Romantic writer Victor Hugo. It is now in the Museo Soumaya in Mexico City.', 'The Museo Soumaya is a private museum in Mexico City and a non-profit cultural institution with two museum buildings in Mexico City - Plaza Carso and Plaza Loreto. It has over 66,000 works from 30 centuries of art including sculptures from Pre-Hispanic Mesoamerica, 19th- and 20th-century Mexican art and an extensive repertoire of works by European old masters and masters of modern western art such as Auguste Rodin, Salvador Dal√≠, Bartolom√© Esteban Murillo and Tintoretto. It is called one of the most complete collections of its kind.', 'El Rosario (Spanish: Estaci√≥n El Rosario) is an at-grade station on the Mexico City Metro. It is located in Azcapotzalco borough, in the northern reaches of Mexico City. It serves as the terminal for both Lines 6 and 7.The station logo depicts a set of rosary beads.The platforms for lines 6 and 7 are at the same level, separated only by a bridge. This terminal, like many others, is multimodal, connecting to other kinds of transport. Metro El Rosario connects with suburban buses that serve municipalities such as Cuautitl√°n Izcalli and Lecher√≠a, in neighboring Mexico State. It also connects with trolleybus Line "I", which runs between El Rosario and Metro Chapultepec.', "The Acuario Inbursa is an aquarium in the Nuevo Polanco area of Miguel Hidalgo district, Mexico City.It is the largest in Mexico with 3500 square meters of exhibition space and 1.6 million liters of ocean water. The project of billionaire Carlos Slim, it cost 250 million Mexican pesos, or 19 million US dollars, to build. It opened in June 2014 with 3000 animals of 230 different species, with plans by the end of the year to have 10,000 animals of over 300 species.The building has 5 stories of which 4 are underground. Some Mexican press articles claim the aquarium as the largest in Latin America, however the Dominican Republic's National Aquarium is much larger at 34,500m¬≤.", 'Colecci√≥n Jumex is a private art collection owned by Eugenio L√≥pez Alonso. It includes works by Damien Hirst, Andy Warhol, Gabriel Orozco, Cy Twombly, Jeff Koons, Marcel Duchamp, Andreas Gursky, Darren Almond, Tacita Dean, Olafur Eliasson, Martin Kippenberger, Carl Hopgood, Bruce Nauman, David Ostrowski, Francis Al√øs and Martin Creed.Eugenio L√≥pez Alonso purchased his first work of Mexican art in 1994. This was the symbolic beginning of Fundaci√≥n Jumex Arte Contempor√°neo: from the outset, L√≥pez was more interested in sharing his interest in art than in amassing a collection of objects.', 'El Pensil Mexicano es un jard√≠n de estilo barroco ubicado en lo que ahora es un predio de 3000 m¬≤ en el n√∫mero 80 de la calle Lago Chiem, en la colonia Pensil de la Ciudad de M√©xico. Es considerado uno de los √∫ltimos vestigios de los jardines novohispanos de recreo.El nombre pensil en castellano antiguo significa jard√≠n delicioso.[1]', 'La Fuente de Petr√≥leos o Fuente de Petr√≥leos Mexicanos, oficialmente denominada por sus creadores Monumento a la Industria Petrolera de M√©xico es un monumento de la Ciudad de M√©xico en el Paseo de la Reforma. Es obra del arquitecto Vicente Mendiola Quezada y del escultor Juan Fernando Olagu√≠bel Rosenzweig, y conmemora la Expropiaci√≥n del petr√≥leo en M√©xico. Se construy√≥ en 1952, durante el sexenio de Miguel Alem√°n Vald√©s.', 'Parque Lincoln, or Lincoln Park, is a city park in Mexico City, Mexico.The park is located in the Polanco neighborhood of Mexico City (M√©xico, D. F.). There is a statue of Martin Luther King Jr. installed in the park, as well as a copy of Abraham Lincoln: The Man (also known as Standing Lincoln). The clock tower was built in 1937 and since 1992 it operates as an art gallery.Media related to Parque Lincoln (Mexico City) at Wikimedia Commons Official website', 'Mexico City Arena (Spanish: Arena Ciudad de M√©xico) is an indoor arena in Azcapotzalco, Mexico City, Mexico. It hosts concerts, sports, and other events. It officially opened on February 25, 2012. The total cost of the arena was $300 million. The arena has a maximum capacity of 22,300 spectators. It is operated by Zignia Live. It is located in Avenida de las Granjas, close to Ferrer√≠a metro station, Fortuna railway station of the Suburban Railway, and next to TecMilenio University.', "National Auditorium (Spanish: Auditorio Nacional) is an entertainment center at Paseo de la Reforma #50, Chapultepec in Mexico City.The National Auditorium is considered among the world's best venues by specialized media. It was designed by Mexican architects Pedro Ram√≠rez V√°zquez and Gonzalo Ram√≠rez del Sordo, and remodeled by Abraham Zabludovsky and Teodoro Gonz√°lez de Le√≥n. Concerts, art, theatre, dance, and more are hosted at the venue.It also has a small venue available for smaller events, called Auditorio Lunario. The total seating capacity of 10,000.", 'The Aztec sun stone (Spanish: Piedra del Sol) is a late post-classic Mexica sculpture housed in the National Anthropology Museum in Mexico City, and is perhaps the most famous work of Mexica sculpture. It measures 358 centimetres (141 in) in diameter and 98 centimetres (39 in) thick, and weighs 24,590 kg (54,210 lb). Shortly after the Spanish conquest, the monolithic sculpture was buried in the Z√≥calo, the main square of Mexico City. It was rediscovered on 17 December 1790 during repairs on the Mexico City Cathedral. Following its rediscovery, the sun stone was mounted on an exterior wall of the cathedral, where it remained until 1885. Early scholars initially thought that the stone was carved in the 1470s, though modern research suggests that it was carved some time between 1502 and 1521.', "The National Museum of Anthropology (Spanish: Museo Nacional de Antropolog√≠a, MNA) is a national museum of Mexico. It is the largest and most visited museum in Mexico. Located in the area between Paseo de la Reforma and Mahatma Gandhi Street within Chapultepec Park in Mexico City, the museum contains significant archaeological and anthropological artifacts from Mexico's pre-Columbian heritage, such as the Stone of the Sun (or the Aztec calendar stone) and the Aztec Xochipilli statue.", 'Chapultepec Zoo (Spanish: Zool√≥gico de Chapultepec) is a zoo located in Chapultepec Park; it is one of four zoos near Mexico City, and the best known Mexican zoo. It was founded July 6, 1923 by Mexican biologist Alfonso Luis Herrera using donations from private citizens and governmental funds from the Ministry of Agriculture and Development, and also with funds from the Society of Biological Studies.', 'The Battle of Molino del Rey (8 September 1847) was one of the bloodiest engagements of the Mexican‚ÄìAmerican War as part of the Battle for Mexico City. It was fought in September 1847 between Mexican forces under General Antonio Le√≥n against an American force under Major General Winfield Scott at El Molino del Rey on the fringes of Mexico City. The Americans made little progress in this battle, but the Mexican forces were unable to hold them back long enough to prevent the capture of Mexico City one week later.', 'Casa del Lago was instituted in 1959 as the first off-campus Cultural Center of the National Autonomous University of Mexico. It is characterized by its extraordinary ability to promote the cultural and generational encounter between the vanguard and tradition. It was established with Juan Jos√© Arreola as its founding director and is located in the Woods of Chapultepec, a traditional Sunday walk area for the inhabitants of the capital.', "Museo Rufino Tamayo is a public contemporary art museum located in Mexico City's Chapultepec Park, that produces contemporary art exhibitions, using its collection of modern and contemporary art, as well as artworks from the collection of its founder, the artist Rufino Tamayo.The building was the first major museum in Mexico built with private funds, with Tamayo participating in its design, which won the Premio Nacional de Arte in 1982. The Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes (INBA) has run the museum since 1986 and in 2012, the facility was expanded from three halls to five.", 'Chapultepec, more commonly called the "Bosque de Chapultepec" (Chapultepec Forest) in Mexico City, is one of the largest city parks in the Western Hemisphere, measuring in total just over 686 hectares (1,695 acres). Centered on a rock formation called Chapultepec Hill, one of the park\'s main functions is as an ecological space in Greater Mexico City. It is considered the first and most important of Mexico City\'s "lungs", with trees that replenish oxygen to the Valley of Mexico.', 'El Museo Tecnol√≥gico de la Comisi√≥n Federal de Electricidad (MUTEC) fue inaugurado el 20 de noviembre de 1970 y cerrado definitivamente en septiembre de 2015. Estuvo enfocado originalmente en la rama de la energ√≠a el√©ctrica. El MUTEC se encontraba localizado en la 2a. secci√≥n del Bosque de Chapultepec en la Ciudad de M√©xico, M√©xico. El museo fue considerado como el primer museo interactivo de ciencias que se cre√≥ en Latinoam√©rica.[1]El MUTEC contaba con las siguientes salas:', '–ü–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ –Æ—Ä–∏—é –ì–∞–≥–∞—Ä–∏–Ω—É –≤ –ú–µ—Ö–∏–∫–æ (—Å—Ç–æ–ª–∏—Ü–∞ –ú–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–∏) –±—ã–ª —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω 19 –∏—é–ª—è 2017 –≥–æ–¥–∞.–ü–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤–Ω—É—Ç—Ä–∏ –∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è –ú—É–∑–µ—è –µ—Å—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è –ú–µ—Ö–∏–∫–æ.–ê–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞ —è–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å–∫—É–ª—å–ø—Ç–æ—Ä –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –õ–µ–æ–Ω–æ–≤.–ò–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–∞—Ç–∏–≤–∞ —É—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∫–∏ –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∞ –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–∞–¥–ª–µ–∂–∏—Ç –º–µ–∂–¥—É–Ω–∞—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–æ–º—É –±–ª–∞–≥–æ—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º—É —Ñ–æ–Ω–¥—É ¬´–î–∏–∞–ª–æ–≥ –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä ‚Äì –ï–¥–∏–Ω—ã–π –º–∏—Ä¬ª, –∞ —Ä–µ–∞–ª–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è —ç—Ç–æ–π –∏–¥–µ–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—à–ª–∞ –ø—Ä–∏ —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–∏ —Ä–æ—Å—Å–∏–π—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –ø–æ—Å–æ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –≤ –ú–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–µ, –†–æ—Å—Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏—á–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –∏ –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–µ—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–∞ –æ–∫—Ä—É–∂–∞—é—â–µ–π —Å—Ä–µ–¥—ã –ú–µ—Ö–∏–∫–æ.', 'Chapultepec, more commonly called the "Bosque de Chapultepec" (Chapultepec Forest) in Mexico City, is one of the largest city parks in the Western Hemisphere, measuring in total just over 686 hectares (1,695 acres). Centered on a rock formation called Chapultepec Hill, one of the park\'s main functions is as an ecological space in Greater Mexico City. It is considered the first and most important of Mexico City\'s "lungs", with trees that replenish oxygen to the Valley of Mexico.', "Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk Monument (Spanish: Estatua de Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk) is a monument located on Paseo de la Reforma in Mexico's capital, Mexico City.It consists of the depiction of the crescent and star on the Turkish flag with the statue of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk and made of white marble. The statue of Atat√ºrk is 3.2 m in length and weighing approximately 1.5 tonnes.", 'The statue of Heydar Aliyev is a bronze sculpture of the third president of Azerbaijan, Heydar Aliyev (1923‚Äì2003). It was originally installed along Paseo de la Reforma, in Chapultepec, Miguel Hidalgo, Mexico City.', 'The Mexico City National Cemetery is a cemetery in Mexico City. It was established in 1851 by the United States Congress to gather the American dead of the Mexican‚ÄìAmerican War that lay in the nearby fields and to provide burial space for Americans who died in the vicinity.The first dedicated United States military cemetery abroad, it served as a model for later cemeteries.An act of Congress on 28 September 1850 authorized the purchase of land for a cemetery. Two acres were purchased for US$3,000 and US$1,734 worth of improvements were done in July 1852. The 750 individuals were interred in 1853.', 'Los Pinos (English: The Pines) was the official residence and office of the President of Mexico from 1934 to 2018. Located in the Bosque de Chapultepec (Chapultepec Forest) in central Mexico City, it became the presidential seat in 1934, when Gen. L√°zaro C√°rdenas became the first president to live there. The term Los Pinos became a metonym for the Presidency of Mexico.Since December 2018, the former presidential complex has operated as a cultural space.After the Spanish Conquest, around 1550 a trapiche (mill) was built in Chapultepec, where wheat and maize were processed into flour. This mill became so important that it was later called el Molino del Rey ("The King\'s Mill").', 'The Battle of Chapultepec was a battle between American forces and Mexican forces holding the strategically located Chapultepec Castle just outside Mexico City, fought 13 September 1847 during the Mexican‚ÄìAmerican War. The building, sitting atop a 200-foot (61 m) hill, was an important position for the defense of the city.', 'The museum Papalote Museo del Ni√±o is located in Mexico City Bosques de Chapultepec. The museum is focused in learning, communication and working together through interactive expositions of science, technology and art for children.This museum was created in 1993 by the architect Ricardo Legorreta. He designed the building with geometric figures and traditional Mexican tiles. The building was made for kids to interact, experiment and touch. The ceiling and walls were made by children.', 'The Museo de Arte Moderno (Museum of Modern Art) is located in Chapultepec park, Mexico City, Mexico.The museum is part of the Instituto Nacional de Bellas Artes y Literatura and provides exhibitions of national and international contemporary artists. The museum also hosts a permanent collection of art from Remedios Varo, Gelsen Gas, Frida Kahlo, Olga Costa, Diego Rivera, David Alfaro Siqueiros, Jos√© Clemente Orozco, Manuel √Ålvarez Bravo, Leonora Carrington, Rufino Tamayo, Juan Soriano, and Vicente Rojo Almaz√°n.In 1971 the posthumous retrospective exhibition of Varo drew the largest audiences in its history - larger than those for Rivera and Orozco.', 'Chapultepec Castle (Spanish: Castillo de Chapultepec) is located on top of Chapultepec Hill in Mexico City\'s Chapultepec park. The name Chapultepec is the Nahuatl word chapoltepƒìc which means "hill of the grasshopper". The castle has such unparalleled views and terraces that explorer James F. Elton wrote they ‚Äúcan\'t be surpassed in beauty in any part of the world." It is located at the entrance to Chapultepec Park at a height of 2,325 meters above sea level. The site of the hill was a sacred place for Aztecs, and the buildings atop it have served several purposes during its history, including that of Military Academy, Imperial residence, Presidential residence, observatory, and since the 1940s, the National Museum of History. Chapultepec Castle, along with Iturbide Palace, also in Mexico City, are the only royal palaces in North America.', 'The National Museum of History (Spanish: Museo Nacional de Historia), also known as MNH, is a national museum of Mexico, located inside Chapultepec Castle in Mexico City. The Castle itself is found within the first section of the well known Chapultepec Park. The museum received 2,135,465 visitors in 2017.The museum hosts twelve showrooms that house objects from various stages in Mexican history, including the foundation of the Spanish Empire (known in Mexico as ‚ÄúThe Conquest‚Äù), the New Spain and the Viceregal era (known in Mexico as ‚ÄúThe Colonial epoch‚Äù), the Mexican War of Independence, the Liberal Reform, and the Revolution of 1910.', 'The Museo del Caracol (lit. Snail Museum) is a Mexican history museum, at the bottom of the access ramp to the Castillo de Chapultepec in Mexico City. The ‚ÄúSnail Museum‚Äù is a spiral shaped building designed by the architect Pedro Ramirez Vazquez. The director is Patricia Torres Aguilar Ugarte. It is opens from Tuesday to Thursday from 9:00 to 16:45.Each of the exhibition halls are found around a central tower.One of the most important pieces of the museum is the bronze handrail of the main stairs. It was made by the muralist Jos√© Ch√°vez Morado and represents the fusion of two cultures (European and indigenous).', 'The National Museum of History (Spanish: Museo Nacional de Historia), also known as MNH, is a national museum of Mexico, located inside Chapultepec Castle in Mexico City. The Castle itself is found within the first section of the well known Chapultepec Park. The museum received 2,135,465 visitors in 2017.The museum hosts twelve showrooms that house objects from various stages in Mexican history, including the foundation of the Spanish Empire (known in Mexico as ‚ÄúThe Conquest‚Äù), the New Spain and the Viceregal era (known in Mexico as ‚ÄúThe Colonial epoch‚Äù), the Mexican War of Independence, the Liberal Reform, and the Revolution of 1910.', 'The Monumento a los Ni√±os H√©roes ("Monument to the Boy Heroes"), officially Altar a la Patria ("Altar to the Homeland"), is a monument commemorating the Ni√±os H√©roes, installed in Chapultepec, Mexico City, Mexico.', "Luis Barrag√°n House and Studio, also known as Casa Luis Barrag√°n, is the former residence of architect Luis Barrag√°n in Miguel Hidalgo district, Mexico City. It is owned by the Fundaci√≥n de Arquitectura Tapat√≠a and the Government of the State of Jalisco. It is now a museum exhibiting Barrag√°n's work and is also used by visiting architects. It retains the original furniture and Barrag√°n's personal objects. These include a mostly Mexican art collection spanning the 16th to 20th century, with works by Picasso, Diego Rivera, Jos√© Clemente Orozco, Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and Miguel Covarrubias.", "Luis Barrag√°n House and Studio, also known as Casa Luis Barrag√°n, is the former residence of architect Luis Barrag√°n in Miguel Hidalgo district, Mexico City. It is owned by the Fundaci√≥n de Arquitectura Tapat√≠a and the Government of the State of Jalisco. It is now a museum exhibiting Barrag√°n's work and is also used by visiting architects. It retains the original furniture and Barrag√°n's personal objects. These include a mostly Mexican art collection spanning the 16th to 20th century, with works by Picasso, Diego Rivera, Jos√© Clemente Orozco, Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and Miguel Covarrubias.", "The Estela de Luz (Stele of Light) is a monument in Mexico City built in 2011 to commemorate the bicentenary of Mexico's independence from Spanish rule. Its design was the winning entry in an invited competition to seek the best combination of Mexico's past and future; the design uses quartz and electric lighting to achieve this effect. The Estela de Luz is mainly used for cultural events.The monument is popularly known as the Suavicrema (a brand of ice cream wafer) due to the resemblance on its shape to said wafer.", 'El Museo de Geolog√≠a de la UNAM, ubicado en la Colonia Santa Mar√≠a la Ribera de la Ciudad de M√©xico, es un recinto destinado a albergar las colecciones geol√≥gicas m√°s importantes de M√©xico, es sede de casi todas las sociedades cient√≠ficas relacionadas con la Geolog√≠a en el pa√≠s, as√≠ como un sitio de divulgaci√≥n del conocimiento sobre las ciencias de la Tierra.[1] El Instituto de Geolog√≠a de la UNAM es la instituci√≥n que se encarga de resguardarlo.', 'The Huntress Diana Fountain (Fuente de la Diana Cazadora) is a monumental fountain of Diana located in the roundabout at Paseo de la Reforma and R√≠o Misisip√≠ and Sevilla streets, on the border of the Colonia Cuauht√©moc and Colonia Ju√°rez neighborhoods of Mexico City. Nearby landmarks named after the fountain include the Cine Diana and the skyscrapers Corporativo Reforma Diana (a.k.a. Torre Reforma Diana) and Torre Diana.', 'The Angel of Independence, most commonly known by the shortened name El √Ångel and officially known as Monumento a la Independencia ("Monument to Independence"), is a victory column on a roundabout on the major thoroughfare of Paseo de la Reforma in downtown Mexico City.', 'The Angel of Independence, most commonly known by the shortened name El √Ångel and officially known as Monumento a la Independencia ("Monument to Independence"), is a victory column on a roundabout on the major thoroughfare of Paseo de la Reforma in downtown Mexico City.', 'El Museo Casa Carranza se encuentra localizado en la Colonia Cuauht√©moc de la Ciudad de M√©xico, M√©xico. El museo lleva el nombre del presidente Venustiano Carranza que la habit√≥ los √∫ltimos seis meses de su vida[2]y narra la historia de la Revoluci√≥n mexicana enfoc√°ndose a la parte relacionada con Carranza,[3] las causas del enfrentamiento de este con √Ålvaro Obreg√≥n y la traici√≥n de Victoriano Huerta.', 'Parque Lira is a public park in the Tacubaya district of Mexico City, once a separate town from Mexico City. It is located on the 18th century estate of Vicente Lira. It is entered by a monumental archway designed by Italian architect Francesco Saverio Cavallari, an Italian architect who was active in Mexico 1857-1864.', 'The Museo Universitario del Chopo (meaning, "poplar"; locally nicknamed Crystal Palace or simply El Chopo, in Spanish) (Chopo University Museum) is located at Doctor Enrique Gonz√°lez Mart√≠nez Street in the Colonia Santa Mar√≠a la Ribera of Mexico City. It has collections in contemporary art, and is part of the National Autonomous University of Mexico (UNAM).The building is located at #10 Doctor Enrique Gonz√°lez Mart√≠nez Street in the Colonia Santa Mar√≠a la Ribera, a neighborhood of Mexico City. The streets of Colonia Santa Mar√≠a la Ribera were originally named after trees and flowers. Fittingly, Doctor Enrique Gonz√°lez Mart√≠nez Street was previously named Poplar ("chopo") Street.']

column5: ['Cebeci ƒ∞n√∂n√º Stadium', 'Ulucanlar Prison Museum', 'Mehmet Akif Ersoy Evi ve M√ºzesi', 'Hacettepe Art Museum', 'Private archeology museum and music venue', 'Abdi ƒ∞pek√ßi Park', 'Museum of Anatolian Civilizations', 'Eller', 'Human Rights Monument', 'Ta≈üankara', 'Hittite Sun Course Monument', 'Statue of Peace', 'Marshal Atat√ºrk Monument', 'State Art and Sculpture Museum', 'Ethnography Museum of Ankara', 'G√ºvenpark', 'G√ºvenpark Monument', 'Ankara Opera House', 'Stamp Museum', 'Meclis Park', 'Ankara Vakƒ±f Museum', 'Ziraat Bank Museum', 'Ziraat Bank Museum', 'Su Perileri', 'Victory Monument', 'Kuƒüulu Park', 'ƒ∞≈übank Museum (Ankara)', 'War of Independence Museum', 'Gen√ßlik Parkƒ±', 'Gen√ßlik Parkƒ±', 'Republic Museum', 'TCDD Open Air Steam Locomotive Museum', "Atat√ºrk's Residence and Railway Museum", 'The Heritage', 'Ankara 19 Mayƒ±s Stadium', 'Pembe K√∂≈ük', 'Pembe K√∂≈ük', 'Anƒ±tkabir', 'Atat√ºrk ve Kurtulu≈ü Sava≈üƒ± M√ºzesi', 'Fighting Turks in the Korean War Monument', 'Anƒ±tkabir', 'MKE Sanayi ve Teknoloji M√ºzesi', 'Feza G√ºrsey Science Center', 'Ankara Botanic Park', 'Cinemaximum Ankamall', 'IMAX Ankamall', 'Battle of Ankara', 'Turkish State Cemetery', 'Turkish State Cemetery', 'G√∂k√ßek Park']
column6: ['Cebeci ƒ∞n√∂n√º Stadium (Turkish: Cebeci ƒ∞n√∂n√º Stadƒ±) is a multi-purpose stadium in Ankara, Turkey. It is currently used mostly for football matches and was the home stadium of Hacettepespor. The stadium holds 15,000 people and was built in 1967. It was named after the Turkish statesman ƒ∞smet ƒ∞n√∂n√º.Venue information', 'The Ulucanlar Prison Museum (Turkish: Ulucanlar Cezaevi M√ºzesi) is a former state prison in Ankara, Turkey that was converted into a prison museum following restoration by Altƒ±ndaƒü Municipality. The museum was opened in 2011. It is the first museum of its kind in Turkey.Ulucanlar Prison was established in 1925 in the Ulucanlar neighborhood of Altƒ±ndaƒü district in Ankara, which had recently become the new capital of the Turkish Republic.', "Mehmet √Çkif Ersoy M√ºze Evi, Ankara'nƒ±n Altƒ±ndaƒü il√ßesinde bulunmaktadƒ±r. Mehmet √Çkif Ersoy'un T√ºrk Kurtulu≈ü Sava≈üƒ± yƒ±llarƒ±nda Ankara'da ikamet ettiƒüi ve ƒ∞stikl√¢l Mar≈üƒ± ba≈üta olmak √ºzere √ßok sayƒ±da ≈üiirini yazdƒ±ƒüƒ± m√ºzeye d√∂n√º≈üt√ºr√ºlm√º≈ü Ankara evidir. Hacettepe √úniversitesi Merkez Kamp√ºs√ºn√ºn sƒ±nƒ±rlarƒ± i√ßinde yer alƒ±r.Vaktiyle Taceddin Derg√¢hƒ± olan iki katlƒ± ah≈üap yapƒ±, Taceddin ≈ûeyhi tarafƒ±ndan sava≈ü yƒ±llarƒ±nda Mehmet √Çkif'e tahsis edilmi≈üti. Yapƒ± 1949'da ≈üehir meclisi kararƒ± ile m√ºze-eve d√∂n√º≈üt√ºr√ºld√º ancak uzun yƒ±llar harap durumda kaldƒ±. 1982 yƒ±lƒ±nda yeniden onarƒ±ldƒ± ve 1984'te ziyarete a√ßƒ±ldƒ±.", "Hacettepe Sanat M√ºzesi; Ankara'nƒ±n √áankaya il√ßesinde bulunan, Hacettepe √úniversitesi'ne baƒülƒ± bir m√ºzedir. 4 Ekim 2005 tarihinde kurulan m√ºzede, ba≈üta Burhan Doƒüan√ßay olmak √ºzere; √ºlke ve d√ºnya √ßapƒ±nda isim yapmƒ±≈ü bir√ßok √∂nemli sanat√ßƒ±dan eserler bulunmaktadƒ±r. ≈ûeref Akdik, Hikmet Onat, Feyhaman Duran, Avni Arba≈ü, Nevzat Akoral, Nuri Aba√ß, Fikret Otyam ve Hayati Misman gibi usta sanat√ßƒ±lardan √ßalƒ±≈ümalarƒ± b√ºnyesinde barƒ±ndƒ±ran m√ºze 2015 yƒ±lƒ±nda onarƒ±ma alƒ±nmƒ±≈ü ve iki yƒ±l ziyarete kapalƒ± kaldƒ±ktan sonra 17 Ekim 2017 tarihinde, Hacettepe √úniversitesi'nin 50. kurulu≈ü yƒ±ld√∂n√ºm√ºnde tekrar a√ßƒ±lmƒ±≈ütƒ±r.", 'Erimtan Archaeology and Arts Museum (Turkish: Erimtan Arkeoloji ve Sanat M√ºzesi) is an archaeology museum and music venue in Ankara, Turkey.The museum is located at G√∂zc√º St. 10 in Kale neighborhood of Altƒ±ndaƒü il√ße (district) in Ankara, close to the Ankara Castle at 39¬∞56‚Ä≤17‚Ä≥N 32¬∞51‚Ä≤47‚Ä≥E. It is between Museum of Anatolian Civilizations and √áengelhan Rahmi M. Ko√ß Museum.', "Abdi ƒ∞pek√ßi Park is an urban park in Ankara's Sƒ±hhiye neighborhood. It was established in 1981 in honor of the assassinated Milliyet journalist Abdi ƒ∞pek√ßi. Covering an area of 36,800 m2 (396,000 sq ft), the park has the usual geographic features and incorporates a sculpture featuring a hand opened towards the sky.", "The Museum of Anatolian Civilizations (Turkish: Anadolu Medeniyetleri M√ºzesi) is located on the south side of Ankara Castle in the Atpazarƒ± area in Ankara, Turkey. It consists of the old Ottoman Mahmut Pa≈üa bazaar storage building, and the Kur≈üunlu Han. Because of Atat√ºrk's desire to establish a Hittite museum, the buildings were bought upon the suggestion of Hamit Z√ºbeyir Ko≈üay, who was then Culture Minister, to the National Education Minister, Saffet Arƒ±kan. After the remodelling and repairs were completed (1938‚Äì1968), the building was opened to the public as the Ankara Archaeological Museum.", 'Eller; T√ºrk heykeltƒ±ra≈ü Metin Yurdanur tarafƒ±ndan yapƒ±lmƒ±≈ü olan bir heykeldir. 1970\'li yƒ±llarƒ±n sonuna doƒüru d√∂nemin Ankara Belediye Ba≈ükanƒ± Ali Din√ßer tarafƒ±ndan ba≈ülatƒ±lan kamusal alanda serbest heykel uygulamalarƒ±nƒ±n bir par√ßasƒ± olarak 1979\'da yapƒ±lan heykel, Abdi ƒ∞pek√ßi Parkƒ±\'nda bulunur. Sanat√ßƒ±, "Ellerin, beynin ve g√∂z√ºn bir par√ßasƒ± olduƒüunu d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorum." diyerek bu eserinde √ßalƒ±≈üan, √ºreten ve yaratan elleri betimlediƒüini vurgulamƒ±≈ütƒ±r.Ankara\'daki anƒ±tlar ve heykeller listesi Miras (heykel)Sanat√ßƒ±nƒ±n kendi sitesinde Eller Ko√ß √úniversitesi Digital Collections\'da Eller', "The Human Rights Monument or Human Rights Sculpture is a monument in Turkey's capital, Ankara.The monument was made by sculptor Metin Yurdanur in 1990 out of bronze. The monument which depicts a woman reading the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, has been the assembly point of many protests. The monument can be found at the intersection of Konur street and Y√ºksel street and its latest restoration was in 2010.", "Ta≈üAnkara, Danimarkalƒ± heykeltƒ±ra≈ü J√∏rgen Haugen S√∏rensen tarafƒ±ndan 1992 yƒ±lƒ±nda yapƒ±lan ve Ankara , √áankaya il√ßesi Sakarya caddesi yaya b√∂lgesine konan heykel.Sorensen bu heykelin yapƒ±mƒ± i√ßin Ankara'da olu≈üturduƒüu at√∂lyede √ßalƒ±≈ümƒ±≈ütƒ±r. Heykelin boyutlarƒ± 130x195x410 cm'dir.Ankara Ba≈ükentin Tarihi, Arkeolojisi ve Mimarisi - ISBN 975-95848-3-2 - Ankara Enstit√ºs√º Vakfƒ± Yayƒ±nlarƒ± - Sayfa:269", 'The Hittite Sun Disc Monument (Turkish: Hitit G√ºne≈ü Kursu Anƒ±tƒ±) is a memorial dedicated to Hittites created by sculptor Nusret Suman, and placed in the Sƒ±hhiye Square in 1978.', 'Barƒ±≈ü Heykeli, heykeltƒ±ra≈ü Burhan Alkar tarafƒ±ndan ta≈ütan yapƒ±lan 1979 yƒ±lƒ±nda Ankara, √áankaya il√ßesi Sakarya Caddesi yaya b√∂lgesine konan heykel.Gen√ß bir kƒ±z ile erkeƒüin birlikte u√ßurduklarƒ± g√ºvercin √∂zg√ºrl√ºk ve barƒ±≈üƒ± simgelemektedir.Ankara Ba≈ükentin Tarihi, Arkeolojisi ve Mimarisi - ISBN 975-95848-3-2 - Ankara Enstit√ºs√º Vakfƒ± Yayƒ±nlarƒ± - Sayfa:269', "Mare≈üal Atat√ºrk Anƒ±tƒ±, Ankara'da Etnografya M√ºzesi Atat√ºrk Anƒ±tƒ±‚Äôndan sonra ikinci Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk anƒ±tƒ± projesidir. Ankara‚Äônƒ±n kent merkezi Ulus ile √áankaya‚Äôyƒ± baƒülayan hatta yer alan Sƒ±hhiye‚Äôde Zafer Meydanƒ±'na yerle≈ütirilmi≈ütir. ƒ∞talyan heykeltƒ±ra≈ü Pietro Canonica tarafƒ±ndan yapƒ±lan anƒ±t, 04 Kasƒ±m 1927 tarihinde a√ßƒ±lmƒ±≈ütƒ±r.Sƒ±hhiye'deki Atat√ºrk Anƒ±tƒ±, Petersburg‚Äôda √áar II. T√ºrkiye Cumhuriyeti‚Äônin d√∂rd√ºnc√º anƒ±tƒ± olan anƒ±tƒ±n a√ßƒ±lƒ±≈üƒ±nƒ± Ba≈üvekil ƒ∞smet ƒ∞n√∂n√º yapmƒ±≈ütƒ±r.", 'The State Art and Sculpture Museum (Turkish: Resim ve Heykel M√ºzesi) is a museum dedicated to fine arts and sculpture in Ankara, Turkey. It was designed in 1927 by architect Arif Hikmet Koyunoƒülu and built between 1927 and 1930 as the T√ºrkocaƒüƒ± Building, upon the direction of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, the founder and first President of Turkey. It is located close to the Ethnography Museum and houses a rich collection of Turkish art from the late 19th century to the present day. There are also galleries for guest exhibitions.', 'The Ethnography Museum of Ankara is dedicated to the cultures of Turkic civilizations. The building was designed by architect Arif Hikmet Koyunoƒülu and was built between 1925 and 1928. The museum temporarily hosted the sarcophagus of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk from 1938 to 1953, during the period of the construction of Anƒ±tkabir, his final resting place.', 'G√ºvenpark or G√ºven Park (literally: Trust Park), is an urban public park located adjacent to the Liberty Square in the Kƒ±zƒ±lay neighborhood of Ankara in Turkey. Established in the 1930s as part of the green belts proposed in the urban plan of the rapid growing capital, the park is noted for its "G√ºven Monument". In mid March 2016, a bomb explosion close to it caused the death of more than 30 people while over 100 were injured.', "G√ºvenpark Anƒ±tƒ± (G√ºvenlik Anƒ±tƒ± - Emniyet Abidesi), Ankara Kƒ±zƒ±lay Meydanƒ±'nda G√ºvenpark i√ßerisinde bulunan ve T√ºrk ulusunun polis ve jandarmaya olan g√ºvenini, Atat√ºrk'√ºn Kurtulu≈ü Sava≈üƒ±'nda ve inkƒ±lap hareketlerinde beraber bulunduƒüu arkada≈ülarƒ±nƒ± temsil eden heykeller ve insan zekasƒ±nƒ±, √ßift√ßinin tarƒ±m √ßalƒ±≈ümalarƒ±nƒ± betimleyen kabartmalarƒ±n yer aldƒ±ƒüƒ± anƒ±ttƒ±r.", 'Ankara Opera House (Turkish: Opera Sahnesi) of the Turkish State Opera and Ballet is the largest of the three venues for opera and ballet in Ankara, Turkey, the other two being Leyla Gencer Sahnesi in Ostim and Operet Sahnesi (Operetta Theater) in Sƒ±hhiye.The building was originally designed by the Turkish architect ≈ûevki Balmumcu as an exhibition center, who came first in an international competition for the project in 1933. It was later converted into an opera house by the German architect Paul Bonatz, and started serving this function on April 2, 1948.', 'Stamp Museum (Turkish: Pul M√ºzesi) is a museum in Ankara, Turkey.The museum is in Ulus neighborhood of Ankara at 39¬∞56‚Ä≤18‚Ä≥N 32¬∞51‚Ä≤15‚Ä≥E. The museum building was the headquarters of a former bank named Emlak ve Eytam Bank. It was planned by Clemens Holzmeister, the renown Austrian architect and was built in 1933-34 term. It is a five floor building with a total area of 6,500 square metres (70,000 sq ft). After the bank was merged to another bank in 1946 the building was handed over to Turkish PTT. In 2013 after renovation the building was opened to public as a stamp museum.', "Meclis Parkƒ±; Ankara'nƒ±n √áankaya il√ßesinde bulunan bir ≈üehir parkƒ±dƒ±r. Resmi adƒ± Milli Egemenlik Parkƒ± olsa da, T√ºrkiye B√ºy√ºk Millet Meclisi arazisinin etrafƒ±nƒ± √ßevrelemesinden dolayƒ± yaygƒ±n olarak bu ≈üekilde anƒ±lmaktadƒ±r. Genellikle paten ve kaykay sporuyla ilgilenenler tarafƒ±ndan kullanƒ±lan parkƒ±n i√ßinde bir adet s√ºs havuzu, bir tane amfitiyatro ve √ßok sayƒ±da anƒ±t-heykel yer almaktadƒ±r.", 'Vakƒ±f Museum (Turkish: Ankara Vakƒ±f Eserleri M√ºzesi) is an ethnography museum in Ankara, Turkey exhibiting endowed articles.', "T.C Ziraat Bankasƒ± M√ºzesi, Ankara'nƒ±n Ulus semtinde il√ßesinde 1981 yƒ±lƒ±ndan bu yana hizmet veren veren, T√ºrkiye'deki bankacƒ±lƒ±k sisteminin geli≈üimini g√∂steren tarihi objelerin sergilendiƒüi m√ºzedir.", "T.C Ziraat Bankasƒ± M√ºzesi, Ankara'nƒ±n Ulus semtinde il√ßesinde 1981 yƒ±lƒ±ndan bu yana hizmet veren veren, T√ºrkiye'deki bankacƒ±lƒ±k sisteminin geli≈üimini g√∂steren tarihi objelerin sergilendiƒüi m√ºzedir.", "Su Perileri, cumhuriyetin ilk yƒ±llarƒ±nda Fransa'dan Ankara'ya getirilmi≈ü olan ve g√ºn√ºm√ºzde Cer Modern'in √∂n√ºnde sergilenen bronz heykeldir.1924 yƒ±lƒ±nda ≈ûehremini Asaf Bey tarafƒ±ndan Fransa'dan getirtildi ve Hacettepe Parkƒ±'na yerle≈ütirildi. Kentin simgesel eserlerinden biri olarak heykel, ≈üehir geli≈ütik√ße Kƒ±zƒ±lay Meydanƒ±, Evkaf Oteli kar≈üƒ±sƒ±nda ≈üimdiki Gen√ßlik Parkƒ±'nƒ±n olduƒüu √ßukurluƒüa, sonra tekrar Hacettepe Parkƒ±'na, son olarak 1960'larda Tandoƒüan Meydanƒ±'na yerle≈ütirilldi. Riyaset-i Cumhur Senfoni Orkestrasƒ±'nƒ±n ilk konserlerini bu heykelin √ßevresinde verdiƒüine ve ilk cumhurba≈ükanƒ± Atat√ºrk'√ºn bu anƒ±tƒ±n √ßevresinde konser dinlediƒüine ili≈ükin bilgiler vardƒ±r.", 'Victory Monument (Turkish: Zafer Anƒ±tƒ± also known as Ulus Atat√ºrk Anƒ±tƒ±) is a monument in Ankara, Turkey.The monument is in the Ulus Square which was the main square in Ankara before the 1950s. It is situated to the east of Atat√ºrk Boulevard.The monument was a result of a nationwide fund drive organized by the journalist Yunus Nadi. After an international competition, the project of Heinrich Krippel from Austria was rewarded. The monument was inaugurated on 24 November 1927. It was restored in 2002.', "Kuƒüulu Park (Swan Park) is a 1 ha (2.5 acres) public park in the √áankaya neighborhood of Ankara, Turkey. The park is known for its swans (a symbol of Ankara), but also has ducks and geese. Its pond was renovated in 2012.In June 2013 Kuƒüulu's waterfowl (35 birds) were evacuated temporarily to protect them from tear gas exposure during the 2013 Turkish protests. The park was a major meeting point for protestors, and saw a Taksim Gezi Park-style encampment.The City of Vienna gave the park a gift of swans.", 'ƒ∞≈übank Museum is a museum in Ankara, Turkey. The official name of the museum is "Economic Independence Museum" (T√ºrkiye ƒ∞≈ü Bankasƒ± ƒ∞ktisadi Baƒüƒ±msƒ±zlƒ±k M√ºzesi) This is the second museum of the bank the first being the ƒ∞≈übank Museum in ƒ∞stanbul. The museum is in Ulus Square facing the Victory Monument at 39¬∞56‚Ä≤34‚Ä≥N 32¬∞51‚Ä≤17‚Ä≥E.', 'The War of Independence Museum (Kurtulu≈ü Sava≈üƒ± M√ºzesi), housed in the first Turkish Grand National Assembly building in the Ulus district of Ankara, Turkey, displays important photographs, documents and furniture from the Turkish War of Independence.The one-storey andesite (Ankara stone) building was designed by architect Salim Bey, at the request of Enver Pasha, as the headquarters of the Committee of Union and Progress. Construction began in 1915, under the supervision of Turkish Army Corps architect Hasip Bey. Before the building was finished, the Turkish Grand National Assembly decided use it, and its completion had to be hurried for the inaugural meeting.', 'Gen√ßlik Parkƒ± (literally Youth Park) is a public park in Ankara, Turkey.The 27.5 ha (68 acres) park is almost at the center of Ankara. Its altitude is about 850 m (2,790 ft), which makes it one of the lowest points in Ankara. It is surrounded by Ulus Square to the north, the Ankara Opera House (formerly Ankara Exhibition Building) to the east, Selim Sƒ±rrƒ± Tarcan Sport Hall and Ankara Central Station to the south and, 19 Mayƒ±s Stadium to the west.', 'Gen√ßlik Parkƒ± (literally Youth Park) is a public park in Ankara, Turkey.The 27.5 ha (68 acres) park is almost at the center of Ankara. Its altitude is about 850 m (2,790 ft), which makes it one of the lowest points in Ankara. It is surrounded by Ulus Square to the north, the Ankara Opera House (formerly Ankara Exhibition Building) to the east, Selim Sƒ±rrƒ± Tarcan Sport Hall and Ankara Central Station to the south and, 19 Mayƒ±s Stadium to the west.', 'Republic Museum (also known as "Second parliament Building of Turkey", Turkish: Cumhuriyet M√ºzesi) is a museum in Ankara, Turkey, which was the Turkish Parliament building from 1924‚Äì1960.The museum is in the Ulus neighborhood of Ankara, on Cumhuriyet Boulevard. The War of Independence Museum, another museum which served as the Turkish Parliament (from 1920‚Äì1924) is to the northeast of the Republic Museum.', "The TCDD Open Air Steam Locomotive Museum (Turkish: TCDD A√ßƒ±k Hava Buharlƒ± Lokomotif M√ºzesi) is a railroad museum in Ankara, Turkey, which focuses on the history of steam locomotives that operated on the Turkish State Railways. The museum was originally located in a park adjacent to Ankara Central Station, and when the property was needed for the station's enlargement project in 2014, the museum was moved to the current location near Wonderland Eurasia. The museum is owned and operated by the Turkish State Railways (TCDD), who also manages the Ankara Railway History Museum, as well as Atat√ºrk's Car and Railway Art Museum.Exhibits on display:", "Atat√ºrk's Residence and Railway Museum (Turkish: Atat√ºrk Konutu ve Demiryollarƒ± M√ºzesi) is a national historic house and railway museum in Ankara, Turkey. It was originally the management building of the Turkish State Railways. Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk used it as a residence and headquarters during the Turkish War of Independence.", 'Miras, is a sculpture by Turkish sculptor Metin Yurdanur. It is famous for being the first civilian sculpture in Ankara. The work describes Nasreddin Hodja on a Hittite Chimera.In 1979, the Ankara Metropolitan Municipality had initiated "the project of equipping the city with plastic elements" and ordered a series of sculptures to decorate different parts of Ankara. Created by several sculptors, including Yurdanur, these works were delivered to the municipality in the same year. Within the scope of this project, the artist\'s "Heritage" was placed in the garden of Ankara Train Station, "Eller" was placed in Abdi ƒ∞pek√ßi Park and "Solidarity" was placed in a square in Batƒ±kent.', "The Ankara 19 Mayƒ±s Stadium (Turkish: Ankara 19 Mayƒ±s Stadyumu) was the home venue of Ankara's Gen√ßlerbirliƒüi. It was built in 1930 and is part of the 19 Mayƒ±s Sports Complex, which is located in the Ulus district. The stadium had a capacity of 19,209 (all-seater). Ankaraspor also used the stadium until they moved to their new venue in the Yenikent district.The stadium was named after the date May 19, 1919, when Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk arrived at Samsun to start the Turkish War of Independence. Official ceremonies to celebrate the May 19th Youth and Sports Day were also held at the stadium.", "Pembe K√∂≈ük (Pink Villa) is an Ottoman-era house in the √áankaya district of Ankara, Turkey, which is the city's oldest villa and was the home of Turkish President ƒ∞smet ƒ∞n√∂n√º from 1925 to 1973.ƒ∞n√∂n√º purchased the villa in 1924 and it was used for strategic meetings by Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, as well as concerts, gallery openings, pool and chess tournaments and the city's first ball, on February 22, 1927.The building now houses a museum of ƒ∞n√∂n√º's personal belongings and diplomatic photographs which is occasionally opened to the public.", "Pembe K√∂≈ük (Pink Villa) is an Ottoman-era house in the √áankaya district of Ankara, Turkey, which is the city's oldest villa and was the home of Turkish President ƒ∞smet ƒ∞n√∂n√º from 1925 to 1973.ƒ∞n√∂n√º purchased the villa in 1924 and it was used for strategic meetings by Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, as well as concerts, gallery openings, pool and chess tournaments and the city's first ball, on February 22, 1927.The building now houses a museum of ƒ∞n√∂n√º's personal belongings and diplomatic photographs which is occasionally opened to the public.", 'Anƒ±tkabir (literally, "memorial tomb") is the mausoleum of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, the leader of the Turkish War of Independence and the founder and first President of the Republic of Turkey. It is located in Ankara and was designed by architects Professor Emin Onat and Assistant Professor Ahmet Orhan Arda, whose proposal beat 48 other entries from several countries in a competition held by the Turkish Government in 1941 for a "monument" for Atat√ºrk.The site is also the final resting place of ƒ∞smet ƒ∞n√∂n√º, the second President of Turkey, who was interred there after he died in 1973. His tomb faces the Atat√ºrk Mausoleum, on the opposite side of the Ceremonial Ground.', "Atat√ºrk ve Kurtulu≈ü Sava≈üƒ± M√ºzesi, Anƒ±tkabir'de Atat√ºrk'√ºn mozolesinin bulunduƒüu ≈ûeref Salonu'nun altƒ±ndaki 3 bin metrekarelik s√ºtunlu alanda bulunan 21 Haziran 1960'ta ziyarete a√ßƒ±lmƒ±≈ü m√ºze.", "Korede Sava≈üan T√ºrkler Anƒ±tƒ±, Ankara'da Kore Sava≈üƒ± sƒ±rasƒ±nda hayatƒ±nƒ± kaybetmi≈ü olan T√ºrk askerlerinin anƒ±sƒ±na yapƒ±lmƒ±≈ü olan, 1973 yƒ±lƒ±nda a√ßƒ±lan anƒ±t. Anƒ±t 2010 yƒ±lƒ±nda yenilenmi≈ütir.Ankara Parkƒ±Wikimedia Commons'ta Kore'de Sava≈üan T√ºrkler Anƒ±tƒ± ile ilgili √ßoklu ortam belgeleri bulunur.", 'Anƒ±tkabir (literally, "memorial tomb") is the mausoleum of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, the leader of the Turkish War of Independence and the founder and first President of the Republic of Turkey. It is located in Ankara and was designed by architects Professor Emin Onat and Assistant Professor Ahmet Orhan Arda, whose proposal beat 48 other entries from several countries in a competition held by the Turkish Government in 1941 for a "monument" for Atat√ºrk.The site is also the final resting place of ƒ∞smet ƒ∞n√∂n√º, the second President of Turkey, who was interred there after he died in 1973. His tomb faces the Atat√ºrk Mausoleum, on the opposite side of the Ceremonial Ground.', "MKE Sanayi ve Teknoloji M√ºzesi; Ankara'nƒ±n Yenimahalle il√ßesine baƒülƒ± Emniyet Mahallesinde yer alan bir m√ºzedir. 22 Mayƒ±s 2013 tarihinde, Makina ve Kimya End√ºstrisi Kurumu'na baƒülƒ± olarak kurulmu≈ütur. M√ºzede, sayƒ±larƒ± 1000'i a≈üan, T√ºrk silah ve savunma end√ºstrisinin geli≈üim a≈üamalarƒ±nƒ± g√∂zler √∂n√ºne seren belgeler ve materyaller ile bir√ßoƒüu Kurtulu≈ü Sava≈üƒ± sƒ±rasƒ±nda da kullanƒ±lmƒ±≈ü olan Osmanlƒ± yapƒ±mƒ± silahlar, √ºretim tezgahlarƒ±, MKE'nin geli≈ütirip √ºrettiƒüi askeri ara√ß-gere√ßler sergilenmektedir. Ayrƒ±ca, √ºlke sanayisinin geli≈üimine katkƒ±da bulunan ve y√∂n veren ki≈üilere ait e≈üyalar, onlarƒ±n portreleri ve m√ºhendislikle alakalƒ± objeler de g√∂sterime sunulanlar arasƒ±ndadƒ±r. M√ºze 3 boyutlu olarak gezilebilmektedir.", "Feza G√ºrsey Science Center (Turkish: Feza G√ºrsey Bilim Merkezi, FGBM) is a science museum in Ankara, Turkey. It is named after Feza G√ºrsey (1921 - 1992), the renowned Turkish mathematician and physicist.The center was founded by the Metropolitan municipality of Ankara. It was opened on 27 August 1999 as Migros Shopping Centre.Official site Mobilworx - The on-site shop', 'The Battle of Ankara or Angora was fought on 20 July 1402 at the √áubuk plain near Ankara, between the forces of the Ottoman Sultan Bayezid I and the Emir of the Timurid Empire, Timur. The battle was a major victory for Timur, and it led to the Ottoman Interregnum.', 'The Turkish State Cemetery (Turkish: Devlet Mezarlƒ±ƒüƒ±) is a national and military cemetery in Ankara, Turkey, containing the graves of the presidents of Turkey and the high-ranked, close companions-in-arms of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, the founder of the Republic of Turkey, in the Turkish War of Independence.The cemetery was established upon an act dated November 10, 1981. It is situated around the "Karadeniz Havuzu" (Black Sea Pool) on the grounds of the historical "Atat√ºrk Orman √áiftliƒüi" (Atat√ºrk Forest Ranch) in Ankara. The architect √ñzg√ºr Ecevit and the agronomist Ekrem G√ºrenli, who won the contest organized by the Ministry of National Defense in 1982, designed the state cemetery.', 'The Turkish State Cemetery (Turkish: Devlet Mezarlƒ±ƒüƒ±) is a national and military cemetery in Ankara, Turkey, containing the graves of the presidents of Turkey and the high-ranked, close companions-in-arms of Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, the founder of the Republic of Turkey, in the Turkish War of Independence.The cemetery was established upon an act dated November 10, 1981. G√∂k√ßek Park is in Ke√ßi√∂ren which is district of Ankara. The park area is about 5.4 ha (13 acres). It is named after Melih G√∂k√ßek, the mayor of Ankara Metropolitan Municipality.']

column6: ['The Cathedral Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption (Spanish: Catedral Bas√≠lica de Nuestra Se√±ora de la Asunci√≥n), also called Santiago de Cuba Cathedral, is a Roman Catholic cathedral and minor basilica in Santiago de Cuba, in eastern Cuba. The cathedral fronts onto C√©spedes Park. Its facade has two marble sculptures.', 'The Moncada Barracks was a military barracks in Santiago de Cuba, named after the General Guillerm√≥n Moncada, a hero of the Cuban War of Independence. On 26 July 1953, the barracks was the site of an armed attack by a small group of revolutionaries led by Fidel Castro. The attack failed and the surviving revolutionaries were imprisoned. This armed attack is widely accepted as the beginning of the Cuban Revolution. The date on which the attack took place, 26 July, was adopted by Castro as the name for his revolutionary movement (Movimiento 26 Julio or M 26-7) which eventually toppled the dictatorship of Fulgencio Batista on 1 January 1959.', 'The Moncada Barracks was a military barracks in Santiago de Cuba, named after the General Guillerm√≥n Moncada, a hero of the Cuban War of Independence. On 26 July 1953, the barracks was the site of an armed attack by a small group of revolutionaries led by Fidel Castro. The attack failed and the surviving revolutionaries were imprisoned. This armed attack is widely accepted as the beginning of the Cuban Revolution. The date on which the attack took place, 26 July, was adopted by Castro as the name for his revolutionary movement (Movimiento 26 Julio or M 26-7) which eventually toppled the dictatorship of Fulgencio Batista on 1 January 1959.', 'El Jard√≠n de los Helechos de Santiago de Cuba o tambi√©n conocido como Jard√≠n de Helechos de la Academia de Ciencias de Santiago de Cuba es un jard√≠n bot√°nico de unos 3.000 m¬≤ de extensi√≥n especializado en helechos y dependiente del Centro Oriental de Biodiversidad y Ecosistemas (BIOECO) y del Ministerio de Ciencia, Tecnolog√≠a y Medio Ambiente (CITMA) de Cuba.El c√≥digo de identificaci√≥n del Jard√≠n de los Helechos de Santiago de Cuba en el "Botanic Gardens Conservation International" (BGCI) es SCUBA.[1]Se encuentra pr√≥ximo a Santiago de Cuba a medio camino entre la ciudad de Santiago de Cuba y el poblado del Caney, a una altitud de 30 msnm.', 'The Battle of Santiago de Cuba was a decisive naval engagement that occurred on July 3, 1898 between an American fleet, led by William T. Sampson and Winfield Scott Schley, against a Spanish fleet led by Pascual Cervera y Topete, which occurred during the Spanish‚ÄìAmerican War. The significantly more powerful US Navy squadron, consisting of four battleships and two armored cruisers, decisively defeated an outgunned squadron of the Royal Spanish Navy, which consisted of four armored cruisers and two destroyers. All the Spanish ships were sunk, but no American ship was lost. The crushing loss sealed American victory in the Cuban theater of the war and ensuring the independence of Cuba from Spanish rule.', 'The Battle of San Juan Hill, also known as the Battle for the San Juan Heights, was a major battle of the Spanish‚ÄìAmerican War fought between an American force under the command of William Rufus Shafter and Joseph Wheeler against a Spanish force led by Arsenio Linares y Pombo. The battle proved to be one of the most significant battles of the war and, along with the Siege of Santiago, a decisive battle in deciding the fate of the United States Army campaign in Cuba. The American forces, outnumbering the Spanish defenders 16-to-one, charged upon the heights and dispersed the Spanish after suffering heavy casualties.', 'USS Merrimac was a United States Navy collier during the Spanish‚ÄìAmerican War. It was the only American vessel sunk by the Spanish navy in that conflict.', 'The Castillo de San Pedro de la Roca (also known by the less formal title of Castillo del Morro or as San Pedro de la Roca Castle) is a fortress on the coast of the Cuban city of Santiago de Cuba. About 6 miles (10 km) southwest of the city centre, it overlooks the bay. The fortress was declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1997, cited as the best preserved and most complete example of Spanish-American military architecture.']

column5: ['Padang Beach', 'Museum Adtywarman', 'Old Bank Indonesia Building, Padang', 'Stadion Gelora Haji Agus Salim']
column6: ['Padang Beach or popularly known as Taplau (short for tapi lauik, Minang language which means waterfront) is a beach located in the city of Padang, West Sumatra, Indonesia. This beach is located in a dense urban area in the District of West Padang, and extends from Purus to Batang Arau estuary. The beach is approximately 23 km from Minangkabau International Airport or 30 minutes by car.', 'Adityawarman Museum is a State Museum (Museum Negeri) located in Padang, Western Sumatra. As a State Museum, Adityawarman Museum is officially known as the State Museum of West Sumatra (Museum Negeri Sumatera Barat). The museum displays ethnographic collections of items related to the culture of the Province of West Sumatra, particularly the culture of Minangkabau and Mentawai.', 'Bank Indonesia Museum (Indonesian Museum Bank Indonesia Padang), is a former bank building located in Padang, Indonesia. The building was built on March 31, 1921 as the Padang branch office of De Javasche Bank before it was taken over by Bank Indonesia on July 1, 1953.Completed in 1925, the building was initially used as the new building for De Javasche Bank, replacing the old de Javasche Bank building at Jalan Nipah, near Padang Beach. The location was formerly the center of the financial offices, commerce and military in colonial Padang. Old colonial buildings from the Dutch East Indies period can still be found lining the waterfront street of Batang Arau.', 'Haji Agus Salim Stadium is a multi-use stadium in Padang, West Sumatra, Indonesia. It is currently used mostly for Football matches and is the home stadium of Semen Padang and PSP Padang. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000. The stadium is also known as a venue for rugby union matches and athletics.']

column5: ['Tuoshan']
column6: ["Tuoshan (Chinese: È©ºÂ±±; pinyin: Tu√≥ ShƒÅn; lit. 'Camel Mountain') is a mountain located 4 km (2 mi) south-west of Qingzhou city, Shandong province, China. It features a number of historic sites and a native pine forest. Tuoshan is the core scenic zone of Qingzhou National Park.Qiaoyu was a chief official of Qingzhou during the Ming Dynasty, and inscribed the characters 'Tuo Shan' on the eastern face of the mountain."]

column5: ['Estadio Alfredo Terrera', 'Estadio √önico Madre de Ciudades']
column6: ['El Estadio Alfredo Terrera es el estadio de f√∫tbol del Club Atl√©tico Central C√≥rdoba de Santiago del Estero.Este estadio cuenta con capacidad para 21.500 espectadores, y fue modificado cuando el equipo logr√≥ el ascenso a primera divisi√≥n, siendo el √∫nico representante de la provincia. Los arreglos en el estadio fueron realizados para cumplir con los est√°ndares de la Asociaci√≥n del F√∫tbol Argentino y la CONMEBOL.Ubicaci√≥n:El estadio, se ubica sobre la calle Granadero Saavedra, (zona de plateas, alta y baja) calle San Mart√≠n (zona de popular visitante) calle Pedro Le√≥n Gallo (zona de popular local) calle Santa Fe (popular local y palcos).', 'The Estadio √önico Madre de Ciudades is a stadium located in the city of Santiago del Estero in the homonymous province of Argentina. The stadium was inaugurated on March 4, 2021, before the 2019 Supercopa Argentina match contested by River Plate and Racing Club. President of Argentina Alberto Fern√°ndez attended the ceremony.']

Anƒ±t aynƒ± zamanda T√ºrkiye\'deki ilk Rauf Denkta≈ü heykeli olma √∂zelliƒüini ta≈üƒ±r.', 'Lake K√º√ß√ºk√ßekmece (Turkish: K√º√ß√ºk√ßekmece G√∂l√º) is a lagoon located between the K√º√ß√ºk√ßekmece, Esenyurt and Avcƒ±lar districts of the European portion of Istanbul Province, northwestern Turkey. The lake is neighbored in the south by state road D.100 and in the north by the O-3 motorway (European route E80).', 'Lake K√º√ß√ºk√ßekmece (Turkish: K√º√ß√ºk√ßekmece G√∂l√º) is a lagoon located between the K√º√ß√ºk√ßekmece, Esenyurt and Avcƒ±lar districts of the European portion of Istanbul Province, northwestern Turkey. The lake is neighbored in the south by state road D.100 and in the north by the O-3 motorway (European route E80).', "The Atat√ºrk Olympic Stadium (Turkish: Atat√ºrk Olimpiyat Stadƒ±, pronounced [aÀàtaty…æc]) is a stadium in Istanbul, Turkey. Located in the western district of ƒ∞kitelli, it is the largest-capacity stadium in the country. The stadium is named after Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, the founder and first President of the Republic of Turkey. Its construction began in 1999 and was completed in 2002. It was originally built for Turkey's failed bid for the 2008 Olympic Games that were ultimately awarded to Beijing, China. It cost about US$140 million."]

column6: ['Moren√£o, also known as Est√°dio Universit√°rio Pedro Pedrossian, is the home ground of Oper√°rio and Esporte Clube Comercial. It is located at Cidade Universit√°ria ("University City", in English), in Campo Grande, Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil.The stadium is owned by Universidade Federal do Mato Grosso do Sul ("Mato Grosso do Sul Federal University", in English), also known as UFMS.Moren√£o was inaugurated on March 7, 1971. The first stadium match was Flamengo against Corinthians, won by the former by 3‚Äì1. The first goal of the stadium was scored by Bui√£o, of Flamengo.The stadium has a capacity of 45,000 people.', 'A Morada dos Ba√≠s √© um centro cultural brasileiro localizado na cidade de Campo Grande, no Mato Grosso do Sul. Anteriormente, foi conhecida como Pens√£o Pimentel. Est√° localizado na Av. Noroeste 5140 - Centro.Bernardo Franco Ba√≠s come√ßa a constru√ß√£o do segundo sobrado do contexto urbano de Campo Grande, o primeiro edificado em alvenaria, com argamassa de saibro, cal e areia, coberto originalmente com telhas de ard√≥sia (formato 40 x 40) vindas da It√°lia.', 'O Museu Jos√© Ant√¥nio Pereira √© um museu que est√° localizado na cidade de Campo Grande, no Mato Grosso do Sul. Seu nome √© uma homenagem ao fundador da cidade, Jos√© Ant√¥nio Pereira. Em 1966 a √°rea aonde se localiza o museu de arquitetura rural do s√©culo XIX, antes sede da Fazenda B√°lsamo, aonde residia a fam√≠lia do fundador da cidade, foi doada a prefeitura. Suas instala√ß√µes foram doados tempos depois pelo fundador da cidade a um dos seus filhos.', 'The Prosa State Park (Portuguese: Parque Estadual do Prosa), formerly the Parque dos Poderes, is an urban state park in the state of Mato Grosso do Sul, Brazil. It protects a remnant of cerrado vegetation, and is home to a wildlife rehabilitation center.The Prosa State Park is within the urban perimeter of the municipality of Campo Grande, capital of the state of Mato Grosso do Sul. It has an area of 135.26 hectares (334.2 acres). It is surrounded by a buffer zone in which there are restrictions on land use.']

column5: ['Stade Omnisport de Bobo-Dioulasso']
column6: ['Stade G√©n√©ral Aboubacar Sangoul√© Lamizana is a multi-use stadium in Bobo Dioulasso, Burkina Faso, used mostly for football matches. The stadium hosted several matches during the 1998 Africa Cup of Nations. The stadium holds 30,000 people.']

column5: ['Prince Mohamed bin Fahd Stadium']
column6: ["The Prince Mohammad bin Fahd Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖŸäÿ± ŸÖÿ≠ŸÖÿØ ÿ®ŸÜ ŸÅŸáÿØ\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Dammam, Saudi Arabia. It was built in 1973 and it was used the name Prince Mohammad bin Fahd. It is used mostly for football matches and is the home of Al-Ettifaq. The stadium's capacity is 26,000 people. It is named after Muhammad bin Fahd, who was the governor of the Eastern Province from 1985 until 2013, and the architects were Malaysian duo Michael KC Cheah and his wife, Steph.Stadium profile - Soccerway"]
