A member of the Greek resistance to Axis rule during World War II, he later became a prominent anti-war activist. His assassination by right-wing zealots provoked mass protests and led to a political crisis.Lambrakis was born in the village of Kerasitsa in the district of Tegea (Arcadia, the Peloponnese). After finishing high school in his home town, he moved to Athens to enter the School of Medicine at the University of Athens.', "The Battle of Thessalonica was fought in the summer or autumn of 380 by Fritigern's Goths and a Roman army led by Theodosius I. Reconstituted after Adrianople, the East Roman army suffered another major defeat. Theodosius retreated to Thessalonica and surrendered control of operations to the Western Emperor, Gratian.Peter Heather, 1996. The Goths, Blackwell Publishers. ISBN 0-631-16536-3.", "The Cinema Museum of Thessaloniki is a museum in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. It was founded in 1995 following a decision by the Organization for Thessaloniki, Cultural Capital of Europe 1997. Today it is part of the Thessaloniki Film Festival with its own management committee. It is housed in Warehouse 1, a listed building on quay 1 in the harbour, at the end of the old sea front near Aristotelous Square.The museum's mission is to gather, preserve and display as museum exhibits items from the life of the cinema in Greece. Setting up the museum became feasible following the purchase of the cinematography collection of the Thessaloniki cinematographer Nikos Bililis.", 'The Church of Panagia Chalkeon (Greek: Œ†Œ±ŒΩŒ±Œ≥ŒØŒ± œÑ·ø∂ŒΩ ŒßŒ±ŒªŒ∫Œ≠œâŒΩ) is an 11th-century Byzantine church in the northern Greek city of Thessaloniki.The church is located at Dikastirion Square, north of the Via Egnatia at the point where it crosses the Aristotelous Avenue, which leads to the Aristotelous Square. The archaeological site of the city\'s Roman forum is located northeast, while its name, which translates as "the Virgin of the Copper-smiths", derives from its proximity to the area traditionally occupied by the city\'s coppersmiths.', 'MOMus Photography, in full MOMus‚ÄìThessaloniki Museum of Photography, is located in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. It is currently housed in Warehouse A, Pier A, at the Port of Thessaloniki, next to the Cinema Museum of Thessaloniki. It was formerly known as the Thessaloniki Museum of Photography (Greek: ŒúŒøœÖœÉŒµŒØŒø Œ¶œâœÑŒøŒ≥œÅŒ±œÜŒØŒ±œÇ ŒòŒµœÉœÉŒ±ŒªŒøŒΩŒØŒ∫Œ∑œÇ).The museum was founded in 1987 by Aris Georgiou, Apostolos Maroulis and Yiannis Vanidis but it was not until 1997 that it was legally established and until 1998 that it opened with Giorgos Makris as its president and Aris Georgiou as its first director.', 'Bey Hamam, alternatively known as the "Baths of Paradise", is a Turkish bathhouse located along Egnatia Street in Thessaloniki, east of Panagia Chalkeon.Built in 1444 by sultan Murad II, it was the first Ottoman bath in Thessaloniki and the most important one still standing throughout Greece. For this reason, it is a part of those few important vestiges of Ottoman culture remaining in Thessaloniki and Greece in general.', "Aristotelous Square (Greek: Œ†ŒªŒ±œÑŒµŒØŒ± ŒëœÅŒπœÉœÑŒøœÑŒ≠ŒªŒøœÖœÇ, IPA: [plaÀàtia aristoÀàtelus], Aristotle Square) is the main city square of Thessaloniki, Greece and is located on Nikis avenue (on the city's waterfront), in the city center. It was designed by French architect Ernest H√©brard in 1918, but most of the square was built in the 1950s. Many buildings surrounding the central square have since been renovated and its northern parts were largely restored in the 2000s.The twelve buildings that make up Aristotelous Square have been listed buildings of the Hellenic Republic since 1950.", 'Chrysostomos Kalafatis (Greek: ŒßœÅœÖœÉœåœÉœÑŒøŒºŒøœÇ ŒöŒ±ŒªŒ±œÜŒ¨œÑŒ∑œÇ; 8 January 1867 ‚Äì 10 September 1922) known as Saint Chrysostomos of Smyrna, Chrysostomos of Smyrna and Metropolitan Chrysostom, was the Greek Orthodox metropolitan bishop of Smyrna (Izmir) between 1910 and 1914, and again from 1919 until his death in 1922. He was born in Triglia (today Zeytinbaƒüƒ±), Turkey in 1867, considerably aided the Greek campaign in Smyrna in 1919 and was subsequently killed by a lynch mob after Turkish troops took back the city at the end of the Greco-Turkish War of 1919‚Äì1922. He was declared a martyr and a saint of the Eastern Orthodox Church by the Holy Synod of the Church of Greece on 4 November 1992.', 'Alaca Imaret Mosque (Turkish: Alaca ƒ∞maret Camii) or Ishak Pasha Mosque (Greek: ŒëŒªŒ±œÑŒ∂Œ¨ ŒôŒºŒ±œÅŒ≠œÑ), literally the "colourful mosque", is a 15th-century Ottoman mosque in Thessaloniki, Greece.It was built by order of Ishak Pasha in 1484 or 1487. It consists of a mosque with an imaret (public charity kitchen). The mosque and imaret are not in use anymore. The mosque has a reverse T plan common to early Ottoman architecture, the prayer hall is covered by two large domes, it has a portico covered by five smaller domes. It had one minaret, which was destroyed after 1912, after Thessaloniki was conquered by the Greek Army and became part of the modern Greek state. It is under restoration till now.', 'The National Map Library (Greek: ŒïŒ∏ŒΩŒπŒ∫ŒÆ ŒßŒ±œÅœÑŒøŒ∏ŒÆŒ∫Œ∑), properly the National Centre for Maps and Cartographic Heritage - National Map Library, is located in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. It was established in 1997 (Law 2466/1997) for the purpose of preserving, archiving, conserving, promoting, and displaying maps, studying the educational, cultural, and social role of maps, collaborating at a scientific and technical level with national and international organizations, organizing permanent and mobile exhibitions accompanied by catalogues, utilising public and private map collections, and organising seminars and conferences.', 'The Museum for the Macedonian Struggle is located in the centre of the city Thessaloniki in Central Macedonia, Greece. It occupies a neo-classical building designed by the renowned architect Ernst Ziller and built in 1893. In its six ground-floor rooms the museum graphically illustrates the modern and contemporary history of Greek Macedonia. It presents the social, economic, political and military developments that shaped the presence of Hellenism in the region. This approach enables the visitor to form a global picture, not only of the revolutionary movements in the area, but also of the rapidly changing society of the southern Balkans and its agonizing struggles to balance between tradition and modernization.', 'Egnatia Street (Greek: ŒüŒ¥œåœÇ ŒïŒ≥ŒΩŒ±œÑŒØŒ±œÇ) is the main commercial street in downtown Thessaloniki. The road is named for the Roman-era Via Egnatia which passed near the city. Lined with shops and office buildings, it is one of the busiest streets of Thessaloniki.', "The Siege of Thessalonica in 617 or 618 was an unsuccessful siege of the city of Thessalonica, the major Byzantine stronghold in the region, by the Avars and the Slavic tribes (Sclaveni) who had settled in the city's vicinity. The attack was the last and best-organized attempt by the Avars to take the city. It lasted 33 days and involved the use of siege engines, but in the end failed. The main source for these events are the Miracles of Saint Demetrius, named after Thessalonica's patron saint, Saint Demetrius.", 'Vlatades Monastery or Vlatadon Monastery (Greek: ŒúŒøŒΩŒÆ ŒíŒªŒ±œÑŒ¨Œ¥œâŒΩ) is a monastery in Ano Poli, Thessaloniki, Greece. Built in the 14th century during the late era of the Byzantine Empire, it is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, one of the 15 in the city.', 'The Water Supply Museum is a museum in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. It is located in the Sfageion area near the city‚Äôs western entry point. The museum began operating in February 2001. It is housed in the historical building known as the Old Pump House belonging to the Thessaloniki Water Supply and Sewage Company (EYATh). This building was constructed between 1890 and 1892 by a Belgian company, as part of the campaign to modernize Thessaloniki, along with other construction projects like the railways and the gasworks, and later on the electricity company and the tram network.', 'The Church of Saint Panteleimon (Greek: ŒùŒ±œåœÇ ŒëŒ≥ŒØŒøœÖ Œ†Œ±ŒΩœÑŒµŒªŒµŒÆŒºŒøŒΩŒ±, Na√≥s Ag√≠ou Pantele√≠mona) is a late Byzantine church in Thessaloniki, Greece, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.', 'The Church of Saint Panteleimon (Greek: ŒùŒ±œåœÇ ŒëŒ≥ŒØŒøœÖ Œ†Œ±ŒΩœÑŒµŒªŒµŒÆŒºŒøŒΩŒ±, Na√≥s Ag√≠ou Pantele√≠mona) is a late Byzantine church in Thessaloniki, Greece, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.', 'The Arch of Galerius (Greek: ŒëœàŒØŒ¥Œ± œÑŒøœÖ ŒìŒ±ŒªŒµœÅŒØŒøœÖ) or Kamara (ŒöŒ±ŒºŒ¨œÅŒ±) and the Rotunda (Œ°ŒøœÑœåŒΩœÑŒ±) are neighbouring early 4th-century AD monuments in the city of Thessaloniki, in the region of Central Macedonia in northern Greece.The 4th-century Roman emperor Galerius commissioned these two structures as elements of an imperial precinct linked to his Thessaloniki palace. Archeologists have found substantial remains of the palace to the southwest. Œ§Œø œÉœÖŒΩŒøŒªŒπŒ∫œå œçœàŒøœÇ ŒºŒ±Œ∂ŒØ ŒºŒµ œÑŒø Œ≤Œ¨Œ∏œÅŒø Œ±ŒΩŒ≠œÅœáŒµœÑŒ±Œπ œÉœÑŒ± 11 ŒºŒ≠œÑœÅŒ±.', 'MOMus Contemporary, in full MOMus‚ÄìMuseum of Contemporary Art‚ÄìMacedonian Museum of Contemporary Art and State Museum of Contemporary Art Collections, is a contemporary art museum in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece, located in the area of the Thessaloniki International Fair. It was formerly known as the Macedonian Museum of Contemporary Art (MMCA, Greek: ŒúŒ±Œ∫ŒµŒ¥ŒøŒΩŒπŒ∫œå ŒúŒøœÖœÉŒµŒØŒø Œ£œçŒ≥œáœÅŒøŒΩŒ∑œÇ Œ§Œ≠œáŒΩŒ∑œÇ, ŒúŒúŒ£Œ§).', 'The Archaeological Museum of Thessaloniki (Greek: ŒëœÅœáŒ±ŒπŒøŒªŒøŒ≥ŒπŒ∫œå ŒúŒøœÖœÉŒµŒØŒø ŒòŒµœÉœÉŒ±ŒªŒøŒΩŒØŒ∫Œ∑œÇ Arkheoloyik√≥ Mous√≠o Thessalon√≠kis) is a museum in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. It holds and interprets artifacts from the Prehistoric, Archaic, Classical, Hellenistic and Roman periods, mostly from the city of Thessaloniki but also from the region of Macedonia in general.', 'The Heptapyrgion (Byzantine Greek: ·ºôœÄœÑŒ±œÄœçœÅŒ≥ŒπŒøŒΩ, [heptaÀàpyrgion]), modern Eptapyrgio (Greek: ŒïœÄœÑŒ±œÄœçœÅŒ≥ŒπŒø, [eptaÀàpir ùio]), also popularly known by its Ottoman Turkish name Yedi Kule (ŒìŒµŒΩœÑŒØ ŒöŒøœÖŒªŒ≠), is a Byzantine and Ottoman-era fortress situated on the north-eastern corner of the Acropolis of Thessaloniki in Greece. Despite its name, which in both languages means "Fortress of Seven Towers", it features ten, and was probably named after the Yedikule Fortress in Constantinople (modern Istanbul, Turkey). It served as the major redoubt of the city\'s acropolis, as well as the seat of its garrison commander in Ottoman times, until the late 19th century. It was then converted to a prison (Œ¶œÖŒªŒ±Œ∫Œ≠œÇ ŒïœÄœÑŒ±œÄœÖœÅŒ≥ŒØŒøœÖ), which remained open until 1989. References to the infamous Yedi Kule prison abound in the Greek rebetika songs. Restoration and archaeological work began in the 1970s and continues to this day.', 'The Teloglion Fine Arts Foundation (formerly known in English as Teloglion Foundation of Art; Greek: Œ§ŒµŒªŒªœåŒ≥ŒªŒµŒπŒø ŒäŒ¥œÅœÖŒºŒ± Œ§ŒµœáŒΩœéŒΩ) was established in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece in 1972. It was named after Nestor and Aliki Telloglou, who donated their art collection and their entire property to the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki. Later the University established this foundation in order to house the art collection and make it available to the public.', "Alexandreio Melathron Nikos Galis Hall (Greek: ŒëŒªŒµŒæŒ¨ŒΩŒ¥œÅŒµŒπŒø ŒúŒ≠ŒªŒ±Œ∏œÅŒøŒΩ, Œ£Œ¨ŒªŒ± ŒùŒØŒ∫ŒøœÇ ŒìŒ∫Œ¨ŒªŒ∑œÇ) is an indoor sports arena that is located in Thessaloniki, Greece. It is also often referred to as the Palais des Sports (Greek: Œ†Œ±ŒªŒ±ŒØ ŒΩœÑŒµ Œ£œÄŒøœÅ).The arena is mainly used to host basketball and volleyball games. The arena's main hall, called Nikos Galis Hall, has a permanent seating capacity of 5,138, and a capacity of 6,000 with temporary seating, for basketball games. The arena also contains a practice court, club offices, shops, and a museum dedicated to the Aris basketball club. The arena hosts the home games of Aris Thessaloniki B.C., a member of the Greek League.", 'The Museum of Byzantine Culture (Greek: ŒúŒøœÖœÉŒµŒØŒø ŒíœÖŒ∂Œ±ŒΩœÑŒπŒΩŒøœç Œ†ŒøŒªŒπœÑŒπœÉŒºŒøœç) is a museum in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece, which opened in 1994.To design the museum, a nationwide architectural competition was announced in 1977. The competition was ultimately won by the entry of Kyriakos Krokos. Construction of the building began in March 1989, and was completed in October 1993. Antiquities from the Byzantine & Christian Museum in Athens were transferred in June 1994, some of them being displayed in the museum\'s inaugural exhibition, "Byzantine Treasures of Thessaloniki: The Return Journey". The museum finally opened on 11 September 1994.Article 4, Goals:', "The War Museum of Thessaloniki (Greek: Œ†ŒøŒªŒµŒºŒπŒ∫œå ŒúŒøœÖœÉŒµŒØŒø ŒòŒµœÉœÉŒ±ŒªŒøŒΩŒØŒ∫Œ∑œÇ Polemiko Mousio Thessalonikis) is a military museum in Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece.Thessaloniki War Museum opened in October 2000. It is housed in a building designed by architect Vitaliano Poselli and erected between 1900 and 1902.The museum's mission is to help preserve military historical memory and heritage in Northern Greece.", "Ivanofeio Sports Arena (Greek: ŒôŒ≤Œ±ŒΩœéœÜŒµŒπŒø ŒöŒªŒµŒπœÉœÑœå ŒìœÖŒºŒΩŒ±œÉœÑŒÆœÅŒπŒø, Greek pronunciation: [iva'nofio klis'to …£imnas'ti…æio]), is an indoor sports arena that is located in Thessaloniki, Greece. Its capacity is 2,500 spectators, and it is mainly used as the home court of the Greek professional basketball club Iraklis.Ivanofeio Sports Arena is located in the city centre of Thessaloniki, next to the campus of the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki. It can be accessed by bus lines 15, 17, and 37.", 'Thessaloniki Olympic Museum, the unique Olympic Museum of Greece, is situated at Thessaloniki, Central Macedonia, Greece. The museum is located on the confluence and educational, athletic and cultural routes of the city. It stands next to the Kaftanzoglio National Stadium and the Aristotle University.The museum was established in 1998 with the name ‚ÄúSports Museum‚Äù ‚Äì being the unique sports museum in Greece ‚Äì with the support of the Ministry of Culture, the Special Secretariat for Sports of Macedonia‚ÄìThrace, Athletic Unions and Associations of Local Authorities.', 'Kaftanzoglio Stadium (Greek: ŒöŒ±œÖœÑŒ±ŒΩŒ∂œåŒ≥ŒªŒµŒπŒø œÉœÑŒ¨Œ¥ŒπŒø) is a sports stadium in Thessaloniki, Greece. The stadium was built with money donated by the Kaftanzoglou Foundation, in honour of Lysandros Kaftanzoglou, hence its name. At the time of its opening on 27 October 1960, the stadium was one of the highest quality stadiums in the Balkans. It currently has 27,770 seats, owing to a comprehensive renovation before reopening to host football matches for the 2004 Summer Olympics, which was centered in Athens. It was the largest stadium in Greece until 1982, but has since been surpassed in capacity by the Olympic Stadium in Athens.', 'The Battle of Thessalonica (Bulgarian: –ë–∏—Ç–∫–∞—Ç–∞ –ø—Ä–∏ –°–æ–ª—É–Ω) occurred in 995 or earlier, near the city of Thessalonica, Greece. The battle was part of the long Bulgarian‚ÄìByzantine war of the late 10th and early 11th centuries. The Bulgarians under their ruler, Tsar Samuil, succeeded in ambushing and destroying the Byzantine garrison of Thessalonica, killing its commander, Gregory Taronites, and capturing his son Ashot.']

Ê†™Âºè‰ºöÁ§æÊù±‰∫¨Â†ÇÂá∫Áâà 1989Âπ¥ 428È†Ö„Éá„Ç∏„Çø„É´Âè§Â¢≥ÁôæÁßë > Âè§Â¢≥„Éá„Éº„Çø„Éô„Éº„Çπ > Ê∞∏Â±±Âè§Â¢≥ÔºàÂ†∫Â∏Ç„Ç¶„Çß„Éñ„Çµ„Ç§„ÉàÔºâ ‰ªÅÂæ≥Â§©ÁöáÈôµÂè§Â¢≥Âë®Ëæ∫ÔΩúÁôæËàåÈ≥•Âè§Â¢≥Áæ§ÔºàÂ†∫Â∏Ç„Ç¶„Çß„Éñ„Çµ„Ç§„ÉàÔºâ „Çπ„Éù„ÉÉ„ÉàË©≥Á¥∞ÔºöÊ∞∏Â±±Âè§Â¢≥ÔΩúÂ†∫Ë¶≥ÂÖâ„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ', '‰∏∏‰øùÂ±±Âè§Â¢≥Ôºà„Åæ„Çã„Åª„ÇÑ„Åæ„Åì„Åµ„ÇìÔºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅÂ§ßÈò™Â∫úÂ†∫Â∏ÇÂ†∫Âå∫Âåó‰∏∏‰øùÂúí„Å´ÊâÄÂú®„Åô„ÇãÂè§Â¢≥ÔºàÂâçÊñπÂæåÂÜÜÂ¢≥Ôºâ„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇÁôæËàåÈ≥•Âè§Â¢≥Áæ§„ÅÆ‰∏≠„ÅÆ‰∏ÄÂü∫„Åß„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅ„Åô„ÅêËøë„Åè„Å´„ÅÇ„ÇãÂ§ß‰ªôÈôµÂè§Â¢≥„ÅÆÈô™Â°ö„Å®ËÄÉ„Åà„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇÂõΩ„ÅÆÂè≤Ë∑°„Å´ÊåáÂÆö„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇÂâçÊñπÈÉ®„Å®Âë®Êø†„ÅØÂ†∫Â∏Ç„ÅåÁÆ°ÁêÜ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ1972Âπ¥ÔºàÊò≠Âíå47Âπ¥Ôºâ„Å´ÂâçÊñπÈÉ®„Å®Âë®Êø†„ÅÆ„Åø„ÅåÂõΩ„ÅÆÂè≤Ë∑°„Å´ÊåáÂÆö„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇÊùæÊùëÈöÜÊñá\u3000„ÄéÊó•Êú¨Âè§Â¢≥Â§ßËæûÂÖ∏„Äè\u3000Ê†™Âºè‰ºöÁ§æÊù±‰∫¨Â†ÇÂá∫Áâà\u30001989Âπ¥\u3000541È†Ö', 'The Mozu Tombs (ÁôæËàåÈ≥•Âè§Â¢≥Áæ§, Mozu kofungun) are a group of megalithic tombs in Sakai, Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Originally consisting of more than 100 tombs, only less than 50% of the key-hole, round and rectangular tombs remain.The Daisenryo Kofun (Â§ß‰ªôÈôµÂè§Â¢≥, Daisenry≈ç kofun), the largest kofun in Japan, is believed to have been constructed over a period of 20 years in the mid 5th century during the Kofun Period. While it cannot be accurately confirmed, it is commonly accepted that the tomb was built for the late Emperor Nintoku. The Imperial Household Agency of Japan treats it as such.', within Daisen Park, in Sakai-ku, Sakai City, in Osaka Prefecture. The exhibition hall of approx. 1,330 square meters is divided up into areas for ancient times, the middle ages, early modern, and modern times. The museum was opened in 1980, to commemorate the 90th anniversary of Sakai‚Äôs municipalization. The present (2017-) director of the museum is Ken'ichi Sudo (ex-director and an emeritus professor at the National Museum of Ethnology). Susumu Nakanishi (Emeritus Professor at the International Research Center for Japanese Studies) was a former (2008-2013) director of the museum.", It is the head temple of the Wa Sect of Buddhism.', 'Shitenn≈ç-ji (Japanese: ÂõõÂ§©ÁéãÂØ∫, Temple of the Four Heavenly Kings) is a Buddhist temple in ≈åsaka, Japan. It is also known as Arahaka-ji, Nanba-ji, or Mitsu-ji. The temple is sometimes regarded as the first Buddhist and oldest officially-administered temple in Japan, although the temple complex and buildings have been rebuilt over the centuries, with the last reconstruction taking place in 1963. It is the head temple of the Wa Sect of Buddhism.', 'Shitenn≈ç-ji (Japanese: ÂõõÂ§©ÁéãÂØ∫, Temple of the Four Heavenly Kings) is a Buddhist temple in ≈åsaka, Japan. It is also known as Arahaka-ji, Nanba-ji, or Mitsu-ji. The temple is sometimes regarded as the first Buddhist and oldest officially-administered temple in Japan, although the temple complex and buildings have been rebuilt over the centuries, with the last reconstruction taking place in 1963. column6: ['Stade Municipal is a multi-use stadium in Pointe-Noire, Republic of the Congo. It is used for football matches and serves as the home of Association Sportive des Cheminots and Jeunesse Sportive les Bougainvill√©es. It holds 13,594 spectators.']

column5: ['Pinang Peranakan Mansion', 'Museum for Batik Paintings', 'Esplanade Grounds', '"Main Street" Sculpture', 'Sun Yat Sen Museum Penang', 'Penang Islamic Museum', 'Marking George Town', 'Marking George Town', 'Penang State Museum and Art Gallery', 'Camera Museum', 'Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion', 'Battle of Penang', 'Bandaraya George Town', 'Penang City Stadium', 'Gurney Wharf', 'City Park (Penang Youth Park)', 'Penang Botanic Gardens']
column6: ["The Pinang Peranakan Mansion (Malay: Rumah Agam Peranakan Pulau Pinang) in George Town, Penang, Malaysia, is a museum dedicated to Penang's Peranakan heritage. The museum itself is housed within a distinctive green-hued mansion at Church Street, George Town, which once served as the residence and office of a 19th-century Chinese tycoon, Chung Keng Quee.", 'The Batik Painting Museum Penang (Malay: Muzium Lukisan Batik Pulau Pinang) is a museum about batik in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The building was purchased in 2010 and underwent a three-year renovation before it was opened on 1 October 2013.The museum is located in a three-story Straits eclectic-style shop house with a total area of 650 m2.', 'The Esplanade is a waterfront location in the heart of George Town, Penang, Malaysia. It covers the field adjacent to Fort Cornwallis, known locally as the Padang, and the seaside promenade along the edge of the field. The Penang City Hall faces the Padang and the Cenotaph of Penang is also located along the promenade.', "Pitt Street or Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling in Malay is a major thoroughfare in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. One of the oldest roads in the city centre, it was named after William Pitt the Younger, the Prime Minister of Great Britain in 1786.Four places of worship, each of a different religion - Islam, Taoism, Hinduism and Christianity - are located within metres of one another along this street, earning it its nickname, the Street of Harmony. Located within the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site, the street's nickname also reflects the harmonious coexistence of various religions and cultures that have lived here for centuries.", 'The Sun Yat-sen Museum Penang (Malay: Muzium Sun Yat-sen Pulau Pinang; Chinese: Â≠´‰∏≠Â±±ÊßüÂüéÂü∫Âú∞ÂçöÁâ©È§®) formerly called the Sun Yat-sen Penang Base, is a museum in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. The museum is dedicated to Sun Yat-sen, a Chinese nationalist who established the Republic of China after his efforts in the Xinhai Revolution.The Sun Yat-sen Museum Penang is in a historic house. The museum building is the same house where Sun Yat-sen devised many of his plans to overthrow the Qing Dynasty. In 1910, acting on the immense support among overseas Chinese for the ousting of the Qing dynasty, Sun shifted the southeast Asian headquarters of the Tongmenghui party to Penang.', "The Penang Islamic Museum (Malay: Muzium Islam Pulau Pinang) is a museum about Islam in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The museum is housed in a restored villa originally built in 1860 that was once the residence of a powerful Acehnese pepper merchant. Later it was used as a recycling depot for Penang's Indian Chettiar community. Restoration work was carried out in 1996 and it was awarded the Best Project award in 1999.The museum building features mid 19th century Straits style.", "Pitt Street or Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling in Malay is a major thoroughfare in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. One of the oldest roads in the city centre, it was named after William Pitt the Younger, the Prime Minister of Great Britain in 1786.Four places of worship, each of a different religion - Islam, Taoism, Hinduism and Christianity - are located within metres of one another along this street, earning it its nickname, the Street of Harmony. Located within the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site, the street's nickname also reflects the harmonious coexistence of various religions and cultures that have lived here for centuries.", "Pitt Street or Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling in Malay is a major thoroughfare in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. One of the oldest roads in the city centre, it was named after William Pitt the Younger, the Prime Minister of Great Britain in 1786.Four places of worship, each of a different religion - Islam, Taoism, Hinduism and Christianity - are located within metres of one another along this street, earning it its nickname, the Street of Harmony. Located within the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site, the street's nickname also reflects the harmonious coexistence of various religions and cultures that have lived here for centuries.", 'The Penang State Museum and Art Gallery (Malay: Muzium dan Balai Seni Lukis Negeri Pulau Pinang) is a museum and art gallery in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The museum building used to house the Penang Free School in 1821‚Äì1927. After Penang Free School moved to a new building in Green Lane, the Hutchings School took over the building in January 1928 and used it until 1960. The museum was opened by Yang di-Pertua Negeri of Penang Raja Uda Raja Muhammad on 14 April 1965. The building was declared a heritage building under the 2005 Heritage Act.', 'The Camera Museum (Malay: Muzium Kamera; Tamil: ‡Æ®‡Æø‡Æ¥‡Æ±‡Øç‡Æ™‡Æü‡Æï‡Øç ‡Æï‡Æ∞‡ØÅ‡Æµ‡Æø ‡ÆÖ‡Æ∞‡ØÅ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡Ææ‡Æü‡Øç‡Æö‡Æø‡ÆØ‡Æï‡ÆÆ‡Øç) is a museum in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The museum started its operation on 31 August 2013 and was officiated on 9 October 2013 by Penang Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng.The museum is housed in a two-story shop house building with a total floor area of 325 m2, which is divided into Dark Room, Obscura Room and Pinhole Room. It also features a cafe and souvenir shop.The museum displays up to 1,000 vintage cameras and accessories.The museum regularly holds exhibition and festival events every month.List of museums in MalaysiaCamera Museum on Facebook', "The Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion is a government gazetted heritage building located on Leith Street in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. The mansion's external decorations and indigo-blue outer walls make it a very distinctive building, and it is sometimes referred to as The Blue Mansion. Built by the merchant Cheong Fatt Tze at the end of the 19th century, the mansion has 38 rooms, 5 granite-paved courtyards, 7 staircases and 220 vernacular timber louvre windows. It served as Cheong's private residence as well as the seat of his business activities in Penang.", 'The Battle of Penang occurred on 28 October 1914, during World War I. It was a naval action in the Strait of Malacca, in which the German cruiser SMS Emden sank two Allied warships.At the time, Penang was part of the Straits Settlements, a British Crown colony. Penang is an island off the west coast of Malaya, now the present day Malaysia. It is only a short distance from the mainland. The main town of Penang, George Town, is on a harbor. In the early months of the war, it was heavily used by Allied naval and merchant vessels.', "George Town is the capital city of the Malaysian state of Penang. George Town is Malaysia's third most populous city with 708,127 inhabitants as of 2010, while Greater Penang, with a population of 2,412,616, is the second largest conurbation in the country after Greater Kuala Lumpur. The historical core of George Town has been inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2008.", 'The City Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in George Town, Penang, Malaysia, and serves as the home stadium of the Penang state football team, Penang FA. The oldest built stadium still in use in Malaysia, it was built in 1932 by the British government.The stadium has a capacity of approximately 25,000 people and is now mainly used for football matches involving Penang FA, such as the Malaysian Super League. It is also well-known for the vociferous home support, dubbed the "Keramat Roar".', 'Gurney Wharf is a planned seafront park, with land for this purpose currently being reclaimed off Gurney Drive in George Town, Penang. Intended as a "new iconic waterfront destination for Penang", Phase 1 of Gurney Wharf is scheduled for completion by 2018.Upon the expected completion of Gurney Wharf by August 2021, the 24.28-hectare seafront park will comprise four distinct recreational areas - a beach, a coastal grove, a water garden, and a seaside retail food and beverages (F&B) area.', "The City Park, also colloquially known as the Youth Park, is an urban park in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. Located near the Penang Botanic Gardens, the City Park was opened in 1972 as a recreational area and a green lung for the city's residents.True to its name, the City Park contains various recreational amenities, such as playgrounds, a skating rink, swimming pools, a graffiti corner, reflexology paths and an outdoor auditorium, all of which are open to the public. The park is maintained by the Penang Island City Council.", 'The Penang Botanic Gardens, (Malay: Taman Kebun Bunga;Tamil :‡Æ™‡Æø‡Æ©‡Ææ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡ØÅ ‡Æ§‡Ææ‡Æµ‡Æ∞‡Æµ‡Æø‡ÆØ‡Æ≤‡Øç ‡Æ™‡ØÇ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡Ææ,Pi·πâƒÅ·πÖku TƒÅvaraviyal p≈´·πÖkƒÅ) also known as the "Waterfall Gardens" because of the cascading waterfall nearby, is a public park situated on Jalan Air Terjun (Waterfall Road) in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. The original gardens were established in 1884 from an old quarry site, under the supervision of Charles Curtis, who was the first superintendent.Prior to the establishment of the present gardens, there were two previous botanic gardens on Penang Island.']

Other planetaria in Greater S√£o Paulo include Professor Arist√≥teles Orsini Planetarium and Carmo Planetarium.', 'O Museu de Santo Andr√© Dr. Octaviano Armando Gaiarsa √© um dos mais importantes de sua cidade, Santo Andr√©, S√£o Paulo. Oficializado museu em 1982, hoje ocupa um edif√≠cio que, na verdade, foi projetado e desenvolvido em 1914, pelo arquiteto Jos√© Van Humbeeck, e constru√≠do pelo Estado de S√£o Paulo, para ser o Primeiro Grupo Escolar de S√£o Bernardo. Em 1990, o edif√≠cio foi considerado um patrim√¥nio hist√≥rico pela Comdephaapasa (Conselho Municipal de Defesa ao Patrim√¥nio Hist√≥rico, Art√≠stico, Arquitet√¥nico-Urban√≠stico e Paisag√≠stico de Santo Andr√©). Alguns anos depois, em 2010, foi tombado pela Condephaat (Conselho Municipal de Defesa ao Patrim√¥nio Hist√≥rico, Arqueol√≥gico, Art√≠stico e Tur√≠stico do Estado de S√£o Paulo).', 'Jo√£o Ramalho (Portuguese pronunciation: [ íuÀà…êÃÉwÃÉ  Å…êÀàma éu]) (1493‚Äì1582) was a Portuguese explorer and adventurer known as the first bandeirante. He lived much of his life among Tupiniquim natives in Brazil after he arrived there in 1515. Some historians agree that his ancestors were Jews from Covilh√£.', "The Est√°dio Bruno Jos√© Daniel, sometimes called Brun√£o or Est√°dio Municipal Bruno Jos√© Daniel, is a football stadium in Santo Andr√©, S√£o Paulo state. The stadium, which opened on December 14, 1969, has a maximum capacity of 18,000 people. It is owned by the City Hall of Santo Andr√©, and is the home of Santo Andr√©. Its formal name honors Bruno Jos√© Daniel, who was mayor of Santo Andr√© at the time of the stadium's construction.The stadium's inaugural match was played on December 14, 1969, when Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras beat Santo Andr√© 4‚Äì0.The stadium's attendance record currently stands at 19,000, set on June 3, 1979 when Santo Andr√© beat Corinthians 2‚Äì1.", "Santos Futebol Clube (Brazilian Portuguese: [Ààs…êÃÉtus fut ÉiÀàb…îw Ààklubi] (listen)), commonly known simply as Santos or Santos FC, is a Brazilian sports club based in Vila Belmiro, a bairro in the city of Santos. It plays in the Paulist√£o, the State of S√£o Paulo's premier state league, as well as the Brasileir√£o, the top tier of the Brazilian football league system.", "Est√°dio Municipal Anacleto Campanella, usually simply Est√°dio Anacleto Campanella - between 1964 and 1989 known as Est√°dio Municipal Lauro Gomes de Almeida, or for short Lauro Gomes, is an association football stadium in S√£o Caetano do Sul, on the outskirts of S√£o Paulo, Brazil. The stadium holds 16,744 people. It was inaugurated in 1955. The stadium is owned by the Municipality of S√£o Caetano do Sul, and its formal name honors Anacleto Campanella, who was S√£o Caetano do Sul's mayor from 1953 to 1957, and from 1961 to 1965.", "The S√£o Paulo Zoo (Portuguese: Parque Zool√≥gico de S√£o Paulo) is the largest zoo in Brazil. With 824,529 m2 (82.45 hectares [203.7 acres]) of space in what was originally the Atlantic Forest, the zoo is south of the city of S√£o Paulo.It displays more than 3,200 animals, 102 species of mammals, 216 species of birds, 95 species of reptiles, 15 species of amphibians and 16 species of invertebrates in enclosures that replicate the natural habitats of these animals. The zoo's farm of 572 ha produces vegetables used in the manufacturing of feed for various animals, and material for the enclosures where the animals are. It also has animals that need extra space for mating.", 'O Parque Natural Estoril, de S√£o Bernardo do Campo, √© uma unidade de conserva√ß√£o da Mata Atl√¢ntica, da Represa Billings e da fauna silvestre. column6: ['Â∑©ÂéøÁü≥Á™üÂØ∫ÂéüÂêçÂ∏åÁéÑÂØ∫„ÄÇÂîêÂÆã‰∏§‰ª£Áß∞‰∏∫ÂáÄÂúüÂØ∫ÔºåÊòé‰ª£Êîπ‰∏∫ÂáÄÂúüÁ¶ÖÂØ∫ÔºåÊ∏Ö‰ª£Êîπ‰∏∫‰ªäÂêç„ÄÇ‰Ωç‰∫éÊ≤≥ÂçóÁúÅÂ∑©‰πâÂ∏ÇÂ≠ù‰πâÈïá‰∏úÂåó‰πùÂÖ¨ÈáåÁöÑÂØ∫ÊπæÊùë‰∏ú„ÄÇÁü≥Á™üÁæ§ÂùêÂåóÂêëÂçóÔºåÂàõÂª∫‰∫éÂåóÈ≠èÔºåÊòØÁªßÈæôÈó®Áü≥Á™üÂêéÔºåÂåóÈ≠èÊó∂ÊúüÁöÑÂèà‰∏Ä‰ΩõÊïôËâ∫ÊúØÂÆùÂ∫ì„ÄÇ‰∏úÈ≠è„ÄÅË•øÈ≠è„ÄÅÂåóÈΩê„ÄÅÂîê„ÄÅÂÆã„ÄÅÈáë„ÄÅÊòéÔºå‰ª•ÂèäÊ∏Ö‰ª£ÈõçÊ≠£Âπ¥Èó¥ÔºåËØ•Áü≥Á™üÁæ§ÈÉΩÈáç‰øÆËøá„ÄÇ‰ΩõÂÉèÁöÑÈõïÈÄ†Ôºå‰ª•ÂåóÈ≠è‰∏∫‰∏ªÔºåÂú®ÂåóÈΩêÂíåÂîê‰ª£ÊòØÂèàËøõË°å‰∫ÜËæÉÂ§öÁöÑÂºÄÂáø„ÄÇÁé∞Â≠òÁü≥Á™ü5‰∏™„ÄÅÂçÉ‰ΩõÈæõ1‰∏™„ÄÅÊë©Â¥ñÈÄ†ÂÉè3Â∞ä„ÄÅÊë©Â¥ñÈÄ†ÂÉèÈæõ225‰∏™„ÄÅÁ¢ëÂàªÈ¢òËÆ∞256Êñπ„ÄÅ‰ΩõÂÉè7743Â∞ä„ÄÇÊçÆÂîê‰ª£ÈæôÊúî‰∫åÂπ¥Ôºà662Âπ¥ÔºâÁöÑ„ÄäÂêéÈ≠èÂ≠ùÊñáÂ∏ùÊïÖÂ∏åÁéÑÂØ∫‰πãÁ¢ë„ÄãËÆ∞ËΩΩÔºåÂåóÈ≠èÂ≠ùÊñáÂ∏ùÂú®Ê≠§ÂàõÂª∫‰ºΩËìù„ÄÇ ÊòéÂºòÊ≤ª‰∏ÉÂπ¥Ôºà1494Âπ¥ÔºâÈáç‰øÆÁ¢ëËÆ∞ËΩΩÔºö‚ÄúËá™ÂêéÈ≠èÂÆ£Ê≠¶Â∏ùÊôØÊòé‰πãÈó¥ÔºåÂáøÁü≥‰∏∫Á™üÔºåÂàª‰ΩõÂçÉ‰∏áÂÉèÔºå‰∏ñÊó†ËÉΩÁÉõÂÖ∂Êï∞ËÄÖ„ÄÇ‚Äù ‰∏≠Âçé‰∫∫Ê∞ëÂÖ±ÂíåÂõΩÊàêÁ´ãÂâçÔºåÂêÑÁ™üË¢´‰∏•ÈáçÁõóÁ™ÉÔºåÈôàÂàóÂú®ÁæéÂõΩÂìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÂ≠¶Á¶èÊ†ºËâ∫ÊúØÂçöÁâ©È¶ÜÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ∞äËè©Ëê®ÂÉèÂ∞±ÊòØ‰ªéÁ¨¨‰∫îÁ™üË•øÂ£Å‰ΩõÈæõÂåó‰æßÁõóÂáøÁöÑ„ÄÇÁ¨¨ 3„ÄÅ4„ÄÅ5Á™üÂèäÂçÉ‰ΩõÈæõË¢´Ê≥•Á†ÇÊ∑§Âüã3/2‰ª•‰∏äÔºå1954Âπ¥ÂØπÂêÑÁ™üÂÜÖÁöÑÊ∑§ÂúüËøõË°å‰∫ÜÊ∏ÖÁêÜÔºåÊñ∞Âª∫‰∫ÜÁü≥Á™üÂØ∫‰øùÊä§Êàø„ÄÇ 1973Âπ¥‰ª•ÂêéÔºåÂØπÁü≥Á™üÂØ∫ËøõË°å‰∫ÜÂÖ®Èù¢ÂåñÂ≠¶ÂêàÂâÇÊäÄÊúØÁ≤òÊé•„ÄÅÂãæÁºù„ÄÅ‰øÆË°•„ÄÇÂè¶Â§ñËøò‰øÆÂª∫‰∫ÜÂ§ßÂûãÊéíÊ∞¥Ê≤üÔºåÊâ©Âª∫Âõ¥Â¢ôÂíåÂÖ∂‰ªñÂª∫Á≠ë„ÄÇ 1982Âπ¥‰∏≠Âçé‰∫∫Ê∞ëÂÖ±ÂíåÂõΩÂõΩÂä°Èô¢Â∞ÜÂÖ∂Âàó‰∏∫ÂÖ®ÂõΩÈáçÁÇπÊñáÁâ©‰øùÊä§Âçï‰Ωç„ÄÇÂ∑©ÂéøÁü≥Á™üÁöÑËßÑÊ®°Êï¥ÈΩêÁîª‰∏ÄÔºåÁ™üÂÆ§ÁöÑÁªìÊûÑ‰ª•‰∏≠ÂøÉÊü±‰∏∫‰∏ªÔºåÂë®Â£ÅÊï¥ÈΩêÂú∞Â∏ÉÊª°ÂçÉ‰ΩõÂõæ‰∏éÁ§º‰ΩõÂõæÔºåÊúâÂæàÂº∫ÁöÑËßÑÂæãÊÄßÔºå‰∏î‰∫éÁ™üÂ§ñÂ£ÅÈù¢‰∏äÈõïÂ°ëÂá∫ÂäõÂ£´„ÄÅÁ´ã‰Ωõ„ÄÅ‰ª•ÂèäÁª¥Êë©ÊñáÊÆäÁ≠âÈÄ†ÂÉèÔºåË°®ÊòéÂú®ÂºÄÂáø‰πãÂàùÔºåÁªèËøá‰∫ÜÂë®ÂØÜÁöÑËßÑÂàí„ÄÇÁü≥Á™üÂÜÖÁöÑÂ∏ÉÂ±ÄÁÆÄÊ¥ÅÊòéÂø´Ôºå‰∫à‰∫∫Êï¥‰Ωì‰πãÊÑü„ÄÇ ‰∏≠ÂøÉÊü±Á™ü‰∏∫Â∑©ÂéøÁü≥Á™üÂØ∫ÁöÑ‰∏ªË¶ÅÁ™üÂΩ¢„ÄÇÈæôÈó®Áü≥Á™üÂåó‰∏éÂ∑©ÂéøÁü≥Á™üÁöÑÂú∞ÁêÜ‰ΩçÁΩÆ„ÄÅÊó∂Èó¥ÂùáÁõ∏ËøëÔºå‰ΩÜÈæôÈó®Áü≥Á™üÂπ∂Ê≤°ÊúâÂá∫Áé∞‰∏≠ÂøÉÊü±Á™ü„ÄÇ']

column5: ['Jard√≠n Bot√°nico Culiac√°n', 'Tomateros Stadium', 'Estadio Banorte']
column6: ['El Jard√≠n Bot√°nico Culiac√°n es un espacio p√∫blico de 10 hect√°reas ubicado en Culiac√°n, M√©xico, cuyas principales funciones son la conservaci√≥n de especies bot√°nicas, la investigaci√≥n cient√≠fica, la educaci√≥n ambiental y la promoci√≥n cultural.Este muestrario de bot√°nica internacional cuenta con m√°s de 1,000 diferentes espec√≠menes de plantas, de m√°s de 400 g√©neros y de alrededor de 100 familias, agrupados en 19 colecciones. A su vez, estas especies bot√°nicas conviven con piezas de arte contempor√°neo y espacios arquitect√≥nicos de primer nivel, introducidos al jard√≠n con la finalidad de enriquecer la experiencia del visitante durante su recorrido por el lugar.', 'Estadio Tomateros is a professional baseball stadium in Culiac√°n, Mexico, it is home to the Tomateros de Culiac√°n of the Mexican Pacific League. The stadium replaced Estadio General √Ångel Flores as home of Tomateros. It has also hosted the 2017 Caribbean Series. It is considered to be one of the premiere baseball stadiums in all of Latin America.', 'Estadio Dorados is a stadium with a capacity of 21,000 seats. Is home of the team Dorados de Sinaloa. The stadium was inaugurated on August 9, 2003 in a match played between Dorados de Sinaloa and Cobras de Ciudad Ju√°rez. The final score was Dorados 4-2 Cobras. The first goal scored in this stage was the work of Hector Gim√©nez. The building has a capacity for 20,108 fans, the same that is constructed in 2003 in record time of just three months.2007 CONCACAF U20 Tournament, Primera Divisi√≥n A, Primera Divisi√≥n, ConcertsList of football stadiums in Mexico']

column6: ['La fuente de Neptuno de la Ciudad de Quer√©taro es una obra del siglo XVIII realizada por el celayense Francisco Eduardo Tresguerras, la cual tiene bajo un arco la figura de Neptuno, dios romano de las aguas y los mares, con dos peces sobre unas olas.Construida en 1797, originalmente se encontraba en la entonces huerta del convento de San Antonio, luego mercado, ahora jard√≠n de la Corregidora en las hoy calles 16 de Septiembre y Corregidora.', 'Quer√©taro (Spanish pronunciation: [keÀà…æeta…æo]), officially the Free and Sovereign State of Quer√©taro (Spanish: Estado Libre y Soberano de Quer√©taro; Otomi: Hyodi Nd√§mxei), is one of the 32 federal entities of Mexico. It is divided into 18 municipalities. Its capital city is Santiago de Quer√©taro. It is located in North-Central Mexico, in a region known as Baj√≠o. It is bordered by the states of San Luis Potos√≠ to the north, Guanajuato to the west, Hidalgo to the east, M√©xico to the southeast and Michoac√°n to the southwest.', 'Teatro de la Rep√∫blica (literally, Theater of the Republic) is a theater in the historic center of the city of Quer√©taro, M√©xico. It is one of the most important historic buildings in the city.', 'The Cerro de las Campanas ("Hill of the Bells") is a hill and national park located in Quer√©taro City, Mexico. It is most noteworthy as the place where Emperor Maximilian I and Generals Miguel Miram√≥n and Tom√°s Mej√≠a were executed, definitively ending the Second French intervention in Mexico. The mountain gets its name from rocks that make bell sounds when struck.', 'The Cerro de las Campanas ("Hill of the Bells") is a hill and national park located in Quer√©taro City, Mexico. It is most noteworthy as the place where Emperor Maximilian I and Generals Miguel Miram√≥n and Tom√°s Mej√≠a were executed, definitively ending the Second French intervention in Mexico. The mountain gets its name from rocks that make bell sounds when struck.', 'La Zona de monumentos hist√≥ricos de Quer√©taro es un Patrimonio de la Humanidad declarado por la Unesco desde 1996. Se encuentra en el estado de Quer√©taro, M√©xico.La antigua ciudad colonial de Santiago de Quer√©taro es singular por haber mantenido al lado del plano primitivo de la ciudad con sus calles sinuosas, el plano geom√©trico de las ciudades indias trazadas por los espa√±oles. Los otom√≠es, tarascos, chichimecas y espa√±oles convivieron en paz en la ciudad, que destaca por sus ornamentos barrocos y numerosos monumentos, c√≠vicos y religiosos, su edad de oro fue en los siglos XVII y XVIII.', 'Estadio Corregidora de Quer√©taro is a stadium in Quer√©taro City, Mexico. Named for Mexican War of Independence heroine Josefa Ortiz de Dom√≠nguez ("La Corregidora"), it has a capacity of 33,162 and is located on the outskirts of the city of Quer√©taro, 211 kilometres (131 mi) north of Mexico City. This venue is used mostly for football games. It is the home of Quer√©taro FC and was one of the venues for the 1986 FIFA World Cup.Built in 1985 in a collaboration between Mexican and European partners, it is considered one of the most notable stadiums in Mexico. Its design allows for the safe exit of all spectators even if full in less than seven minutes.', 'El parque Nacional El Cimatario es una reserva natural mexicana ubicada en el estado de Quer√©taro entre los l√≠mites de los municipios de Huimilpan y Quer√©taro, el parque y el cerro se ubican en lo que alguna vez, hace cerca de 5 millones de a√±os fue un volc√°n el cual ha permanecido inactivo y no muestra signos de actividad.Este parque nacional, se convirti√≥ en √°rea protegida por decreto, el d√≠a 7 de julio de 1982, por ser una porci√≥n de territorio representativa de diversos ecosistemas, poseer una gran riqueza biol√≥gica e hist√≥rica y ser un sitio que produce beneficios ambientales a la regi√≥n central del pa√≠s y principalmente a toda el √°rea metropolitana de la ciudad de Quer√©taro.', 'El parque Nacional El Cimatario es una reserva natural mexicana ubicada en el estado de Quer√©taro entre los l√≠mites de los municipios de Huimilpan y Quer√©taro, el parque y el cerro se ubican en lo que alguna vez, hace cerca de 5 millones de a√±os fue un volc√°n el cual ha permanecido inactivo y no muestra signos de actividad.Este parque nacional, se convirti√≥ en √°rea protegida por decreto, el d√≠a 7 de julio de 1982, por ser una porci√≥n de territorio representativa de diversos ecosistemas, poseer una gran riqueza biol√≥gica e hist√≥rica y ser un sitio que produce beneficios ambientales a la regi√≥n central del pa√≠s y principalmente a toda el √°rea metropolitana de la ciudad de Quer√©taro.']

column6: ["The siege of Krak√≥w was one of the battles during the Swedish invasion of Polish‚ÄìLithuanian Commonwealth (Second Northern War / Deluge). It started on 25 September 1655 and ended on 13 October 1655. Capitulation treatment was signed 4 days later. Polish troops marched out the city on 19 October. The city's defense was led by Kiev's castellan Stefan Czarniecki, while Swedish forces were commanded by king Charles Gustav and Arvid Wittenberg.", 'The Siege of Krak√≥w was one of the military conflicts of the Swedish and Transylvanian invasion of Poland, which took place in the summer of 1657. The royal city of Krak√≥w, had been occupied for two years by a Swedish-Transylvanian garrison led by Paul Wirtz and J√°nos Bethlen. It was besieged by Polish Army of Hetman Jerzy Lubomirski, supported by soldiers of the Holy Roman Empire under Austrian Field Marshal Melchior von Hatzfeldt.', "The Krak√≥w Cloth Hall (Polish: Sukiennice, pronounced [suk ≤…õÀà…≤ÀêitÕ°s…õ]), in Lesser Poland, dates to the Renaissance and is one of the city's most recognizable icons. It is the central feature of the main market square in the Krak√≥w Old Town (the historic center of Krak√≥w), which since 1978 has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site).It was once a major centre of international trade. Travelling merchants met there to discuss business and to barter. During its golden age in the 15th century, the hall was the source of a variety of exotic imports from the east ‚Äì spices, silk, leather and wax ‚Äì while Krak√≥w itself exported textiles, lead, and salt from the Wieliczka Salt Mine.", "The Krak√≥w Cloth Hall (Polish: Sukiennice, pronounced [suk ≤…õÀà…≤ÀêitÕ°s…õ]), in Lesser Poland, dates to the Renaissance and is one of the city's most recognizable icons. It is the central feature of the main market square in the Krak√≥w Old Town (the historic center of Krak√≥w), which since 1978 has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site).It was once a major centre of international trade. Travelling merchants met there to discuss business and to barter. During its golden age in the 15th century, the hall was the source of a variety of exotic imports from the east ‚Äì spices, silk, leather and wax ‚Äì while Krak√≥w itself exported textiles, lead, and salt from the Wieliczka Salt Mine.", "The Gallery of 19th-Century Polish Art at Sukiennice (Polish: Galeria Sztuki Polskiej XIX wieku w Sukiennicach), is a division of the National Museum, Krak√≥w, Poland. The Gallery is housed on the upper floor of the Renaissance Sukiennice Cloth Hall in the center of the Main Market Square in Old Town Krak√≥w.The Gallery holds the largest permanent exhibit of the 19th-century Polish painting and sculpture, in four grand rooms. The majority of today's collection at Sukiennice comprises gifts from collectors, artists and their families.", 'Adam Mickiewicz Monument in Krak√≥w, (Polish: pomnik Adama Mickiewicza w Krakowie), is one of the best known bronze monuments in Poland, and a favourite meeting place at the Main Market Square in the Old Town (Stare Miasto) district of Krak√≥w.The statue of Adam Mickiewicz, the greatest Polish Romantic poet of the 19th century, was unveiled on June 16, 1898, on the 100th anniversary of his birth, in the presence of his daughter and son. It was designed by Teodor Rygier, a little-known sculptor at the time, who won the third and final competition for this project by popular demand ahead of over 60 artists in total, the renowned painter Jan Matejko included.', "Krak√≥w Old Town is the historic central district of Krak√≥w, Poland. It is one of the most famous old districts in Poland today and was the center of Poland's political life from 1038 until King Sigismund III Vasa relocated his court to Warsaw in 1596.The entire medieval old town is among the first sites chosen for the UNESCO's original World Heritage List, inscribed as Cracow's Historic Centre. The old town is also one of Poland's official national Historic Monuments (Pomnik historii) chosen in the first round, as designated September 16, 1994, and tracked by the National Heritage Board of Poland.", "The underground square central museum of Krak√≥w is situated below the market square of the city and has an area of over 6000 square metres.Work on the underground square first began at the start of 2009 and cost 38 million zloty. The museum first opened on 24 September 2010, at the time only displaying regular exhibitions. The main feature ‚ÄúIn the footsteps of Krakow‚Äôs European identity‚Äù was launched three days after the museum's opening, on 27 September 2010.", "The Gallery of 19th-Century Polish Art at Sukiennice (Polish: Galeria Sztuki Polskiej XIX wieku w Sukiennicach), is a division of the National Museum, Krak√≥w, Poland. The Gallery is housed on the upper floor of the Renaissance Sukiennice Cloth Hall in the center of the Main Market Square in Old Town Krak√≥w.The Gallery holds the largest permanent exhibit of the 19th-century Polish painting and sculpture, in four grand rooms. The majority of today's collection at Sukiennice comprises gifts from collectors, artists and their families.", 'The main square (Polish: Rynek G≈Ç√≥wny [Ààr…®n…õk Àà…°wuvn…®]) of the Old Town of Krak√≥w, Lesser Poland, is the principal urban space located at the center of the city. It dates back to the 13th century, and at 3.79 ha (9.4 acres) is the largest medieval town square in Europe. The Project for Public Spaces (PPS) lists the square as the best public space in Europe due to its lively street life, and it was a major factor in the inclusion of Krak√≥w as one of the top off-the-beaten-path destinations in the world in 2016.', 'Pomnik Piotra Skrzyneckiego ‚Äì pomnik znajdujƒÖcy siƒô w Krakowie na Starym Mie≈õcie, na Rynku G≈Ç√≥wnym 29 przed KamienicƒÖ Pod BlachƒÖ.Piotr Skrzynecki tw√≥rca i kierownik artystyczny, re≈ºyser i scenarzysta oraz konferansjer kabaretu Piwnica pod Baranami, siedzƒÖcy przy stoliku, w ulubionym kƒÖcie ogr√≥dka drink baru Vis-√†-Vis, w miejscu bƒôdƒÖcym nieformalnym biurem Piwnicy, tam gdzie spotykali siƒô arty≈õci z niƒÖ zwiƒÖzani.Na stoliku fili≈ºanka kawy, w rƒôku zawsze ≈õwie≈ºe kwiaty.Pomnik z brƒÖzu jest dzie≈Çem Krystyny Borkowskiej-Niemojewskiej i ≈Åukasza Niemojewskiego. Ufundowa≈Ç go Zbigniew Preisner z W≈Çadys≈Çawem Bartoszewskim. Ods≈Çoniƒôty zosta≈Ç 29 czerwca 2000 roku.', "The Piwnica pod Baranami (English: The Basement, or the Cellar under the Rams) is a Polish literary cabaret located in Krak√≥w, Poland. For over thirty years, in the People's Republic of Poland, Piwnica pod Baranami served as the most renowned political cabaret in the country, until the end of (and beyond) the communist era. Created by Piotr Skrzynecki in 1956, the cabaret continues its activities, contrary to rumours that it has been closed after the death of its founder in 1997. It resides at its original location in the medieval Old Town district, at the Main Market Square (next to Vis-√°-vis caf√©).", "The Altarpiece by Veit Stoss (Polish: O≈Çtarz Wita Stwosza), also St. Mary's Altar (O≈Çtarz Mariacki), is a large Gothic altarpiece and a national treasure of Poland. It is located behind the high altar of St. Mary's Basilica in the city of Krak√≥w. Jagiello≈Ñska, od po≈Çudniowego zachodu Collegium Minus i Collegium Witkowskiego a od p√≥≈Çnocnego zachodu Planty.Pierwsze wzmianki o ogrodzie pojawiajƒÖ siƒô w 1467 roku. Jego kuratorkƒÖ jest Anna Litak.', 'Pomnik Kraka ‚Äì pomnik znajdujƒÖcy siƒô w Krakowie na Starym Mie≈õcie przy ulicy Siennej 16, na dziedzi≈Ñcu Archiwum Narodowego.Modernistyczna rze≈∫ba przedstawiajƒÖca walczƒÖcego ze smokiem Kraka wykonana zosta≈Ça z czerwonego piaskowca przez Franciszka Kalfasa w 1929. We wrze≈õniu tego samego roku zosta≈Ça nagrodzona na Powszechnej Wystawie Krajowej w Poznaniu.Lista krakowskich pomnik√≥wEncyklopedia Krakowa, redakcja Antoni Henryk Stachowski, Wydawnictwo Naukowe PWN, 2000, ISBN 83-01-13325-2.', "Muzeum Farmacji Collegium Medicum Uniwersytetu Jagiello≈Ñskiego (Pharmacy Museum, Jagiellonian University Medical College) is a museum on Floria≈Ñska Street, Krak√≥w, Poland, specializing in the history of pharmacy and pharmaceutical technology. It was established in 1946.The founder and first director of the museum was Dr. Stanislaw Pron, legal counsel and administrative director of the Regional Chamber of Pharmacists in Krak√≥w. Until the late 1980s, the museum was housed in the building at 3 ul. Basztowa. It was then transferred to the newly renovated building at ul. St. Florian's, where it remains today.", 'Galeria Sztuki Wsp√≥≈Çczesnej ‚ÄûBunkier Sztuki‚Äù ‚Äì galeria sztuki w Krakowie, powsta≈Ça w roku 1965, zaliczana do najwa≈ºniejszych polskich instytucji prezentujƒÖcych sztukƒô wsp√≥≈ÇczesnƒÖ. Jest to artystycznie niezale≈ºna instytucja kultury, finansowana przez Miasto Krak√≥w.', "Floria≈Ñska Street or St. Florian's Street (Polish: ulica Floria≈Ñska, Latin: platea Sancti Floriani) is one of the main streets in Krak√≥w Old Town and one of the most famous promenades in the city. The street forms part of the regular grid plan of Stare Miasto (the Old Town), the merchants' town that extends the medieval heart of the city, which was drawn up in 1257 after the destruction of the city during the first Mongol invasion of Poland of 1241.", "The Nicolaus Copernicus Monument in Krak√≥w (Polish: Pomnik Miko≈Çaja Kopernika) is a notable landmark of Krak√≥w, Poland. It memorializes the astronomer Copernicus, who studied at the Krak√≥w Academy and whose father came from that city, then the capital of Poland.The statue, designed by sculptor Cyprian Godebski in 1899, was completed in 1900. It originally stood in the courtyard of the Jagiellonian University's Collegium Maius. In 1953 it was moved to Krak√≥w's Planty Park, in front of the Collegium Witkowski building.Nicolaus Copernicus Monument in Toru≈Ñ Nicolaus Copernicus Monument in WarsawMedia related to Nicolaus Copernicus Monument in Krak√≥w at Wikimedia Commons", 'Muzeum i Archiwum Marii Angeli Truszkowskiej ‚Äì B≈Çogos≈Çawionej Za≈Ço≈ºycielki Si√≥str Felicjanek ‚Äì jedno z krakowskich muze√≥w ko≈õcielnych, zlokalizowane w zabytkowej kamienicy, budynku, bƒôdƒÖcym domem zakonnym Zgromadzenia Si√≥str Felicjanek, a znajdujƒÖcym siƒô przy ul. Muzeum jest czynne w dni powszednie od 10:00 do 14:00.Oficjalna strona muzeum', 'Pa≈Çac Sztuki ‚Äì gmach Towarzystwa Przyjaci√≥≈Ç Sztuk Piƒôknych w Krakowie przy Placu Szczepa≈Ñskim 4.', 'Dom Jana Matejki w Krakowie, muzeum po≈õwiƒôcone Janowi Matejce, za≈Ço≈ºone w 1895, od 1904 oddzia≈Ç Muzeum Narodowego w Krakowie.', 'Dom pod Krzy≈ºem ‚Äì zabytkowy budynek przy ulicy Szpitalnej 21 w Krakowie. Mie≈õci siƒô w nim Oddzia≈Ç Teatralny Muzeum Historycznego Miasta Krakowa (od 2008 udostƒôpniany tylko podczas wystaw czasowych).', "The Princes Czartoryski Museum (Polish: Muzeum KsiƒÖ≈ºƒÖt Czartoryskich [muÀàz…õum Ààk…ï…îÃÉ ê…înt t Çart…îÀàr…®sk ≤ix]) ‚Äì often abbreviated to Czartoryski Museum ‚Äì is a historic museum in Krak√≥w, Poland, and one of the country's oldest museums. The initial collection was formed in 1796 in Pu≈Çawy by Princess Izabela Czartoryska. The Museum officially opened in 1878.The Pu≈Çawy collection was partly destroyed after the November 1830 Uprising and the confiscation of the Czartoryski properties. Most of the Museum holdings, however, were saved and moved to Paris, where they reposed at the H√¥tel Lambert. In 1870 Prince W≈Çadys≈Çaw Czartoryski decided to move the collections to Krak√≥w, where they arrived in 1876.", 'Pomnik Fryderyka Chopina ‚Äì pomnik polskiego pianisty i kompozytora Fryderyka Chopina na Plantach w Krakowie.', 'The Krak√≥w Museum of Insurance (Polish: Muzeum Ubezpiecze≈Ñ w Krakowie) is a former museum in Krak√≥w, Poland which was dedicated to insurances. It was established in 1987. It was the only such museum in existence devoted to all aspects of the history of insurance in Poland and in formerly Polish lands. The director of the museum was Marianna Halota. The collections of the museum encompassed two centuries of rare artifacts and memorabilia including over 35,000 historic documents and certificates from 28 countries.', 'The Krak√≥w Philharmonic (Polish: Filharmonia Krakowska) is the primary concert hall in Krak√≥w, Poland. It is one of the largest auditoriums in the city. It consists of the main hall for orchestral performances with 693 seats, and two smaller venues, the Golden Hall and the Blue Hall, for chamber music concerts.', 'The Bagatela Theatre in Krak√≥w is situated at the junction of Karmelicka Street and Krupniczej Street. The theatre\'s intimate "new stage" is located on Sarego J√≥zefa Street.', 'Muzeum Geologiczne Instytutu Nauk Geologicznych PAN w Krakowie is a museum in Krak√≥w, Poland. The collection dates back to 1865.Official website', 'The Archaeological Museum of Krak√≥w (Polish: Muzeum Archeologiczne w Krakowie) is a historic museum in Krak√≥w, Lesser Poland Voivodeship, Poland. It was established in 1850.', 'Ogr√≥d Muzeum Archeologicznego ‚Äì zabytkowy ogr√≥d o powierzchni oko≈Ço 0,5 ha, znajdujƒÖcy siƒô w Krakowie na Starym Mie≈õcie przy ul. Poselskiej 3 u podn√≥≈ºa Wzg√≥rza Wawelskiego.Jest to renesansowe za≈Ço≈ºenie ogrodowe powsta≈Çe przy dawnym klasztorze karmelit√≥w bosych, jest te≈º jednym z wiƒôkszych ogrod√≥w na krakowskim Starym Mie≈õcie,W roku 1961 rozpoczƒôto rekonstrukcjƒô ogrodu. Aby ustaliƒá jego pierwotny wyglƒÖd pos≈Çu≈ºono siƒô dawnymi planami Krakowa: tzw. Ko≈Ç≈ÇƒÖtajowskim z roku 1785, Mosano i Chavana z 1796 roku oraz tzw. Senackim S. Enderle z lat 1802-1808.', 'Planty is one of the largest city parks in Krak√≥w, Poland. It encircles the Stare Miasto (Old Town), where the Medieval city walls used to stand until the early 19th century. The historic Old Town is not to be confused with the Administrative District No. 1 Stare Miasto extending further east.', 'Juliusz S≈Çowacki Theatre (Polish: Teatr im. Juliusza S≈Çowackiego w Krakowie) is a 19th-century Eclectic theatre-opera house in the heart of Krak√≥w, Poland, and a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Erected in 1893, it was modeled after some of the best European Baroque and Eclectic theatres such as the Palais Garnier in Paris. The theatre was named after Polish poet Juliusz S≈Çowacki in 1909 and in 1978 was inscribed alongside the Historic Centre of Krak√≥w into the World Heritage Register.', 'Pomnik Piotra Skargi w Krakowie ‚Äì pomnik jezuickiego teologa i kaznodziei, Piotra Skargi, znajdujƒÖcy siƒô na placu Marii Magdaleny w Krakowie, naprzeciwko ko≈õcio≈Ça ≈õw. Piotra i Paw≈Ça, gdzie pochowany jest Skarga. Jego autorem jest Czes≈Çaw D≈∫wigaj, a fundatorem Arcybractwo Mi≈Çosierdzia.Pomnik Piotra Skargi zosta≈Ç ods≈Çoniƒôty 12 maja 2001 w obecno≈õci √≥wczesnego prezydenta miasta Andrzeja Go≈Çasia, kardyna≈Ça Franciszka Macharskiego, biskupa Kazimierza Nycza, przedstawicieli Arcybractwa, Kurii i samorzƒÖdu oraz krakowian.', 'Pomnik Jana Matejki ‚Äì pomnik po≈Ço≈ºony w Krakowie przy ul. Basztowej, na Plantach, po zachodniej stronie Barbakanu naprzeciwko ASP, w rejonie gdzie do 1997 znajdowa≈Ç siƒô pomnik ≈ºo≈Çnierzy Armii Radzieckiej.Przedstawia Jana Matejkƒô siedzƒÖcego w fotelu, umieszczonego w ramie obrazu. Postaƒá wykonana z brƒÖzu umieszczona jest na cokole z czerwonego granitu. Na cokole umieszczono wykuty, w bia≈Çym kolorze napis: Jan Matejko 1838-1893.', 'The Emeryk Hutten-Czapski Museum (Also the Czapski Museum) is a branch of the National Museum of Krak√≥w, 12 Pilsudski Street, Krak√≥w.', 'Pomnik Tadeusza Rejtana ‚Äì pomnik znajdujƒÖcy siƒô w Krakowie na Skwerze prof. W≈Çadys≈Çawa Bartoszewskiego, u zbiegu ulic Basztowej, Dunajewskiego i Garbarskiej.', 'Nowy ≈öwiat, zwany tak≈ºe Smole≈Ñsko ‚Äì obszar Krakowa wchodzƒÖcy w sk≈Çad Dzielnicy I Stare Miasto. W latach 1859‚Äì1951 stanowi≈Ç odrƒôbnƒÖ III dzielnicƒô katastralnƒÖ miasta. NazwƒÖ Nowy ≈öwiat okre≈õla siƒô teren pomiƒôdzy ulicami Straszewskiego, Podzamcze, rzekƒÖ Wis≈ÇƒÖ, Krasi≈Ñskiego, Pi≈Çsudskiego, GarncarskƒÖ, pl. Sikorskiego, Jab≈Çonowskich, Loreta≈ÑskƒÖ, Kapucy≈ÑskƒÖ.W 1994 Nowy ≈öwiat wraz ze Starym Miastem, Wawelem, Stradomiem, Piaskiem, Kazimierzem i Podg√≥rzem zosta≈Ç uznany za pomnik historii.Encyklopedia Krakowa, Antoni HenrykA.H. Stachowski (red.), El≈ºbietaE. Adamczyk, Warszawa: PWN, 2000, ISBN 83-01-13325-2, OCLC 830213257 .', 'The Krak√≥w Barbican (Polish: Barbakan Krakowski) is a barbican ‚Äì a fortified outpost once connected to the city walls. It is a historic gateway leading into the Old Town of Krak√≥w, Poland. The barbican is one of the few remaining relics of the complex network of fortifications and defensive barriers that once encircled the royal city of Krak√≥w in the south of Poland. It currently serves as a tourist attraction and venue for a variety of exhibitions.Today the Barbican is under the jurisdiction of The Historical Museum of the City of Krak√≥w. Tourists may tour its interior with its displays outlining the historical development of fortifications in Krak√≥w.', 'Pa≈Çac biskupa Erazma Cio≈Çka ‚Äì zabytkowy pa≈Çac z XVI wieku znajdujƒÖcy siƒô przy ulicy Kanoniczej 17 w Krakowie. Obecnie oddzia≈Ç Muzeum Narodowego w Krakowie.W 1505 staraniem biskupa p≈Çockiego Erazma Cio≈Çka po≈ÇƒÖczono dwa domy, tworzƒÖc tzw. curia ampla, czyli wielki dw√≥r, uchodzƒÖcy w XVI wieku za najokazalszy przy ulicy Kanoniczej. Kolejnymi w≈Ça≈õcicielami pa≈Çacu byli Miko≈Çaj Wolski, a nastƒôpnie kardyna≈Ç Jerzy Radziwi≈Ç≈Ç, kt√≥ry dokona≈Ç kolejnej przebudowy rezydencji.', "The EUROPEUM ‚Äì European Culture Centre is a division of the Krak√≥w National Museum housing a permanent exhibition of European art. Placed on two floors in a restored 17th century granary, the museum was opened to the public on 13 September 2013.The museum's building, an old granary from the 17th century, is located in Krak√≥w's Old Town (Stare Miasto) in proximity to a Capuchin monastery. After World War II it became property of the National Museum and in 1969 held a furniture storehouse."]

column6: ["The Penang Islamic Museum (Malay: Muzium Islam Pulau Pinang) is a museum about Islam in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The museum is housed in a restored villa originally built in 1860 that was once the residence of a powerful Acehnese pepper merchant. Later it was used as a recycling depot for Penang's Indian Chettiar community. Restoration work was carried out in 1996 and it was awarded the Best Project award in 1999.The museum building features mid 19th century Straits style.", 'The Sun Yat-sen Museum Penang (Malay: Muzium Sun Yat-sen Pulau Pinang; Chinese: Â≠´‰∏≠Â±±ÊßüÂüéÂü∫Âú∞ÂçöÁâ©È§®) formerly called the Sun Yat-sen Penang Base, is a museum in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. The museum is dedicated to Sun Yat-sen, a Chinese nationalist who established the Republic of China after his efforts in the Xinhai Revolution.The Sun Yat-sen Museum Penang is in a historic house. The museum building is the same house where Sun Yat-sen devised many of his plans to overthrow the Qing Dynasty. In 1910, acting on the immense support among overseas Chinese for the ousting of the Qing dynasty, Sun shifted the southeast Asian headquarters of the Tongmenghui party to Penang.', 'The Camera Museum (Malay: Muzium Kamera; Tamil: ‡Æ®‡Æø‡Æ¥‡Æ±‡Øç‡Æ™‡Æü‡Æï‡Øç ‡Æï‡Æ∞‡ØÅ‡Æµ‡Æø ‡ÆÖ‡Æ∞‡ØÅ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡Ææ‡Æü‡Øç‡Æö‡Æø‡ÆØ‡Æï‡ÆÆ‡Øç) is a museum in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The museum started its operation on 31 August 2013 and was officiated on 9 October 2013 by Penang Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng.The museum is housed in a two-story shop house building with a total floor area of 325 m2, which is divided into Dark Room, Obscura Room and Pinhole Room. It also features a cafe and souvenir shop.The museum displays up to 1,000 vintage cameras and accessories.The museum regularly holds exhibition and festival events every month.List of museums in MalaysiaCamera Museum on Facebook', 'The Batik Painting Museum Penang (Malay: Muzium Lukisan Batik Pulau Pinang) is a museum about batik in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The building was purchased in 2010 and underwent a three-year renovation before it was opened on 1 October 2013.The museum is located in a three-story Straits eclectic-style shop house with a total area of 650 m2.', "The Cheong Fatt Tze Mansion is a government gazetted heritage building located on Leith Street in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. The mansion's external decorations and indigo-blue outer walls make it a very distinctive building, and it is sometimes referred to as The Blue Mansion. Built by the merchant Cheong Fatt Tze at the end of the 19th century, the mansion has 38 rooms, 5 granite-paved courtyards, 7 staircases and 220 vernacular timber louvre windows. It served as Cheong's private residence as well as the seat of his business activities in Penang.", "Pitt Street or Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling in Malay is a major thoroughfare in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. One of the oldest roads in the city centre, it was named after William Pitt the Younger, the Prime Minister of Great Britain in 1786.Four places of worship, each of a different religion - Islam, Taoism, Hinduism and Christianity - are located within metres of one another along this street, earning it its nickname, the Street of Harmony. Located within the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site, the street's nickname also reflects the harmonious coexistence of various religions and cultures that have lived here for centuries.", "Pitt Street or Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling in Malay is a major thoroughfare in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. One of the oldest roads in the city centre, it was named after William Pitt the Younger, the Prime Minister of Great Britain in 1786.Four places of worship, each of a different religion - Islam, Taoism, Hinduism and Christianity - are located within metres of one another along this street, earning it its nickname, the Street of Harmony. Located within the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site, the street's nickname also reflects the harmonious coexistence of various religions and cultures that have lived here for centuries.", "George Town is the capital city of the Malaysian state of Penang. George Town is Malaysia's third most populous city with 708,127 inhabitants as of 2010, while Greater Penang, with a population of 2,412,616, is the second largest conurbation in the country after Greater Kuala Lumpur. The historical core of George Town has been inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2008.", 'The Penang State Museum and Art Gallery (Malay: Muzium dan Balai Seni Lukis Negeri Pulau Pinang) is a museum and art gallery in George Town, Penang, Malaysia.The museum building used to house the Penang Free School in 1821‚Äì1927. After Penang Free School moved to a new building in Green Lane, the Hutchings School took over the building in January 1928 and used it until 1960. The museum was opened by Yang di-Pertua Negeri of Penang Raja Uda Raja Muhammad on 14 April 1965. The building was declared a heritage building under the 2005 Heritage Act.', "Pitt Street or Jalan Masjid Kapitan Keling in Malay is a major thoroughfare in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. One of the oldest roads in the city centre, it was named after William Pitt the Younger, the Prime Minister of Great Britain in 1786.Four places of worship, each of a different religion - Islam, Taoism, Hinduism and Christianity - are located within metres of one another along this street, earning it its nickname, the Street of Harmony. Located within the city's UNESCO World Heritage Site, the street's nickname also reflects the harmonious coexistence of various religions and cultures that have lived here for centuries.", "The Pinang Peranakan Mansion (Malay: Rumah Agam Peranakan Pulau Pinang) in George Town, Penang, Malaysia, is a museum dedicated to Penang's Peranakan heritage. The museum itself is housed within a distinctive green-hued mansion at Church Street, George Town, which once served as the residence and office of a 19th-century Chinese tycoon, Chung Keng Quee.", 'The Esplanade is a waterfront location in the heart of George Town, Penang, Malaysia. It covers the field adjacent to Fort Cornwallis, known locally as the Padang, and the seaside promenade along the edge of the field. The Penang City Hall faces the Padang and the Cenotaph of Penang is also located along the promenade.', 'The City Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in George Town, Penang, Malaysia, and serves as the home stadium of the Penang state football team, Penang FA. The oldest built stadium still in use in Malaysia, it was built in 1932 by the British government.The stadium has a capacity of approximately 25,000 people and is now mainly used for football matches involving Penang FA, such as the Malaysian Super League. It is also well-known for the vociferous home support, dubbed the "Keramat Roar".', 'The Battle of Penang occurred on 28 October 1914, during World War I. It was a naval action in the Strait of Malacca, in which the German cruiser SMS Emden sank two Allied warships.At the time, Penang was part of the Straits Settlements, a British Crown colony. Penang is an island off the west coast of Malaya, now the present day Malaysia. It is only a short distance from the mainland. The main town of Penang, George Town, is on a harbor. In the early months of the war, it was heavily used by Allied naval and merchant vessels.', 'Gurney Wharf is a planned seafront park, with land for this purpose currently being reclaimed off Gurney Drive in George Town, Penang. Intended as a "new iconic waterfront destination for Penang", Phase 1 of Gurney Wharf is scheduled for completion by 2018.Upon the expected completion of Gurney Wharf by August 2021, the 24.28-hectare seafront park will comprise four distinct recreational areas - a beach, a coastal grove, a water garden, and a seaside retail food and beverages (F&B) area.', "The City Park, also colloquially known as the Youth Park, is an urban park in the city of George Town in Penang, Malaysia. Located near the Penang Botanic Gardens, the City Park was opened in 1972 as a recreational area and a green lung for the city's residents.True to its name, the City Park contains various recreational amenities, such as playgrounds, a skating rink, swimming pools, a graffiti corner, reflexology paths and an outdoor auditorium, all of which are open to the public. The park is maintained by the Penang Island City Council.", 'The Penang Botanic Gardens, (Malay: Taman Kebun Bunga;Tamil :‡Æ™‡Æø‡Æ©‡Ææ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡ØÅ ‡Æ§‡Ææ‡Æµ‡Æ∞‡Æµ‡Æø‡ÆØ‡Æ≤‡Øç ‡Æ™‡ØÇ‡Æô‡Øç‡Æï‡Ææ,Pi·πâƒÅ·πÖku TƒÅvaraviyal p≈´·πÖkƒÅ) also known as the "Waterfall Gardens" because of the cascading waterfall nearby, is a public park situated on Jalan Air Terjun (Waterfall Road) in George Town, Penang, Malaysia. The original gardens were established in 1884 from an old quarry site, under the supervision of Charles Curtis, who was the first superintendent.Prior to the establishment of the present gardens, there were two previous botanic gardens on Penang Island.', 'Penang Hill is a hill resort comprising a group of peaks on Penang Island, Malaysia. It is located within the Air Itam suburb, 9 km (5.6 mi) west of the center of George Town. Penang Hill is also known by the Malay name Bukit Bendera, which actually refers to Flagstaff Hill, the most developed peak. One of the peaks is known as Strawberry Hill, which was also the name of a house owned by Francis Light, founder of Penang colony. It is the highest point in the state of Penang.', 'Penang Hill is a hill resort comprising a group of peaks on Penang Island, Malaysia. It is located within the Air Itam suburb, 9 km (5.6 mi) west of the center of George Town. Penang Hill is also known by the Malay name Bukit Bendera, which actually refers to Flagstaff Hill, the most developed peak. One of the peaks is known as Strawberry Hill, which was also the name of a house owned by Francis Light, founder of Penang colony. It is the highest point in the state of Penang.']
