column6: ['Der Gerechtigkeitsbrunnen (auch Justitiabrunnen) ist ein Springbrunnen auf dem R√∂merberg in Frankfurt am Main und eines der Wahrzeichen der Stadt. Er geht auf einen Vorg√§ngerbau von 1543 an selber Stelle zur√ºck und entstand in seiner heutigen Form 1611. Zur Zeit des Heiligen R√∂mischen Reiches spielte er w√§hrend des Kr√∂nungszeremoniells eine besondere, wenn auch kurzfristige Rolle als Weinbrunnen f√ºr den Kaiser und dann auch f√ºr das Volk. Der gegenw√§rtig zu sehende Brunnen ist eine weitgehend detailgetreue Kopie aus dem Jahr 1887, die der Frankfurter Weinh√§ndler Gustav D. Manskopf finanzierte. Er steht unter Denkmalschutz.', 'The Schirn Kunsthalle is a Kunsthalle in Frankfurt, Germany, located in the old city between the R√∂mer and the Frankfurt Cathedral. The Schirn exhibits both modern and contemporary art. It is the main venue for temporary art exhibitions in Frankfurt. Exhibitions in recent years included retrospectives of Wassily Kandinsky, Marc Chagall, Frida Kahlo, Alberto Giacometti, Bill Viola, and Yves Klein. The Kunsthalle opened in 1986 and is financially supported by the city and the state. Historically, the German term "Schirn" denotes an open-air stall for the sale of goods, and such stalls were located here until the 19th century. The area was destroyed in 1944 during the Second World War and was not redeveloped until the building of the Kunsthalle. As an exhibition venue, the Schirn enjoys national and international renown, which it has attained through independent productions, publications, and exhibition collaborations with museums such as the Centre Pompidou, the Tate Gallery, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, the Hermitage Museum, or the Museum of Modern Art.', 'The Frankfurt Art Association (German: Frankfurter Kunstverein) is an art museum founded in 1829 by a group of influential citizens of the city of Frankfurt, Germany. The aim of the institution is to support the arts in the city, which was an important center of trade and business. Works of art were bought and exhibitions organized in order to open access to art and culture for the public.Among the founders were Johann Gerhard Christian Thomas, a senator and later mayor of the city, historian Johann Friedrich B√∂hmer, and art historian Johann David Passavant. Soon after the establishment of the museum, many important and influential citizens and artists became members.', 'The Schirn Kunsthalle is a Kunsthalle in Frankfurt, Germany, located in the old city between the R√∂mer and the Frankfurt Cathedral. The Schirn exhibits both modern and contemporary art. It is the main venue for temporary art exhibitions in Frankfurt. Exhibitions in recent years included retrospectives of Wassily Kandinsky, Marc Chagall, Frida Kahlo, Alberto Giacometti, Bill Viola, and Yves Klein. The Kunsthalle opened in 1986 and is financially supported by the city and the state. Historically, the German term "Schirn" denotes an open-air stall for the sale of goods, and such stalls were located here until the 19th century. The area was destroyed in 1944 during the Second World War and was not redeveloped until the building of the Kunsthalle. As an exhibition venue, the Schirn enjoys national and international renown, which it has attained through independent productions, publications, and exhibition collaborations with museums such as the Centre Pompidou, the Tate Gallery, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, the Hermitage Museum, or the Museum of Modern Art.', 'Friedrich Ebert (German: [Ààf ÅiÀêd Å…™√ß ÀàeÀêb…êt] (listen); 4 February 1871 ‚Äì 28 February 1925) was a German politician of the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) and the first president of Germany from 1919 until his death in office in 1925.', 'The Schirn Kunsthalle is a Kunsthalle in Frankfurt, Germany, located in the old city between the R√∂mer and the Frankfurt Cathedral. The Schirn exhibits both modern and contemporary art. It is the main venue for temporary art exhibitions in Frankfurt. Exhibitions in recent years included retrospectives of Wassily Kandinsky, Marc Chagall, Frida Kahlo, Alberto Giacometti, Bill Viola, and Yves Klein. The Kunsthalle opened in 1986 and is financially supported by the city and the state. Historically, the German term "Schirn" denotes an open-air stall for the sale of goods, and such stalls were located here until the 19th century. The area was destroyed in 1944 during the Second World War and was not redeveloped until the building of the Kunsthalle. As an exhibition venue, the Schirn enjoys national and international renown, which it has attained through independent productions, publications, and exhibition collaborations with museums such as the Centre Pompidou, the Tate Gallery, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum, the Hermitage Museum, or the Museum of Modern Art.', 'The Historical Museum (German: Historisches Museum) in Frankfurt am Main, Germany, was founded in 1878, and includes cultural and historical objects relating to the history of Frankfurt and Germany. It moved into the Saalhof in 1955, and a new extension was opened in 1972.The 1970s extension is currently being replaced by a modern new exhibition building and a small administration building which are expected to be completed by 2015.', 'Der Stoltze-Brunnen ist ein Brunnen auf dem H√ºhnermarkt in der Altstadt von Frankfurt am Main‚ñº. Er steht unter Denkmalschutz. Von 1981 bis 2016 stand er auf dem Friedrich-Stoltze-Platz hinter der Katharinenkirche‚ñº.Der Stoltze-Brunnen ist ein Denkmal im Stil der Neorenaissance. Er wurde nach Entwurf von Friedrich Schierholz zu Ehren des Dichters und Schriftstellers Friedrich Stoltze (1816‚Äì1891) geschaffen und 1892 auf dem Frankfurter H√ºhnermarkt in direkter N√§he zu Stoltzes Geburtshaus Zum Rebstock aufgestellt. Die feierliche Einweihung erfolgte am 2. November 1895. Der bisher auf dem H√ºhnermarkt stehende Freiheitsbrunnen wurde an das Roseneck am Weckmarkt versetzt.', 'Saalgasse is one of the oldest streets in the Altstadt of Frankfurt am Main. It runs parallel to the bank of the Main. From the Middle Ages to the destruction of the city on 22 March 1944, the Saal, together with the more northerly alte Markt and the central Bendergasse, formed one of the three east-west traffic axes of the Old Town.', 'The Museum f√ºr Moderne Kunst (English: Museum of Modern Art), or short MMK, in Frankfurt, was founded in 1981 and opened to the public June 6, 1991. The museum was designed by the Viennese architect Hans Hollein. Because of its triangular shape, it is popularly called "piece of cake", Claes Oldenburg artistically has expressed in a work.', 'Das Dommuseum im historischen Kreuzgang des Kaiserdoms St. Bartholom√§us in Frankfurt am Main besteht seit 1987. Die Regelausstellung beinhaltet einige H√∂hepunkte sakraler Kunst. Zudem pr√§sentiert das Museum in wechselnden Ausstellungen zeitgen√∂ssische Kunst oder kulturhistorische Themen. Ein zweiter Ausstellungsraum ist seit 2007 das sogenannte Sakristeum im benachbarten Haus am Dom (‚ÄûDependance Sakristeum im Haus am Dom‚Äú).', 'Der Mainkai ist eine Stra√üe am rechten Mainufer in der Frankfurter Altstadt zwischen Alter Br√ºcke und Untermainbr√ºcke. Sie entstand ab 1826 durch Aufsch√ºttung und Verbreiterung aus dem seit dem Mittelalter befestigten Anlege- und Landungsplatz am Mainufer. Sie ist heute eine Flaniermeile am Fluss und war ab 30. Juli 2019 versuchsweise f√ºr ein Jahr Fu√üg√§ngern und Radfahrern vorbehalten.Der Mainkai geht mainabw√§rts in den Untermainkai mit dem Nizza, einem Teil des Frankfurter Gr√ºng√ºrtels, √ºber. Zusammen mit dem Schaumainkai auf der gegen√ºberliegenden Mainseite bildet er das Museumsufer.', 'Frankfurt Cathedral (German: Frankfurter Dom), officially Imperial Cathedral of Saint Bartholomew (German: Kaiserdom Sankt Bartholom√§us) is a Roman Catholic Gothic church located in the centre of Frankfurt am Main, Germany. It is dedicated to Saint Bartholomew.', 'The Caricatura Museum, official name Caricatura Museum f√ºr Komische Kunst, is a museum for comic art in Frankfurt, Hesse, Germany. It shows a in a permanent exhibition works by the artists of the Neue Frankfurter Schule, and additionally exhibitions of contemporary artists.', 'The Museum f√ºr Moderne Kunst (English: Museum of Modern Art), or short MMK, in Frankfurt, was founded in 1981 and opened to the public June 6, 1991. The museum was designed by the Viennese architect Hans Hollein. Because of its triangular shape, it is popularly called "piece of cake", Claes Oldenburg artistically has expressed in a work.', 'Das Arch√§ologische Museum Frankfurt (bis 2002 Museum f√ºr Vor- und Fr√ºhgeschichte) erl√§utert die Geschichte Frankfurts in arch√§ologisch relevanten Epochen. Dar√ºber hinaus besitzt es eine Ausstellung Vorderer Orient sowie eine Antikensammlung.', 'Das Karmeliterkloster in Frankfurt am Main ist Sitz des Institut f√ºr Stadtgeschichte und des Arch√§ologischen Museums. Von 1246 bis 1803 war es ein Kloster des Karmeliterordens.', "The Goethe House is a writer's house museum in the Innenstadt district of Frankfurt am Main, Germany. It is a birthplace of Johann Wolfgang von Goethe. Decorated with period furniture and paintings, it provides an authentic environment in which Goethe spent his youth. It is also a place where Goethe wrote his famous works G√∂tz von Berlichingen, Faust and The Sorrows of Young Werther.", "The Altstadt (old town) is a quarter (Stadtteil) of Frankfurt am Main, Germany. It is part of the Ortsbezirk Innenstadt I.The Altstadt is located on the northern Main river bank. It is completely surrounded by the Innenstadt district, Frankfurt's present-day city centre. On the opposite side of the Main is the district of Sachsenhausen.", 'Das Kabarett Die Schmiere wurde 1950 von Rudolf Rolfs gegr√ºndet und ist eines der √§ltesten Privattheater in Frankfurt am Main. Das Theater zeigte sich als ‚ÄûDas schlechteste Theater der Welt‚Äú; auch der Name ‚ÄûSchmiere‚Äú ist ein abwertender Begriff f√ºr schlechtes Theater, ein sogenanntes Schmierentheater.', 'Gibson ist ein Club mit Liveb√ºhne auf der Zeil in Frankfurt am Main.Der Club wurde 2012 von dem ehemaligen King-Kamehameha-Macher Madjid Djamegari im Untergeschoss des ehemaligen Zeilkinos er√∂ffnet. Nach 14 Monaten Bauzeit wurde der Hauptraum mit einer Soundanlage von Martin Audio und einer B√ºhne mit LED-Wand best√ºckt. Der Club fasst 900 Personen bei 1600 Quadratmeter. 2013 wurde der Club mit dem Gastronomiepreis Fizzz-Award f√ºr den besten Club ausgezeichnet und z√§hlt auch laut Dance-Charts, S√ºddeutsche Zeitung und diverser Reisef√ºhrer zu den wichtigsten Clubadressen.', 'Das Deutsche Museum f√ºr Kochkunst und Tafelkultur wurde am 25. November 2015 in Frankfurt am Main er√∂ffnet. Es sieht sich in der Tradition des von 1909 bis 1937 existierenden Kochkunstmuseums des Internationalen Verbands der K√∂che, dessen eingelagerter Sammlungsbestand im Zweiten Weltkrieg vollkommen zerst√∂rt wurde. Im Bestand des heutigen Museums befinden sich allerdings Sammlungsobjekte des Deutschen Gastst√§ttenmuseums, das von 1941 bis 1944 in Frankfurt am Main existierte.', 'An der Hauptwache, kurz Hauptwache genannt, ist das Zentrum der Innenstadt und einer der bekanntesten Pl√§tze in Frankfurt am Main. Die eigentliche Hauptwache ist das hier befindliche barocke Wachengeb√§ude, die Bezeichnung ging aber um 1900 auf den ganzen Platz √ºber und verdr√§ngte dessen fr√ºheren Namen Schillerplatz. Vor der Aufstellung des Schillerdenkmals 1864 hie√ü der Platz entsprechend seiner damaligen milit√§rischen Funktion Paradeplatz.In den Platz m√ºnden einige der wichtigsten Stra√üen der Innenstadt (im Uhrzeigersinn):', 'Das Johannes-Gutenberg-Denkmal ist ein Denkmal und Brunnen auf dem Ro√ümarkt in Frankfurt am Main. Es erinnert an den Erfinder des Buchdrucks mit beweglichen Metall-Lettern Johannes Gensfleisch, genannt Gutenberg, sowie an die mit ihm in Frankfurt arbeitenden Drucker und Verleger Johannes Fust und Peter Sch√∂ffer.', 'Der Portikus ist eine Ausstellungsinstitution f√ºr zeitgen√∂ssische Kunst in Frankfurt am Main. Er wurde 1987 in einem Containerraum hinter dem klassizistischen S√§ulenfrontispiz der Alten Stadtbibliothek er√∂ffnet und befindet sich seit 2006 auf der Maininsel an der Alten Br√ºcke. Neben aktuellen Arbeiten von international bekannten K√ºnstlern werden auch Positionen junger K√ºnstler gezeigt. Der Portikus ist seit seiner Gr√ºndung im Jahre 1987 wesentlicher Bestandteil der St√§delschule und tr√§gt zur Bereicherung des Lehrplans und der internationalen Reputation der Schule bei. Von Oktober 2014 bis Ende 2017 war Fabian Sch√∂neich Kurator des Portikus, ihm folgt Christina Lehnert, die zuletzt den Braunschweiger Kunstverein leitete.', 'The Museum Angewandte Kunst is located in Frankfurt am Main, Germany and part of the Museumsufer. The alternating exhibitions recount tales of cultural values and changing living conditions. Beyond that, they continually refer to the question of what applied art is today and can be and demonstrate the field of tension between function and aesthetic value.The collections consist of more than 60,000 objects of European handicrafts dating from the twelfth to the twenty-first century, design, book art and graphics as well as Islamic and East Asian art.', 'Das Goethedenkmal auf dem Goetheplatz in Frankfurt am Main ist ein Werk des Bildhauers Ludwig Schwanthaler. Es wurde am 22. Oktober 1844 feierlich eingeweiht. Der 1749 in Frankfurt geborene Johann Wolfgang von Goethe gilt als bedeutendster Sohn der Stadt. Schon zu Lebzeiten wurde er zum deutschen Nationaldichter verkl√§rt. Er galt als Symbol f√ºr die Deutsche Einigung. Frankfurt war die erste Stadt, in der ein √∂ffentliches Goethedenkmal zu seinen Ehren errichtet wurde. Bereits seit 1819 hatte es mehrere Denkmalprojekte in Frankfurt gegeben.', 'Das Kellertheater Frankfurt ist ein freies, vollst√§ndig ehrenamtlich betriebenes Theater in Frankfurt am Main. Es befindet sich seit 1980 in der Mainstra√üe 2. Gef√ºhrt wird es von der Junge B√ºhne Frankfurt e. V. und ist seit 1975 im Vereinsregister eingetragen. Das Kellertheater ist Mitglied in der Frankfurter Theaterallianz e. V.', 'Das Ikonen-Museum, (auch Ikonenmuseum Stiftung Dr. Schmidt-Voigt) ist ein Museum f√ºr sakrale Kunst des orthodoxen Christentums in Frankfurt am Main. Es befindet sich im Barockbau des Deutschordenshauses und bildet den √∂stlichen Abschluss des Museumsufers. Es ist dem Museum Angewandte Kunst angeschlossen, Tr√§ger ist die Stadt Frankfurt am Main.', 'Die Kom√∂die ist ein privates Boulevardtheater in der Innenstadt von Frankfurt am Main.', "The Comoedienhaus theater, first opened on 3 September 1782, and demolished in 1911, was the first drama theater and opera house built in the German city of Frankfurt. Designed by renowned architect Johann Andreas Hardt Lieb, the Frankfurter National-Theater (which in 1842 became the Stadttheater, later renamed Comoedienhaus) became a popular venue for entertainment, particularly among the middle-class members of Frankfurt's society, and became known, even outside of Frankfurt itself, for its dramas and operas. It remained a centre of entertainment for over 100 years, and by the mid-nineteenth century, the population of the city was so great, and the theater still so popular, that the theater was regularly completely filled, despite the relatively high expense of admission. As the first theater of performing arts in Frankfurt, it was a major contributor to the popularisation of the performing arts in Frankfurt and elsewhere in Germany.", 'The Museum of World Cultures (German: Museum der Weltkulturen) is an ethnological museum in Frankfurt, Germany. Until 2001 it was called the Museum of Ethnology (Museum f√ºr V√∂lkerkunde).', 'Das Ikonen-Museum, (auch Ikonenmuseum Stiftung Dr. Schmidt-Voigt) ist ein Museum f√ºr sakrale Kunst des orthodoxen Christentums in Frankfurt am Main. Es befindet sich im Barockbau des Deutschordenshauses und bildet den √∂stlichen Abschluss des Museumsufers. Es ist dem Museum Angewandte Kunst angeschlossen, Tr√§ger ist die Stadt Frankfurt am Main.', 'Das Ikonen-Museum, (auch Ikonenmuseum Stiftung Dr. Schmidt-Voigt) ist ein Museum f√ºr sakrale Kunst des orthodoxen Christentums in Frankfurt am Main. Es befindet sich im Barockbau des Deutschordenshauses und bildet den √∂stlichen Abschluss des Museumsufers. Es ist dem Museum Angewandte Kunst angeschlossen, Tr√§ger ist die Stadt Frankfurt am Main.', 'Das Schauspielhaus in Frankfurt am Main war ein 1899 bis 1902 errichteter Theaterbau am Gallustor. Der historistische Bau des Berliner Theaterarchitekten Heinrich Seeling ‚Äûsignalisierte mit exotisch unterf√ºtterter Neorenaissance und einem freien Zitat der Berliner Reichstagskuppel staatstragende Bedeutung, w√§hrend Jugendstildetails dezent den Willen zur Moderne andeuteten‚Äú. In den 1920er Jahren wurde es ein Zentrum des expressionistischen Theaters in Deutschland und zur ‚ÄûTalentschmiede f√ºr Autoren und Schauspieler‚Äú. Bei einem Luftangriff auf Frankfurt wurde das Schauspielhaus 1944 im Inneren v√∂llig zerst√∂rt, w√§hrend die Bausubstanz und Teile der Fassade erhalten blieben.', "The Schauspiel Frankfurt is the municipal theatre company for plays in Frankfurt, Hesse, Germany. It is part of St√§dtische B√ºhnen Frankfurt.In the late 1770s the theatre principal Abel Seyler was based in Frankfurt, and established the city's theatrical life.Opened in 1782, the Comoedienhaus (comedy house) was the first permanent venue of the Frankfurt theatre, both plays and opera (drama and opera). Its traditional house, the Schauspielhaus, build in 1902 by architect Heinrich Seeling at the Theaterplatz (now Willy-Brandt-Platz) was destroyed in World War II. In 1926, Brecht's A Respectable Wedding premiered.", "The Oper Frankfurt (Frankfurt Opera) is a German opera company based in Frankfurt.Opera in Frankfurt am Main has a long tradition, with many world premieres such as Franz Schreker's Der ferne Klang in 1912, Fennimore und Gerda by Frederick Delius in 1919, and Carl Orff's Carmina Burana in 1937. Frankfurt's international recognition began in the Gielen Era, 1977 to 1987, when Michael Gielen and stage directors such as Ruth Berghaus collaborated.", 'Fre√ügass (literally, "Grazing Street") is an upmarket shopping street in the city centre of Frankfurt, Germany, located in the district of Innenstadt and within the central business district known as the Bankenviertel. It is commonly regarded as Frankfurt\'s culinary main street. The street is a broad pedestrian zone, and is located between Hochstra√üe and the Opernplatz (Opera Square) with the Alte Oper in the west and the B√∂rsenstra√üe (Stock Exchange Street) with the Frankfurt Stock Exchange in the east. The street is also the direct continuation (in the western direction) of the Zeil, and is a parallel street of Goethestra√üe, Germany\'s best known luxury shopping street. In recent years Fre√ügass has increasingly become a luxury shopping street, serving as an extension of the Goethestra√üe in this regard. Its other primary adjacent street is the Kaiserhofstra√üe.', 'The Jewish Museum Frankfurt am Main is the oldest independent Jewish Museum in Germany. It was opened by Federal Chancellor Helmut Kohl on 9 November 1988, the 50th anniversary of Kristallnacht.', 'Das Deutsche Filmmuseum am Museumsufer in Frankfurt am Main ist eines von sieben Filmmuseen in Deutschland. Es ist in einer unter Denkmalschutz stehenden historischen Villa untergebracht.Das Deutsche Filmmuseum wurde 1984 er√∂ffnet. Es setzte die Tradition des Kommunalen Kinos der Stadt Frankfurt fort, das in dem inzwischen abgerissenen Historischem Museum am R√∂merberg untergebracht war. Der Umbau der historischen Villa erfolgte nach Pl√§nen des Architekten Helge Bofinger, die Konzeption der Innenausstattung durch den Berliner B√ºhnenbildner Jan Schlubach.', 'Der M√§rchenbrunnen oder Schauspielhausbrunnen in Frankfurt am Main befindet sich an der Untermainanlage neben den St√§dtischen B√ºhnen Frankfurt. Es handelt sich dabei um einen Jugendstilbrunnen, der im Jahre 1910 fertiggestellt wurde.', 'Das Deutsche Filmmuseum am Museumsufer in Frankfurt am Main ist eines von sieben Filmmuseen in Deutschland. Es ist in einer unter Denkmalschutz stehenden historischen Villa untergebracht.Das Deutsche Filmmuseum wurde 1984 er√∂ffnet. Es setzte die Tradition des Kommunalen Kinos der Stadt Frankfurt fort, das in dem inzwischen abgerissenen Historischem Museum am R√∂merberg untergebracht war. Der Umbau der historischen Villa erfolgte nach Pl√§nen des Architekten Helge Bofinger, die Konzeption der Innenausstattung durch den Berliner B√ºhnenbildner Jan Schlubach.', 'The German Architecture Museum (Deutsches Architekturmuseum) (DAM) is located on the Museumsufer in Frankfurt, Germany. Housed in an 18th-century building, the interior has been re-designed by Oswald Mathias Ungers in 1984 as a set of "elemental Platonic buildings within elemental Platonic buildings". It houses a permanent exhibition entitled "From Ancient Huts to Skyscrapers" which displays the history of architectural development in Germany.', 'Der Schwarze Violinschl√ºssel ist eine Skulptur in Frankfurt am Main des deutsch-japanischen K√ºnstlers Hans-Peter Taro Miyabe (1960‚Äì1997) aus dem Jahr 1982. Das Kunstwerk steht in der Frankfurter Innenstadt auf dem Horst-Lippmann-Platz an der Ecke Goethestra√üe und Kleine Bockenheimer Stra√üe vor dem Jazzkeller Frankfurt.', 'The Frankfurter Engel (German for Frankfurt angel) is a memorial in the city of Frankfurt am Main in southwestern Germany; it is dedicated to homosexual people who were persecuted under Nazi rule, and as well as under Paragraph 175 of the German Criminal Code during the 1950s and 1960s.The memorial is a statue of an angel and is the first of its kind in Germany. Subsequent memorials in Germany are K√∂lner Rosa Winkel (1995) in Cologne and Memorial to Homosexuals persecuted under Nazism (2008) in Berlin.At the basis of the memorial written in the German language is:', 'The German Architecture Museum (Deutsches Architekturmuseum) (DAM) is located on the Museumsufer in Frankfurt, Germany. Housed in an 18th-century building, the interior has been re-designed by Oswald Mathias Ungers in 1984 as a set of "elemental Platonic buildings within elemental Platonic buildings". It houses a permanent exhibition entitled "From Ancient Huts to Skyscrapers" which displays the history of architectural development in Germany.', 'Der Jazzkeller ist ein als Jazzclub gegr√ºndeter Veranstaltungsort f√ºr Jazzmusik in Frankfurt am Main.Als domicile du jazz wurde er 1952 von dem Trompeter Carlo Bohl√§nder in Frankfurt im Keller der Kleinen Bockenheimer Stra√üe Nr. 18a gegr√ºndet und hei√üt unter ‚ÄûEingeweihten‚Äú nur ‚Äûder Keller‚Äú. Eine schmale Treppe mit 19 Steinstufen f√ºhrt hinab.', "The English Theatre Frankfurt is a 300-seat theatre located at the Gallileo skyscraper. Founded more than 30 years ago, it is continental Europe's largest English-speaking theatre. Each season, more than 60,000 patrons visits its wide range of classics, comedies, thrillers and musicals. In terms of its audience, 70 percent are native German speakers and 30 percent are from the extensive English-speaking community at home in and around Frankfurt.", "The Museum f√ºr Kommunikation is a communication museum in Frankfurt, Germany. It opened on 31 January 1958 under the name Bundespostmuseum (National Postal Museum) and is the oldest museum on Frankfurt's Museumsufer (Museum Riverbank).The museum was owned by Deutsche Bundespost until 1994. The present building, a modern and transparent glass structure, opened in 1990 and was designed by architect G√ºnter Behnisch. Following the opening of the new building, the museum acquired its present name.", 'Das Philipp-Reis-Denkmal ist ein 1919 geschaffenes Denkmal in der Eschenheimer Anlage in Frankfurt am Main. Es ehrt den Erfinder des Telefons Philipp Reis.Das Denkmal besteht aus massivem Kunststein. In der Mitte befindet sich eine B√ºste des Philipp Reis auf einer S√§ule. Links und rechts davon stehen zwei nackte J√ºnglinge, die sich nicht sehen k√∂nnen, aber mit einem Telefon von Reis unterhalten. Auf beiden Seiten des Denkmals befindet sich folgende Inschrift:']

column5: ['Al Ain', 'Al Ain Sheikh Zayed Palace Museum', 'Sheikh Khalifa International Stadium', 'Al ain oasis', 'Al Ain National Museum', 'Al Ain Zoo']
column6: ["Al Ain (Arabic: Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ, al- øayn, literally The Spring) is a city in the Eastern Region of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, on the United Arab Emirates' border with Oman, adjacent to the town of Al-Buraimi. It is the largest inland city in the Emirates, the fourth-largest city (after Dubai, Abu Dhabi, and Sharjah), and the second-largest in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. The freeways connecting Al-Ain, Abu Dhabi, and Dubai form a geographic triangle in the country, each city being roughly 130 kilometres (81 mi) from the other two.", 'Sheikh Zayed Palace Museum (Arabic: ŸÖŸéÿ™Ÿíÿ≠ŸéŸÅ ŸÇŸéÿµŸíÿ± Ÿ±ŸÑÿ¥ŸéŸëŸäŸíÿÆ ÿ≤ŸéÿßŸäŸêÿØ\u200e, romanized: Mat·∏•af Ash-Shaykh ZƒÅyid al-Wa·π≠anƒ´), also known as "Al Ain Palace Museum" (Arabic: ŸÖŸéÿ™Ÿíÿ≠ŸéŸÅ ŸÇŸéÿµŸíÿ± Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ\u200e, romanized: Mat·∏•af Qa·π£r Al- øAyn), is a museum in the city of Al Ain, within the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates.The museum is based in the palace of the former UAE President, Sheikh Zayed Bin Sultan Al Nahyan (1918‚Äì2004), and his family. It was originally built in 1937 on the western side of the Al Ain Oasis, the largest oasis in Al Ain. Sheikh Zayed lived here until 1966. It was made into a museum in 1998.', 'Khalifa bin Zayed Stadium (Arabic: ÿßŸêÿ≥Ÿíÿ™ŸéÿßÿØ ÿÆŸéŸÑŸêŸäŸíŸÅŸéÿ© ÿ®ŸêŸÜ ÿ≤ŸéÿßŸäŸêÿØ\u200e, romanized: IstƒÅd ·∏¥alƒ´fah Bin ZƒÅyid) is a multi-purpose stadium in Al Ain, the United Arab Emirates.One of the prominent events to be staged on this stadium was the Group E matches of the 2003 FIFA World Youth Championship and the stadium also hosted some matches from the 1996 AFC Asian Cup.', 'Al-Ain Oasis (Arabic: ŸàŸéÿßÿ≠Ÿéÿ© Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ\u200e\u200e, romanized: WƒÅ·∏•at Al- øAyn, "Oasis of the Spring") is the largest oasis in the city of Al Ain, within the Eastern Region of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates.', 'Al Ain Museum (Arabic: ŸÖŸéÿ™Ÿíÿ≠ŸéŸÅ Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ, romanized: Mat·∏•af Al), also known as Al Ain Museum (Arabic: ŸÖŸéÿ™Ÿíÿ≠ŸéŸÅ Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ, romanized: Mat·∏•af al- øAyn), is a museum in the city of Al Ain, within the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates.', 'Al Ain Zoo (Arabic: ÿ≠ŸéÿØŸêŸäŸíŸÇŸéÿ© Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿ≠ŸéŸäŸíŸàŸéÿßŸÜŸéÿßÿ™ ÿ®ŸêŸ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ\u200e, romanized: ·∏§adƒ´qat ·∏§aywƒÅnƒÅt Bil- øAyn), also "Al Ain Wildlife Park & Resort" or simply "Al Ain Wildlife Park" (Arabic: ŸÖŸèÿ™ŸéŸÜŸéÿ≤ŸéŸëŸá Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿπŸéŸäŸíŸÜ ŸÑŸêŸÑŸíÿ≠ŸéŸäŸéÿßÿ© Ÿ±ŸÑŸíÿ®Ÿéÿ±ŸêŸäŸéŸëÿ©\u200e, romanized: Mutanazzah Al- øAyn Lil-·∏§ayƒÅt Al-Bariyyah), is a 400-hectare (990-acre) zoo located in the foothills of Jebel Hafeet in Al Ain, Abu Dhabi, the United Arab Emirates. It is primarily composed of ungulates and herbivores such as Arabian antelopes and oryx, eland, gazelle, lechwe and can be found in the tree shaded paddocks which offer breeding conditions that were deemed \'excellent\'. Like the Breeding Centre for Endangered Wildlife in the Emirate of Sharjah, which is now closed to the public, it is a member of the EAZA.']

column5: ['Bahawalpur Museum', 'Bahawal Stadium (Dring Stadium)', 'Noor Mahal palace']
column6: ['The Bahawalpur Museum (Urdu: ÿ®€ÅÿßŸàŸÑŸæŸàÿ± ÿπÿ¨ÿßÿ¶ÿ® ⁄Ø⁄æÿ±\u200e), established in 1976, is a museum of archaeology, art, heritage, modern history and religion located in Bahawalpur, Punjab, Pakistan. It comes under the control of Bahawalpur district government. The current director of the museum is Hussain Ahmed Madni.The Bahawalpur Museum was established in 1974. It is a museum of archaeology, ethnology, art, heritage, of traditional and modern history. It is supervised by the local government of Bahawalpur district. It has eight galleries.Collection', 'The Bahawal Stadium is a cricket ground in Bahawalpur, Punjab, Pakistan. Locally known as Dring Stadium, it is a multi-purpose stadium used mostly for cricket games. Situated on Stadium Road, opposite Bahawalpur Zoo, the stadium has a capacity of 15,000 people.It is one of the stadiums in Asia that hold all games at one place. The stadium includes cricket, hockey, football, swimming, squash, judo, karate, swimming, gym, volleyball, tennis courts init.', 'The Noor Mahal (Urdu: ŸÜŸàÿ± ŸÖÿ≠ŸÑ\u200e) is a Pakistan Army-owned palace in Bahawalpur, Punjab, Pakistan. It was built in 1872 like an Italian chateau on neoclassical lines, at a time when modernism had set in. It belonged to the Nawabs of Bahawalpur princely state, during British Raj.There are various stories regarding its construction. According to one legend, Nawab Adnan Abbasi IV had the palace made for his wife; however, she was only there for one night, as she happened to see the adjoining graveyard from her balcony, and refused to spend another night there, and so it remained unused during his reign.']

column6: ['The Francisco Moraz√°n Stadium is one of the three stadiums available to the city of San Pedro Sula, Honduras. It is an official stadium for games of the National League of Professional Football in Honduras; as well as, for international matches and international competitions of the Football Confederation of North, Central and Caribbean (CONCACAF) and FIFA.Nowadays, it is the official stadium of Real Espa√±a and occasionally for C.D. Marath√≥n. It is also used for other activities, including concerts, religious services, parades, and other things. It has a capacity of 18,000 fans, according to FIFA restrictions, but 21,500 viewers according to the Football Federation of Honduras.', 'The Francisco Moraz√°n Stadium is one of the three stadiums available to the city of San Pedro Sula, Honduras. It is an official stadium for games of the National League of Professional Football in Honduras; as well as, for international matches and international competitions of the Football Confederation of North, Central and Caribbean (CONCACAF) and FIFA.Nowadays, it is the official stadium of Real Espa√±a and occasionally for C.D. Marath√≥n. It is also used for other activities, including concerts, religious services, parades, and other things. It has a capacity of 18,000 fans, according to FIFA restrictions, but 21,500 viewers according to the Football Federation of Honduras.', 'Estadio Ol√≠mpico Metropolitano is a multi-purpose stadium in San Pedro Sula, Honduras. It is currently used mostly for football matches and also has facilities for athletics. The stadium has a capacity of 37,325.']

column5: ['Battle of Chamdo']
column6: ["The Battle of Chamdo (or Qamdo; Chinese: ÊòåÈÉΩÊàòÂΩπ) occurred from 6 to 19 October 1950. It was a military campaign by the People's Republic of China (PRC) to take the Chamdo Region from a de facto independent Tibetan state The campaign resulted in the capture of Chamdo and the annexation of Tibet by the People's Republic of China.Kham was a border region of Tibet. Prior to the establishment of the PRC, it roughly coincided with the Sikang Province under Kuomintang-led Republic of China. Its western half is known as Chamdo."]

It had a variety of rides, including three roller coasters, and a water park with 25 slides and six pools. It closed for good on August 31, 2020.The carousel "El Dorado" is Japan\'s oldest play machine and is a merry-go-round with a long history in the world.', 'Á∑¥È¶¨Âå∫Á´ãÁæéË°ìÈ§®Ôºà„Å≠„Çä„Åæ„Åè„Çä„Å§„Å≥„Åò„ÇÖ„Å§„Åã„Çì Ëã±Ë°®Ë®ò:Nerima Art MuseumÔºâ„ÅØÊù±‰∫¨ÈÉΩÁ∑¥È¶¨Âå∫Ë≤´‰∫ï„ÅÆÁæéË°ì„ÅÆÊ£ÆÁ∑ëÂú∞„Å´„ÅÇ„ÇãÁæéË°ìÈ§®„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇ1985Âπ¥ÔºàÊò≠Âíå60Âπ¥Ôºâ10Êúà1Êó•„Å´ÈñãÈ§®„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÁ∑¥È¶¨Âå∫„Å´„ÇÜ„Åã„Çä„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„Çã‰ΩúÂÆ∂„ÅÆ‰ΩúÂìÅ„Çí„ÅØ„Åò„ÇÅ„ÄÅËøë„ÉªÁèæ‰ª£„ÅÆÊó•Êú¨„ÅÆÊ¥ãÁîª„ÄÅÂâçË°õÁæéË°ìÁ≠â„ÅÆ‰ΩúÂìÅÁ¥Ñ6700ÁÇπ„ÇíÂèéËîµ„Åô„ÇãÔºàÂØÑË®óÂìÅÂê´„ÇÄÔºâ„ÄÇ „ÄåÁæéË°ìÂìÅ„Çí‰øùÁÆ°„ÉªÂ±ïÁ§∫„Åô„Çã„Å†„Åë„Åß„Å™„Åè„ÄÅÂå∫Ê∞ë„ÅåÁæéË°ì„Å´ÂØæ„Åô„ÇãÁêÜËß£„ÇíÊ∑±„ÇÅ„ÄÅÁô∫Â±ï„Åï„Åõ„ÄÅ‰∏ª‰ΩìÁöÑ„Å´ÂèÇÂä†„Åß„Åç„Çã„ÄÅÈñã„Åã„Çå„ÅüÁæéË°ìÈ§®„Å®„Åô„Çã„Äç„Å®„Åó„Å¶Ë®≠Á´ã„Åï„Çå„Åü„Åì„Å®„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅÂå∫Ê∞ë„Å∏„ÅÆÂ±ïÁ§∫ÂÆ§„ÅÆË≤∏„ÅóÂá∫„Åó„ÇÑÂêÑÁ®ÆË¨õÂ∫ß„ÇíÈñãË¨õ„Åô„Çã„Å™„Å©Â∫É„ÅèÊñáÂåñÊã†ÁÇπ„Å®„Åó„Å¶Âà©Áî®„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ „Åæ„Åü„ÄÅÁ∑¥È¶¨Âå∫ÂÜÖ„ÅÆÂÖ¨Á´ãÂ∞è‰∏≠Â≠¶Ê†°Áîü„ÅÆ‰∏≠„Åã„ÇâÈÅ∏„Å∞„Çå„ÅüÂÑ™ÁßÄ„Å™Êõ∏„ÅçÂàù„ÇÅ‰ΩúÂìÅ„ÄÅÁµµÁîª‰ΩúÂìÅ„ÇÇÂ±ïÁ§∫„Åô„Çã„ÄÇÂª∫Áâ©„ÅØÁ∑¥È¶¨Âå∫Á´ãË≤´‰∫ïÂõ≥Êõ∏È§®„Å®ÂêàÁØâ„Åï„Çå„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅ1F„ÅåÂõ≥Êõ∏È§®„ÄÅ2F„ÄÅ3F„ÅåÁæéË°ìÈ§®„Å®„Å™„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇÈñãÈ§®ÊôÇÈñìÔºö10:00ÔΩû18:00 ‰ºëÈ§®Êó•ÔºöÊØéÈÄ±ÊúàÊõúÊó•ÔºàÁ•ùÊó•„ÅÆÂ†¥Âêà„ÅØÁøåÊó•Ôºâ„ÄÅÂπ¥Êú´Âπ¥Âßã„ÉªÂ±ïÁ§∫Êõø„ÅàÊúüÈñìÁ≠â ÂÖ•È§®ÊñôÔºöÊâÄËîµÂìÅÂ±ï„ÅØÁÑ°Êñô / ÁâπÂà•Â±ï„ÅØ„Åù„ÅÆÈÉΩÂ∫¶Ë®≠ÂÆö „Ç¢„ÇØ„Çª„ÇπÔºöË•øÊ≠¶Ê±†Ë¢ãÁ∑ö‰∏≠ÊùëÊ©ãÈßÖ„Çà„ÇäÂæíÊ≠©3ÂàÜÈùâÂÖâ„ÄåËë°ËêÑ„ÄçÔºà1934Âπ¥Ôºâ È∂¥Â≤°ÊîøÁî∑„ÄåÁâ©‰πû„ÅÜ‰∫∫(ËæªÊ•ΩÂ∏´)„ÄçÔºà1950Ôºâ Â∞èÈáéÊú®Â≠¶„ÄåÁæ§ÂÉè„ÄçÔºà1953Ôºâ ÈáéË¶ãÂ±±ÊöÅÊ≤ª„Äå‰∏ò(„ÇØ„É¨„Éº„É≥) „ÄçÔºà1957Ôºâ ‰∏≠ÊùëÂÆè„ÄåËúÇËµ∑„Åõ„ÇàÂ∞ëÂ•≥ „ÄçÔºà1959Ôºâ Â±±Âè£Èï∑Áî∑„ÄåÈáéÂΩ¢„ÄçÔºà1960Ôºâ ÁôΩÈ´™‰∏ÄÈõÑ„ÄåÊñáË¶ö Êªù„ÅÆË°å„ÄçÔºà1972Ôºâ È´òÊùæÊ¨°ÈÉé„ÄåÂΩ±„ÄçÔºà1978ÔºâÁ∑¥È¶¨Âå∫Á´ãÁæéË°ìÈ§®„ÅÆ„Éñ„É≠„Ç∞ Á∑¥È¶¨Âå∫Á´ãÁæéË°ìÈ§®', 'Egota-no-Mori Park (Ê±üÂè§Áî∞„ÅÆÊ£ÆÂÖ¨Âúí, Egota no Mori K≈çen) is a public park in Nakano Ward, Tokyo, Japan. It is the largest park in Nakano Ward.Within the grounds of the park there is a large, six-story building called Tokyo General Health and Welfare Center Egota-no-Mori (Êù±‰∫¨Á∑èÂêà‰øùÂÅ•Á¶èÁ•â„Çª„É≥„Çø„ÉºÊ±üÂè§Áî∞„ÅÆÊ£Æ, T≈çky≈ç S≈çg≈ç Hoken Fukushi Shisetsu Egota no Mori). The park also has a multipurpose open area, wooded area, wooden playground equipment, sandbox, swings, water fountain, toilet (with wheelchair access), study room, benches, lawn, biotope pond, and dogwood hill.', 'Tetsugaku-d≈ç Park (Âì≤Â≠¶Â†ÇÂÖ¨Âúí, Tetsugaku-d≈ç K≈çen) ("Park of the Philosophy Shrine" or "Temple Garden of Philosophy") is a public park in Tokyo, Japan. Most of the park is in Nakano Ward, while approximately 7% (at the south-eastern edge) is in Shinjuku Ward. It was created successively during the years 1904 to 1919 by the philosopher and founder of Toyo University, Inoue Enry≈ç. Inoue thought of this philosophical theme park as a place for mental cultivation. column5: ['City Oval']
column6: ["City Oval (formerly Alexandra Park and sometimes called the Pietermaritzburg Oval), is a multi-purpose stadium in Pietermaritzburg, South Africa. The 12,000 capacity stadium is currently used predominantly for cricket matches, with the ground being used by KwaZulu-Natal Inland men's and women's teams, KwaZulu-Natal and Dolphins (who also play at Kingsmead, Durban), and hosted two matches during the 2003 Cricket World Cup. It is one of only three first-class cricket grounds in the world to have a tree within the boundary ropes (the others being St Lawrence Ground in Canterbury, United Kingdom and VRA Cricket Ground in Amstelveen, Netherlands), and any cricketer that scores a century or takes a five-wicket haul in a match at the City Oval gets to plant a tree at the ground. The City Oval Pavilion is based on the design of Queen's Park cricket ground in Chesterfield, United Kingdom."]

column5: ['Palaran Stadium']
column6: ['Stadion Palaran is the main sports venue of Samarinda, the capital city of East Kalimantan province. It is a multi-purpose stadium located at the center of the East Kalimantan Main Stadium Sports Complex. It was opened in 2008 and has a seating capacity of 67,075, making it the second-largest stadium in Indonesia, after the Gelora Bung Karno Stadium. It is also the largest stadium on the island of Borneo. The stadium was the main venue for the 2008 Indonesia National Games. It is the first Indonesian all-seater stadium. The stadium has become abandoned and has not been redeveloped.']

column5: ['Changhua Arts Hall', 'Changhua County Stadium', 'Chengkungling History Museum', 'Lukang Wen Wu Temple', 'Wanggaoliao', 'Dadu Plateau', 'Lukang Folk Arts Museum']
column6: ["The Changhua Arts Hall (traditional Chinese: ÂΩ∞ÂåñËóùË°ìÈ§®; simplified Chinese: ÂΩ∞ÂåñËâ∫ÊúØÈ¶Ü; pinyin: ZhƒÅnghu√† Y√¨sh√πgu«én) is an art gallery in Changhua City, Changhua County, Taiwan.The art gallery is housed in the Jungshan Hall, a quaint building dating back several decades. The building also doubles as a performance theater, lecture hall, and art gallery. The museum's premises also have a 300-year-old well, known as the Ang-mo Well (Á¥ÖÊØõ‰∫ï). It is the last remaining well of the several built by the Dutch. This link with the Dutch gives it the name Ang-mo, which means 'red hair' in Taiwanese.The art gallery is accessible within walking distance east from Changhua Station of the Taiwan Railways.", 'The Dadu Plateau (Chinese: Â§ßËÇöÂè∞Âú∞), also known as Dadu Mountain or Dadushan (Chinese: Â§ßËÇöÂ±±; PeÃçh-≈çe-jƒ´: T≈ça-t≈çÕò-soa‚Åø), is a plateau that stretches across Taichung, Taiwan. It borders the Taichung Basin in the east and the seacoast of Taichung in the west, and lies between the Dajia River and the Dadu River. The plateau is long and narrow, with a length of about 20 km and a width of about 5 to 7 km. Its average elevation is about 151 m above sea level, with its highest peak at 310 m.Dadu, Taichung Kingdom of Middag', 'The Lukang Folk Arts Museum (traditional Chinese: ÈπøÊ∏ØÊ∞ë‰øóÊñáÁâ©È§®; simplified Chinese: ÈπøÊ∏ØÊ∞ë‰øóÊñáÁâ©È¶Ü; pinyin: L√πg«éng M√≠ns√∫ W√©nw√πgu«én) is a museum in Lukang Township, Changhua County, Taiwan.']

column6: ['Estadio La Ceiba is a multi-use stadium in the San Felix area of Ciudad Guayana, Venezuela. It is currently used mostly for baseball games. The dam's main purpose is hydroelectric power generation and it was later named after Antonio Jos√© de Sucre.", 'Llovizna Falls is a waterfall on the Caron√≠ River, close to its confluence with the Orinoco, are located in the Llovizna Park, Puerto Ordaz, Venezuela. The nearby Macagua Dam has reduced the flow over the waterfall in recent years, but the cascade continues to be spectacular and returns to its former glory several times a year when the floodgates of the dam are opened.(Llovizna - "yoviz-nah", is Spanish for mist, drizzle, spray).', 'The Estadio Cachamay is part of the Centro Total de Entretenimiento Cachamay (English: The Total Entertainment Center of Cachamay). The old stadium was opened in 1990 and subjected to an expansion, modernization and remodeling over the years 2006‚Äì2007, which involved the demolition of some parts and redesign of its structure to point to double its capacity before 2006, being one of the 9 host stadiums of the 2007 Copa Am√©rica, when it reopened as Cachamay CTE. The CTE is known popularly as Cachamay Cachamay Stadium.', 'The Estadio Cachamay is part of the Centro Total de Entretenimiento Cachamay (English: The Total Entertainment Center of Cachamay). The CTE is known popularly as Cachamay Cachamay Stadium.', 'The Loefling Zoo (Spanish: Parque Zool√≥gico Loefling) Also Zoological Park Loefling Is a publicly owned zoological garden located southwest of Cachamay Park, in Ciudad Guayana, part of the Bolivar State in the Venezuelan Guayana region. It received its name in honor of the Swedish botanist Pehr L√∂fling one of the first to show interest in the fauna and flora of this region.Its administration and management are a responsibility of the Venezuelan Guiana Corporation (CVG, Corporaci√≥n Venezolana de Guayana) under the supervision of the National Foundation of Zoological Parks and Aquariums of Venezuela. column6: ['General Santander Stadium (Estadio General Santander) is a multi-purpose stadium in C√∫cuta, Colombia. It is currently used mostly for football matches. Se localiza en la Diagonal Santander, entre las calles 10 y 11. Fue inaugurado el 4 de mayo de 2007.Su √°rea total es de 56.307 m¬≤, de los cuales 20 407 m¬≤ forman parte de la zona comercial,[1] tiene 121 almacenes,[1] cines multiplex, plazoleta de comidas, diversas entidades bancarias y 750 parqueaderos. Su almac√©n Ancla es el Hipermercado Metro, (Antiguos Carrefour en Colombia).[1] Su eslogan es "Un Mundo Sin Fronteras".']

Á∑èÊ∞¥Èáè1,844t(Êµ∑Ê∞¥:1,804t Ê∑°Ê∞¥:40t)', 'Kawasaki Velodrome (Â∑ùÂ¥éÁ´∂Ëº™Â†¥, Kawasaki Keirinjy≈ç) is a velodrome located in Kawasaki, Kanagawa that conducts pari-mutuel Keirin racing - one of Japan\'s four authorized "Public Sports" (ÂÖ¨Âñ∂Á´∂ÊäÄ, k≈çei ky≈çgi) where gambling is permitted. column6: ['University Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala and is used for predominantly football and also for athletics. University stadium had hosted the first one-day international cricket match in kerala.The stadium is owned by the University of Kerala and was opened by Sir Mirza the Diwan of the erstwhile princely state of Hyderabad in 1940. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000. The G. V. Raja Pavilion is in the stadium. The stadium was used as the home ground for the Indian domestic cricket team Kerala till the late 1980s. The stadium has hosted 2 ODI matches with the host team India losing one match and the other match yielded no result.', 'University Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala and is used for predominantly football and also for athletics. University stadium had hosted the first one-day international cricket match in kerala.The stadium is owned by the University of Kerala and was opened by Sir Mirza the Diwan of the erstwhile princely state of Hyderabad in 1940. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000. The G. V. Raja Pavilion is in the stadium. The stadium was used as the home ground for the Indian domestic cricket team Kerala till the late 1980s. The stadium has hosted 2 ODI matches with the host team India losing one match and the other match yielded no result.', 'Keralam ‚Äì Museum of History and Heritage, located at Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India is a museum that aims to document the history and heritage of Kerala that spans over 3000 years as per available prehistorical and historical evidence. It is a joint venture of Kerala Tourism and the Kerala State Department of Archaeology. The museum is placed within the Park View mansion, near the famous Napier Museum and Thiruvananthapuram Zoo. In order to enable effective content delivery and user interaction, the museum employs modern techniques such as touchscreen terminals to illustrate the exhibits and multimedia systems to render documentary videos.', 'Subhas Chandra Bose ( (listen) shuub-HAHSS CHUN-dr…ô BOHSS; 23 January 1897 ‚Äì 18 August 1945) was an Indian nationalist whose defiant patriotism made him a hero in India, but whose attempt during World War II to rid India of British rule with the help of Nazi Germany and Imperial Japan left a troubled legacy. The honorific Netaji (Hindustani: "Respected Leader"), first applied to Bose in Germany in early 1942 by the Indian soldiers of the Indische Legion and by the German and Indian officials in the Special Bureau for India in Berlin, was later used throughout India.', 'The Napier Museum is an art and natural history museum situated in Thiruvananthapuram, India.The Museum is grounds to the Trivandrum Zoo, one of the oldest zoological gardens in India. The zoo was established in 1857 over 55 acres (220,000 m2) of land. It also contains the Sree Chitra Art Gallery, a separate art gallery established in 1935.The set of museums, along with the zoo, are managed by the Department of Museums and Zoos, a branch of the Department of Cultural Affairs of Kerala.A building was constructed in 1857 during the reign of Uthram Thirunal Marthanda Varma, and later demolished in 1874 to lay foundation for a new building, during the reign of Ayilyam Thirunal.', 'Kerala Science and Technology Museum is an autonomous institution established by Government of Kerala, India, in 1984, as a center for popularisation of science and scientific temper among the general public, especially among the young generation. The institution is in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram city, in Kerala. The Priyadarsini Planetarium is attached to the museum, functioning since 1994.', 'Kerala Science and Technology Museum is an autonomous institution established by Government of Kerala, India, in 1984, as a center for popularisation of science and scientific temper among the general public, especially among the young generation. The institution is in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram city, in Kerala. The Priyadarsini Planetarium is attached to the museum, functioning since 1994.', 'Kerala Science and Technology Museum is an autonomous institution established by Government of Kerala, India, in 1984, as a center for popularisation of science and scientific temper among the general public, especially among the young generation. The institution is in the heart of Thiruvananthapuram city, in Kerala. The Priyadarsini Planetarium is attached to the museum, functioning since 1994.', 'The Thiruvananthapuram Zoo (also known as Trivandrum Zoo) is located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital of Kerala, India. It occupies 55 acres (22 ha) of woodland, lakes, and lawns.', 'The Thiruvananthapuram Zoo (also known as Trivandrum Zoo) is located in the city of Thiruvananthapuram, the capital of Kerala, India. It occupies 55 acres (22 ha) of woodland, lakes, and lawns.', 'Kowdiar Palace in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India was built in 1934 by Maharajah Sree Chithira Thirunal Balarama Varma, on Pallikettu (wedding) of his only sister, Maharani Karthika Thirunal Lakshmi Bayi with Lt. Col. G. V. Raja. After the Constitutional Amendment of 1971, the properties and estates of the royal family were partitioned and divided equally among the branches of the two Travancore Queens, Sethu Lakshmi Bayi and Sethu Parvathi Bayi. This Palace belongs to the heirs of Sethu Parvathi Bayi as it was built by her son Maharajah Sree Chithira Thirunal.', 'Shankumugham Beach is a beach in Thiruvananthapuram district of Kerala, south India. The beach is on the western side of Thiruvananthapuram (Trivandrum) and very near to Trivandrum International Airport.']

–æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª–µ–º —Å—á–∏—Ç–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è –∫—Ä—É–ø–Ω–µ–π—à–∏–π —É—á–µ–Ω—ã–π, –∫—Ä–∞–µ–≤–µ–¥ –ò–≤–∞–Ω –Ø–∫–æ–≤–ª–µ–≤–∏—á –°–ª–æ–≤—Ü–æ–≤ (1844‚Äî1907), —á—å–∏ –º—É–∑–µ–π–Ω—ã–µ –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ü–∏–∏ –¥–æ 1922 –≥–æ–¥–∞ —ç–∫—Å–ø–æ–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏—Å—å –≤ –∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–∞–Ω–¥—Ä–æ–≤—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ä–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É—á–∏–ª–∏—â–∞. –° —Å–∞–º–æ–≥–æ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞ –º—É–∑–µ–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–ª—Å—è –∫–∞–∫ –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–∏–ª—å–Ω—ã–π: –∫—Ä–∞–µ–≤–µ–¥—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π –∏ –Ω–∞—É—á–Ω—ã–π. –í –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ XIX –≤–µ–∫–∞ –µ–≥–æ —Å–æ–±—Ä–∞–Ω–∏–µ —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–∏–≤–∞–ª–∏ —Å –Ω–∞–∏–±–æ–ª–µ–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º–∏ –µ–≤—Ä–æ–ø–µ–π—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ –º—É–∑–µ–π–Ω—ã–º–∏ –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ü–∏—è–º–∏. –°—Ä–µ–¥–∏ —Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö –º—É–∑–µ–µ–≤ —Ç–∞–∫–æ–µ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ –æ–Ω —Å–æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω—è–µ—Ç –∏ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è.', 'Chimgi-Tura or Chingi-Tura (Russian: –ß–∏–Ω–≥–∏ÃÅ-–¢—É—Ä–∞ÃÅ, Siberian Tatar: –ß–∏–º–∫–µ-—Ç–æ—Ä–∞) was a medieval city of the Siberian Tatars in 12th-16th centuries located in Western Siberia.It was a capital of the Khanate of Sibir until the early 16th century, when its ruler Khan Muhammad decided not to remain at Chimgi-Tura, and chose a new capital named Qashliq located on the Irtysh.After the Cossack ataman Yermak from Muscovy conquered the Siberian Khanate in the 1580s, the city of Chimgi-Tura was abandoned or burned. In 1586 the Russian fort Tyumen was built nearby. Modern Tyumen, one of the centres of the Russian oil industry, covers the site where Chimgi-Tura used to stand.', '–ö–æ–º—Å–æ–º–æ–ª—å—Å–∫–∏–π —Å–∫–≤–µ—Ä –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω–∏ –≤ –ö–∞–ª–∏–Ω–∏–Ω—Å–∫–æ–º –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–º –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–µ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–∞ –≤ —Ç—Ä–µ—É–≥–æ–ª—å–Ω–∏–∫–µ, –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–Ω–æ–º —É–ª–∏—Ü–∞–º–∏ –ó–æ–∏ –ö–æ—Å–º–æ–¥–µ–º—å—è–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π, –ú–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–º —Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–æ–º –∏ –¢—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–æ–≤–æ–π —É–ª–∏—Ü–µ–π.–ò—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è –ö–æ–º—Å–æ–º–æ–ª—å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Å–∫–≤–µ—Ä–∞ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞—Å—å –≤ 1961 –≥., –∫–æ–≥–¥–∞ –ø–æ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–ª–æ–∂–µ–Ω–∏—é –°–µ–º–µ–Ω–∞ –ü–∞—Ü–∫–æ, —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∞–≤—à–µ–≥–æ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–º —Å–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–∞—Ä—ë–º –≥–æ—Ä–∫–æ–º–∞ –ö–ü–°–°, –Ω–∞ –ø–æ–ª–µ –º–µ–∂–¥—É –ú–æ—Å–∫–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–º –∏ –ß–µ—Ä–≤–∏—à–µ–≤—Å–∫–∏–º —Ç—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∞–º–∏ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∞—Å—å –ø–æ—Å–∞–¥–∫–∞ –¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤—å–µ–≤. –†–∞–Ω–µ–µ –Ω–∞ —ç—Ç–æ–º –º–µ—Å—Ç–µ –±—ã–ª–æ –ø–æ–ª–µ, –Ω–∞ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–º —Ç—é–º–µ–Ω—Ü—ã —Å–∞–∂–∞–ª–∏ –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–æ—Ñ–µ–ª—å. –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —Ä–∞–∑–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏ –ø–æ–ª—è –∫–æ–º—Å–æ–º–æ–ª—å—Ü—ã, —É—á–∞—â–∏–µ—Å—è –¥–≤—É—Ö —Ç—é–º–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏—Ö –≤—É–∑–æ–≤ –∏ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–∞—è –º–æ–ª–æ–¥–µ–∂—å –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–æ–¥–æ—Ä–æ–∂–Ω–æ–≥–æ —É–∑–ª–∞, –∑–∞–≤–æ–¥–æ–≤ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Å–∞–¥–∫—É —Å–∞–∂–µ–Ω—Ü–µ–≤ –ª–∏–ø –∏ –¥—Ä—É–≥–∏—Ö –¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤—å–µ–≤.', 'La malnova urbodomo konata kiel la Urba Dumao (ruse –ì–æ—Ä–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞—è –î—É–º–∞) en Tjumeno (Rusio) estis la sidejo de la urba administracio, en 1922 transformita je muzeo. ƒúi situas ƒâe la komenco de strato Lenin.En 1824 oni sciigis ke la imperiestro Aleksandro la 1-a planas viziti Siberion, inkluzive de Tjumeno. Komenciƒùis aktiva konstruado kaj rekonstruado por ke la urbo aspektu pli bela kaj bonfarta. La 17-an de decembro 1824 la a≈≠toritatoj kunvenigis la negocistojn kaj burƒùojn, kiuj promesis oferi tiucele 7 509,2 rublojn. Sed poste multaj ne pagis ƒùustatempe, ƒâar samtempe ili devis beligi siajn domojn kaj apudajn terenojn kaj krome impostoj kreskis.', '–¢—é–º–µ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –¥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π —Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä ‚Äî –¥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–π —Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä –≤ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–µ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω—å, —Å—É—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤—É—é—â–∏–π —Å 1858 –≥–æ–¥–∞. –ù–∞ –¥–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç —É —Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä–∞ —Å–∞–º–æ–µ –±–æ–ª—å—à–æ–µ –∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏–µ –∏–∑ –≤—Å–µ—Ö –¥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Ç–µ–∞—Ç—Ä–æ–≤ –†–æ—Å—Å–∏–∏.', 'Geolog Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in Tyumen, Russia. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the home stadium of FC Tyumen. The stadium holds 13,057 people, all seated. Since 2008, many health units including a sports hall and gymnasium, swimming pool, saunas, and a restaurant, have been added to the complex.Stadium information', '–ó–∞ÃÅ–≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–Ω—ã–π –ø–∞—Ä–∫ ‚Äî –ø–∞—Ä–∫ –≤ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω–∏. –ù–∞—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –¶–µ–Ω—Ç—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω–æ–º –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–µ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω–∏ –Ω–µ–¥–∞–ª–µ–∫–æ –æ—Ç –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑–Ω–æ–≥–æ –º–æ—Å—Ç–∞ —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ —Ä–µ–∫—É –¢—É—Ä–∞.', '–ó–∞—Ç—é–º–µÃÅ–Ω—Å–∫–∏–π –ª–µ—Å–æ–ø–∞ÃÅ—Ä–∫ ‚Äî –æ—Å–æ–±–æ –æ—Ö—Ä–∞–Ω—è–µ–º–∞—è –ø—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–¥–Ω–∞—è —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è –¢—é–º–µ–Ω—Å–∫–æ–π –æ–±–ª–∞—Å—Ç–∏, —è–≤–ª—è—é—â–∞—è—Å—è –ø–∞–º—è—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–º –ø—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–¥—ã —Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏ –Ω–∞—Ö–æ–¥—è—â–∞—è—Å—è –≤ –¢—é–º–µ–Ω–∏ (–≤ —Ä–∞–π–æ–Ω–µ –ó–∞—Ç—é–º–µ–Ω–∫–∏). –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç —Å–æ–±–æ–π —É—á–∞—Å—Ç–æ–∫ –ª–µ—Å–∞ –≤ –æ–∫—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è—Ö –≥–æ—Ä–æ–¥–∞ —Å –µ–≥–æ –∑–∞–ø–∞–¥–Ω–æ–π —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏, –æ–±—â–µ–π –ø–ª–æ—â–∞–¥—å—é 77,193 –≥–∞. –õ—é–±–∏–º–æ–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ –æ—Ç–¥—ã—Ö–∞ –≥–æ—Ä–æ–∂–∞–Ω –≤ –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –≤ –∑–∏–º–Ω–µ–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º—è –≥–æ–¥–∞, –∫–∞—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –ª—ã–∂–∞—Ö –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø—É–ª—è—Ä–Ω–æ, —Ç–∞–∫ –∫–∞–∫ –ø–∞—Ä–∫ –∏–º–µ–µ—Ç –Ω–µ—Å–∫–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –ª—ã–∂–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–∞—Å—Å. –í 2012‚Äî2013 –≥–æ–¥–∞—Ö —Å –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∏–µ–º –∑–∏–º–Ω–µ–≥–æ —Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω–∞ –±—ã–ª –ø—Ä–æ–≤–µ–¥—ë–Ω –∑–∞–±–µ–≥ –±–∏–∞—Ç–ª–æ–Ω–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤ –Ω–∞ –±–∞–∑–µ –°–î–Æ–°–®–û–† ‚Ññ 2, —á—Ç–æ –Ω–∞ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –ª–µ—Å–æ–ø–∞—Ä–∫–∞.']

column6: ['O Museu Nacional de Etnografia de Nampula, √© o √∫nico museu nacional mo√ßambicano n√£o localizado em Maputo.Foi inaugurado em 23 de Agosto de 1956 pelo general Craveiro Lopes com o nome de Museu Comandante Eug√©nio Ferreira de Almeida, num edif√≠cio com projeto do arquiteto M√°rio Oliveira.O principal impulsionador do museu foi o etn√≥grafo Soares de Castro, que conseguiu mobilizar os governantes locais para a realiza√ß√£o do projeto.Na fase colonial o museu tinha sec√ß√µes, de hist√≥ria, arqueologia, mineralogia, cineg√©tica, numism√°tica, em 1993 foi transformado em museu nacional com uma voca√ß√£o especialmente etnogr√°fica.']

"Suizen-ji J≈çju-en (Ê∞¥ÂâçÂØ∫ÊàêË∂£Âúí) is a tsukiyama Japanese garden located within Suizen-ji Park (Ê∞¥ÂâçÂØ∫ÂÖ¨Âúí, Suizen-ji K≈çen) in Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan. The main tsukiyama is a representation of Mount Fuji. Lord Hosokawa Tadatoshi began construction of the garden in 1636 as a tea retreat. The park was named after a no-longer-extant Buddhist temple called Suizen-ji, and now hosts the Izumi Shrine, where members of the Hosokawa family are enshrined, and a N≈çgaku-d≈ç, a Noh theater. Lord Hosokawa selected this site because of its spring-fed pond, the clean water of which was excellent for tea. The thatched Kokin-Denju-no-Ma teahouse was originally in Kyoto's Imperial Palace, but was moved here in 1912.", 'Kumamoto Suizenji Stadium (ÁÜäÊú¨Â∏ÇÊ∞¥ÂâçÂØ∫Á´∂ÊäÄÂ†¥) is an athletic stadium in ÂÄâÊï∑Ê∞ëËóùÈ§®ÁÜäÊú¨ÂõΩÈöõÊ∞ëËóùÈ§®', 'Aqua Dome Kumamoto is a multi-purpose indoor arena in Kumamoto, Kumamoto, Japan. The capacity of the arena is 6,400 and was opened in 1998.', 'Mount Kinb≈ç (ÈáëÂ≥∞Â±±, Kinb≈ç-san) or Mount Kinp≈ç (ÈáëÂ≥∞Â±±, Kinp≈ç-san) is a mountain in the west of Kumamoto city, Kumamoto Prefecture, Japan. It is an extinct caldera-type volcano. Mount Kinb≈ç overlooks the city of Kumamoto and is used for sightseeing and for radio and TV broadcast antennas.Older than nearby Mount Aso, it formed over the past 100 million years. Extensive volcanic activity took place 56 million years to 50 million years ago. The last eruption took place from 200,000 years to 150,000 years ago. In 1889 a 6.3 magnitude earthquake struck beneath the mountain. In 2016 the foreshock of the 2016 Kumamoto earthquakes also struck beneath Mount Kinb≈ç.', 'ÁÜäÊú¨Áî£Ê•≠Â±ïÁ§∫Â†¥Ôºà„Åè„Åæ„ÇÇ„Å®„Åï„Çì„Åé„Çá„ÅÜ„Å¶„Çì„Åò„Åò„Çá„ÅÜÔºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅÁÜäÊú¨Áúå‰∏äÁõäÂüéÈÉ°ÁõäÂüéÁî∫„Å´„ÅÇ„ÇãÂ∏∏Ë®≠Â±ïÁ§∫Â†¥„ÄÇÊÑõÁß∞„ÅØ„Ç∞„É©„É≥„É°„ÉÉ„ÇªÁÜäÊú¨Ôºà„Ç∞„É©„É≥„É°„ÉÉ„Çª„Åè„Åæ„ÇÇ„Å®„ÄÅGRANDMESSE KUMAMOTOÔºâ„ÄÇÈñãÈ§®ÊôÇÈñì - Âü∫Êú¨9:00 - 17:00„ÄÇ„Åü„Å†„ÅóÈñãÂÇ¨„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„Å´„Çà„Å£„Å¶„ÅØ24ÊôÇÈñì„ÄÇ ‰ºëÈ§®Êó• - ÁÑ°‰ºëÔºà„Åü„Å†„Åó‰∏çÂÆöÊúü„Å´ÊñΩË®≠ÁÇπÊ§ú„ÅÆÁÇ∫„ÅÆ‰ºëÊó•„ÅåÊúà„Å´1Êó•Ë®≠ÂÆö„Åï„Çå„ÇãÔºâ ÂÖ•È§®Êñô - Âü∫Êú¨ÁÑ°ÊñôÔºàÈñãÂÇ¨„Ç§„Éô„É≥„Éà„Å´„Çà„ÇãÔºâ ÊåáÂÆöÁÆ°ÁêÜËÄÖ - ÁÜäÊú¨Áî£Ê•≠ÊñáÂåñÊåØËààÊ†™Âºè‰ºöÁ§æÔºàÊúüÈñìÔºö2016Âπ¥4Êúà1Êó• - 2020Âπ¥3Êúà31Êó•‰∫àÂÆöÔºâ1998Âπ¥ÔºàÂπ≥Êàê10Âπ¥Ôºâ3Êúà - ÈñãÈ§®„ÄÇÂΩìÊôÇ„ÅØË≤°Âõ£Ê≥ï‰∫∫„Ç∞„É©„É≥„É°„ÉÉ„ÇªÁÜäÊú¨„ÅåÈÅãÂñ∂„ÄÇ 2006Âπ¥ÔºàÂπ≥Êàê18Âπ¥Ôºâ - ÊåáÂÆöÁÆ°ÁêÜËÄÖÂà∂Â∫¶Â∞éÂÖ•„ÄÇÊåáÂÆöÊúüÈñì„ÅØ5Âπ¥„ÄÇÁèæÂú®‰∏âÊúüÁõÆ„ÄÇÂ±ïÁ§∫„Éõ„Éº„É´„Ç≥„É≥„Éô„É≥„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Éõ„Éº„É´ ‰ºöË≠∞ÂÆ§ ‰∏≠‰ºöË≠∞ÂÆ§Ôºà84‰∫∫ÂèéÂÆπÔºâ Â§ß‰ºöË≠∞ÂÆ§Ôºà144‰∫∫ÂèéÂÆπÔºâ „É¨„Çπ„Éà„É©„É≥„Éª„Ç∞„É©„É≥„Éá„Ç£„Éº„É´ Â∏≠Êï∞Ôºö160Â∏≠ Âñ∂Ê•≠ÊôÇÈñìÔºö11:00 - 18:00‰∏≠‰ºöË≠∞ÂÆ§Ôºà84‰∫∫ÂèéÂÆπÔºâ Â§ß‰ºöË≠∞ÂÆ§Ôºà144‰∫∫ÂèéÂÆπÔºâÂ∏≠Êï∞Ôºö160Â∏≠ Âñ∂Ê•≠ÊôÇÈñìÔºö11:00 - 18:00ÁÑ°ÊñôÈßêËªäÂ†¥Ôºà2,200Âè∞ÂèéÂÆπÔºâÁÜäÊú¨Â∏ÇÊñπÈù¢ ÁÜäÊú¨Ê°úÁî∫„Éê„Çπ„Çø„Éº„Éü„Éä„É´„Çà„ÇäÁî£‰∫§„Éê„Çπ„ÄåÁ©∫Ê∏Ø„É™„É†„Ç∏„É≥„Éê„Çπ„Äç„Åæ„Åü„ÅØ„Äå„Åü„Åã„ÇÇ„ÇäÂè∑„Äç‰πóËªä„ÄÅ„Äå„Ç∞„É©„É≥„É°„ÉÉ„ÇªÂâç„Äç„Éê„ÇπÂÅú‰∏ãËªäÔºàÁ¥Ñ30ÂàÜÔºâ„ÄÇ ÁÜäÊú¨ÈßÖÔºà„ÅÆ„Çä„Å∞1Ôºâ„Çà„ÇäÁî£‰∫§„Éê„Çπ„ÄåÁ©∫Ê∏Ø„É™„É†„Ç∏„É≥„Éê„Çπ„Äç„Åæ„Åü„ÅØ„Äå„Åü„Åã„ÇÇ„ÇäÂè∑„Äç‰πóËªä„ÄÅ„Äå„Ç∞„É©„É≥„É°„ÉÉ„ÇªÂâç„Äç„Éê„ÇπÂÅú‰∏ãËªäÔºàÁ¥Ñ40ÂàÜÔºâ„ÄÇ ÈòøËòá„Åè„Åæ„ÇÇ„Å®Á©∫Ê∏ØÊñπÈù¢ ÈòøËòá„Åè„Åæ„ÇÇ„Å®Á©∫Ê∏ØÔºà1Áï™„ÅÆ„Çä„Å∞Ôºâ„Çà„ÇäÁî£‰∫§„Éê„Çπ„ÄåÁ©∫Ê∏Ø„É™„É†„Ç∏„É≥„Éê„Çπ„Äç„Åæ„Åü„ÅØ„Äå„Åü„Åã„ÇÇ„ÇäÂè∑„Äç‰πóËªä„ÄÅ„Äå„Ç∞„É©„É≥„É°„ÉÉ„ÇªÂâç„Äç„Éê„ÇπÂÅú‰∏ãËªäÔºàÁ¥Ñ15ÂàÜÔºâ„ÄÇ', 'Reigand≈ç (ÈúäÂ∑åÊ¥û, meaning "Spirit Rock Cave") is a cave that lies to the west of Kumamoto, Japan, that became a temporary home to the legendary r≈çnin, Miyamoto Musashi. From 1643, Musashi spent many of his last months in the cave, meditating and writing his Book of Five Rings. The cave is accessed easily by bus from Kumamoto City and nearby Tamana.', "Egao Kenko Stadium („Åà„Åå„ÅäÂÅ•Â∫∑„Çπ„Çø„Ç∏„Ç¢„É†) is a multi-purpose stadium in Higashi-ku, Kumamoto, Japan. It is currently used mostly for football (Roasso Kumamoto) matches and sometimes for Top League rugby games. The stadium holds 32,000 people.With Rosso's promotion from the Japan Football League to the J. League Division 2 in 2007, KKWing is expected to play a role in Rosso's ascendancy.The stadium has been announced as one of the venues for 2019 Rugby World Cup which will be the first Rugby World Cup to be held in Asia.Effective 1 February 2017, the stadium adopted a new name as Egao Kenko Stadium („Åà„Åå„ÅäÂÅ•Â∫∑„Çπ„Çø„Ç∏„Ç¢„É†) (Egao Sta („Åà„Åå„Åä„Çπ„Çø) as an abbreviation) by 4-year naming rights contract.", "Park Dome Kumamoto is a multi-purpose indoor arena in Kumamoto, Kumamoto, Japan. The capacity of the arena is 2,000 and was opened in 1997. Games were played here during the 1997 World Men's Handball Championship.KKWing StadiumOfficial website(in Japanese)"]

column5: ['Osun-Osogbo']
column6: ['Osun-Osogbo or Osun-Osogbo Sacred Grove is a sacred grove along the banks of the Osun river just outside the city of Osogbo, Osun State, Nigeria.The Osun-Osogbo Grove is among the last of the sacred forests which usually adjoined the edges of most Yoruba cities before extensive urbanization. In recognition of its global significance and its cultural value, the Sacred Grove was inscribed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2005.']
