Áî∫Áî∞ÊñπÈù¢„Åã„Çâ\u3000ÂõΩÈÅì246Âè∑Ë•øÂéü‰∫§Â∑ÆÁÇπÂè≥ÊäòÂ∫ßÈñìË∞∑Êà∏Â±±ÂÖ¨Âúí - Á•ûÂ•àÂ∑ùÁúå„ÅÆ„Çµ„Ç§„Éà Á•ûÂ•àÂ∑ùÁúåÁ´ãÂ∫ßÈñìË∞∑Êà∏Â±±ÂÖ¨Âúí - ÊåáÂÆöÁÆ°ÁêÜËÄÖ„ÅÆ„Çµ„Ç§„Éà', 'Keio Rail-Land (‰∫¨Áéã„Çå„Éº„Çã„É©„É≥„Éâ, Kei≈ç Rƒìru Rando) is a railway museum located next to Tama-D≈çbutsuk≈çen Station on the Keio D≈çbutsuen Line in Hino, Tokyo, Japan. It is operated by the private railway operator Keio Corporation. Originally opening in March 2000, the museum was refurbished and expanded with a new outdoor exhibition area in 2013, re-opening on 10 October to mark the 100th anniversary of Keio.The outdoor exhibition area houses the following five former Keio EMU cars.Keio 6000 series car DeHa 6438 Keio 3000 series car KuHa 3719 Keio 5000 series car KuHa 5723 Keio 2010 series car DeHa 2015 Keio 2400 series car DeHa 2410', "The Tama Zoological Park (Â§öÊë©ÂãïÁâ©ÂÖ¨Âúí, Tama D≈çbutsuk≈çen, Tama Zoo for short) is a zoo, owned by the government of Tokyo Metropolis, and located in Hino, Tokyo, Japan. The Tama Zoo was opened on May 5, 1958, originally as a branch (ÂàÜÂúí, satellite facility) of the Ueno Zoo. The zoo aims to use its large site ‚Äì 52 ha, compared to the 14.3 ha of the Ueno Zoo ‚Äì to show its animals moving in a more free and natural environment.Cheetah Serval Golden Takin Snow Leopard Red kangaroo Asian elephant Lesser panda Oriental stork Japanese macaque Sun bear Flamingo A common wombat named ChewbaccaTama-D≈çbutsuk≈çen Station on the Kei≈ç D≈çbutsuen Line and the Tama Toshi Monorail Line is in front of the park's gate.", '„Å§„ÇãËàû„ÅÆÈáåÊ≠¥Âè≤Ë≥áÊñôÈ§®Ôºà„Å§„Çã„Åæ„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åï„Å®„Çå„Åç„Åó„Åó„Çä„Çá„ÅÜ„Åã„ÇìÔºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅÁ•ûÂ•àÂ∑ùÁúåÂ§ßÂíåÂ∏Ç„Å´„ÅÇ„ÇãÊ≠¥Âè≤ÂçöÁâ©È§®„ÄÇÈ§®Âêç„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Åù„ÅÆÊòîÊ∫êÈ†ºÊúù„ÅåÈ∑πÁã©„Çä„ÅÆÂ∏∞„Çä„Å´„ÄÅ„ÅÇ„Çã„ÅÑ„ÅØÊ∫êÁæ©Áµå„ÅåÂ••Â∑û„Å´ËêΩ„Å°„ÇãÊôÇ„Å´„Åì„ÅÆÂú∞ÔºàÈ∂¥ÈñìÔºâ„ÅßÈ∂¥„ÅåËàû„ÅÜ„ÅÆ„ÇíË¶ã„Åü„ÄÅ„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ‰ºùË™¨„Å´„Çà„Çã„ÄÇÊúÄÂØÑ„ÇäÈßÖ„ÅØÊù±ÊÄ•Áî∞ÂúíÈÉΩÂ∏ÇÁ∑ö„ÅÆ„Å§„Åç„ÅøÈáéÈßÖ„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇÂñ∂Ê•≠Êó•„ÅØÊØéÈÄ±ÁÅ´ÊõúÊó•ÔΩûÊó•ÊõúÊó•ÔºàÊúàÊõúÂÆö‰ºëÔºâ„ÄÇÂñ∂Ê•≠ÊôÇÈñì„ÅØ9:00ÔΩû17:00ÔºàÂÖ•È§®„ÅØ16:30Ôºâ„ÄÇÂÖ•Â†¥ÁÑ°Êñô„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇÂ§ßÂíåÂ∏ÇÂåóÈÉ®„Åß„ÅÇ„ÇãÊóß‰∏ãÈ∂¥ÈñìÊùëÂú∞Âüü„ÅÆÊ≠¥Âè≤„Çí‰∏≠ÂøÉ„Å´„ÄÅÁ¥Ñ7‰∏áÂπ¥ÂâçÔºàÊóßÁü≥Âô®ÊôÇ‰ª£Ôºâ„Åã„ÇâÁèæ‰ª£„Åæ„Åß„ÅÆÂ§ßÂíå„ÅÆÈÉ∑ÂúüÂè≤„ÇíËß£Ë™¨„Åô„Çã„ÄÇ‰∏≠‰∏ñ„ÅÆÊ∑±Ë¶ãÂüé„ÇÑ„ÄÅËøë‰∏ñ„ÅÆÁü¢ÂÄâÊ≤¢ÂæÄÈÇÑ„ÅÆ‰∏ãÈ∂¥ÈñìÂÆø„Å´Èñ¢„Åô„ÇãÂ±ïÁ§∫„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇË≥áÊñôÈ§®„ÅÆÂª∫Áâ©„ÅØ„ÄÅÂπïÊú´„Åã„ÇâÊòéÊ≤ªÂàùÈ†≠„ÅÆËæ≤ÂÆ∂Âª∫ÁØâ„Çí„Ç§„É°„Éº„Ç∏„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇ„Åæ„ÅüÂèéËîµÂ∫´„ÅØËæ≤ÂÆ∂„ÅÆÂúüËîµ„Çí„Ç§„É°„Éº„Ç∏„Åó„Åü„Éá„Ç∂„Ç§„É≥„Åß„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇ‰∏ãÈ∂¥ÈñìÂÆø Â§ßÂíåÂ∏Ç‰∏ãÈ∂¥Èñì„Åµ„Çã„Åï„Å®È§®„Å§„ÇãËàû„ÅÆÈáåÊ≠¥Âè≤Ë≥áÊñôÈ§®']

column5: ['Art Gallery of Mississauga', 'Centennial Park Conservatory', 'Centennial Park', 'Centennial Park Stadium', 'Marie Curtis Park']
column6: ['The Art Gallery of Mississauga (AGM) is a public, not-for-profit art gallery in Mississauga, Ontario, Canada. It is located at the Mississauga Civic Centre right on Celebration Square across from Square One Mall. The Gallery is open every day and offers free admission and guided exhibition tours in addition to regular art social events, workshops for adult learners, and youth programmes for schools, universities and community groups.The Gallery holds approximately 18 exhibitions a year on a rotating basis.', 'Centennial Park Conservatory is a conservatory in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It consists of three greenhouses and 12,000 square feet (1,100 m2) of plants including a cactus house, a tropical house and a show house which features seasonal displays. It is located in Centennial Park, in the former City of Etobicoke. This conservatory is cared for by Toronto Parks who also run Allan Gardens. Admission is free.', "Centennial Park is a large municipal park with many sports facilities, maintained by the Parks, Forestry and Recreation Division of the city of Toronto, Ontario, Canada.The park was opened in 1967 for Canada's 100 birthday by the then Borough of Etobicoke and was part of the Hirons' dairy farm (the remaining part of the farm was sold for residential development in 1968).In 1976, the park was one of two venue sites for the 1976 Summer Paralympics.", "The Centennial Park Stadium is a 2,200 seat capacity stadium in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is primarily used for soccer, track and field, football and occasionally for kabaddi. The park is also used for the ROPSSAA football finals and the PSAA (Private Schools Athletic Association) on the first Monday of May for an annual Track and Field Meet.The stadium is named for the city park it is located in, which opened during Canada's centennial year of 1967; the stadium was opened in 1975, eight years after the centennial.", "Marie Curtis Park is a public park in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. It is located at the mouth of the Etobicoke Creek on Lake Ontario in the Long Branch neighbourhood. Marie Curtis Park was built after the devastating floods of Hurricane Hazel in 1954 destroyed 56 homes and cottages on the site, leaving 1,868 persons homeless and 81 dead. It is named after Marie Curtis, the reeve of Long Branch at the time of its construction. Long Branch at the time was a separate village; it's now amalgamated into the City of Toronto government."]

column5: ['Museo de Arte Religioso', 'Teatro Universidad de Concepci√≥n', 'Plaza de la Independencia', 'Aula Magna Arzobispal', 'Cine Regina', 'Teatro Enrique Molina Garmendia', 'Teatro Rex', 'Parque Ecuador', 'Museo de Historia de Concepci√≥n', 'Cerro Amarillo', 'Education: Past, Present and Future', 'Plaza Per√∫', 'Plaza Per√∫', 'Integraci√≥n de Am√©rica latina', 'Casa del Arte', 'Plaza Cruz', 'Teatro Biob√≠o', 'Pileta Plaza Condell', 'Plaza Condell', 'Memorial 27F', 'Parque Costanera', 'University of Concepci√≥n', 'Bismarck tower in Concepci√≥n, Chile', 'Cerro Chepe', 'Cerro Caracol', 'Estadio Municipal Alcaldesa Ester Roa Rebolledo', 'Battle of Lagunillas', 'Anfiteatro San Pedro de la Paz', 'Playita Laguna Grande', 'Club H√≠pico de Concepci√≥n', 'Cerro Amarillo', 'Estadio Huachipato-CAP Acero', 'Complejo Deportivo Estadio CAP', 'Nongu√©n Nature Reserve']
column6: ['El Museo de arte religioso de la Universidad Cat√≥lica de la Sant√≠sima Concepci√≥n es una instituci√≥n creada con el fin de preservar tesoros eclesi√°sticos relacionada con la iglesia cat√≥lica.[1][2] La Universidad Cat√≥lica de la Sant√≠sima Concepci√≥n (UCSC) es su actual administrador, con Ver√≥nica Zamorano Catal√°n como encargada en el a√±o 2011.[3] Recibe un promedio de 400 visitas al mes.Se ubica entre la Catedral de Concepci√≥n y la oficina de la Parroquia del Sagrario, la en la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile (espec√≠ficamente en Caupolic√°n 441 frente a la Plaza de la Independencia).[4]', 'El Teatro Universidad de Concepci√≥n es el principal teatro de la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, construido en 1885 en el centro de la ciudad bajo el nombre de Teatro Concepci√≥n, y que desde 1928 pertenece a la Universidad de Concepci√≥n. En 1976 fue trasladado a su ubicaci√≥n actual, frente a la Plaza de la Independencia.[1]Fue fundado en octubre de 1890 gracias a los esfuerzos de las juntas vecinales de la ciudad, que no contaban con el apoyo gubernamental de ese entonces. La motivaci√≥n principal para su construcci√≥n fue la ausencia de un teatro para la zona, luego del incendio del Teatro Gal√°n en 1882.[2]', "La plaza de la Independencia es la plaza de Armas de la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n. Es considerada el n√∫cleo de toda la ciudad por su relevancia hist√≥rica-social.Se ubica en el cuadrante formado por las avenidas O'Higgins, An√≠bal Pinto, Barros Arana y Caupolic√°n.Es la √∫nica plaza de armas en Chile que se denomina de esa manera, y su nombre se debe a que es el lugar en donde Bernardo O'Higgins realiz√≥ la declaraci√≥n solemne de la independencia chilena.", 'El Aula Magna Arzobispal o simplemente Aula Magna es un centro de eventos perteneciente a la Universidad Cat√≥lica de la Sant√≠sima Concepci√≥n, con capacidad para 342 personas (220 en platea baja y 122 en platea alta) ubicado en la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile, m√°s espec√≠ficamente en la calle Caupolic√°n, frente a la Plaza de la Independencia y dentro de las dependencias de la Catedral de la Sant√≠sima Concepci√≥n.[1]', 'El Cine Regina fue una sala de cine ubicada en el n√∫cleo de la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile, en la calle Barros Arana, muy cerca de la Plaza de la Independencia. Fue inaugurada el 2 de diciembre de 1960, funcion√≥ activamente hasta la d√©cada de los 90, y espor√°dicamente hasta el a√±o 2003, fecha en que termin√≥ sus √∫ltimos d√≠as funcionando como centro de eventos religiosos. Su nombre se debe a su familia fundadora, los Regina de Akel, quienes tambi√©n fueron due√±os del Cine Explanade (posteriormente llamado Cine Astor) y el Cine Windsor. Su √∫ltimo gerente fue el m√©dico Carlos Akel Anan√≠as.[1]', 'El Teatro Enrique Molina fue un teatro de la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile, perteneciente al antiguo Liceo Enrique Molina Garmendia, ubicado en la calle V√≠ctor Lamas, entre Caupolic√°n y An√≠bal Pinto, junto a la actual Biblioteca Municipal Jos√© Toribio Medina. Actualmente s√≥lo queda su estructura principal, de estilo neocl√°sico.[2]Es considerado Patrimonio de la ciudad, y fue declarado Monumento Hist√≥rico por el Decreto 147 con fecha 30 de abril de 2009.[1]', 'El Teatro Rex, que tambi√©n se llam√≥ Teatro √ìpera, fue una conocida sala de cine que existi√≥ en la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, inaugurada en 1938 durante la √©poca de consolidaci√≥n del cine en la ciudad, estando m√°s alejado de la zona c√©ntrica de entonces, adonde ya exist√≠an otras prestigiosas salas de cine como el Teatro Splendid.[1]', 'El Parque Ecuador es un parque chileno perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, en la Regi√≥n del Biob√≠o. Se ubica a los pies del Cerro Caracol y muy cerca del centro de la ciudad, estando dividido del centro urbano por la Calle V√≠ctor Lamas. Corresponde a una gran zona recreativa de m√°s de un kil√≥metro de longitud, con varios puntos de relevancia hist√≥rica, social y cultural.[1]Desde inicios del a√±o 2015, es un parque inclusivo de accesibilidad para ni√±os y adultos con capacidades diferentes.[2]', 'La Galer√≠a de la Historia de Concepci√≥n (GHC) es un museo inaugurado en 1983, ubicado en la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, espec√≠ficamente en el centro del Parque Ecuador, en las faldas del Cerro Caracol.[1][2]El museo cuenta con una sala de exposiciones, adem√°s de una muestra permanente de dioramas realizados por Zerreitug, nombre art√≠stico de Rodolfo Guti√©rrez (figuras talladas y ambientadas en distintos escenarios) sobre la historia de Concepci√≥n, de su conurbaci√≥n el Gran Concepci√≥n y de la Regi√≥n del Biob√≠o. En sus instalaciones, tambi√©n, se cuenta con exposiciones de artesan√≠as, instrumentos, vestimentas y utensilios de la cultura Mapuche.[1]', 'El Cerro Amarillo es un cerro de la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile, ubicado entre las calles Rozas y Rengo, que abarca una superficie de 3000 m¬≤ y posee 30 metros de altitud. Sobre este se sit√∫a un parque creado en 1933, actualmente administrado por la Municipalidad de Concepci√≥n, que comprende jardines, paseos y miradores rodeados por murallas de mamposter√≠a de piedra.[1]El actual Cerro Amarillo antiguamente formaba parte de un extenso cord√≥n monta√±oso, que se conoc√≠a como Cerro Gavil√°n, y que limitaba por el norte a la ciudad del Concepci√≥n de la segunda mitad del siglo XVIII y primera mitad del siglo XIX.', 'ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿπŸÑŸäŸÖ: ŸÅŸä ÿßŸÑŸÖÿßÿ∂Ÿä ŸàÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿßÿ∂ÿ± ŸàÿßŸÑŸÖÿ≥ÿ™ŸÇÿ®ŸÑ ŸÑŸàÿ≠ÿ© ÿ¨ÿØÿßÿ±Ÿäÿ© ŸÖŸÜ 86 ŸÖÿ™ÿ± ŸÖÿ±ÿ®ÿπÿå ÿ±ÿ≥ŸÖŸáÿß ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÜÿßŸÜ ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿ¥ŸäŸÑŸä ŸÖÿßÿ±ŸÉŸà ÿ•Ÿäÿ±ŸÜÿßŸÜÿØÿ´ ÿπÿßŸÖ 2009. ŸàŸäÿØŸàÿ± ŸÖŸàÿ∂ŸàÿπŸáÿß ÿ≠ŸàŸÑ ÿ™ÿ∑Ÿàÿ± ÿßŸÑÿ™ÿπŸÑŸäŸÖ ŸÅŸä ÿ™ÿ¥ŸäŸÑŸä ÿπŸÑŸâ ŸÖÿØŸâ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸÜŸàÿßÿ™. Ÿàÿ™ŸÇÿπ Ÿáÿ∞Ÿá ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàÿ≠ÿ© ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿØÿÆŸÑ ŸÖÿ¨ŸÑÿ≥ ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸÖÿßŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿπÿßŸÖÿ© ÿßŸÑŸàÿ≤ÿßÿ±Ÿä ŸÑŸÑÿ™ÿπŸÑŸäŸÖ ŸÅŸä ŸÖŸÜÿ∑ŸÇÿ© ÿ®ŸäŸàÿ®ŸäŸà ŸÅŸä ŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ŸÉŸàŸÜÿ´ÿ®ÿ´ŸäŸàŸÜ ŸÅŸä ÿ™ÿ¥ŸäŸÑŸä. Ÿàÿ™ŸÜŸÇÿ≥ŸÖ ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàÿ≠ÿ© ÿ•ŸÑŸâ ŸÇÿ≥ŸÖŸäŸÜ: ÿßŸÑÿ£ŸàŸÑ :- ÿÆÿßÿ±ÿ¨ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®ŸÜŸâÿå ŸàŸÇÿØ ÿµŸèŸÖŸêŸÖŸé ÿ®ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿÆÿØÿßŸÖ ÿ™ŸÇŸÜŸäÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÅÿ≥ŸäŸÅÿ≥ÿßÿ°. ÿßŸÑÿ´ŸÄÿßŸÜŸä:- ÿØÿßÿÆŸÑ ÿßŸÑŸÖÿ®ŸÜŸâÿå ŸàŸÇÿØ ÿµŸèŸÖŸêŸÖŸé ŸÖŸÜ ÿÆŸÑÿßŸÑ ÿßÿ≥ÿ™ÿÆÿØÿßŸÖ ÿßŸÑÿ•ŸÉÿ±ŸäŸÑŸäŸÉ.2 ŸÖÿßŸäŸà 1808 ÿ≤ÿ≠ŸÑ ŸäŸÑÿ™ŸáŸÖ ÿßÿ®ŸÜŸá ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàÿ≠ÿßÿ™ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ŸàÿØÿßÿ° ÿπÿßÿ¶ŸÑÿ© ŸÉÿßÿ±ŸÑŸàÿ≥ ÿßŸÑÿ±ÿßÿ®ÿπ ÿπÿ¨Ÿàÿ≤ ÿ™ÿ∑ŸáŸà ÿßŸÑÿ®Ÿäÿ∂ ÿ£ÿ≥ÿ∑Ÿàÿ±ÿ© ÿ£ÿ±ÿßŸÉŸÜŸäÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ŸÅŸÜŸàŸÜ ŸÖÿ±ÿ¶Ÿäÿ© ÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ÿ™ÿ¥ŸäŸÑŸä ÿ®Ÿàÿßÿ®ÿ© ŸÅŸÜŸàŸÜ', 'Plaza Per√∫ is a square in the city of Concepci√≥n, Chile. It is situated in the University District in front of the main entrance of the Ciudad Universitaria de Concepci√≥n, by the Arco Universidad de Concepci√≥n and adjacent to the Casa del Arte. Built in 1942, there are several historic buildings surrounding the square, which were built in the 1940s. The plaza is known for being a gathering of students at the University of Concepci√≥n and youth in general.', 'Plaza Per√∫ is a square in the city of Concepci√≥n, Chile. It is situated in the University District in front of the main entrance of the Ciudad Universitaria de Concepci√≥n, by the Arco Universidad de Concepci√≥n and adjacent to the Casa del Arte. Built in 1942, there are several historic buildings surrounding the square, which were built in the 1940s. The plaza is known for being a gathering of students at the University of Concepci√≥n and youth in general.', 'Presencia de Am√©rica Latina (Presence of Latin America), also known as Integraci√≥n de Am√©rica Latina (Integration of Latin America) is a mural painted by Mexican artist Jorge Gonz√°lez Camarena between November 1964 and April 1965. The 300-square-meter mural, painted in acrylics on rough stucco, is located in the lobby of the Casa del Arte of the University of Concepci√≥n (Ciudad Universitaria de Concepci√≥n), in Concepci√≥n, Chile. Its principal theme is the unity and brotherhood of the different Latin American cultures.', 'The Casa del Arte Jos√© Clemente Orozco (more commonly known simply as the Casa del Arte, "House of Art" or Pinacoteco, "Art Gallery") is a Chilean art museum on the campus of the University of Concepci√≥n, in Concepci√≥n. It is situated on the corner of Chacabuco and Larenas, facing the Plaza Per√∫. The gallery attracts approximately 75,000 visitors a year and houses the country\'s largest collection of paintings outside the capital city of Santiago, and the most complete collection of Chilean art with some 1,800 works. One of its main features is the mural Presencia de Am√©rica Latina (1964) by the Mexican artist Jorge Gonz√°lez Camarena, which is in the entrance hall.', 'La Plaza Cruz es una plaza ubicada en la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, en la manzana delimitada por las calles General Cruz, Joaqu√≠n Prieto, Salas y Angol, cerca del centro de la ciudad.Fue construida el a√±o 1876 y es la segunda m√°s antigua de Concepci√≥n, despu√©s de la Plaza de la Independencia, siendo inaugurada el 13 de octubre de 1907[1] en una ceremonia que cont√≥ con numerosos asistentes.Su nombre es en honor al General Jos√© Mar√≠a de la Cruz Prieto, y sobre ella existe una estatua erigida en su nombre, con un busto de 0.6 metros realizado en la primera mitad del siglo XX, fundido en metal y montado sobre un pedestal, alcanzando una altura total de 2.4 metros.[2]', 'El Teatro Biob√≠o, tambi√©n conocido como Teatro Regional del Biob√≠o, es un teatro ubicado en la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, inaugurado el 7 de marzo de 2018 por la entonces presidenta de la Rep√∫blica, Michelle Bachelet.El edificio fue dise√±ado por el arquitecto chileno Smiljan Radic Clarke, Eduardo Castillo y Gabriela Medrano,[2] y construido por Radic y la Constructora Echeverr√≠a Izquierdo.[1] Previo a su construcci√≥n, otros proyectos de teatro se hab√≠an pensado para emplazarse en la misma ribera norte del r√≠o Biob√≠o. Desde 1994 y durante varios a√±os, se defendi√≥ el proyecto denominado Teatro Pencopolitano, el cual finalmente no se llev√≥ a cabo por falta de financiamiento.', 'La plaza Carlos Condell, com√∫nmente llamada simplemente plaza Condell, es una peque√±a plaza ubicada en la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, en la manzana delimitada por las calles Rozas, Heras, Lautaro y Janequeo.La plaza data de 1890 en que el solar fue comprado por la Municipalidad de Concepci√≥n en 1700 pesos de la √©poca a do√±a Mar√≠a Antonia Palma. En un cabildo se decidi√≥ nombrarla en honor del h√©roe de la Guerra del Pac√≠fico, el contralmirante Carlos Condell de la Haza.[1]', 'La plaza Carlos Condell, com√∫nmente llamada simplemente plaza Condell, es una peque√±a plaza ubicada en la ciudad chilena de Concepci√≥n, en la manzana delimitada por las calles Rozas, Heras, Lautaro y Janequeo.La plaza data de 1890 en que el solar fue comprado por la Municipalidad de Concepci√≥n en 1700 pesos de la √©poca a do√±a Mar√≠a Antonia Palma. En un cabildo se decidi√≥ nombrarla en honor del h√©roe de la Guerra del Pac√≠fico, el contralmirante Carlos Condell de la Haza.[1]', 'El Memorial Conmemorativo de las V√≠ctimas del Terremoto y Posterior Tsunami del 27 de febrero de 2010 o Memorial 27F es un monumento conmemorativo ubicado en el Parque Costanera, en la comuna de Concepci√≥n, en la ciudad del Gran Concepci√≥n, Regi√≥n del Biob√≠o. Es una construcci√≥n arquitect√≥nica moderna cuyo fin es el de conmemorar a las v√≠ctimas del terremoto ocurrido el 27 de febrero de 2010 y que afect√≥ la zona centro sur de Chile.Fue inaugurado el d√≠a mi√©rcoles 23 de octubre de 2013 por el entonces presidente Sebasti√°n Pi√±era en medio de un acto conmemorativo por las 551 v√≠ctimas del poderoso sismo.[1]', 'El Parque Costanera es un parque ubicado en la ribera norte del R√≠o Bio-Bio, en la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile. Comenz√≥ a ser construido el a√±o 2000 como parte de las obras de recuperaci√≥n urbana de la Ribera Norte impulsado por el gobierno de Eduardo Frei Ruiz-Tagle, cuya obra m√°s importante fue el Puente Llacol√©n. Durante todo el siglo XX el √°rea fue un sector de pantanos, ocupado por viviendas precarias y utilizado como basural. Fue inaugurado el 26 de marzo de 2003, por el presidente Ricardo Lagos.', 'Universidad de Concepci√≥n (UdeC), is a traditional Chilean private university, the work of the Penquista community, one of the most traditional and prestigious in its country, considered complex due to its extensive research in the various areas of knowledge. Founded on May 14, 1919, it is the third oldest university in Chile, and one of the 25 universities belonging to the Council of Rectors of Chilean Universities.Its headquarters are located in the city of Concepci√≥n, and also has two other campuses in Chill√°n and Los √Ångeles. In a citizen survey carried out in 2012, it was chosen as the symbol that most identifies Penquists.', 'El Mirador Alem√°n es un monumento ubicado en la cumbre del Cerro Caracol, a 80 metros de altitud en la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile, y entre 230 y 250 msnm. Corresponde a la √∫nica Torre Bismarck construida en Am√©rica, de las aproximadamente 250 que se construyeron, entre 1869 y 1934 en honor al excanciller alem√°n Otto von Bismarck.[2]', 'El Cerro Chepe es un cerro ubicado en la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile. La atraviesa por uno de sus costados la Avenida 21 de Mayo, a la altura del barrio Lorenzo Arenas, y por el costado opuesto, el R√≠o Biob√≠o, a la altura del Puente Ferroviario Biob√≠o, dando la cara a la comuna de San Pedro de la Paz.En sus faldas se sit√∫a el Cementerio General de Concepci√≥n, y durante un tiempo sirvi√≥ como paseo y lugar de descanso, quedando de ello actualmente s√≥lo una gran cruz y un mirador abandonados.', 'El Cerro Caracol es un hito geogr√°fico de la ciudad de Concepci√≥n, Chile. Es conocido como el pulm√≥n verde de la ciudad, por la gran cantidad de forestaci√≥n y flora que contiene. Como √°rea recreativa se ha ¬´fusionado¬ª con el Parque Ecuador, el que se ubica a las faldas del cerro.[2]El cerro se extiende por m√°s de 1200 ha de variada y abundante vegetaci√≥n, y su altura m√°xima es de 250 metros. Posee diversos senderos y caminos para veh√≠culos motorizados que permiten la realizaci√≥n de paseos, senderismo o ciclismo.[2]', 'Estadio Alcaldesa Ester Roa Rebolledo is a multi-purpose stadium in Concepci√≥n, Chile. It is used mostly for football matches. The stadium was built in 1962, as Estadio Regional, with an original capacity of 35,000 people. In 2015, it was completely renovated with new seats and a roof; currently has a capacity of 30,448 seats.Until 2010 it was known as Estadio Municipal de Concepci√≥n. The stadium took its new name, Ester Roa Rebolledo, who was a former Concepci√≥n city mayor.', "The Battle of Lagunillas was a battle in the Arauco War on November 8, 1557, between the army of Garc√≠a Hurtado de Mendoza and the Mapuche army near some shallow lakes a league south of the Bio-Bio River.In anticipation of Mendoza's invasion of their territory, the Mapuche organized their defense by gathering their forces in three places; the first was a pucar√° on the height of Andalic√°n five leagues south of Concepcion covering the approach down the coast to Arauco. The rest of their forces gathered near Millarapue and Tucapel.", 'El Anfiteatro de San Pedro de la Paz o Anfiteatro San Pedro de la Paz es un peque√±o anfiteatro al aire libre de estructura semi-circular, con capacidad para 3000 personas sentadas, ubicado en la Villa San Pedro, que constituye el n√∫cleo c√≠vico de la comuna San Pedro de la Paz, perteneciente a la Provincia de Concepci√≥n, Chile.Se sit√∫a detr√°s del Colegio Concepci√≥n de San Pedro, y en las faldas de los cerros pertenecientes a la Laguna Grande. Por ser al aire libre, el anfiteatro est√° dise√±ado para la realizaci√≥n de eventos culturales, musicales, teatrales, danc√≠sticos, etc. gratuitos, normalmente financiados por la Municipalidad de San Pedro de la Paz.', 'La Laguna Grande es un lago de origen glacial ubicado en la comuna de San Pedro de la Paz, en la Regi√≥n del B√≠o-B√≠o, Chile.Corresponde a un peque√±o lago de baja profundidad, emplazado en uno de los costados del radio urbano del Gran Concepci√≥n, en el extremo noroeste de la Cordillera de Nahuelbuta y al sur del R√≠o B√≠o-B√≠o. Con un per√≠metro de 9800 metros, posee un largo m√°ximo de 2675 metros, y su parte m√°s ancha mide 1.375 metros. En total ocupa un √°rea de poco m√°s de 155 hect√°reas (1,557,725 metros cuadrados), y posee una profundidad m√°xima de 13.5 metros, siendo su profundidad media de 8.1 metros.', 'Club Hipico de Concepcion, also called the Mediocamino, is a Thoroughbred race track in Hualpen near Concepcion in the Bio-Bio Region of Chile. It features a right-handed nine-furlong dirt track. Currently, no major races are run at the Mediocamino.Four-time American Champion jockey Jos√© A. Santos, a native of Concepcion, started his career at the track.Home Page Racecourse Profile on Horse Racing South America', 'El Cerro Amarillo es un peque√±o cerro de la comuna de Hualp√©n, parte del √°rea metropolitana del Gran Concepci√≥n, en la Provincia de Concepci√≥n, Chile. Posee una altura de 28 metros.[1]El cerro se ubica casi en el centro de la comuna, entre las calles Finlandia, Alemania y Bulgaria, siendo rodeado por la 4¬™ Comisar√≠a de Carabineros, la 10¬™ Compa√±√≠a de Bomberos y el Consultorio de Salud de la comuna.[2]Antiguamente el Cerro Amarillo era utilizado por los mapuches como uno de sus centros de actividades y ceremonias del sector.[3]', 'Estadio Huachipato-CAP Acero (Compa√±√≠a de Acero del Pac√≠fico), is a football stadium in Talcahuano, Chile. It is the home field of the Huachipato football team. Until 2012, Naval also played its home matches there until 2012. Opened in 2009, it replaced the old Estadio Las Higueras, which was demolished in 2008. The stadium capacity is 10,500 people (all-seated).Official Page Blog about the construction progress', 'Estadio Huachipato-CAP Acero (Compa√±√≠a de Acero del Pac√≠fico), is a football stadium in Talcahuano, Chile. It is the home field of the Huachipato football team. Until 2012, Naval also played its home matches there until 2012. Opened in 2009, it replaced the old Estadio Las Higueras, which was demolished in 2008. The stadium capacity is 10,500 people (all-seated).Official Page Blog about the construction progress', 'El parque nacional Nongu√©n, que abarca 3055 hect√°reas y est√° mayormente emplazada en la comuna de Chiguayante (aunque tambi√©n ocupa parte de las comunas de Concepci√≥n y Hualqui), fue creada el 30 de diciembre de 2009, siendo la quinta reserva de la regi√≥n del Biob√≠o, y el 8 de mayo de 2020 fue recategorizado como parque nacional, convirti√©ndose en el primero de su tipo existente en un sector periurbano de Chile.[1]']

column5: ['CCM Kirumba Stadium']
column6: ['CCM Kirumba Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in Mwanza, Tanzania. It has a capacity of 35,000 and is the second largest stadium in the country after the National Stadium in Dar es SalaamThe Tanzania national football team has played many friendlies at this stadium.The Tanzania national football team played a friendly game in the stadium against Malawi on 29 March 2015. The match resulted in a 1-1 draw.It has been the home of Mwanza football teams that play in Tanzanian Premier League and in the Tanzanian First Division League.CCM Kirumba Stadium on YouTube CCM Kirumba Stadium at National-football-teams.com']

column6: ['El teatro Isauro Mart√≠nez es un teatro ubicado en la ciudad mexicana de Torre√≥n, Coahuila, considerado el segundo m√°s bello del pa√≠s, luego del Teatro Ju√°rez de la ciudad de Guanajuato. Su arquitectura es una mezcla de estilos neog√≥tico, bizantino y morisco. Fue inaugurado en 1930 por el empresario de espect√°culos Isauro Mart√≠nez.Fue dise√±ado por el se√±or Abel Blas Cortinas, construido en el a√±o de 1928 e inaugurado el 7 de marzo de 1930 con la obra ¬øQui√©n te quiere a ti?, bajo la direcci√≥n de Manuel Tam√©s y protagonizada por este y la actriz Maruja Griffel.Fue remodelado por el se√±or Alberto Ortega y reinaugurado el 12 de noviembre de 1983.', 'El Museo del Ferrocarril de Torre√≥n es un espacio de exhibici√≥n del patrimonio ferroviario de Torre√≥n. Fue inaugurado el 7 de noviembre de 1997, con el objetivo de rescatar y difundir la historia del ferrocarril en la Comarca Lagunera y su relevancia para la historia nacional de los ferrocarriles.', 'El Museo Regional de la Laguna es un recinto museogr√°fico que se encuentra en la Comarca Lagunera (la cual es una regi√≥n entre dos estados de M√©xico: Coahuila y Durango).Este museo tiene colecciones de objetos de arqueolog√≠a particularmente regional, por lo que es un patrimonio hist√≥rico para los pobladores del norte del pa√≠s.El Museo Regional de la Laguna tiene cuatro salas principales, las cuales son:Mesoam√©rica. Licio Lagos.Etnograf√≠a.[1]y la independencia de los gatosComarca Lagunera. Durango.Museo Regional de la Laguna [1]', 'The Second Battle of Torre√≥n, which lasted from March 21 to April 2, 1914, was one of the major battles of the Mexican Revolution, where revolutionaries led by Pancho Villa occupied a city protected by Huertist federal forces.', 'El Cristo de las Noas, located on the Cerro de las Noas hill, in the Mexican city of Torre√≥n, Coahuila, is a large sculpture by Vladimir Alvarado, portraying Jesus Christ. It was built between 1973 and 2000.', "Estadio de la Revoluci√≥n is a sports arena located near the downtown area of Torre√≥n in Coahuila, Mexico. It has a seating capacity of 9,500. Though used mainly for baseball games, it sometimes hosts concerts and other non-sport events. It is the home field of the Algodoneros de Uni√≥n Laguna baseball team, and as such, it is the oldest professional baseball field in Mexico still in function. Since it was originally constructed as a multi sport stadium and featured a running track the Estadio de la Revoluci√≥n features the largest foul territory of any ball park within the Mexican League, the area of the former running track. The stadium is named to commemorate the Mexican Revolution of 1910‚Äì1920, a political change that was still recent at the time of the venue's opening on 15 September 1932. The stadium was renovated in the fall of 2002 to provide a refurbished appearance for the baseball team's reorganization, renaming, and new season starting in 2003.", 'The Corona Stadium (the name comes from the beer brand) was one of the smallest football stadiums in Mexico having only capacity for 20,100 seats. It was located in the city of Torre√≥n, Coahuila. This sport facility was used mostly for football games and was the home of the club Santos Laguna. This stadium did not host any FIFA World Cup games because of its limited size and facilities. In 2004 this stadium hosted several games of the Copa Libertadores. The stadium was demolished on 2 November 2009.List of football stadiums in Mexico', 'The Coliseo Centenario de Torre√≥n (Centennial Coliseum of Torre√≥n in English), officially named "Centro de Espectaculos Coliseo Centenario" is a multi-purpose complex in Torre√≥n, in the state of Coahuila, Mexico. The complex can seat up to 10,000 people. It can also accommodate and services concerts, theater, sports venue, exhibitions and conventions it also has restaurants, a bullfighting museum, and offices.']

column5: ['Battle of Guararapes', 'Praia do Paiva']
column6: ['The Second Battle of Guararapes was the second and decisive battle in a conflict called the Pernambucana Insurrection, between Dutch and Portuguese forces in February 1649 at Jaboat√£o dos Guararapes in Pernambuco. The defeat convinced the Dutch "that the Portuguese were formidable opponents, something which they had hitherto refused to concede." The Dutch still retained a presence in Brazil until 1654 and a treaty was signed in 1661.', 'A Praia do Paiva √© uma praia localizada no munic√≠pio de Cabo de Santo Agostinho, a 28km de Recife no estado brasileiro de Pernambuco.A sua paisagem √© composta por uma densa faixa de coqueirais, mar azul e areias claras. O banho √© mais adequado na mar√© baixa, pois a presen√ßa de arrecifes ocasiona a forma√ß√£o de pequenas piscinas naturais.Na praia do Paiva acontece uma das maiores manifesta√ß√µes culturais da regi√£o: a Festa da Lavadeira, um evento popular que surgiu em 1987 e a cada ano atrai mais turistas.Praia de Boa Viagem Praia do Pina']

column6: ['The Musashigawa stable (Japanese: Ê≠¶ËîµÂ∑ùÈÉ®Â±ã, Hepburn: Musashigawa-beya) is a stable of sumo wrestlers, part of the Dewanoumi ichimon or group of stables. It is an off-shoot of the better known stable of the same name set up by former yokozuna Mienoumi in 1981, which is currently known as Fujishima stable. Former yokozuna Musashimaru branched off from that stable in April 2013 after taking on the elder name of his former head coach and started a new stable using the Musashigawa name. The site was reformed by constructing the museum and other facilities including Colton Plaza.', "Edogawa Stadium (Ê±üÊà∏Â∑ùÂå∫Èô∏‰∏äÁ´∂ÊäÄÂ†¥, Edogawa-ku rikuj≈ç ky≈çgi-j≈ç) is a multi-purpose stadium in the Edogawa area of Tokyo, Japan. 'Kiba Park (Êú®Â†¥ÂÖ¨Âúí, kiba k≈çen) is a Tokyo metropolitan park in K≈çt≈ç, Tokyo. The park includes jogging paths, playgrounds, tennis courts, a BBQ area, and spaces for events. The park is divided into two parts, north and south, connected by a pedestrian bridge. The Museum of Contemporary Art Tokyo is located in this park.After Great fire of Meireki in 1657, timber yard was moved here from Central TokyoÔºàthen EdoÔºâ.In 1969, the Tokyo Metropolitan Government relocated its timber industries and then made the current location into a tree filled park.General admission is free. It is an 8-minute walk from Kiba Station on the Tokyo Metro Tozai Line.Parks and gardens in Tokyo', 'The Textile Culture and Ukiyo-e Art Museum ‚Äì Amuse Museum („ÄåÂ∏ÉÊñáÂåñ„Å®ÊµÆ‰∏ñÁµµ„ÅÆÁæéË°ìÈ§®„Äç„Ç¢„Éü„É•„Éº„Ç∫„Éü„É•„Éº„Ç∏„Ç¢„É†, Nuno Bunka to Ukiyoe no Bijutsukan Amy≈´zu My≈´jiamu), or simply Amuse Museum, is a private museum specializing in Japanese textile culture and ukiyo-e. It opened on 1 November 2009 in Asakusa, Tokyo, not far from Ueno Park, where multiple other museums are located.The museum houses a collection of everyday clothing and other textiles from the private collection of folklorist Ch≈´zabur≈ç Tanaka. While only about 1500 of the items are on display at any time, the museum rotates through the collection every few months.The talent and entertainment agency Amuse is the owner of the museum.', 'Yokoamich≈ç Park (Ê®™Á∂≤Áî∫ÂÖ¨Âúí, Yokoamich≈ç k≈çen) is a public park in the Yokoami district of Sumida, Tokyo, Japan.Following the Great Kant≈ç earthquake on 1 September 1923, as many as 44,000 column6: ['The Latakia Tetraporticus, also sometimes referred to as the Triumphal Arch of Septimius Severus is a triumphal arch located in modern-day Latakia in the south-east region of the city, in the Port Said street believed to be built in honour of the Roman emperor Septimius Severus, and its date of construction is around 183.It is considered as a symbol for the city of Latakia.It is from 30 to 40 feet high, and has four door ways.The tetrapylon would have marked the eastern end of the Roman city, as occasional Classic Roman columns litter the surrounding streets.', 'Al-Assad Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿØ\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Latakia, Syria. It is currently used mostly for football matches. The stadium has a capacity of 28,000 spectators. The stadium was opened in 1978 and completely renovated in 2004. It is home to Syrian Premier League football clubs Hutteen SC and Tishreen SC.The complex includes a nearby Olympic size swimming and diving pools and a hotel.The stadium was home to the final match of the football competition at the 1987 Mediterranean Games.', 'Al-Assad Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿØ\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Latakia, Syria. It is currently used mostly for football matches. The stadium has a capacity of 28,000 spectators. The stadium was opened in 1978 and completely renovated in 2004. It is home to Syrian Premier League football clubs Hutteen SC and Tishreen SC.The complex includes a nearby Olympic size swimming and diving pools and a hotel.The stadium was home to the final match of the football competition at the 1987 Mediterranean Games.', "Tishreen University (Arabic: ÿ¨ÿßŸÖÿπÿ© ÿ™ÿ¥ÿ±ŸäŸÜ\u200e, lit.\u2009'October University'), is a public university located in Latakia, Syria. It is the third-largest university in Syria. It was established on 20 May 1971 as the University of Latakia before the name was turned to commemorate October War.", 'The Battle of Latakia (Arabic: ŸÖÿπÿ±ŸÉÿ© ÿßŸÑŸÑÿßÿ∞ŸÇŸäÿ©\u200e; Hebrew: ◊ß◊®◊ë ◊ú◊ò◊ß◊ô◊î\u200e) was a small but revolutionary naval action of the Yom Kippur War, fought on 7 October 1973 between Israel and Syria. It was the first naval battle in history to see combat between surface-to-surface missile-equipped missile boats and the use of electronic deception.', 'Hama Municipal Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿ≠ŸÖÿßÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ®ŸÑÿØŸä\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Hama, Syria. It is currently used mostly for football matches. The stadium has a capacity of 22,000 spectators. It was opened in 1958 and renovated 1996. It is home to Nawair SC and Taliya SC of the Syrian Premier League.List of stadiums', 'Bassel al-Assad Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿ®ÿßÿ≥ŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ£ÿ≥ÿØ\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Al-Hasakah. It is currently used mostly for football matches. The stadium has a capacity of 25,000 spectators.List of stadiums', 'Latakia Sports City Stadium (Arabic: ŸÖŸÑÿπÿ® ÿßŸÑŸÖÿØŸäŸÜÿ© ÿßŸÑÿ±Ÿäÿßÿ∂Ÿäÿ© ÿ®ÿßŸÑŸÑÿßÿ∞ŸÇŸäÿ©\u200e) is a multi-purpose stadium in Latakia, Syria. It is mostly used for football matches. With a capacity of 45,000 spectators, the stadium is the second largest sports venue in Syria. It was opened in 1987 as a part of the Latakia Sports City and became the main venue of the 10th Mediterranean Games in Latakia (1987).List of football stadiums in Syria']

column5: ["Sucat People's Park", 'Bamboo Organ Park', 'Las Pi√±as‚ÄìPara√±aque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area', 'Newport Performing Arts Theatre', 'Battle of Zapote River', 'Battle of Zapote River', 'Triumph of Science over Death', 'Philippine Army Museum', 'Emperador Stadium', 'Dessert Museum', 'Cuneta Astrodome', 'Glorietta 4 Cinemas', 'Washington SyCip Park', 'Legazpi Active Park', 'Museo ng Muntinlupa', 'Ayala Triangle Gardens', 'Sunken Garden', 'Battle of Manila Bay', 'Salcedo Park']
column6: ["The Sucat People's Park, also known simply as Sucat Park and Sucmun Park, is a lakefront park located on the shore of Laguna de Bay in Muntinlupa, Metro Manila, the Philippines. It is a public community park in a reclaimed portion of the village of Sucat just north of the Sucat Thermal Power Plant on the border between Purok 3 and Purok 4, east of Don Juan Bayview Subdivision. Entry is from M.L. Quezon Street (Alabang‚ÄìPateros Road) and Meralco Road from the Sucat Interchange of the South Luzon Expressway and Dr. Santos Avenue (Sucat Road).", "The Las Pi√±as Bamboo Organ in St. Joseph Parish Church in Las Pi√±as, Philippines, is a 19th-century church organ. It is known for its unique organ pipes; of its 1031 pipes, 902 are made of bamboo. It was completed after 6 years of work in 1824 by Father Diego Cera, the builder of the town's stone church and its first resident Catholic parish priest.", 'The Las Pi√±as‚ÄìPara√±aque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA), also known as the Las Pi√±as‚ÄìPara√±aque Wetland Park, is a protected area at the coasts of the cities of Las Pi√±as and Para√±aque in Metro Manila, Philippines. The entire wetland is a declared Ramsar site under the Ramsar Convention of UNESCO.', 'The Newport Performing Arts Theater (NPAT), also known as simply Newport Theater, is a performing arts center on the grounds of Resorts World Manila in Pasay, Metro Manila, the Philippines. It is a modern multi-purpose theater named after its location in the Newport Mall and entertainment complex connected to the integrated resort in the 25-hectare (62-acre) Newport City township. The 1,500-seat facility opened in 2010 and holds the widest stage in the Philippines. It is one of the three major performing arts venues in Metro Manila that plays host to both touring and locally-produced musicals, live stage shows, concerts, and regular televised events such as awards ceremonies and pageants.', 'The Battle of Zapote River (Filipino: Labanan sa Ilog ng Zapote, Spanish: Batalla de Rio de Zapote), also known as the Battle of Zapote Bridge, was fought on the 13 June 1899 between 1,200 Americans and between 4,000~5,000 Filipinos. It was the second largest battle of the Philippine‚ÄìAmerican War after the Battle of Manila five months before in February 1899. Zapote River separates the town of Las Pi√±as in what was then Manila province from Bacoor in the province of Cavite. The ruins of Zapote Bridge still stands next to its replacement bridge on Aguinaldo Highway.', 'The Battle of Zapote River (Filipino: Labanan sa Ilog ng Zapote, Spanish: Batalla de Rio de Zapote), also known as the Battle of Zapote Bridge, was fought on the 13 June 1899 between 1,200 Americans and between 4,000~5,000 Filipinos. It was the second largest battle of the Philippine‚ÄìAmerican War after the Battle of Manila five months before in February 1899. Zapote River separates the town of Las Pi√±as in what was then Manila province from Bacoor in the province of Cavite. The ruins of Zapote Bridge still stands next to its replacement bridge on Aguinaldo Highway.', 'The Triumph of Science over Death, also known as Scientia, is a clay sculpture made by Jos√© Rizal as a gift to his friend Ferdinand Blumentritt.The statue depicts a young, nude woman with flowing hair, standing on a skull while bearing a torch. The woman symbolizes the ignorance of humankind during the Dark Ages of history, while the torch she bears symbolizes the enlightenment science brings to the world. The woman stands atop a skull, a symbol of death, to signify the victory that humankind aims to achieve by conquering the bane of death through scientific advancement.', "The Philippine Army Museum is a military museum located within the premises of Fort Bonifacio in Taguig, Philippines.The Philippine Army Museum was established in 1979. In the late 1980s, Commanding General of the Philippine Army Mariano Adalem had the former US Army Commanding General headquarters converted into the Philippine Army Museum and Library. The Fort Bonifacio Tunnel was also integrated into the museum's exhibits. Both museum and tunnel were inaugurated in 1989. During the 1990s, the museum was relocated when a substantial portion of Fort Bonifacio was converted into the business and residential district now known as Bonifacio Global City.", 'McKinley Hill Stadium is an all-weather football pitch in the Philippines made of artificial turf. Developed by real estate developer Megaworld Corporation and constructed by All Asia Structures, Inc., it sits on a 15,000 square meter land in McKinley Hill, Fort Bonifacio, Taguig. The stadium has a seating capacity of 2,000 and is home to the United Football League (UFL). The Philippine Rugby Football Union signed a memorandum of agreement with Megaworld stating that the venue will be used as the official training ground of the national rugby teams.', 'The Dessert Museum is an interactive art exhibition, or "selfie museum", described as a cross between a museum, theme park and candy shop, with dessert-themed art pieces and installations. Located in Pasay, Metro Manila in the Philippines at the Conrad Manila Hotel within the SM Mall of Asia complex, and inspired by similar exhibitions like the Museum of Ice Cream, it is the first exhibit of its kind in Asia.Official website of the Dessert Museum', 'The Cuneta Astrodome is an indoor arena that is located in Pasay, Philippines. Since the 1993 PBA season, it was better known as the home of the Philippine Basketball Association. when it left the PhilSports Arena (that was then known as ULTRA), up until the 1998 and since 2001. It hosts the local basketball league sports competition. It has also hosted a slew of other political, evangelical gatherings and church anniversaries. It is also the permanent home of the Philippine Super Liga since 2014.Despite its name, the Cuneta Astrodome is not a dome-shaped indoor arena, since its exterior is rectangular in shape.', 'Glorietta is a shopping mall complex in the Ayala Center, Makati, Metro Manila, Philippines. The mall is owned by Ayala Land and operated through its subsidiary, the Ayala Malls. The mall is divided into five sections (named Glorietta 1‚Äì5) and contains many shops and restaurants, as well as cinemas, a gym, arcades and a large central activity center, often used to stage events.', 'Washington SyCip Park is a privately owned public park near Greenbelt mall in Legaspi Village, Makati, Metro Manila, Philippines. The park opened in 2006, and was named after Filipino accountant and banker Washington SyCip. In addition to many indigenous tropical trees and plants, the park contains gazebos, benches with quotes by Sycip, sculptures and a koi pond.The park is open daily from 06:00 to 22:00 PST (GMT+8). It is a no-smoking, no pet zone.', 'The Legazpi Active Park (sometimes spelled Legaspi) is a privately owned public space and pocket park in the Makati Central Business District in Makati, Metro Manila, the Philippines. It is located in Legazpi Village in the western side of the CBD, adjacent to Washington SyCip Park and near Greenbelt. The park, best known as the location of a weekend market known as the Legazpi Sunday Market, is maintained by the Makati Commercial Estate Association which is headquartered in a two-storey building at the adjoining parking lot since 2017. Its name is in reference to its location along Legazpi Street within the formerly gated Legazpi Village that was merged with the neighboring gated San Lorenzo Village to form Barangay San Lorenzo.', "Museo ng Muntinlupa also known as the Muntinlupa Museum is a history city museum in Centennial Avenue, Tunasan, Muntinlupa, Metro Manila, Philippines.The construction of the Museo ng Muntinlupa commenced on April 25, 2017 with an allotted budget of ‚Ç±180 million by the city government. It was initially projected to be finished within a year in time for the centennial celebration of Muntinlupa on December 19 but was completed within almost two years. It was opened to the public on March 1, 2019 coinciding with Muntinlupa's 24th founding anniversary as a city.", 'The Ayala Triangle Gardens is a 2-hectare (4.9-acre) landscaped urban park in Makati, Metro Manila, Philippines. It is a triangular public garden and courtyard in the center of the Makati Central Business District. It was named after its owner and developer Ayala Land, and opened to the public in November 19, 2009. Inspired by Hyde Park in London, the park, which is dotted with palms, acacia trees, and tropical foliage, is considered one of the few "green" areas in Makati.', 'The Muntinlupa Sunken Garden, also known as the New Bilibid Prison Sunken Garden and often shortened to simply Sunken Garden, is a large public urban park and a local government-protected zone in Muntinlupa, southern Metro Manila, the Philippines. It is an open grassy space on the southern shore of Jamboree Lake that is lower than the surrounding elevation in the New Bilibid Prison Reservation. The park is under the joint operation and management of the City Government of Muntinlupa and the Bureau of Corrections.', 'The Battle of Manila Bay (Filipino: Labanan sa Look ng Maynila; Spanish: Batalla de Bah√≠a de Manila), also known as the Battle of Cavite, took place on 1 May 1898, during the Spanish‚ÄìAmerican War. The American Asiatic Squadron under Commodore George Dewey engaged and destroyed the Spanish Pacific Squadron under Contraalmirante (Rear admiral) Patricio Montojo. The battle took place in Manila Bay in the Philippines, and was the first major engagement of the Spanish‚ÄìAmerican War. The battle was one of the most decisive naval battles in history and marked the end of the Spanish colonial period in Philippine history.', 'Jaime C. Velasquez Park, commonly referred to as Salcedo Park, is a pocket park in Makati, Metro Manila, the Philippines. It is one of four pockets of greenery located in the central business district within Salcedo Village in barangay Bel-Air. The park is the site of a popular weekend market called the Salcedo Community Market. It is also the main venue of the bi-annual contemporary art fair called Art in the Park.']

column5: ['General Trias Monument', 'Battle of Alapan']
column6: ['The St. Francis of Assisi Parish Church, commonly known as the General Trias Church, is the first Catholic parish church of the municipality of General Trias in Cavite province in the Philippines. Typical of towns established during the Spanish colonial period, the church is located at the plaza (town square) of General Trias, which was formerly called San Francisco de Malabon in honor of its patron saint, Saint Francis of Assisi.', 'The Battle of Alapan (Filipino: Labanan sa Alapan, Spanish: Batalla de Alapan) was fought on May 28, 1898, and was the first military victory of the Filipino Revolutionaries led by Emilio Aguinaldo after his return to the Philippines from Hong Kong. After the American naval victory in the Battle of Manila Bay, Aguinaldo returned from exile in Hong Kong, reconstituted the Philippine Revolutionary Army, and fought against the Spanish troops in a garrison in Alapan, Imus, Cavite. The battle lasted for five hours, from 10:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M.']

column5: ['Fort']
column6: ['Warangal Fort is located in Warangal District, Telangana, India. It was the capital city of Kakatiya dynasty and Musunuri Nayakas. It appears to have existed since at least the 12th century when it was the capital of the Kakatiyas. The fort has four ornamental gates, known as Kakatiya Kala Thoranam, that originally formed the entrances to a now ruined great Shiva temple. The Kakatiyan arch has been adopted and officially incorporated into the emblem of Telangana after the bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh. The fort is included in the "tentative list" of UNESCO World Heritage Site and was submitted by the Permanent Delegation of India to UNESCO on 10/09/2010.']

column5: ['Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Mel√©ndez', 'Metropolitano', 'Museo del Atlantico', 'Teatro Rex', 'Teatro Col√≥n', 'Teatro Amira de la Rosa']
column6: ["Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Mel√©ndez, commonly known as Estadio Metropolitano, or colloquially, El Metro, is a multi-use all-seater football stadium in Barranquilla, Colombia. It is the home stadium of local football team Atl√©tico Junior. It was built with a capacity of 46,692 for the Colombian World Cup bid in 1986. The stadium was inaugurated that year with a game between Uruguay and Junior, which the Uruguayans won 2‚Äì1. It is the largest stadium in Colombia, after the Estadio Deportivo Cali's renovation. The first official name of the stadium was Estadio Metropolitano, which was changed around 1991 in order to honor the Colombian footballer Roberto Mel√©ndez. This is the official stadium for the national football team of Colombia.", "Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Mel√©ndez, commonly known as Estadio Metropolitano, or colloquially, El Metro, is a multi-use all-seater football stadium in Barranquilla, Colombia. It is the home stadium of local football team Atl√©tico Junior. It was built with a capacity of 46,692 for the Colombian World Cup bid in 1986. The stadium was inaugurated that year with a game between Uruguay and Junior, which the Uruguayans won 2‚Äì1. It is the largest stadium in Colombia, after the Estadio Deportivo Cali's renovation. The first official name of the stadium was Estadio Metropolitano, which was changed around 1991 in order to honor the Colombian footballer Roberto Mel√©ndez. This is the official stadium for the national football team of Colombia.", 'El Museo del Atl√°ntico es un escenario cultural de Barranquilla, Colombia, dedicado a salvaguardar la historia y la cultura del departamento del Atl√°ntico. Se encuentra ubicado en la calle 35 (San Blas), con carrera 39 (Ricaurte), en la edificaci√≥n donde funcion√≥ por muchos a√±os la gobernaci√≥n del Atl√°ntico. Fue preinaugurado el 20 de septiembre de 2011 por el gobernador Eduardo Verano de la Rosa e inaugurado oficialmente el 27 de diciembre de 2011. La inversi√≥n del proyecto fue de 6 000 millones de pesos colombianos.[1][2]', 'El Teatro Rex es una edificaci√≥n de estilo art dec√≥ dise√±ada como teatro a mediados de los a√±os 1930 por el arquitecto cubano Manuel Carrer√° en Barranquilla, Colombia.El teatro fue fundado por David Ferrero y abri√≥ fue inaugurado el jueves 7 de febrero de 1935 con la cinta Seamos o optimistas.[1]En la d√©cada de 1970 empez√≥ a funcionar como teatro porno. En 2008 cerr√≥ como teatro. En 2015 fue acondicionado como restaurante y funcion√≥ como tal hasta 2019.[2]La arquitectura art dec√≥ tiene como fin evocar la modernidad y los adelantos tecnol√≥gicos.[3] Dentro de ese marco, cont√≥ con un sistema de refrigeraci√≥n central, que le dio fama al teatro por su novedad y exclusividad.[3]', 'El Teatro Col√≥n es una sala de cine de estilo art dec√≥ dise√±ada a mediados de los a√±os 1940 por el arquitecto cubano Manuel Carrer√° en Barranquilla, Colombia.El edificio muestra la influencia del expresionismo alem√°n.[1] Su formas hacen referencias a las carabelas de Crist√≥bal Col√≥n.[1]Su fachada presenta una complejja composici√≥n de √°ngulos y planos,[1] tal y como es tradicional en el art dec√≥.Carlos Bell Lemus (coordinador) (2017). El Caribe Colombiano. p. 212. ISBN 978-84-8095-591-1. Consultado el 4 de junio de 2020.', 'El teatro Amira de la Rosa es un complejo cultural de la ciudad colombiana de Barranquilla. Fue bautizado en honor de la dramaturga y escritora Amira de la Rosa, autora de la letra del himno de Barranquilla.[2] Est√° ubicado en un estrat√©gico y tradicional sector de la ciudad donde confluyen los tradicionales barrios El Prado, Montecristo y Abajo, adem√°s de escenarios deportivos como el coliseo Humberto Perea, la piscina ol√≠mpica y varias universidades. Tambi√©n es la sede del √Årea Cultural del Banco de la Rep√∫blica en Barranquilla. Cumple una importante funci√≥n de difusi√≥n cultural y es el principal escenario de la ciudad para la realizaci√≥n de exposiciones, conciertos, tertulias, festivales, presentaciones y encuentros.[3]']

column6: ['O Museu Dimitri Sensaud de Lavaud, tamb√©m conhecido como Museu de Osasco, localiza-se no munic√≠pio de Osasco na grande S√£o Paulo, era no seu in√≠cio um casar√£o que fora constru√≠do no s√©culo XIX por Ant√¥nio Ag√∫ (cujo morou no casar√£o juntamente de sua esposa Primitiva Vianco), a mando do banqueiro Giovanni Br√≠cola. Se tornou museu apenas em 1976 com o intuito de contar um pouco a hist√≥ria da cidade de Osasco desde sua cria√ß√£o. O chal√© se localiza na regi√£o onde hoje √© a Avenida dos Autonomistas.', 'O Museu do Rel√≥gio Professor Dimas de Melo Pimenta √© um museu brasileiro tem√°tico dedicado a mostrar a evolu√ß√£o hist√≥rica e t√©cnica do rel√≥gio a partir dos anos, focando em seus diversos tipos e modelos usados pelo homem para contar a passagem do tempo e enfatiza a import√¢ncia do tempo cronol√≥gico para a Meteorologia, em que, sem ela, a ci√™ncia n√£o seria capaz de elaborar previs√µes de tempo em nenhum lugar.Localizado na Zona Oeste de S√£o Paulo (cidade), na Avenida Mofarrej, 840, no bairro Leopoldina na sede da DIMEP - Dimas de Melo Pimenta Sistemas de Ponto e Acesso Ltda.O museu se encontra dentro do pr√©dio da Dimep, espa√ßo que abrigava uma antiga f√°brica.', 'Aldeia de Carapicu√≠ba √© um centro hist√≥rico localizado ao sul do munic√≠pio de Carapicu√≠ba, situado no distrito de mesmo nome.Sua funda√ß√£o oficial √© considerada em 12 de Outubro de 1580.A fim de catequizar os √≠ndios e proteg√™-los da escravid√£o, o Padre Jos√© de Anchieta, segundo transcrevem alguns livros da √©poca, construiu doze aldeias em volta do Mosteiro de S√£o Bento para tirar os √≠ndios e padres que l√° viviam. Das doze aldeias a √∫nica que n√£o foi totalmente destru√≠da √© a Aldeia de Carapicu√≠ba, isso se deve ao fato de ser uma aldeia de dif√≠cil acesso.', 'O Museu de Arqueologia e Etnologia da Universidade de S√£o Paulo (MAE-USP) √© uma unidade da Universidade de S√£o Paulo. Voltada √† pesquisa, √† doc√™ncia e √† difus√£o cultural e cient√≠fica. Foi criado em 1989, a partir do desmembramento dos setores de arqueologia e etnologia do Museu Paulista, aos quais se fundiram as cole√ß√µes do Instituto de Pr√©-Hist√≥ria da USP, do antigo museu hom√¥nimo da Faculdade de Filosofia, Letras e Ci√™ncias Humanas (FFLCH) e do Acervo Pl√≠nio Ayrosa. Est√° localizado na Cidade Universit√°ria, na Zona Oeste de S√£o Paulo.', 'O Centro de Mem√≥ria Votorantim √© um museu de mem√≥ria empresarial, fundado na cidade de S√£o Paulo no ano de 2002 e aberto ao p√∫blico em 2005, marcando esse momento com uma exposi√ß√£o do Instituto Votorantim com o intuito de construir e armazenar um acervo com informa√ß√µes sobre a hist√≥ria da empresa Votorantim, do embri√£o da funda√ß√£o do grupo de fato no ano de 1918, com a funda√ß√£o da Sociedade Anonyma Fabrica Votorantim, aos dias de hoje. √â considerado um projeto pioneiro de mem√≥ria empresarial, com o objetivo central de organizar a documenta√ß√£o sobre a empresa brasileira.', 'O Monumento a Ramos de Azevedo √© um conjunto escult√≥rico em bronze e granito, localizado na cidade de S√£o Paulo. Foi executado pelo escultor √≠talo-brasileiro Galileo Emendabili, como uma homenagem p√≥stuma a Francisco de Paula Ramos de Azevedo, um dos mais importantes nomes da arquitetura e do urbanismo em S√£o Paulo. O artista faleceu em 12 de Junho de 1928 e o monumento em sua homenagem escolhido por meio de concurso, foi inaugurado em 25 de janeiro de 1934, anivers√°rio da cidade, na avenida Tiradentes, em frente ao edif√≠cio da Pinacoteca do Estado ‚Äì importante obra do engenheiro-arquiteto. Em 1973, devido √†s obras do metr√¥, o monumento foi transferido para a Cidade Universit√°ria Armando de Salles Oliveira, onde permanece, at√© hoje, na pra√ßa que leva o nome do arquiteto, pr√≥xima √† Escola Polit√©cnica, institui√ß√£o que ajudou a criar. O monumento come√ßou a ser constru√≠do em 1929, no entanto, levou seis anos para ser constru√≠do.', "The Museum of Veterinary Anatomy (MAV), Portuguese: Museu de Anatomia Veterin√°ria Prof. Dr. Pl√≠nio Pinto e Silva, is a museum open to public at the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine and Animal Science (FMVZ) at the University of S√£o Paulo (USP), Brazil. It was named in honor of Professor Plinio Pinto e Silva, veterinarian and member of the S√£o Paulo Veterinary Medicine Academy, a pioneer in obtaining the associate professor title at the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine of USP. The museum was opened to visitors in 1984 and has a permanent exhibition, studied and curated by teachers, professionals and students of the faculty. Before the museum was opened to visitors, the collection was used by college teachers in their classes. Between 2004 and 2008, the MAV was closed to visitors for the transfer of FMVZ headquarters to USP's college campus (known as Cidade Universit√°ria).", 'A Matemateca (Matemateca IME-USP) re√∫ne um acervo de objetos relacionados √† matem√°tica e ao ensino da matem√°tica que est√° abrigado no Instituto de Matem√°tica e Estat√≠stica da Universidade de S√£o Paulo. Trata-se de numa iniciativa que remonta ao ano de 2003, quando professores ligados ao IME se mobilizaram e contaram com o apoio das Pr√≥-Reitorias de Gradua√ß√£o e de Cultura e Extens√£o da USP ( Universidade de S√£o Paulo) e do CNPQ ( Conselho Nacional de Pesquisa) para a organiza√ß√£o do acervo. A Matemateca organiza exposi√ß√µes abertas ao p√∫blico.Os professores que iniciaram o projeto foram:', 'O Museu Oceanogr√°fico do Instituto Oceanogr√°fico da Universidade de S√£o Paulo foi fundado em outubro de 1988, localizado na Pra√ßa do Oceanogr√°fico na Cidade Universit√°ria, com o objetivo de difundir a Ci√™ncia Oceanogr√°fica e as pesquisas realizadas pelo Instituto Oceanogr√°fico (IOUSP), al√©m de promover atividades culturais em benef√≠cio a sociedade. O museu mant√©m exposi√ß√µes permanentes com um acervo dividido em m√≥dulos que evidenciam a din√¢mica, a estrutura e a biodiversidade dos oceanos bem como aspectos da ci√™ncia oceanografia. Possui o intuito de ser uma institui√ß√£o de refer√™ncia na transmiss√£o do conhecimento sobre os oceanos e tamb√©m na contribui√ß√£o para respostas aos problemas de ordem local e global, relacionados ao clima e explora√ß√£o sustentada dos ecossistemas marinhos. Docentes do Instituto participam ativamente do encaminhamento de quest√µes com aplica√ß√£o imediata √† preserva√ß√£o e conserva√ß√£o do meio ambiente marinho, quando solicitados por empresas, √≥rg√£os p√∫blicos e privados. O Museu Oceanogr√°fico recebe cerca de 25 mil visitantes anuais.', 'Villa-Lobos State Park (Portuguese: Parque Estadual Villa-Lobos) is a park in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. It is named after composer Heitor Villa-Lobos, and is located next to Pinheiros River. It was created in 1989 on a site that was previously used as a rubbish tip. The park now has around 37,000 trees. It hosts the annual Aberto de S√£o Paulo.The park is located the Alto de Pinheiros district to the west of the centre of S√£o Paulo.', 'O Museu de Geoci√™ncias do Instituto de Geoci√™ncias da Universidade de S√£o Paulo √© um museu localizado no interior da Universidade de S√£o Paulo, mais precisamente no campus do Butant√£, na Cidade Universit√°ria Armando de Salles Oliveira. Seu acervo √© diversificado e conta com √°reas de geologia, mineralogia e paleontologia, estando aberto √† visita√ß√£o p√∫blica. Trata-se de uma unidade auxiliar ligada ao Instituto de Geoci√™ncias da USP. Desde 1991, o Museu ocupa uma √°rea de 550 m¬≤, localizada no primeiro andar do edif√≠cio principal do Instituto de Geoci√™ncias da USP, mas possui tamb√©m espa√ßos abertos para outras e maiores exposi√ß√µes.', 'O Parque Cidade de Toronto √© um parque localizado no bairro City Am√©rica, regi√£o de Pirituba, zona noroeste da cidade de S√£o Paulo.O parque foi criado no ano de 1992 pela Prefeitura de S√£o Paulo em parceria e coopera√ß√£o t√©cnica da prefeitura da cidade de Toronto, Canad√°.prodam.sp.gov.br: Parque Cidade de Toronto - Hist√≥rico e descri√ß√£o', 'O Memorial aos Membros da Comunidade USP que foram perseguidos e mortos por motiva√ß√µes pol√≠ticas durante o regime militar (1964-1985) √© um monumento localizado no campus Butant√£ da Universidade de S√£o Paulo. Presta homenagem aos docentes, funcion√°rios e discentes da USP assassinados ou que desapareceram durante a ditadura militar no Brasil. Foi inaugurado em 2011, tendo sido idealizado pelo N√∫cleo de Estudos da Viol√™ncia (NEV).Constam do monumento nomes como: Ana Rosa Kucinski Silva e Vladimir Herzog.Est√° grafada no monumento a frase da Declara√ß√£o Universal dos Direitos Humanos: ‚ÄúNingu√©m ser√° submetido a tortura nem a tratamento ou castigo cruel, desumano ou degradante‚Äù.', 'Het Beeldenpark van het Museu de Arte Contempor√¢nea is de buitencollectie van het Museu de Arte Contempor√¢nea da Universidade de S√£o Paulo (MAC-USP) in de Braziliaanse stad S√£o Paulo.De beeldencollectie toont moderne en hedendaagse beeldhouwkunst van voornamelijk Braziliaanse beeldhouwers in de Jardim de Esculturas.De buitencollectie omvat sculpturen van onder anderen:Website MAC-USP', "The Museum of Contemporary Art, University of S√£o Paulo (Portuguese, Museu de Arte Contempor√¢nea da Universidade de S√£o Paulo) is a contemporary art museum located in the main campus of the University of S√£o Paulo, in S√£o Paulo, Brazil, and in Ibirapuera Park, in the same city. It is one of the largest art museums in the country.The museum was inaugurated in 1963, when the Brazilian industrialist and art collector Francisco Matarazzo Sobrinho, founder of the S√£o Paulo Museum of Modern Art, decided to extinguish this museum and donate all of its holdings, along with his and his wife's private collection, to the University of S√£o Paulo.", 'O Centro Cultural e de Estudos Superiores A√∫thos Pagano (CCESAP) √© uma institui√ß√£o cultural brasileira, localizada no bairro Alto da Lapa, na cidade de S√£o Paulo. √â uma organiza√ß√£o p√∫blica estadual, mantida pela Secretaria de Estado da Cultura e administrada em conjunto com uma organiza√ß√£o da sociedade civil (Instituto Pensarte).', 'O Museu Hist√≥rico do Instituto Butantan √© um dos dos tr√™s museus encontrados no parque do Instituto Butantan em S√£o Paulo. O Instituto Butantan possui ao todo quatro museus. O Museu Biol√≥gico, o Museu Hist√≥rico, o Museu de Microbiologia, localizados no Campus Butantan, e o Museu de Sa√∫de P√∫blica ‚ÄúEm√≠lio Ribas‚Äù, localizado no bairro do Bom Retiro. Este Museu, que foi criado em 1981, √© a reconstru√ß√£o do local do primeiro laborat√≥rio da institui√ß√£o, onde foram produzidos soros contra o surto da peste bub√¥nica. Diante desse fato, seu objetivo √© resgatar a hist√≥ria dos trabalhos desenvolvidos na √°rea de sa√∫de no Brasil, apresentando diversos objetos hist√≥ricos, como centrifugas, microsc√≥pios e fotos das antigas instala√ß√µes.', 'Inaugurado em 2002, em meio √†s comemora√ß√µes do 101¬∫ anivers√°rio do Instituto Butantan, o Museu de Microbiologia integra o complexo cient√≠fico e cultural do Instituto Butantan juntamente com o Museu Biol√≥gico, o Museu Hist√≥rico e o Museu de Sa√∫de P√∫blica Emilio Ribas. A miss√£o do museu √© "estimular a curiosidade cient√≠fica nas pessoas, principalmente nos jovens, promover oportunidades de aproxima√ß√£o da cultura cient√≠fica pelo p√∫blico em geral por meio de suas exposi√ß√µes e a√ß√µes educativas, a fim de promover cidad√£os cr√≠ticos e atuantes na sociedade."', 'O Museu do Instituto Butantan, em S√£o Paulo dedicado √† investiga√ß√£o cient√≠fica e onde s√£o expostos esp√©cimes vivos de cobras, lagartos, aranhas e escorpi√µes.O laborat√≥rio foi reconhecido como institui√ß√£o aut√¥noma em fevereiro de 1901, sob a denomina√ß√£o de Instituto Serumther√°pico, sendo designado para primeiro diretor, Vital Brazil Mineiro da Campanha, m√©dico voltado para problemas de sa√∫de p√∫blica. Gra√ßas ao idealismo de Vital Brazil, que al√©m da produ√ß√£o de soro antiof√≠dico e vacinas, tamb√©m se preocupava em desenvolver pesquisas, o Instituto tornou-se internacionalmente reconhecido. Em 1914 foi inaugurado o pr√©dio principal, com as condi√ß√µes necess√°rias para abrigar os laborat√≥rios, em torno dos quais cresceu uma institui√ß√£o que combina pesquisa e produ√ß√£o.', "Instituto Butantan (in modern Portuguese, Instituto Butant√£, pronounced [ƒ© Ét ÉiÀàtutu but…êÃÉÀàt…êÃÉ]) is a Brazilian biologic research center located in Butant√£, in the western part of the city of S√£o Paulo, Brazil. Instituto Butantan is a public institution affiliated with the S√£o Paulo State Secretariat of Health and considered one of the major scientific centers in the world. Butantan is the largest immunobiologicals and biopharmaceuticals producer in Latin America (and one of the largest in the world). It is world-renowned for its collection of venomous snakes, as well as those of venomous lizards, spiders, insects and scorpions. By extracting the reptiles' and insects' venoms, the Institute develops antivenoms and medicines against many diseases, which include tuberculosis, rabies, tetanus and diphtheria.", 'O Parque Estadual do Jaragu√° √© um parque brasileiro do estado de S√£o Paulo, Brasil. A √°rea de preserva√ß√£o foi criada em 1961, em torno do Pico do Jaragu√°, o ponto mais alto do munic√≠pio de S√£o Paulo, elevando-se a uma altitude de 1.135 metros, na Serra da Cantareira.√â um parque remanescente de Mata Atl√¢ntica, onde se localiza a casa de Afonso Sardinha, que hoje √© tombada pelo patrim√¥nio hist√≥rico, do lado da casa tamb√©m est√° localizado o local onde os escravos lavavam os ouros que eram encontrados no local. Tem tr√™s trilhas com total contato com a natureza. Tamb√©m √© poss√≠vel encontrar uma tribo de √≠ndios que at√© hoje vivem l√°.', 'O Museu da Educa√ß√£o e do Brinquedo (MEB), localizado na Faculdade de Educa√ß√£o da Universidade de S√£o Paulo (FEUSP) na zona oeste da capital, foi criado em 1999. O acervo do museu re√∫ne itens que s√£o datados do in√≠cio do s√©culo XX. Surge a partir de doa√ß√µes feitas para o Laborat√≥rio de Brinquedos e Materiais Pedag√≥gicos (Labrimp) da FEUSP de brinquedos, jogos, materiais pedag√≥gicos e um acervo fotogr√°fico, que possui valor hist√≥rico, das primeiras institui√ß√µes de educa√ß√£o infantil na cidade de S√£o Paulo. Instalou-se na Faculdade de Educa√ß√£o atrav√©s do financiamento da Funda√ß√£o de Amparo √† Pesquisa do Estado de S√£o Paulo (FAPESP).', 'Pico do Jaragu√° (Jaragu√° Peak) is the highest mountain in the Brazilian city of S√£o Paulo, at 1135 metres above sea level, located at the Serra da Cantareira. Jaragu√° means Lord of the Valley in Tupi.In 1580, Afonso Sardinha was settled on the mountain, and found gold there. However, due to the indigenous people who lived there at that time, the mining only began ten years later, after numerous wars. The gold was explored until it was not possible to find it any more, by the 19th century.', 'O Museu da Pol√≠cia Civil do Estado de S√£o Paulo, tamb√©m conhecido como Museu do Crime da Pol√≠cia Civil do Estado de S√£o Paulo, √© uma institui√ß√£o p√∫blica localizada na Cidade Universit√°ria, no bairro Butant√£, zona Oeste da cidade de S√£o Paulo. Seu objetivo √© preservar um acervo constitu√≠do por documentos de inqu√©ritos policiais, tais como as diferentes armas utilizadas pelos civis, tatuagens t√≠picas das cadeias, trag√©dias no tr√¢nsito, objetos usados em delitos e todas as outras situa√ß√µes que envolvem a criminalidade paulista a partir do s√©culo XX. O museu est√° situado no Campus I da Academia de Pol√≠cia "Dr. Coriolano Nogueira Cobra" (Acadepol) e seu patrim√¥nio cont√©m cerca de 3.000 itens.', 'A Casa do Butant√£, ou Casa do Bandeirante, √© uma constru√ß√£o em estilo bandeirista remanescente do per√≠odo colonial brasileiro localizada no Butant√£, bairro da cidade de S√£o Paulo. Representando um dos modelos t√≠picos de moradia rurais paulistas, foi constru√≠da por volta da primeira metade do s√©culo XVIII em extensa √°rea perif√©rica ao n√∫cleo urbano primitivo. Esta casa retrata um inabitual exemplar de edifica√ß√£o que acompanha as mudan√ßas da Cidade de S√£o Paulo desde os primeiros s√©culos da coloniza√ß√£o portuguesa, demonstrando em seu partido arquitet√¥nico e em suas paredes a mem√≥ria dos processos construtivos da arquitetura colonial paulista,em particular da taipa de pil√£o, t√©cnica utilizada na arquitetura colonial bandeirista. Possui 350m¬≤ divididos entre 12 c√¥modos e alpendres frontal e posterior. Atualmente o s√≠tio no qual a casa est√° implantada constitui a Pra√ßa Monteiro Lobato. Tal espa√ßo foi reservado para a preserva√ß√£o do im√≥vel quando do loteamento do bairro por parte da Cia. City. Durante a d√©cada de 1950, por conta das comemora√ß√µes do 4¬∫ Centen√°rio da cidade de S√£o Paulo, a casa foi objeto de um projeto de restauro de autoria de Lu√≠s Saia. A casa foi tombado pelo CONDEPHAAT (Conselho de Defesa do Patrim√¥nio Hist√≥rico, Arqueol√≥gico, Art√≠stico e Tur√≠stico), em 1982.', 'A Esta√ß√£o Ci√™ncia √© um centro de difus√£o cient√≠fica, tecnol√≥gica e cultural da Pr√≥-Reitoria de Cultura e Extens√£o Universit√°ria da Universidade de S√£o Paulo. Est√° localizada originalmente no bairro da Lapa, na zona oeste da cidade de S√£o Paulo, numa antiga f√°brica reformada, cont√≠gua ao terminal de √¥nibus da Lapa, ao Shopping Center Lapa e √† esta√ß√£o ferrovi√°ria da Companhia Paulista de Trens Metropolitanos. Atualmente, o edif√≠cio est√° fechado e n√£o existe um novo espa√ßo f√≠sico para o projeto.', 'O Museu da Pessoa √© um museu virtual e colaborativo de hist√≥rias de vida fundado em S√£o Paulo, em 1991. Desde sua origem tem como objetivo registrar, preservar e transformar em informa√ß√£o hist√≥rias de vida de toda e qualquer pessoa da sociedade. No Museu da Pessoa, al√©m de visitante, toda pessoa pode tamb√©m tornar-se parte do acervo ao registrar sua hist√≥ria de vida, assim como tamb√©m ser um curador, na medida em que pode publicar suas pr√≥prias cole√ß√µes de hist√≥rias, imagens e v√≠deos.']

column5: ['Battle of Tashihchiao']
column6: ["The Battle of Tashihchiao (Â§ßÁü≥Ê©ã„ÅÆÊà¶„ÅÑ, Taisekihashi no Tatakai) was a land engagement fought on 24‚Äì25 July 1904, during the Imperial Japanese Army's advance toward Liaoyang in first stage of the Russo-Japanese War. Tashihchiao (modern Dashiqiao) is located about 25 kilometres (16 mi) southwest of the city of Haicheng, in present-day Liaoning Province, China. The town of Tashihchiao was of strategic importance in the Russo-Japanese War, as it was a railroad junction between the main line on the Russian South Manchurian Railway and a spur which led to the old treaty port of Yingkou (Newchwang). Control of both was essential for further advances by Japanese forces towards Liaoyang and Mukden."]

column5: ['May 17th Stadium']
column6: ["17th May Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium located in Banjarmasin, Indonesia. It is currently used mostly for football matches. The stadium holds 15,000 people. It is the home stadium of Barito Putera and Peseban Banjarmasin, which was considered one of the major football clubs in Indonesia in 1994/95 Premier Division.The Stadium originally opened to the public on 17 May 1974 as a Multi-purpose stadium with a capacity around 5.000. it's undergone renovations three times first in 1988 with the last major one in 2008 and a third one for 2012."]

column6: ['Sha Tin Park, formerly known as Sha Tin Central Park, is a park at 2 Yuen Wo Road, Sha Tin, Hong Kong. It is situated along the Shing Mun River in the new town of Sha Tin, next to the New Town Plaza, Sha Tin Town Hall, and Sha Tin Public Library.The park occupies 8.05 hectares (19.89 acres) of land, and is managed by Leisure and Cultural Services Department. The opening hours are from 6:30 am to 11:00 pm.Most of the land that the park occupies was reclaimed from Tide Cove during the construction of the Sha Tin New Town, though some of the land existed beforehand and was previously occupied by the Sha Tin Airfield, a military air base.', 'Hong Kong Heritage Museum is a museum of history, art and culture in Sha Tin, Hong Kong, located beside the Shing Mun River. The museum opened on 16 December 2000. It is managed by the Leisure and Cultural Services Department of the Hong Kong Government. The six permanent exhibits and the original temporary exhibits were designed by design firm Reich+Petch along with Lord Cultural Resources.The museum building is the largest in Hong Kong, and can accommodate up to 6,000 visitors.The Museum has been designed to provide comprehensive exhibitions on history, art and culture. The Museum has a number of interactive exhibitions and programmes. It is adjacent to the Shing Mun River. It is currently used mostly for football matches by Shatin Sports Association. The stadium holds 5,000.Two covered grandstands Natural grass football pitch 400 m running track Clock (unused) Two refreshment kiosks (one is unused)Shatin will use the sports ground as the home stadium in the 2009‚Äì10 season.Leisure and Cultural Services Department of Hong Kong - Sports grounds in Shatin', 'Â§ßÂõ¥Ê∏∏‰πêÂú∫ÔºàËã±Ë™ûÔºöTai Wai PlaygroundÔºâ Ôºå È¶ôÊ∏ØÁöÑ‰∏ÄÂ∫ßÂÖ¨Âõ≠ Ôºå‰πüÊòØ‰∏ÄÂ∫ßÊ∏∏‰πêÂú∫ÔºåÂÆÉ‰Ωç‰∫éÊ≤ôÁî∞Â§ßÂõ¥ ÁßØÂØåË°óÂêåÊùëÂçóÈÅì‰∫§ÁïåÔºåË°åÊîø‰∏äÂΩíÊ≤ôÁî∞Âå∫„ÄÇËÆæÊñΩÊúâÁ°¨Âú∞ÁêÉÂú∫Ôºå‰ª•Âèä‰∏É‰∫∫Ë∂≥ÁêÉÂú∫„ÄÇÂÆòÁΩëÔºàÈ°µÈù¢Â≠òÊ°£Â§á‰ªΩÔºåÂ≠ò‰∫é‰∫íËÅîÁΩëÊ°£Ê°àÈ¶ÜÔºâ', "Tao Heung Foods of Mankind Museum (Chinese: Á®ªÈÑâÈ£≤È£üÊñáÂåñÂçöÁâ©È§®), formerly Foods of Mankind Museum, is the first 'foods of mankind' museum in Hong Kong. It is one of the few museums not run and funded by the government. It was housed in a two-floored building at 1 Lok Tin Street, On Lok Tsuen, Fanling, Hong Kong but closed in 2005 due to lack of funds. The museum introduced the food cultures of different countries from the past to the present.The museum was reopened on 15 October 2005. In 2008 it moved to Fo Tan, Sha Tin.", 'Shui Chuen O (Chinese: Ê∞¥Ê≥âÊæ≥), also known as Sugar Loaf Peak, is a 372 metres (1,220 ft) tall mountain located in Sha Tin, in Hong Kong\'s New Territories.The Shui Chuen O area is located between Lion Rock Country Park and Ma On Shan Country Park. Currently, this area primarily consists of public housing estates. Currently, this area primarily consists of upmarket residences, concentrating on the two sides of Sha Tin Heights Road.The hill is the site of Sha Tin Heights Tunnel and nearby Eagle's Nest Tunnel, a major infrastructure project in the area.List of mountains, peaks and hills in Hong Kong", 'Penfold Park (Chinese: ÂΩ≠Á¶èÂÖ¨Âúí) is a public park managed by the Hong Kong Jockey Club in Sha Tin, Hong Kong.
