column6: ['Los Jardines de la Universidad de Murcia son unas colecciones de plantas situados en el Campus de la Universidad de Murcia en Espinardo, Murcia. Comunidad aut√≥noma de la Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a.Se encuentra en la zona norte del municipio de Murcia, y aunque el Campus de denomina del Espinardo, no se encuentra en esta localidad, sino situado en las localidades de Guadalupe y El Puntal, se llega a √©l a trav√©s de la autov√≠a A-30, o bien por la Avenida de Juan Carlos I.', 'El palacio Vinader es un antiguo inmueble de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), construido en la segunda mitad del siglo XVIII en la plaza de Juli√°n Romea del centro hist√≥rico de la capital murciana.Construido por D. Salvador Vinader, Capit√°n de los Ej√©rcitos Reales y regidor del concejo de Murcia (sus sucesores ostentaron el t√≠tulo de marqueses de Torre Octavio),[1] en la segunda mitad del siglo XVIII, cuando el impacto de las obras de la fachada de la Catedral de Murcia trajo una evoluci√≥n hacia modelos m√°s pr√≥ximos al refinamiento rococ√≥ en la arquitectura de la ciudad, incluida la palaciega.', 'El Real Casino de Murcia, conocido habitualmente como Casino de Murcia, es uno de los edificios m√°s emblem√°ticos de la ciudad del mismo nombre, capital de la Regi√≥n de Murcia (Espa√±a). Se encuentra en el centro de la misma, en la calle Traper√≠a, no lejos de la catedral. El edificio, cuya construcci√≥n comenz√≥ en 1853, es una mezcla de distintas corrientes art√≠sticas que coexistieron en la segunda mitad del siglo XIX y principios del siglo XX en Espa√±a y fue declarado monumento hist√≥rico-art√≠stico nacional en 1983, por lo que en la actualidad est√° considerado Bien de Inter√©s Cultural, con la categor√≠a de ¬´monumento¬ª.[2][1]', 'El teatro Romea de Murcia est√° situado en la plaza de Juli√°n Romea del centro hist√≥rico de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Se trata del principal teatro de la localidad y uno de los m√°s importantes del pa√≠s.Inaugurado en 1862, tuvo que ser reconstruido tras sufrir diversos incendios. Su exterior es de 1880 y su interior se reconstruy√≥ entre 1899 y 1901.', 'El Monasterio de Santa Clara la Real es un conjunto mon√°stico de la orden de las Clarisas situado en la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Tiene su origen en el siglo XIV, ocupando lo que fue el antiguo Al-Qasr al-Sagir (Alc√°zar Menor) musulm√°n del siglo XIII.[2] Es uno de los edificios hist√≥ricos m√°s importantes de la ciudad al disponer de restos del palacio √°rabe (los m√°s importantes del arte isl√°mico murciano). El monasterio cuenta tambi√©n con un claustro y coro g√≥ticos, y una iglesia barroca.Parte del edificio es actualmente el Museo de Santa Clara, mientras que en el ala oeste se sit√∫a el Centro Cultural Las Claras de CajaMurcia.', 'El museo de la Catedral de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a) es un museo que forma parte del edificio de la catedral. Fue creado por deseo del obispo Miguel de los Santos e inaugurado en 1956. Cuenta con el Compromiso de Calidad Tur√≠stica.', 'La plaza de Santa Catalina de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a) es una de los espacios urbanos m√°s destacados del casco antiguo de dicha ciudad espa√±ola. Situada en el centro de la principal √°rea de tapeo y restauraci√≥n de la urbe, es una plaza peatonal.Considerada desde antiguo como la verdadera plaza mayor de Murcia, fue durante la Edad Media y gran parte de la Edad Moderna el centro pol√≠tico de la ciudad, lugar de proclamaciones, pregones, ejecuciones y reuniones concejiles.[1]En ella se encuentra el Museo Ram√≥n Gaya,[2] que expone la obra de este fundamental pintor murciano.', 'El Palacio de San Esteban es la sede de la Presidencia de la Regi√≥n de Murcia y del Consejo de Gobierno de esta comunidad aut√≥noma, situado en el antiguo Colegio de San Esteban de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), conjunto monumental edificado por los Jesu√≠tas en el siglo XVI, declarado Monumento Nacional en 1931.[1] Se encuentra en el centro de la capital, entre la calle de Acisclo D√≠az y el jard√≠n de San Esteban.', "The Archaeological Museum of Murcia (Spanish: Museo Arqueol√≥gico de Murcia; MAM) is a State-owned archaeological museum in Murcia, Spain.The Museum of Antiquities of Murcia was created by means of a 6 July 1864 royal order, constituted as an added section to the Museum of Painting and Sculpture, created earlier in the year. In 1910, the museum moved to the Cerr√°n building. In the 1950s, the museum moved again to its current premises, also known as Casa de la Cultura. The Spanish State transferred the museum's management to the Murcia's regional administration in 1984, while retaining its ownership.", 'La casa D√≠az Cassou de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), es uno de los inmuebles m√°s representativos de la arquitectura modernista en la susodicha ciudad. Est√° catalogada como Bien de Inter√©s CulturalSituada en la Calle Santa Teresa de la capital, se trata de una de las obras m√°s significativas del modernismo en la ciudad de Murcia.Es obra del arquitecto Jos√© Antonio Rodr√≠guez (1868-1938), hecha por encargo del escritor y erudito murcianista Pedro D√≠az Cassou (1843-1902).[1]La historia de la construcci√≥n de esta casa suscit√≥ una larga pol√©mica por parte de los due√±os en contra del Ayuntamiento durante su periodo constructivo (desde junio de 1900 hasta 1906).', 'El Hospicio de Santa Florentina es un edificio hist√≥rico de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Instituci√≥n ben√©fica cuyo origen se remonta a comienzos del siglo XVIII como parte de las fundaciones del Cardenal Belluga, conservando el mismo uso para el que fue planificado desde entonces.Tambi√©n denominada Casa de Ni√±os y Ni√±as Hu√©rfanos y Exp√≥sitos, o Inclusa, el inmueble fue declarado Bien de Inter√©s Cultural en 1978.', 'La Iglesia de Santa Eulalia de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), es una iglesia parroquial del casco antiguo de la susodicha capital. Aunque de origen medieval, el inmueble actual se construy√≥ en la segunda mitad del siglo XVIII, siendo uno de los √∫ltimos ejemplos del estilo barroco-rococ√≥ en la ciudad.Situada en la tradicional plaza del mismo nombre, forma un conjunto hist√≥rico con la contigua Capilla de San Jos√© y el Centro de Interpretaci√≥n de la Muralla √°rabe de Santa Eulalia.', 'El Paseo del Malec√≥n es una construcci√≥n situada en la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), cuyo objeto era servir de contenci√≥n frente a las crecidas del r√≠o Segura, convertido con posterioridad en paseo sobre la huerta circundante de la ciudad. Se trata de uno de los lugares emblem√°ticos de la capital murciana, y est√° catalogado como Bien de Inter√©s Cultural.Paseo que se sit√∫a a tres metros sobre el nivel del suelo, rodea la ciudad por su lado oeste en m√°s de 1,5 km, partiendo del Plano de San Francisco y adentr√°ndose en las antiguas huertas de la pedan√≠a de La Arboleja.', 'El Museo de Bellas Artes de Murcia (MUBAM) es una instituci√≥n muse√≠stica de la ciudad de Murcia, (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), cuyo origen se sit√∫a en 1864, cuando se cre√≥ el Museo Provincial por instancia de la Comisi√≥n Provincial de Monumentos. En 1953 fue trasladada la secci√≥n de arqueolog√≠a al actual Museo Arqueol√≥gico de Murcia, dando lugar al Museo de Bellas Artes hoy existente, al quedar en esta instituci√≥n las colecciones pict√≥ricas y escult√≥ricas.', "The Battle of Murcia or Battle of the Huerto de las Bombas was a battle on 4 September 1706, between the Bourbons under bishop Luis de Belluga and a combined British and Dutch force. It formed part of the War of the Spanish Succession and occurred near the Spanish town of Murcia. It resulted in a Bourbon victory.Garre Clemente, Juan Antonio. ¬´La Batalla del Huerto de las Bombas¬ª. Regi√≥n de Murcia Digital. ¬´Regiment d'Infanteria de Don Diego Rej√≥n, Marqu√©s de Alcantarilla¬ª 11setembre1714.org.", 'The Plaza de Toros de Murcia (also known as the Plaza de Toros de La Condomina) is a bullring in Murcia, Spain. As of June 2015, it is used for bull fighting. The stadium holds 15,000 people. It was built in 1887.Official website (in Spanish)', 'La Plaza Circular de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), tambi√©n conocida como la Redonda, es una de las plazas principales de dicha ciudad, en la que convergen los barrios de Santa Mar√≠a de Gracia, Vistalegre, La Fama y San Miguel.Actualmente, constituye parte del centro de la misma y conforma el punto donde confluyen sus principales arterias.La construcci√≥n de la Plaza Circular tiene su origen en el Plan Cort de 1926, que preve√≠a un ensanche urbano en el norte de la ciudad de Murcia que, sin embargo, no se llevar√≠a a cabo hasta la d√©cada de 1930.', 'El museo Salzillo es un espacio museogr√°fico que se halla en la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), y que est√° dedicado monogr√°ficamente a las obras realizadas por el escultor barroco murciano Francisco Salzillo.El museo est√° situado en la c√©ntrica plaza de San Agust√≠n, junto a la Iglesia de Jes√∫s, que forma parte del mismo. En √©l se exponen los pasos de la Cofrad√≠a de Nuestro Padre Jes√∫s, que salen en procesi√≥n en la ma√±ana de Viernes Santo, su afamado Bel√©n de quinientas cincuenta y seis piezas y una cincuentena de bocetos preparatorios del imaginero.', 'La Condomina is a multi-use stadium in Murcia, Spain. The stadium holds 6,500 spectators and it is currently used mostly for football matches and music concerts.La Condomina was built in 1924 with an initial capacity of 16,800 spectators.Real Murcia played at La Condomina for over 80 years before moving the Estadio Nueva Condomina in October 2006. Ciudad de Murcia played at the stadium throughout its existence.In 1995, Real Murcia sold the stadium to the town hall for solving the financial trouble of the club.', 'El castillo de Monteagudo es una fortificaci√≥n que se encuentra situada a unos 5 kil√≥metros al noreste de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a) y a unos 18 kil√≥metros al suroeste de Orihuela, en la pedan√≠a del mismo nombre.El castillo est√° enclavado en un impresionante puntal rocoso que se eleva 149 m sobre el nivel del mar, por lo que domina toda la Huerta de Murcia, regada por el r√≠o Segura. Su estrat√©gica situaci√≥n y su singular disposici√≥n convierten a esta fortaleza en un hito fundamental de la depresi√≥n prelitoral murciana, situado en el borde septentrional de la Huerta.[1]', 'The Christ of Monteagudo is a colossal statue of Jesus located on top of the Castle of Monteagudo, in Murcia, Spain.There was a previous statue of Jesus on top of the hill, sculpted by Anastasio Mart√≠nez Hern√°ndez and inaugurated on 31 October 1926. It was demolished after an agreement voted by the Municipal Council in November 1936, in the midst of the Spanish Civil War.The second and current iteration of the sculpture was a work by Nicol√°s Mart√≠nez Ram√≥n, son of Anastasio Mart√≠nez Hern√°ndez. 14 metre high and put on a 20 metre plinth, it stands 4 metres higher than its predecessor. It was unveiled on 28 October 1951.', 'El castillo de Monteagudo es una fortificaci√≥n que se encuentra situada a unos 5 kil√≥metros al noreste de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a) y a unos 18 kil√≥metros al suroeste de Orihuela, en la pedan√≠a del mismo nombre.El castillo est√° enclavado en un impresionante puntal rocoso que se eleva 149 m sobre el nivel del mar, por lo que domina toda la Huerta de Murcia, regada por el r√≠o Segura. Su estrat√©gica situaci√≥n y su singular disposici√≥n convierten a esta fortaleza en un hito fundamental de la depresi√≥n prelitoral murciana, situado en el borde septentrional de la Huerta.[1]', 'El conocido popularmente como castillejo de Monteagudo es una antiguo recinto palacial andalus√≠ que se encuentra situado a unos 5 kil√≥metros al noreste de la ciudad de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a), en la pedan√≠a de Monteagudo.Las actuales ruinas de este palacio fortificado corresponden al antiguo Qasr Ibn Sad, residencia que el rey taifa murciano Ibn Mardanis orden√≥ construir a las afueras de la ciudad de Murcia en el siglo XII.', 'El monasterio de los Jer√≥nimos es un conjunto monumental situado en la pedan√≠a de Guadalupe (Murcia, Regi√≥n de Murcia), entre dicha localidad murciana y la de La √ëora. El monasterio procede de otro anterior fundado en 1579 en un lugar cercano que se conoci√≥ como la √ëora de Abajo, de ah√≠ que en los cap√≠tulos mon√°sticos de la orden fundacional se le titulara como monasterio de San Pedro de la √ëora, denominaci√≥n que se mantuvo en su nuevo edificio, aunque dicho nombre cay√≥ en desuso tras la exclaustraci√≥n de la orden jer√≥nima en 1835, conoci√©ndose desde entonces como monasterio de Los Jer√≥nimos.[1]', 'La Bas√≠lica del Llano del Olivar (o Bas√≠lica de Algezares) est√° situada en la vertiente norte de la Sierra de Carrascoy, al pie de las estribaciones de la Cresta del Gallo en la pedan√≠a murciana de Algezares (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a).Se encuentra en un √°rea de gran inter√©s arqueol√≥gico ya que en sus proximidades se ubican multitud de yacimientos como el Puntarr√≥n Chico de Beniaj√°n de √©poca arg√°rica, el Santuario Ib√©rico de la Luz, edificio religioso vinculado al poblado ib√©rico del Verdolay y la necr√≥polis del Cabecico del Tesoro; el tardorromano Martyrium de La Alberca, edificio √∫nico en su tipolog√≠a en la pen√≠nsula ib√©rica, o el bizantino Castillo de los Garres.', 'El Martyrium de La Alberca es un mausoleo romano situado en la pedan√≠a murciana de La Alberca, en la Regi√≥n de Murcia (Espa√±a). Sus restos han sido datados en torno a la primera mitad del siglo IV, siendo uno de los monumentos tardorromanos m√°s importantes de la Pen√≠nsula Ib√©rica, lo que mereci√≥ su declaraci√≥n como Monumento Nacional en 1931.Se encuentra situado a unos 5 kil√≥metros al sur de la ciudad de Murcia, en el piedemonte del conjunto monta√±oso que conforman las sierras de Carrascoy y El Valle, en el antiguo Llano de la Mora, actualmente Calle de la Paz de La Alberca.', 'Estadio Nueva Condomina, currently known as Estadio Enrique Roca de Murcia for sponsorship reasons, is a multi-use stadium in Murcia, Spain. Completed in 2006, it is used mostly for football matches and hosts the homes matches of Real Murcia. The stadium has a capacity of 31,179 seats, making it the 16th-largest stadium in Spain and the largest in the Region of Murcia. The Nueva Condomina replaced La Condomina stadium as the home venue of Real Murcia.The stadium was officially opened on October 11, 2006 with a friendly match between Spain and Argentina. Real Murcia played its first game at this stadium on 26 November 2006, against Real Valladolid.', 'La Rueda de Alcantarilla (tambi√©n conocida como "Rueda de la Huerta"[1]) es una noria situada en la localidad de Alcantarilla (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Se encuentra en el norte del municipio, en las cercan√≠as del Museo Etnol√≥gico de la Huerta, y junto con √©ste es Bien de Inter√©s Cultural (BIC) desde el 30 de julio de 1982[2]La primera construcci√≥n data del siglo XV, era de menor tama√±o que la actual y se utilizaba para poder regar las tierras de la zona alta de Alcantarilla, Murcia, elevando el agua de la Acequia Mayor Alquibla o de Barreras (procedente de la Contraparada) a la acequia del Turbedal.', 'El Azud Mayor o Contraparada es una presa construida entre los siglos IX y X. Distribuye el agua del r√≠o Segura por la denominada Huerta de Murcia. Situada entre las pedan√≠as de Javal√≠ Nuevo y Javal√≠ Viejo, en el municipio de Murcia (Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Declarada Bien de Inter√©s Cultural por la Comunidad Aut√≥noma de Murcia en 2002.[1]', 'El castillo de La Asomada es una antigua fortificaci√≥n que se encuentra situada en un estrat√©gico lugar cercano a la pedan√≠a de El Palmar (Murcia, Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Est√° enclavado en la cima del conocido cabezo del Puerto (532 metros).[1] A sus pies se halla el puerto de La Cadena, paso de monta√±a que conecta el Campo de Cartagena con la Huerta de Murcia.', 'El castillo de La Asomada es una antigua fortificaci√≥n que se encuentra situada en un estrat√©gico lugar cercano a la pedan√≠a de El Palmar (Murcia, Regi√≥n de Murcia, Espa√±a). Est√° enclavado en la cima del conocido cabezo del Puerto (532 metros).[1] A sus pies se halla el puerto de La Cadena, paso de monta√±a que conecta el Campo de Cartagena con la Huerta de Murcia.']

column5: ['Quattro Canti', 'Pretoria Fountain', 'Genio di Palazzo Pretorio', "Museo d'Arte Contemporanea della Sicilia", 'Teatro Bellini', 'Teatro Biondo', 'Teatro Nuovo Montevergini', 'Archivio Storico Comunale', 'Genio del Garraffo', "Colonna dell'Immacolata", 'Modern art gallery "Empedocle Restivo"', 'Fontana del Garraffello', 'Teatro Santa Cecilia', 'Museo del Risorgimento Vittorio Emanuele Orlando', 'Tomb of Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor', 'Battle of Panormus', 'Il Genio di Palermo', 'al Massimo', 'Giardino dei Giusti', 'Museo Diocesano di Palermo (MUdiPA)', 'Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonio Salinas', 'Fontana del Garraffo', 'museo di Palazzo Mirto', 'Teatro Massimo Vittorio Emanuele', 'Villa Bonanno', 'Fontana della Doganella', 'Teatro Garibaldi', 'Giardino Garibaldi', 'Museo di Geologia Gemmelaro', 'Teatro Marmoreo', 'Palazzo Steri', "Museo dell'Osservatorio Astronomico", 'Galleria Regionale della Sicilia (Palermo)', 'museo internazionale delle marionette Antonio Pasqualino', 'Galleria Regionale', 'Fontana del Cavalluccio Marino', 'Museo di Zoologia Doderlein', "Parco D'Orleans", 'Herbarium Mediterraneum', 'Politeama Garibaldi', 'Fontana del Genio a Villa Giulia', 'Foro Italico', 'Orto Botanico', 'Palazzo Ziino', 'Villa Giulia', 'Genio del Porto', 'ricordo della strage di via Carini', 'Dante', 'Giardino della Zisa', 'Museo storico dei motori e dei meccanismi']
column6: ['Quattro Canti, officially known as Piazza Vigliena, is a Baroque square in Palermo, Sicily, Southern Italy.It was laid out on the orders of the Viceroys between 1608-1620 by Giulio Lasso and Mariano Smiriglio at the crossing of the two principal streets in Palermo, the Via Maqueda and the Corso Vittorio Emanuele.', 'The Praetorian Fountain (Italian: Fontana Pretoria) is a monumental fountain of Palermo. It is located in the heart of the historic centre and represents the most important landmark of Piazza Pretoria. The fountain was built by Francesco Camilliani in the city of Florence in 1554, but was transferred in Palermo in 1574.', "Il Genio di Palazzo Pretorio √® un gruppo scultoreo posto sullo scalone del Palazzo Pretorio, sede del Municipio di Palermo, in Piazza Pretoria.In siciliano √® detto Palermu u Nicu (Palermo il piccolo), per le sue dimensioni ridotte in relazione a quelle della statua detta Palermu lu Grandi (Palermo il Grande). √à una delle otto rappresentazioni monumentali del Genio di Palermo.La statua del Genio venne ritrovata nel 1596 nelle cantine di Palazzo Pretorio, dove era stata dimenticata. Fu sistemata sullo scalone monumentale del palazzo a cura dell'allora Pretore Francesco del Bosco, conte di Vicari.", "The Palazzo Riso, or RISO, Museo d‚ÄôArte Contemporanea della Sicilia (RISO, Contemporary Art Museum of Sicily also known as Palazzo Belmonte Riso), is a regional contemporary art museum located in the ancient Corso Vittorio Emanuele, Palermo, Italy.The Palazzo Riso's architecture clearly shows the final days of Sicilian Baroque as it was transformed into Neoclassicism. Designed by the architect Giuseppe Venanzio Marvuglia, the house was constructed at the end of the 18th century and completed in 1784. It became property of the Prince of Belmonte, and in the 19th century it passed to Baron Riso. The marble Riso coat of arms on the portal of the palazzo was carved by Ignazio Marabitti.", "Il Real Teatro Bellini o Regio Teatro Carolino √® un teatro di Palermo edificato nel 1726.La storia del teatro comincia nel 1676 con il Teatro Travaglino, un teatro popolare che prende il nome di una maschera popolare palermitana.Successivamente si inaugura un grande teatro all'italiana, il Teatro Santa Lucia prende il nome dei Marchesi Valguarnera di Santa Lucia, proprietari all'epoca. Il teatro, inaugurato nel 1726, fu concepito e realizzato interamente in legno e poteva ospitare 500 spettatori e fu considerato fino alla met√† dell'Ottocento il pi√π importante teatro della citt√†. Inizialmente si chiamava teatro ‚Äúdei Travaglini‚Äù o ‚Äúdi Travaglino‚Äù (nome di una maschera popolare palermitana).", 'The Biondo Theatre (Italian: Teatro Biondo, complete name Teatro Biondo Stabile) is a theatre of Palermo. It is located in the central Via Roma and represents the more recent historical theatre of the city.The theatre was designed by the communal architect Nicol√≤ Mineo and built between 1899 and 1903. On 15 October 1903 it was inaugurated with a performance of Ermete Novelli.Official site', "Il Teatro Nuovo Montevergini √® un teatro di Palermo situato nel quartiere Seralcadio.Il primo complesso fu costruito nel 1498, adibito a monastero di Santa Maria delle Grazie di Montevergini per volere di Luisa Settimo, su licenza del pontefice Alessandro VI, questa prima struttura si trovava a poca distanza dall'aggregato attuale e fu parzialmente distrutta nel 1885.Nei secoli successivi alla costruzione al nucleo originario si aggiunsero nuove strutture. Nel 1563, fu inglobata la medievale chiesa di Sant'Elia dei Latini, la chiesa di Santa Maria Maggiore, l'abitazione dei marchesi di Geraci. Nel XVII secolo la propriet√† dell'istituzione fu varie volte ceduta.", "L'archivio storico comunale di Palermo √® un edificio che conserva gli archivi dell'amministrazione comunale di Palermo, che contengono documenti a partire dalla fine del XIII secolo fino al 1957.La struttura si trova nell'ex convento Agostiniano della chiesa di San Nicol√≤ da Tolentino, edificato nel XVII secolo e situato al civico 157 di via Maqueda a Palermo.Nel 1866 l'edificio venne adibito all'uso di vari uffici e istituzioni, tra cui l'archivio comunale, che venne inizialmente collocato prima nella Sala degli Abbaini e nella Sala Rettangolare. Il primo archivista fu Fedele Pollaci Nuccio (dal 1866 fino alla sua morte nel 1901).", "Il Genio del Garraffo, detto anche Genio di Palermo al Garraffo, o in siciliano Palermu lu Grandi (Palermo il Grande), √® una scultura marmorea della fine del XV secolo, e fa parte di un gruppo scultoreo posto in una edicola del XVII secolo, in piazzetta del Garraffo, nel mercato della Vucciria, a Palermo.L'opera, realizzata da Pietro de Bonitate nel 1483 √® una delle sette rappresentazioni principali del Genio di Palermo, l'antico nume tutelare ed emblema civico di Palermo. L'appellativo siciliano Grandi √® riferito alle dimensioni della statua rispetto a Palermu u Nicu, rappresentazione omologa e pi√π piccola, che si trova nel Palazzo Pretorio (Palermo), municipio di Palermo.", "La Colonna dell'Immacolata √® un monumento di Palermo posto in Piazza San Domenico nel quartiere La Loggia.", "The Modern Art Gallery Sant'Anna (Italian: Galleria d'Arte Moderna Sant'Anna) is a modern art museum in Palermo. It is located in a complex consisting of the former Franciscan convent of the Church of Sant'Anna la Misericordia and the adjacent Palazzo Bonet, in the quarter of the Kalsa, inside the historic centre of the city.", "La fontana del Garraffello √® una fontana del 1591. Si trova nell'omonima piazza all'interno del rione Vucciria nel mandamento Castello a Mare a Palermo.Da non confondere con la fontana del Garraffo. Le due fontane hanno il nome derivato dall'arabo gharraf (abbondante d'acqua).Venne posta in loco nel XVI secolo. L'acqua che ne sgorgava √® stata a lungo considerata capace di curare molti malanni e per questo motivo in epoca storica molte persone venivano dagli altri quartieri a rifornirsi della sua acqua.Loggia:Loggia dei Genovesi. Loggia dei Catalani.Si salv√≤ dai bombardamenti sulla citt√† della seconda guerra mondiale nonostante la zona circostante sia stata pesantemente rovinata.", 'Il real teatro di Santa Cecilia, pi√π comunemente noto come teatro di Santa Cecilia, √® un teatro di Palermo del XVII secolo.', "Il Museo del Risorgimento √® uno spazio espositivo di Palermo dedicato al Risorgimento. L'esposizione tratta temi relativi soprattutto alla rivoluzione siciliana del 1848 e alle fasi della spedizione dei Mille avvenute in Sicilia. √à intitolato a Vittorio Emanuele Orlando.Il museo √® ospitato in una parte dell'ex convento di San Domenico, edificio del XIV secolo in pieno centro storico della citt√†. √à gestito dalla Societ√† Siciliana per la Storia Patria ed √® diretto da Pasquale Hamel.", 'Das Grabmal Kaiser Friedrichs II. in der Kathedrale von Palermo ist die letzte Ruhest√§tte f√ºr den am 13. Dezember 1250 verstorbenen Staufer Friedrich II., Kaiser des Heiligen R√∂mischen Reichs. Das aus r√∂tlichem Cefal√πaner Porphyr gefertigte prunkvolle Muldengrab mit Baldachin war zusammen mit einem weiteren, typgleichen auf Veranlassung seines Gro√üvaters, Roger II. aus dem Geschlecht der Hauteville, f√ºr diesen selbst hergestellt worden. Roger II. wurde jedoch entgegen seinem Wunsch nicht in diesem Sarkophag beigesetzt.', 'The Battle of Panormus was fought in Sicily in 250 BC during the First Punic War between a Roman army led by Lucius Caecilius Metellus and a Carthaginian force led by Hasdrubal. The Roman force of two legions defending the city of Panormus defeated the much larger Carthaginian army of 30,000 men and between 60 and 142 war elephants.', "Il Genio di Piazza Rivoluzione o Fontana del Genio, anticamente detto Genio del Molo o Genio della Fieravecchia, √® una statua del XVI secolo posta su una fontana del XIX secolo che si trova in Piazza Rivoluzione, nel quartiere Fieravecchia a Palermo.Il Genio di piazza Rivoluzione √® una delle otto rappresentazioni monumentali del Genio di Palermo, l'antico nume tutelare della citt√†.Per il valore simbolico assunto dal Genio di Piazza Rivoluzione durante i moti palermitani che precedettero il Risorgimento, questo monumento √® particolarmente importante nella definizione del moderno significato del Genio di Palermo come protettore laico della citt√†.", 'Il Teatro al Massimo noto in origine come Cineteatro al Massimo √® un teatro di Palermo situato nel centro storico nel quartiere Seralcadio.', "Il giardino dei Giusti (ex giardino di via Alloro) √® un giardino pubblico di Palermo, che fu tra gli spazi degradati del centro storico recuperato dall'amministrazione comunale negli anni 1999-2000. Il progetto curato dagli architetti Mario Li Castri e Giuseppe Prestigiacomo, fa riferimento alle xirbe dei secoli XII e XIII, piccoli giardini a carattere produttivo e ornamentale, ricavati nelle aree dismesse dell'edilizia urbana, cinti da muri all'interno di cortili. Si trova in pieno centro, e si affaccia in una via di rilevante importanza per il centro storico della citt√†: la via Alloro.", 'The Diocesan Museum of Palermo (Italian - MUDIPA or Museo diocesano di Palermo) is a museum of religious art in Palermo on Sicily, housed in a number of rooms in the Palazzo Arcivescovile opposite Palermo Cathedral.It was founded in 1927 by cardinal Alessandro Lualdi, Archbishop of Palermo (1904-1927)This houses the welcome desk as well as artworks from the Norman and Swabian eras.This contains works from the 14th and 15th centuries as well as imported 14th century Pisa works:', 'The Antonino Salinas Regional Archeological Museum (Italian: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas) is a museum in Palermo, Italy. It possesses one of the richest collections of Punic and Ancient Greek art in Italy, as well as many items related to the history of Sicily. Formerly the property of the Oratory of Saint Philip Neri, the museum is named after Antonino Salinas, a famous archaeologist and numismatist from Palermo who had served as its director from 1873 until his death in 1914, upon which he left it his major private collection. It is part of the Olivella monumental complex, which includes the Church of St. Ignatius and the adjoining Oratory.', 'The Garraffo Fountain (Italian: Fontana del Garraffo) is a Baroque fountain of Palermo. It is located in Piazza Marina, down the Cassaro street, within the historic centre of Palermo.The name of the fountain comes from the Arabic word "Gharraf", meaning the abundance of water. It was sculpted by Gioacchino Vitagliano in 1698, although the design was previously realized by the architect Paolo Amato. The sculpture represents an abundance goddess riding an eagle fighting against a hydra.The location of the Garraffo fountain was in the market of the Vucciria, in front of the monument called Genio del Garraffo, until 1862, when it was shifted to Piazza Marina.', "Palazzo Mirto √® un palazzo storico di Palermo, oggi casa-museo.L'edificio √® ubicato nel centro storico di Palermo, alla Kalsa, antica cittadella araba fortificata. √à stato per quattro secoli dimora palermitana dei Filangeri, e poi dei Lanza Filangieri Principi di Mirto, da cui prende nome il palazzo. I Filangeri sono ricordati ancora oggi come la pi√π importante famiglia normanna in Sicilia e nel Mezzogiorno d'Italia, dello stesso ceppo dei Sanseverino e dei Gravina, tutti discendenti da un capostipite comune, il leggendario cavaliere Angerio, delle stirpe dei Duchi di Normandia, che venne in Italia al seguito di Tancredi d'Altavilla e di cui se ne ha menzione gi√† nel 1069.", 'The Teatro Massimo Vittorio Emanuele is an opera house and opera company located on the Piazza Verdi in Palermo, Sicily. It was dedicated to King Victor Emanuel II. It is the biggest in Italy, and one of the largest of Europe (at the time of its inauguration, it was - with its area of 7730 m¬≤ - the third largest opera house in Europe after the Palais Garnier in Paris, and the K. K. Hof-Opernhaus in Vienna), renowned for its perfect acoustics.', "Villa Bonanno √® un giardino pubblico di Palermo, nel quartiere Palazzo Reale.Nel 1905 con la sistemazione di piazza Vittoria viene progettata da Giuseppe Damiani Almeyda villa Bonanno, una villa intitolata al sindaco di Palermo Pietro Bonanno che volle realizzata quest'opera che riqualific√≤ il piano antistante il palazzo dei Normanni. √à stata interessata da lavori di riqualificazione che si sono conclusi alla fine del 2013. L'intervento √® rientrato tra quelli finanziati dall'Unione Europea con una somma totale di circa 8 milioni di euro per il restauro di tre piazze del centro storico di Palermo: piazza Bologni, piazza Marina e piazza della Vittoria.", "La fontana della Doganella o di Porto Salvo √® una fontana rinascimentale di Palermo, progettata da Antonello Gagini nel 1526.La fontana √® situata presso il prospetto settentrionale della chiesa di Santa Maria di Porto Salvo, √® realizzata in marmo grigio proveniente dal monte Billiemi. Il nome deriva dalla presenza dell'omonima porta che venne distrutta a causa del prolungamento del Cassaro.Palermo Monumenti di Palermo Chiesa di Santa Maria di Porto SalvoWikimedia Commons contiene immagini o altri file su Fontana della Doganella", 'Il Teatro Garibaldi di Palermo si trova nel quartiere La Kalsa, a pochi passi dalla Basilica La Magione.', "Il giardino Garibaldi, chiamato anche villa Garibaldi, √® un giardino pubblico di Palermo.Il giardino √® stato realizzato tra il 1861 e il 1864 dall'architetto Giovan Battista Filippo Basile a piazza Marina a Palermo, nello storico quartiere della Kalsa e fu intitolata all'eroe nazionale Giuseppe Garibaldi proprio per celebrare la nascita della nazione Italiana, da poco avvenuta.", 'Il Museo "Gaetano Giorgio Gemmellaro" √® un museo paleontologico e geologico di Palermo, appartenente al Sistema museale d\'Ateneo dell\'Universit√† degli Studi di Palermo.', "Il Teatro marmoreo √® un monumento barocco della citt√† di Palermo, eretto nel 1662 nella piazza antistante il Palazzo reale noto anche come Palazzo dei Normanni, oggi denominata Piazza del Parlamento.Si tratta di un gruppo scultoreo, opera dell'illustre scultore Gaspare Guercio, di Carlo D'Aprile e Gaspare Serpotta su un recuperato progetto di Pietro Novelli. Il monumentale manufatto fu realizzato per celebrare la gloria di Filippo IV d'Asburgo, re di Spagna e di Sicilia, detto Filippo il Grande e soprannominato il Re Pianeta in quanto i suoi possedimenti si estendevano per tutti i continenti del mondo allora conosciuti.", 'Palazzo Chiaramonte-Steri is a historical palace in Palermo, Sicily, southern Italy.The building was begun in the early 14th century, and was the residence of the powerful Sicilian lord Manfredi III Chiaramonte. He commissioned the decoration of the Sala Magna ("Grand Hall"), with a painted wooden ceiling by Cecco di Naro, Simone da Corleone and Pellegrino Darena. From the late 15th century to 1517 it housed the Aragonese-Spanish viceroys of Sicily; later it was home to the Royal Customs and, from 1600 to 1782, the tribunal of the Holy Inquisition.', 'The Giuseppe S. Vaiana Astronomical Observatory is an astronomical observatory located in Palermo, Sicily, Italy, housed inside the Palazzo dei Normanni. It is one of the research facilities of the National Institute of Astrophysics. The observatory carries out research projects in the field of astronomy and astrophysics including the study of solar and stellar coronas, stellar evolution (including the birth of stars) and of the supernova remnants.', 'Die Galleria Interdisciplinare Regionale della Sicilia in Palermo ist Siziliens umfangreichstes Kunstmuseum. Es befindet sich in der Altstadt an der Via Alloro im Palazzo Abatellis und zeigt Werke der sizilianischen Malerei und Bildhauerei vom Mittelalter bis zur Neuzeit. Das Museum ist seit dem 23. Juni 1954 f√ºr die √ñffentlichkeit zug√§nglich.Zu den Hauptwerken der Sammlung z√§hlt ein Fresko mit dem Motiv Triumph des Todes in der ehemaligen Palastkapelle. Es wurde im 15. Jahrhundert von einem unbekannten Meister f√ºr das B√ºrgerhospital im Palazzo Sclafani gemalt. Ein weiteres Hauptwerk ist das Portr√§t der Verk√ºndigungsmadonna ‚ÄûAnnunziata di Palermo‚Äú des Renaissancemalers Antonello da Messina.', 'Il Museo internazionale delle marionette Antonio Pasqualino √® un museo di tradizioni popolari di Palermo, intitolato ad Antonio Pasqualino, che raccolse il primo nucleo della collezione di pupi siciliani, burattini e marionette provenienti da tutto il mondo.Nel 2017 ha vinto il Premio Icom Italia come Museo dell‚Äôanno.√à nato nel 1975 ad opera di Antonio Pasqualino, cui dopo la morte nel 1995 √® stato intitolato.', 'Palazzo Abatellis (also known as Palazzo Patella) is a palazzo in Palermo, Sicily, southern Italy, located in the Kalsa quarter. It is home to the Galleria Regionale della Sicilia, the Gallery of Art for the Sicilian region.The palazzo, an example of Gothic-Catalan architecture, was designed in the 15th century by Matteo Carnelivari, at the time working in Palermo at the palazzo Aiutamicristo. It was the residence of Francesco Abatellis (or Patella), port master of the Kingdom of Sicily.', "La fontana del Cavallo Marino √® una fontana del XVIII secolo. Si trova in piazza Santo Spirito a Palermo.La fontana venne realizzata su progetto dello scultore Ignazio Marabitti.La sua prima collocazione era all'interno del giardino del palazzo Ajutamicristo.Nel 1864, durante i lavori di restauro di piazza Santo Spirito, il comune di Palermo decise di spostarla nella sua collocazione attuale, l√¨ dove un tempo sorgeva la chiesa di San Nicol√≤ alla Kalsa, distrutta dal terremoto del 5 marzo 1823.Ignazio Marabitti Palazzo Ajutamicristo Kalsa Monumenti di Palermo PalermoWikimedia Commons contiene immagini o altri file su Fontana del Cavallo Marino", 'Il museo "Pietro Doderlein" √® un museo universitario di Zoologia di Palermo. √à il pi√π importante museo zoologico siciliano ed √® dedicato al professore Pietro Doderlein, che lo fond√≤ nel 1863.', "Il parco d'Orl√©ans √® un giardino zoologico urbano di Palermo, adiacente a palazzo d'Orl√©ans, gestito dalla Regione siciliana.Si tratta dell'unico parco ornitologico presente in Italia. Vi sono presenti dei grandi ficus macrophylla dalle radici volanti e 350 esemplari di 70 specie animali diverse, oltre a pesci e tartarughe.Il parco venne edificato a inizio Ottocento come riserva di palazzo d'Orl√©ans, che dal 1947 √® sede della presidenza della Regione siciliana. Aveva originariamente una superficie complessiva di 46 ettari.", 'The Orto Botanico di Palermo (Palermo Botanical Garden) is both a botanical garden and a research and educational institution of the Department of Botany of the University of Palermo. The garden lies within the city of Palermo, Italy at 10 m (33 feet) above sea-level. It covers about 0.12 km2 (30 acres) on top of red soil that has evolved on a limestone tuff substratum.', 'The Politeama Theatre (Italian: Teatro Politeama, complete name Teatro Politeama Garibaldi) is a theatre of Palermo. It is located in the central Piazza Ruggero Settimo and represents the second most important theatre of the city after the Teatro Massimo. It houses the Orchestra Sinfonica Siciliana.In 1864 the municipality of Palermo launched an international competition for the construction of a monumental opera house (the Teatro Massimo) and, a year later, an internal competition for the construction of a diurnal multi-purpose theatre (hence the name "Politeama" from the Greek language).', 'The Fontana del Genio a Villa Giulia or Genio di Villa Giulia is a sculpted water fountain in the park of the Villa Giulia in Palermo. It was sculpted by Ignazio Marabitti in 1778 and shows the Genius of Palermo.', 'The Foro Italico is a lawn along the seafront of Palermo, Sicily, Italy.In 1582 Vice-King Marco Antonio Colonna created a walking path in this part of the coast, that became a favorite destination for the leisure of the upper classes of the city in the 17th and 18th centuries.It is entirely pedestrian, is approximately 40,000 m2 in size, with Mediterranean flora of various kinds, benches, trees, ceramic sculptures, a bike path, night lighting and a wide scenic walk along the coast. It was redeveloped in 2003, when, the lawn, the pedestrian paths, the public lighting and an irrigation system were improved. The project was carried out by the technicians of the municipality of Palermo.', 'The Orto Botanico di Palermo (Palermo Botanical Garden) is both a botanical garden and a research and educational institution of the Department of Botany of the University of Palermo. The garden lies within the city of Palermo, Italy at 10 m (33 feet) above sea-level. It covers about 0.12 km2 (30 acres) on top of red soil that has evolved on a limestone tuff substratum.', 'Palazzo Ziino √® un palazzo storico di Palermo adibito a museo e mediateca, sito in via Dante.', "The Villa Giulia, also known as Villa del Popolo, and as Villa Flor is a park in Palermo, lying to the east of the botanical gardens. The park was commissioned by magistrate D. Antonino La Grua e Talamanca, marquis of Regalmici, in 1777 with inspiration from Giovanni Meli. Construction began that year and was completed in 1778. It was extended and enlarged in 1866. Designed by Nicol√≤ Palma and named after Giulia Guevara (wife of Viceroy Marcantonio Colonna, prince of Stigliano, to whom the villa was dedicated), it was Palermo's first public park.", "Il Genio del Porto, detto anche Genio del Molo, Genio di Palermo al Porto o Genio del Cippo Smeriglio, √® un antico altorilievo marmoreo inserito alla fine del XVI secolo in un cippo commemorativo che dal 2000 si trova all'ingresso di via Emerico Amari, all'interno del Porto di Palermo.√à la pi√π antica delle otto rappresentazioni iconografiche del Genio di Palermo.La lastra marmorea del Genio del Porto √® la pi√π antica rispetto alle altre sculture raffiguranti la divinit√†, la sua origine √® incerta ma precederebbe la realizzazione del cippo.", "The Via Carini massacre was a Cosa Nostra attack in which, on 3 September 1982, in the Palermo's via Isidoro Carini, the prefect of Palermo Carlo Alberto Dalla Chiesa, his wife Emanuela Setti Carraro and the escort agent Domenico Russo lost their lives.General Dalla Chiesa was leaving the prefecture on a beige A112, led by his wife Emanuela Setti Carraro to go to dinner at a restaurant in Mondello. The A112 was followed by an Alfetta guided by the escort agent Domenico Russo. At 21:15, as they passed via Isidoro Carini, a motorcycle, led by a killer who had the mafioso Pino Greco (aka Scarpuzzedda) sitting behind him, flanked the Alfetta, where Greco killed him with an AK-47 rifle.", "Via Dante √® un importante asse viario della citt√† di Palermo.Collega il centralissimo Teatro Politeama a Piazza Principe di Camporeale, nelle vicinanze del sollazzo regio della Zisa, patrimonio dell'umanit√† nell'ambito del sito seriale Palermo arabo-normanna e le cattedrali di Cefal√π e Monreale.", "Il giardino della Zisa di Palermo (inaugurato nel 2005) si trova in quello che era l'antico Genoard (il parco di caccia) di fronte al palazzo della Zisa, estendendosi per una superficie totale di 30.000 m2.", 'Il Museo storico dei motori e dei meccanismi - in breve anche "Museo dei motori" - √® un museo accademico italiano che fa parte del Sistema Museale di Ateneo dell\'Universit√† degli Studi di Palermo.']

column5: ['Mount Qingcheng', 'Dujiangyan']
column6: ["Mount Qingcheng (Chinese: ÈùíÂüéÂ±±; pinyin: Qƒ´ngch√©ng ShƒÅn) is a mountain in Dujiangyan, Sichuan, China.It is considered one of the birthplaces of Taoism (Daoism) and one of the most important Taoist centres in China. In Taoist mythology, it was the site of the Yellow Emperor's studies with Ning Fengzi. As a centre of the Taoist religion it became host to many temples. The mountain has 36 peaks. It is home to Dujiangyan Giant Panda Center and since 2000 has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Mount Qingcheng was affected by the Wenchuan Earthquake in 2008.", 'The Dujiangyan (Chinese: ÈÉΩÊ±üÂ†∞; pinyin: D≈´jiƒÅngy√†n) is an ancient irrigation system in Dujiangyan City, Sichuan, China. Originally constructed around 256 BC by the State of Qin as an irrigation and flood control project, it is still in use today. The system\'s infrastructure develops on the Min River (Minjiang), the longest tributary of the Yangtze. The area is in the west part of the Chengdu Plain, between the Sichuan Basin and the Tibetan Plateau. Originally, the Min would rush down from the Min Mountains and slow down abruptly after reaching the Chengdu Plain, filling the watercourse with silt, thus making the nearby areas extremely prone to floods. King Zhao of Qin commissioned the project, and the construction of the Dujiangyan harnessed the river using a new method of channeling and dividing the water rather than simply damming it. The water management scheme is still in use today to irrigate over 5,300 km2 (2,000 sq mi) of land in the region. The Dujiangyan, the Zhengguo Canal in Shaanxi and the Lingqu Canal in Guangxi are collectively known as the "three great hydraulic engineering projects of the Qin."']

column5: ['Museo Regional de la Ceramica, Tlaquepaque', 'Tlaquepaque', 'Guggenheim Guadalajara', 'Hospicio Caba√±as', 'Museo de Cera Guadalajara', 'Teatro Degollado', 'Estatua Jorge Matute Remus', 'Museo de las Artes UDG', 'Arcos del Milenio', 'Arcos de Guadalajara', 'Estadio Jalisco']
column6: ['The Museo Regional de la Cer√°mica (Regional Ceramic Museum) in Tlaquepaque, Jalisco, Mexico is located on Independencia Street in the center of the city. The museum is one of two main ceramics museums in the city, with the other being the Pantaleon Panduro Museum . It was established in 1954 to preserve and promote indigenous handcrafts of Jalisco, especially the state‚Äôs ceramic tradition. The emphasis is still on ceramics but the museum also has a room dedicated to Huichol art and holds events related to various types of indigenous crafts and culture.', 'The Museo Regional de la Cer√°mica (Regional Ceramic Museum) in Tlaquepaque, Jalisco, Mexico is located on Independencia Street in the center of the city. The museum is one of two main ceramics museums in the city, with the other being the Pantaleon Panduro Museum . It was established in 1954 to preserve and promote indigenous handcrafts of Jalisco, especially the state‚Äôs ceramic tradition. The emphasis is still on ceramics but the museum also has a room dedicated to Huichol art and holds events related to various types of indigenous crafts and culture.', 'The Solomon R. Guggenheim Foundation is a nonprofit organization founded in 1937 by philanthropist Solomon R. Guggenheim and his long-time art advisor, artist Hilla von Rebay. The foundation is a leading institution for the collection, preservation, and research of modern and contemporary art and operates several museums around the world. The first museum established by the foundation was The Museum of Non-Objective Painting, in New York City. This became The Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum in 1952, and the foundation moved the collection into its first permanent museum building, in New York City, in 1959. The foundation next opened the Peggy Guggenheim Collection in Venice, Italy, in 1980. Its international network of museums expanded in 1997 to include the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao in Bilbao, Spain, and it expects to open a new museum, Guggenheim Abu Dhabi, in the United Arab Emirates after its construction is completed.', 'The Hospicio (Museo) Caba√±as in Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico, a World Heritage Site, is one of the oldest and largest hospital complexes in the Americas.The complex was founded in 1791 by the Bishop of Guadalajara in order to combine the functions of a workhouse, hospital, orphanage, and almshouse. It owes its name to Juan Ruiz de Caba√±as who was appointed to the see of Guadalajara in 1796 and engaged Manuel Tols√°, a renowned architect from Mexico City, to design the structure.', 'The Guadalajara Cathedral or Cathedral of the Assumption of Our Lady (Spanish: Catedral de Guadalajara or Catedral de la Asunci√≥n de Mar√≠a Sant√≠sima), located in Guadalajara, Jalisco, is the Roman Catholic cathedral of the Archdiocese of Guadalajara and a minor basilica. It is built in the Spanish Renaissance style, except its Neo-gothic spires.The first cathedral was built in 1541 on the site of the present Templo de Santa Maria de Gracia. This primitive church was built with adobe and a thatched roof. Nevertheless, in 1548 the region was declared a diocese by the Holy See and the church became the cathedral of the city.', "Teatro Degollado (Spanish: [teÀàat…æo √∞e…£oÀà ùa√∞o], Degollado Theater) is a neoclassical Mexican theater known for its diverse performances and artistic design. It is located in the central plaza of Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico on Belen Street between Hidalgo Avenue and Morelos Avenue. Many performances (from cultural Mexican dances to international operas) take place in this building. Meant to be a monument of Guadalajara's culture, the theater was inaugurated in September 1866; breathing life to the city through its innovative artistic beauty.", 'Jorge Matute (February 17, 1912 ‚Äì July 6, 2002) was a Mexican engineer.', 'El Museo de las Artes de la Universidad de Guadalajara, tambi√©n conocido como ¬´MUSA¬ª, es un museo ubicado en la ciudad de Guadalajara, Jalisco, M√©xico. Fue inaugurado el 10 de octubre de 1994 y ampliado en 2013. El MUSA es un recinto dedicado a promover la educaci√≥n y el desarrollo cultural de la sociedad. Su finalidad es la de generar conocimiento, reflexi√≥n, inspiraci√≥n y gozo con las manifestaciones art√≠sticas, cumpliendo as√≠ con una de las funciones sustantivas de la M√°xima Casa de Estudios de Jalisco.', 'Los Arcos del tercer milenio, com√∫nmente conocidos simplemente como Arcos del milenio, son una obra escult√≥rica del artista mexicano Enrique Carbajal Gonz√°lez conocido como "Sebasti√°n", que se encuentra en la ciudad de Guadalajara, Jalisco, en el occidente de M√©xico.', 'Los Arcos de Guadalajara son un monumento representativo de la Ciudad de Guadalajara, en el estado de Jalisco, M√©xico. Dicho monumento fue erigido como entrada de la ciudad a ra√≠z de la inauguraci√≥n de la carretera M√©xico-Morelia-Guadalajara, en el a√±o de 1938. La obra se realiz√≥ durante el periodo del gobernador Silvano Barba Gonz√°lez, quien encargo el proyecto al arquitecto Aurelio Aceves.Es uno de los monumentos m√°s distintivos del recientemente llamado Silicon Valley Mexicano junto a la Catedral de Guadalajara, el Hospicio Caba√±as, el Teatro Degollado y la Glorieta Minerva.', 'The Jalisco Stadium is a football stadium located in Guadalajara, Mexico. It is the third largest Mexican football stadium behind Estadio Azteca and Estadio Ol√≠mpico Universitario. The facility is located in the city of Guadalajara, Jalisco, 400 kilometers north-west of Mexico City, and has a maximum capacity of 56,713 spectators.Estadio Jalisco was the home ground of Guadalajara, one of the oldest football teams in Mexico, until 2010. It remains the home stadium of Atlas in the Liga MX and Club Universidad de Guadalajara in the Liga de Expansi√≥n MX. Several football preliminary matches took place for the 1968 Summer Olympics.']

column5: ['Dengfeng', 'Mount Song']
column6: ['Dengfeng (Chinese: ÁôªÂ∞Å; pinyin: Dƒìngfƒìng; postal: Tengfeng) is a county-level city of Henan Province, South Central China, it is under the administration of the prefecture-level city of Zhengzhou. In ancient times, it was known as Yangcheng (traditional Chinese: ÈôΩÂüé; simplified Chinese: Èò≥Âüé; pinyin: Y√°ngch√©ng).Dengfeng has an area of 1,220 km2 (470 sq mi) and a population of 630,000. It occupies the southwestern corner of Zhengzhou and is its westernmost county-level division.', "Mount Song (Chinese: Âµ©Â±±; pinyin: S≈çngshƒÅn) is a mountain in central China's Henan Province, along the southern bank of the Yellow River, that is known as the central mountain of the Five Great Mountains of China. Its summit is 1,500 metres (4,900 ft) above sea level."]

column5: ['Estadio Manuel Calle Lombana']
column6: ['Estadio Bello Horizonte is a football stadium located in Villavicencio, Colombia. The stadium, built in 1958, has a capacity of 15,000 people and was named after Manuel Calle Lombana, mayor of Villavicencio in 1958, thus receiving the nickname of Macal. Categor√≠a Primera B club Llaneros play their home matches at this stadium.']

column5: ['Tenayuca II', 'Santa Cecilia Acatitlan', 'Museo de sitio Tenayuca', 'Cristo Resucitado', 'cinemex el rosario', 'Parque Tezoz√≥moc', 'Mexico City Arena', 'Torres de Sat√©lite', 'Torres de Sat√©lite', 'Torres de Sat√©lite', 'Torres de Satelite', 'Parque Naucalli', 'Estadio Wilfrido Massieu', 'Planetario Luis Enrique Erro', 'Parque Nacional Los Remedios', 'Indios Verdes monument', 'Acueducto de Guadalupe', 'El Pensil Mexicano', 'El Tepeyac National Park', 'Cerro Tepeyac', 'Acueducto de los Remedios']
column6: ['Tenayuca (Nahuatl languages: TenanyohcƒÅn pronounced [te.naÀàyo î.kaÀên]) is a pre-Columbian Mesoamerican archaeological site in the Valley of Mexico. In the Postclassic period of Mesoamerican chronology, Tenayuca was a settlement on the former shoreline of the western arm of Lake Texcoco. It was located approximately 10 kilometres (6.2 mi) to the northwest of Tenochtitlan (the heart of present-day Mexico City).Tenayuca is considered to be the earliest capital city of the Chichimec, nomadic tribes who migrated and settled in the Valley of Mexico, where they formed their own kingdoms.Tenayuca means walled place in Nahuatl.', 'Acatitlan (Nahuatl: "place among the reeds"; Spanish "carrizal") is an archeological zone of the early Aztec (or Epi-toltec) culture located in the town of Santa Cecilia, in the municipality of Tlalnepantla de Baz in Mexico State, about 10 km northwest of Mexico City. In pre-Hispanic times it was located on the northwest shore of the great Lake Texcoco.', 'Tenayuca (Nahuatl languages: TenanyohcƒÅn pronounced [te.naÀàyo î.kaÀên]) is a pre-Columbian Mesoamerican archaeological site in the Valley of Mexico. In the Postclassic period of Mesoamerican chronology, Tenayuca was a settlement on the former shoreline of the western arm of Lake Texcoco. It was located approximately 10 kilometres (6.2 mi) to the northwest of Tenochtitlan (the heart of present-day Mexico City).Tenayuca is considered to be the earliest capital city of the Chichimec, nomadic tribes who migrated and settled in the Valley of Mexico, where they formed their own kingdoms.Tenayuca means walled place in Nahuatl.', 'El Cristo Rey es un monumento localizado en el municipio de Tlalnepantla de Baz en el Estado de M√©xico dentro del Cementerio Jardines del Recuerdo, se empez√≥ a levantar a finales de los a√±os 70 y fue inaugurado en 1981 por el escultor V√≠ctor Guti√©rrez Guerra y el constructor David Guti√©rrez Becerril. Se localiza al norte de la ciudad de M√©xico[2]Es una de las estatuas de Cristo m√°s altas del mundo al tener 33 metros tan solo la estatua, m√°s 7 metros de la base dando una altura total de 40 metros Es visible desde el centro de la ciudad de M√©xico por las noches en los d√≠as cercanos a navidad ya que se ilumina y destaca al norte de la ciudad.Anexo:Estatuas m√°s altas del mundo', 'El Rosario (Spanish: Estaci√≥n El Rosario) is an at-grade station on the Mexico City Metro. It is located in Azcapotzalco borough, in the northern reaches of Mexico City. It serves as the terminal for both Lines 6 and 7.The station logo depicts a set of rosary beads.The platforms for lines 6 and 7 are at the same level, separated only by a bridge. This terminal, like many others, is multimodal, connecting to other kinds of transport. Metro El Rosario connects with suburban buses that serve municipalities such as Cuautitl√°n Izcalli and Lecher√≠a, in neighboring Mexico State. It also connects with trolleybus Line "I", which runs between El Rosario and Metro Chapultepec.', "Parque Tezoz√≥moc is a large park in Mexico City. It is located in the Azcapotzalco borough, in the northwestern section of Mexico City (M√©xico, D. F.), Mexico. It is 28 hectares (69 acres) in size.The park was designed by Mario Schjetnan, and opened in 1982. It is near the El Rosario residential neighborhood, and was built on the land of the former Hacienda del Rosario. It an important public open space, sports and recreational area, and a point of reference landmark for northwestern Mexico City.In the park's center there is a large pond with a 'nature reserve' island. The Museum of Regional Art, and the Museum of Three Dimensional Art, are both located on the northern perimeter.", 'Mexico City Arena (Spanish: Arena Ciudad de M√©xico) is an indoor arena in Azcapotzalco, Mexico City, Mexico. It hosts concerts, sports, and other events. It officially opened on February 25, 2012. The total cost of the arena was $300 million. The arena has a maximum capacity of 22,300 spectators. It is operated by Zignia Live. It is located in Avenida de las Granjas, close to Ferrer√≠a metro station, Fortuna railway station of the Suburban Railway, and next to TecMilenio University.', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'The Torres de Sat√©lite ("Satellite Towers") are a group of sculptures located in the Ciudad Sat√©lite district of Naucalpan, Mexico State, Mexico outside of Mexico City. One of the country\'s first urban sculptures of great dimensions, had its planning started in 1957 with the ideas of renowned Mexican architect Luis Barrag√°n, painter Jes√∫s Reyes Ferreira and sculptor Mathias Goeritz. The project was originally planned to be composed of seven towers, with the tallest one reaching a height of 200 meters (about 650 feet), but a budget reduction forced the design to be composed of only five towers, with the tallest measuring 52 meters (170 feet) and the shortest 30 meters (98 feet).', 'Parque Naucalli is a park in Mexico City in the municipality of Naucalpan de Ju√°rez. Planning for the park began in 1975. Reforesting the area began in 1977 and the park opened to the public in 1982.', 'Estadio Wilfrido Massieu is an outdoor stadium located north of Mexico City, within the "Adolfo Lopez Mateos" campus of the National Polytechnic Institute (IPN). It was built in 1959 and has a capacity of 15,000 spectators. The stadium is the home field of the IPN\'s college football teams: the √Åguilas Blancas and Burros Blancos .The stadium was primarily used for American football until 2000, when it was vetoed from American football events by damages in its structure. However, in 2015 it was announced that the stadium will again host American football matches.Currently, the stadium is also used by the Mayas of the Liga de F√∫tbol Americano Profesional.√Åguilas Blancas Mexican College Football', 'Planetario Luis Enrique Erro is a planetarium located in Mexico City, owned and operated by the National Polytechnic Institute. It was the first planetarium in Mexico open to the public and is one of the oldest in Latin America. It was opened in 1967 and operated for over 39 years with a planetarium projector model Mark 4.It was reopened to the public on 15 January 2007 after renovation and modernization costing about 43 million pesos. Its innovations include a stellar dome and new digital projection systems Digistar 3 provided by E&S through Ecosistemas de M√©xico, audio, acoustics and lighting.(in Spanish) Official website', 'Los Remedios National Park is a national park in Mexico, located in the far west of the municipality of Naucalpan in Mexico State, just northwest of Mexico City. The park was established by federal decree in 1938 with an area of 400 hectares (990 acres). Within its borders is the Sanctuary of the Virgin of Los Remedios, a colonial-era aqueduct and a pre-Hispanic archaeological zone with a Chichimeca temple. All of these are located in and around the mountain called Cerro Moctezuma. The site was an Aztec observatory and is also believed to be where Hern√°n Cort√©s and his men rested after fleeing Tenochtitlan.', 'El Monumento a los Indios Verdes es un conjunto de dos estatuas de bronce ubicadas al norte de la Ciudad de M√©xico que representan a los dos Huey Tlatoani mexicas Itzc√≥atl y Ahuizotl.[1][2] Su color verde es el efecto de la humedad y el clima; miden entre tres y cuatro metros de altura y pesan m√°s de tres toneladas.[3] Las cre√≥ el artista Alejandro Casar√≠n para formar parte de la representaci√≥n de M√©xico en la Exposici√≥n Universal de 1889.[1] En la base cuentan con inscripciones y grabados en n√°huatl.', 'El Acueducto de Guadalupe es una obra hidr√°ulica de la √©poca novohispana construida a mediados del siglo XVIII, que ten√≠a como finalidad llevar agua potable del r√≠o Tlalnepantla en el pueblo de Santa Mar√≠a Tlalnepantla a la Villa de Guadalupe, para luego ser conectado al acueducto que llevaba agua hasta Santiago Tlatelolco. Se ubica en la zona norte de la actual Ciudad de M√©xico y es solo usado como monumento hist√≥rico y art√≠stico.[1][2]', 'El Pensil Mexicano es un jard√≠n de estilo barroco ubicado en lo que ahora es un predio de 3000 m¬≤ en el n√∫mero 80 de la calle Lago Chiem, en la colonia Pensil de la Ciudad de M√©xico. Es considerado uno de los √∫ltimos vestigios de los jardines novohispanos de recreo.El nombre pensil en castellano antiguo significa jard√≠n delicioso.[1]', 'El Tepeyac National Park is one of a number of federally recognized national parks in Mexico that are protected natural areas and administered by the federal National Commission of Protected Natural Areas (CONANP), a subsidiary of SEMARNAT (Ministry of Environment). It is one of the few green areas located north of the Mexico City suburbs. 95% of its territory is located in Gustavo A. Madero, D.F. Borough and 5% in the municipality of Tlalnepantla de Baz.', 'Tepeyac or the Hill of Tepeyac, historically known by the names Tepeyacac and Tepeaquilla, is located inside Gustavo A. Madero, the northernmost delegaci√≥n or borough of Mexico City. According to the Catholic tradition, it is the site where Saint Juan Diego met the Virgin of Guadalupe in December 1531, and received the iconic image of the Lady of Guadalupe. The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe located there is one of the most visited Catholic shrines in the world. Spanish colonists erected a Catholic chapel at the site, Our Lady of Guadalupe, "the place of many miracles.":\u200a363\u200a', 'El Acueducto de los Remedios (conocido coloquialmente como "Los Arcos") est√° ubicado dentro del municipio de Naucalpan en el Estado de M√©xico, en lo que correspondiera anteriormente al poblado de Los Remedios (y que hoy forma parte de la mancha urbana), es un monumento de la √©poca colonial y que se pensaba sirviera para llevar agua del ejido de San Francisco Chimalpa al pueblo de los Remedios, alrededor del santuario del mismo nombre.']

column5: ['Ganot-Peschard Museum of Archeology', 'Palacio de Zambrano', 'Durango Institute of Technology', 'Estadio Francisco Zarco']
column6: ["The Museo de Arqueolog√≠a Ganot-Peschard is an archaeology museum located in Zona Centro, Durango, Mexico. The museum plays a major role in preserving the indigenous history of Northern Mexico. The Ganot-Peschard's collection offers archeological materials from the region's landscapes and dwellings including, funeral urns, skulls, vessels, arrowheads, winches, pectorals and other ornamental materials of pre-Hispanic peoples. Its objective is to preserve and spread the archaeological heritage of Durango and the region formed by the states of Zacatecas, Sinaloa, Nayarit and Jalisco.", 'El Palacio de Zambrano es un palacete que data de finales del siglo XVIII, situado en la ciudad de Victoria de Durango, en el estado mexicano de Durango. Actualmente alberga el museo "Francisco Villa de Durango".', 'The Durango Institute of Technology (in Spanish: Instituto Tecnol√≥gico de Durango) is a Mexican public university located in the state of Durango.', 'The Estadio Francisco Zarco is a multi-use stadium in the Mexican city of Durango. The stadium holds 18,000 people. It is used mostly for football matches, and is the home stadium of Alacranes de Durango (as of 2014‚Äì15, playing in the third tier of Mexican football) and of fourth-tier club Dorados de Villa (Teca Huixquilucan). The stadium is owned by the state of Durango.In February 2015, the State Ministry of Public Works stated the stadium and surroundings were to be the subject of improvement works ‚Äì not, as had been suggested, demolition ‚Äì and private investment was being invited.']

column5: ['Stade de la Paix']
column6: ["Stade Bouak√© is a multi-use stadium in Bouak√©, C√¥te d'Ivoire. It is currently used mostly for football matches. The stadium holds 35,000 people. Along with Stade F√©lix Houphou√´t-Boigny, it was constructed for the 1984 African Nations Cup.The stadium is expected to host matches of the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations, and is currently being renovated for the competition by Mota-Engil, with structures designed by Quadrante Group.The stadium measures 119x73 (yards), and was constructed in an oval shape.The club is the home of ASC Bouak√© and Alliance Bouak√©"]

column5: ['Estadio Teodoro Mariscal']
column6: ['The Estadio Teodoro Mariscal is a stadium in Mazatl√°n, Mexico.It is primarily used for baseball and serves as the home stadium for Venados de Mazatl√°n. and it is the stadium in which Mexico won its first home Caribbean Series championship. The stadium has also hosted the Caribbean Series on five occasions; 1978, 1985, 1993, and 2005.The stadium was built in 1962 and expanded in 2000. In 2018 was rebuilt and has a capacity of 16,000 spectators. Its dimensions are 325 feet on right and left field and to center field is 400 feet.Between February and April 2019, the stadium was used for football, being the temporary ground of the Pacific F.C., which plays in the Liga Premier de M√©xico.']

column5: ['Glorieta Park', 'La Mesa Watershed Reservation']
column6: ['Glorieta Park, sometimes spelled Glorietta Park, is an urban park in Caloocan, northern Metro Manila, the Philippines. It is situated at the border between the villages of Barangay 187 and Barangay 188 (Zone 16, District I) in the former Tala Estate in North Caloocan close to the boundary with San Jose del Monte, Bulacan. The park is one of three city-owned parks in Caloocan under the management of the Caloocan Parks Administration Services, the others being the Buena Park and Sports Complex in South Caloocan and the Caloocan Amparo Nature Park in eastern Tala, North Caloocan.', 'The La Mesa Watershed Reservation is a protected area that preserves the only major watershed in Metro Manila, Philippines. Also known as the Novaliches Watershed, it contains the last remaining rainforest of its size in Metro Manila surrounding the La Mesa Dam and Reservoir, the primary source of potable drinking water for 12 million residents in the Manila metropolitan area. The area is under the joint administration, supervision and control of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources and the Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System. It was established in 2007 through Proclamation No. 1336 issued by President Gloria Arroyo.']

column6: ["Ansan Wa~ Stadium (Korean: ÏïàÏÇ∞ ÏôÄ~ Ïä§ÌÉÄÎîîÏõÄ) is a multi-purpose stadium in Ansan, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea. It's currently served as home stadium for Ansan Greeners FC. While under construction it was known as 'Ansan Stadium'. After the public subscription during the construction, the formal name 'Ansan Wa~ Stadium' was selected. 'Wa' means harmonious cheering and the wave notation (~) represents the extension of that sound. The stadium was opened in 2007 and has a capacity of 35,000 people. It is used mostly for football matches and athletics. 2013 HSBC Asia 5 countries football game was held in the stadium. Surisan is 488 metres (1,601 ft) above sea level (a.s.l.). Another name for Surisan is GyeonBulSan.Several Korean Buddhist temples are located on Surisan mountain and the surrounding area. In spring, the mountain is covered in azaleas in bloom. Surisan was designated a Park of Gyeonggi by Gyeonggi-do province in 2009.']

column5: ['Ganvie', "Bank Of Africa agence stade de l'amitie", "Stade de l'Amiti√©", "UBA agence stade de l'amitie", "BIBE agence stade de l'amitie", 'Lake Nokou√©']
column6: ['Ganvie is a lake village in Benin, Africa, lying in Lake Nokou√©, near Cotonou. With a population of around 20,000 people, it is probably the largest lake village in Africa and is very popular with tourists.The village was created in the sixteenth or seventeenth centuries by the Tofinu people who took to the lake to avoid Fon warriors who were capturing slaves for sale to European traders. Making the shallow waters and islands of Lake Nokoue a haven, the Ganvie villagers are often referred to as "water men" and the area itself is often called the "Venice of Africa."', "Stade de l'Amitie or Friendship Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in Cotonou, Benin. It is currently used for football matches and also has facilities for athletics. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000 people.Photo at worldstadiums.com", "Stade de l'Amitie or Friendship Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in Cotonou, Benin. It is currently used for football matches and also has facilities for athletics. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000 people.Photo at worldstadiums.com", "Stade de l'Amitie or Friendship Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in Cotonou, Benin. It is currently used for football matches and also has facilities for athletics. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000 people.Photo at worldstadiums.com", "Stade de l'Amitie or Friendship Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium in Cotonou, Benin. It is currently used for football matches and also has facilities for athletics. The stadium has a capacity of 20,000 people.Photo at worldstadiums.com", 'Lake Nokou√© is a lake in the southern part of Benin. It is 20 km (12 mi) wide and 11 km (6.8 mi) long and covers an area of 4,900 ha (12,000 acres). The lake is partly fed by the Ou√©m√© River and the S√¥ River, both of which deposit sediments from throughout the region in the lake.The city of Cotonou sits on the southern border of the lake. Sections of the population of Cotonou have been displaced by coastal and lake flooding. On the northern edge of the lake is the town of Ganvi√©.']

After initially losing control of most of Hu·∫ø and its surroundings, the combined South Vietnamese and American forces gradually recaptured the city over one month of intense fighting. The battle was one of the longest and bloodiest of the war, and the battle negatively affected American public perception of the war.', 'C·ª≠u ƒê·ªânh c·ªßa Nh√† Nguy·ªÖn (ti·∫øng H√°n: ÈòÆÊúù‰πùÈºé) l√† ch√≠n c√°i ƒë·ªânh b·∫±ng ƒë·ªìng, ƒë·∫∑t ·ªü tr∆∞·ªõc s√¢n Th·∫ø mi·∫øu trong Ho√†ng th√†nh Hu·∫ø. Geomancers were consulted as to the propitious location site for the new city and construction began in 1804. The original earthwork was later reinforced and faced with brick and stone resulting in 2 m (6 ft 7 in)-thick ramparts.', 'The Hu·∫ø Museum of Royal Fine Arts is a museum dedicated to Vietnam\'s imperial past and arts of that era.
